description:
The best place in my life .. 
They have everything you need !
We ask special menu and they have it !
Highly recommend
author: Zurab M.

description:
Went here for lunch with a co-worker, for what was supposed to be a birthday lunch.  The missing star is due to their failure to recognize the birthday we were celebrating, even though I put several notes in the OpenTable reservation about it (and if Boulevard blames OpenTable for this gaffe I just blame Boulevard, as OpenTable is its chosen reservation platform).

The service was very good, from the waiter to the busboys refilling water and bread.  Our server was able to describe the dishes in great detail to help us make our selections.  We had two appetizers, the calamari and the beet salad, and both were beautifully plated and tasted great.  Our server totally pitched the scallop entree and we both went that route, and we were not disappointed.  The scallops were accompanied by two fried oysters and beans and mushrooms in a cauliflower puree.  Once again, beautifully plated and tasted great.

This place is phenomenal but due to price ($140 with tip and no alcohol for two apps and two entrees) it is not an everyday type of lunch place.  However, it is a great option for a business or special celebratory lunch or dinner/date night!
author: IYELP U.

description:
WOW this was... not good. It was a coworker's birthday so we came here for lunch with two other coworkers. We got seated right away and paired with one of the strangest waitresses I've ever experienced.

The menu at Boulevard has both starters and mains, but nowhere on the menu does it say you're required to order both. But after the first person placed their order for a starter, the waitress followed that up with, "And your main?" My coworker only wanted a starter and seemed a bit confused by the question, so she said she would just stick with the starter for now and consider a main later. The waitress didn't seem pleased.

She again questioned the next person that only ordered a main but no starter, asking, "And your starter?" By this point I could tell we were all confused about whether the expectation here is that you order both a main and starter or if this was just a way to get more money out of us (especially since we weren't ordering alcohol, which the waitress really seemed disapproving of), but ordering rapidly turned awkward. One person asked to keep a menu at the table and the waitress didn't want to let her keep it and said she'd bring one back if we needed it.

Crispy squash blossoms ($17) were ordered for the table. Stuffed with white shrimp and sweet corn and served on top of a green tomato carpaccio with corn relish and lemon aioli, they were lightly crisp and generously filled. The house bread and salted butter was quite good.

I got the roast chicken salad ($23), which was one of the blandest things I've ever eaten. The chicken was either boiled or blanched, not roasted, not seasoned, and reminded me of the plain, boiled chicken breast my uncle fed his dog when she was on a diet. The walnuts also tasted raw, not toasted like the menu claimed. While the apples, beets, and feta all came together nicely in the salad, the lack of any sort of dressing made for a dry, sad meal. I didn't finish it.

The white peach iced tea was served on ice, but at room temperature, so it was warm for the majority of the meal.

One of our party members had to leave early but he secretly paid the check as a gift to my coworker celebrating her birthday. We didn't know this when the busboy was clearing our plates and asked if we wanted dessert; we said no thank you, just the check, so he flagged down our waitress and asked her for it. The birthday girl went to the bathroom, and the waitress came back with dessert menus asking who was celebrating the birthday. We said we didn't want dessert, just the check, and she said, "Oh, not even something for the birthday girl?" Again, we politely declined, and she coldly removed the menus.

Birthday girl comes back and sees we still don't have the check, so she asks our waitress at the hostess desk for it and was told stiffly it had been paid for -- and that our coworker had wanted us all to order dessert.

Why in the world the waitress didn't just say that to me and my coworker while the birthday girl was in the bathroom, I have no idea, but had we known our other coworker had intended for us all to celebrate with dessert we would've taken him up on his generous offer. The birthday girl came back and was awkwardly delivered a complimentary birthday bon bon by the waitress, which was very nice, but at this point the entire meal just felt like a total bust.

I have no desire to return here.
author: Angela M.

description:
I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and it did not disappoint! I made reservations around a week prior because of last minute change of plans. We were lucky and was able to get a reservation at 7:15 on a Thursday night. 

We decided to drive there since it was a school night for both of us. They have valet, but it looked pretty pricey so we were lucky to find a different parking spot down the block, around the corner. When we arrived, they were setting up our table so we grabbed drinks at the bar. I really enjoyed my drink. It was fruity and not too sweet, I wish I could remember its name. Drinks cost about $16 each...which is expected in sf. 

We were seated at this cute little oval table where we were able to sit side by side. Then they immediately wished my boyfriend a happy birthday and handed him a card. We decided to order the tuna appetizer. It was our FAVORITE! We loved the bread that came with it and the flavors were delicious. Boyfriend ordered the pork prime rib and I ordered the lamb. These were the two suggestions that the waiter gave us after I asked him what he would recommend. I personally liked the lamb more than my boyfriend's dish. 

At the end of our meal, they surprised my boyfriend with a small birthday chocolate cannoli dessert. Overall, this place was a nice place to eat a fancy dinner or to go to for a special occasion.
author: Heather I.

description:
Boulevard has been a staple of the SF fine dining scene since before I moved here in 2002. The restaurant feels a little formal (white tablecloths) and it's frequented by the expense account crowd. I've had many good meals here when I worked in the financial district and I was happy to return here for Friday dinner as I was working through the SF top 100 list. 

I started with the Spanish Octopus as my appetizer. The octopus was cooked perfectly and came with black rice and smoked ham hock.  This was a great way to start a meal.  My entree was the lamb T-bone (wood oven roasted, medium rare and served off the bone).  This was just excellent!!!  A Virgin mojito was the ideal non-alcoholic pairing for this meal.  The bread service was good.  

I ordered the baked hot chocolate for dessert. It was a warm flourless chocolate cake with caramel popcorn, paprika puffed sorghum, toasted Spanish peanuts, raspberries and chocolate peanut ice cream.  There's a lot going on here and I think it didn't work. The cake itself was a bit chalky and the caramel popcorn was a bit too sweet.  I'd pass on this one. Mint tea is always good with chocolate and I like the DIY tea kit they use. 

Service was excellent. With tax and tip, this was about $115 which is about average for SF fine dining these days. Highly recommended particularly for a nice business meal in the financial district.
author: Andrew S.

description:
A little underwhelming TBH! But overall a fair experience. This restaurant is a classic -- it's been around for decades. I can appreciate that it maintained its classic furniture and decor, and especially loved the red-brick ceilings. 

As for the food, I got the corn soup which was pretty good. I tried some of the ahi tuna tartare which was excellent. Loved the taro chips. As for the main, it took 45 minutes to come out. Added on to the fact we were in the wine cellar (resourceful haha) so we weren't able to check on our food because we were blocked out from the waitstaff. I got the lobster & scallop risotto, which was underwhelming. The scallops were good, but my lobster tasted wet and fishy... and the risotto itself was way too creamy and rich. I was only able to eat half of it, and was drinking water excessively after. I felt like it was a little overboard on how umami it was that it didn't taste natural. 

I would give it another shot to try other items on the menu for sure! Perhaps the risotto was not my cup of tea.
author: Vickie Z.

description:
When I was in my 20's, Boulevard was the place that my boyfriend took me for a very special occasion.  We would dress up and be young and awkward in this fancy restaurant.  It probably took a couple of paychecks to cover our meal, but it was well worth it back then.  

Now that I'm much, much older (but who's counting), going to Boulevard is still great for a special occasion, or just a really, really well executed dinner.  My former boyfriend, now husband, took me here the other day and it was great to see that the place hasn't changed, and yet doesn't look old or stale.  It's still a very nice place for friends and family, or for that power lunch or dinner.

We sat at the chef's counter which is always exciting to me.  I love watching meals being prepared and the hard work the cooks put into plating everything perfectly.  Our servers worked wonderfully as a team, making sure everything from our utensils to drinks were always in place.  While I loved my duck, my husband's steak was absolutely perfect and I wish I ordered that as well.  The cook who was right across from me joked around about how cool it was being in front of the wood burning oven.  We thanked him for how delicious the meals were.  

Its nice to know Boulevard still provides such a wonderful dining experience after all these years.  I hope not to spend such a long time between visits again as I want this to be one of those go to places on my restaurant rotation.
author: Maria S.

description:
I absolutely love this restaurant for special occasions. I came here for my birthday and was greeted with a personalized card that someone on the staff hand wrote. This special gesture really made my day already before my meal even began. 

We started off with the tuna tartare which was delicious and is by far my favorite starter on the menu. I ordered the black truffle risotto and my boyfriend ordered the halibut. The risotto was full of flavor and had a generous portion of shaved truffles in it. The halibut was delicious as well and had very unique ingredients, including gazpacho. 

For dessert, we ordered a scoop of the boysenberry and strawberry sorbet. I would recommend the strawberry sorbet because it is refreshing and perfect after dinner. Overall, the food and service were both fantastic. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Helen z.

description:
I graduated from culinary school this past spring, and I remember hearing the restaurant "Boulevard" mentioned several times by the chefs and staff.  I checked my bookmarks and didn't see it bookmarked, so I quickly bookmarked it!

A few weeks back, my dentist, after hearing I graduated from culinary school, felt compelled to tell me his favorite restaurant in the bay area.  He named Boulevard as his favorite.  He's a big-time foodie and loves the fine dining scene, so my ears perked up to hear his opinion.

Wow, I thought. I really need to make it to Boulevard soon.  And so we did!

Be forewarned, no valet - street parking can be a challenge depending on what time you go.  Do your nearest garage research in advance.  We didn't.  :(

Elegant interior, you'll feel better if you're not wearing a t-shirt.

While our table was being prepared, we sat at the bar and my wife asked the bartender if he knew how to make a Whiskey Smash.  He said he could.  She asked for it extra sour and he said if she didn't like it, he would make her a different drink.  Well, it came and it didn't appeal to either one of us.  So he was good enough to replace her drink with something she was happy with.  Happy ending, but coulda been ugly.  :)

Pretty simple menu, LOVE simple menus!  We chose the:

HAMACHI CRUDO (4/5)  Elegant, little plate that came to our table with some fresh tasting yellowtail, garnished with shishito peppers, avocado and furikake.  Refreshing and tasty.  Another plate please.

FRIES (5/5)  We read in some of the Yelp reviews about the recommendations for the Truffle Fries.  When we asked about them, the waiter told us that they no longer have them on the menu, but that he could bring us "regular fries".  So we got the regular fries and they were not ordinary. They were served piping hot, crispy on the outside, tender on the inside.  Perfectly seasoned, perfectly enjoyed.  Order the fries for sure.

OVEN ROASTED DUCK BREAST (5/5)  My wife's dish.  She's a duck lover and I might even say a connoisseur of duck.  She had nothing negative to say about her plate.  Presentation was again, nicely done and all the small garnishes on the plate complimented the duck.

ANGUS FILET (5/5) This steak was wood-fired and came perfectly "medium" - garnished with very thinly and beautifully sliced King Trumpet mushrooms.  The mushrooms were delicious and there was also a golf-ball sized potato croquette that was pretty tasty too.  The filet wasn't huge, but it was thick and it was the perfect amount for me, given the appetizers, bread and then dessert!

The desserts were more de-constructed than I prefer, and I'm not sure I remember the exact names of what we ordered, but they were decent.  I like rustic, hearty desserts - not dainty, delicate ones.  These were a bit too pretentious for me - but they looked beautiful.  I'd rather have a fresh-baked brownie with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream.  You get the picture.  I might skip the desserts next time we come.

The service was very good, the atmosphere would be perfect for a special occasion, a birthday, a celebration.  It definitely felt like fine dining.  And you know what?  I discovered my dentist has good taste when it comes to restaurants!  Somehow I knew he did!

I'll have to tell him that at my next check-up in 6 months!
author: Darien R.

description:
Nothing for vegetarians or vegans other than grilled veggies !! The ambience is good.
I did not like the key lime cheesecake either no taste...
author: Anamika A.

description:
Old school dinner spot. Wonderful food. 
This is the place where you want to bring you parents or your boss. 

Decoration: Heavy wood and gold - a 1920s feel. Great view. The restaurant is much bigger than you think. 

Attended the black truffle culinary dinner event. While the black truffles are more challenging to taste than the white ones the menu was still neat. Had the steak. Medium rare was done correctly. It did not fill me up. It's a giant piece of meat and a little something of something. 

Service: good
Clean: yes 
Vibe: older folks, wealthy elite, splurging tourists 

Deserts were delish. My fave was the peach. The chocolate is super heavy. 

Prepare to spend quite a bit here.
author: Zita M.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for an early birthday dinner. 5 stars simply because:

1. Wonderful service! Our server was very accommodating for my food allergies and gave recommendations of what they could substitute instead. Thank you sir and to all the chefs! I worked in the service industry before and I know how annoying food allergies can be, so thank you for being so understanding!

2. Delicious food and wine. We got a bottle of the 2015 Nickel & Nickel Cab to with our Spanish Octopus, Lamb T-Bone, and Liberty Farm Duck.

3. Ambiance. It had an old school steak house charm to it. There was bar style seating by the kitchen where you can watch them prep too if you don't want to sit at a dining table or the regular bar. I think we were probably the youngest ones in there too. 

4. They don't sing Happy Birthday to you! Lol, sorry, but I got enough birthday embarrassment from a restaurant the night before, so when the server brought out a bowl of sorbet with a candle and plaque with Happy Birthday written, I was like uh oh. However, he didn't sing and just kindly wished me happy birthday. Whew!
author: Marissa C.

description: Good service. Food is also quite flavorful. I particularly loved the lobster bisque. My friends and I asked them to split the bowl in 3 so we could all have our own sample, and they were awesome about it. Service is on point and food good. Its always nice when a restaurant isn't overly crowded, and that's exactly how it is during lunch. We didn't feel rushed and the waitstaff was exceptional. I even got a birthday dessert treat. That's always a plus!!
author: Ali R.

description: First time here. What a great place. Food was very good. Loved the lamb  I ordered. The seared octopus for an appetizer was very good as well. I had Ben has my waiter, and I must say...he was wonderful!!! I loved him!!!! He had a great sense of humor and was extremely accommodating!!! Top notch service!!! I was super impressed! Loved it.
author: Olive R.

description: The interior space is uniquely beautiful, both traditionally cozy and chicly ornate.  Beautiful view of Bay Bridge with many aesthetic details, such as the peacock mosaic (on the floor of the bar), to enjoy along with delicious offerings and clearly capable and attentive servers.
author: Alexis V.

description:
I love the historical building that they pains ta-kingly restored. The food is wonderful and the portions are generous. They always make us feel welcome and go out of there way to see that we enjoy our evening. It is San Francisco and they are very trans friendly.

We go back every time we are in town which is about 3 times each year.

Always great!
author: Micki F.

description:
My girlfriend and I wanted to have a light dinner on a Friday evening. Boulevard was busy understandably, but we were seated at the counter immediately (although we didn't have a reservation). 

I loved the ambience. It felt classy, but it didn't feel uptight. It was very lively without being loud. So, we were able to talk during dinner. The service was also excellent. Our waiter, Martin, was friendly and very knowledge. 

We just shared some appetizers. We both love truffles! So, we had to order the risotto with back truffles. They were very generous with the truffles, but the truffles were not very flavorful. For our "entrees," I ordered the Chilled Dungeness Crab, my girlfriend Abalone Milanese. The presentation of their food was impressive, but I thought all of the food looked better than they tasted. Don't get me wrong, they all tasted very good. It's just that they did not blow me away.

It's pricy, but I would definitely come back when I'm in San Francisco next time for the ambience and their excellent service.

******************************
If you found something useful in my review, please hit "useful" so that I can improve my reviews. If you love food and traveling, follow me, or better yet, let's become friends on Yelp! Thank you and happy Yelping!
author: Masanori D.

description:
We've been coming to Blvd for years.  From the time they served foi gras on their app trio, then having it banned, and back again.  I have not come around to writing a review.

Our favorite server is Sheena (Shaina?).  We had the pleasure of sitting at her section for many birthday celebrations.

This time around, we had Tim.  He's definitely a seasoned pro.  The service was flawless.  

We celebrated our 15 yr Anniversary.  Blvd made it so special.  They even got a chair for my DD 's otter, Odde.  

We usually order all the apps and an entree to share, family style.  

The Lobster and shrimp ravioli was my DD's favorite that we had to order another round. 

Scallops are my all time favorite! 

The keylime pudding was amazing!
author: Winnie L.

description:
Boulevard is a true fine dining experience and the quality of everything, from the food to the ambiance to the service is really unimpeachable. Even the temperature of the air is perfect.

I've only been once, with my girlfriend for our anniversary last year, but I'm looking for an excuse to go back. As a graduate student, it's a bit out of my price range, but it's so good that it's worth planning my budget around going once a year.

We were seriously impressed by the food. Their daily menu has some staples, but features new items every day. When we went, we got their foie gras and ahi tuna tartare appetizers. Each were magnificent. The foie gras was served with corn, blueberries, and brioche, along with a blueberry sauce that had an incredible depth of flavor. The ahi tuna nearly stood up to it, too. It was playful and bright. We each got their porkchop, which was cooked to a perfect medium. For dessert, we got their chocolate and caramel which was super texturally interesting and perfectly sweet. As a hobbyist cook, it's a particularly special experience to see what the masters can accomplish. 

The service was attentive, but not intrusive: always there when needed and never a second longer. I don't mean to imply that the service was curt, but rather that we were able to converse and enjoy our anniversary meal in peace, and all of our needs were taken care of. There was no fluff.

I can't contrive even a single quibble about my experience. It is without hesitation the best restaurant I've been to in California.
author: Alex R.

description:
Went here for our anniversary. Absolutely loved the drinks, service and ambience. Food is great as well. 

I'm a vegetarian and the menu was't very accommodating though. The chef who was super nice got me a special custom-made entree' (don't remember what went into it anymore) which tasted great and fresh. 

The desserts are a must have. Among the two we tried, the chocolate semifreddo with creme fraîche and chocolate crémeux is incredible. Occasion place and totally worth it!
author: Wini V.

description: Definitely lived up to its reputation, one of the best dining experiences. Sitting up at the bar getting to watch all the chefs prepare the meals was very entertaining the food was exceptionally delicious.. The complex city of flavors and how beautiful the food comes out is just breathtaking... started off with three appetizers the crab the duck and the octopus everything is so beautiful it's almost hard to eat... finished with the lamb... I definitely ate too much but regretted nothing!! The cocktails were fabulous as well and I cannot wait to have another experience here thank you again so much..:)
author: Kathryn F.

description:
A star for convenience and one for location. However this place is too big for its britches. Snooty?  Why? You're on a dirty corner of a smelly street with drug addicts on the corner leaving their needles to step over. Your crowds visiting for lunch are the people who work the offices in buildings surrounding your location.  We waited 10 minutes to be greeted after being seated granted without reservations. But 10 mins. for a glass of water we had to get up and ask the hostess to organize? 

Also,  always wondered why staff would be anything less than gracious to guests. We were about to order $100 plus of food and drinks for an hour at lunchtime. Yes, it's San Francisco and yes, that = $$$. But too many options are out there. 

We left deciding that we wouldn't spend another second waiting nor a single dollar on poor service.
author: Mary R.

description:
My hubby and I always wanted to dine here and we finally got the opportunity. This time, we had our three kiddos with us (13,11 and 9). The food and service were A M A Z I N G! 

The menu changes daily ensuring the freshest ingredients are used to make each dish.  The kids and I had steak which was superb. The menu is not kid friendly so I wouldn't recommend for young children or picky eaters.
author: Elle W.

description:
A week ago we dined at the Boulevard~ We were a walkin, no reservation and we (my daughter and I) were seated at the counter which was what i preferred, my daughter had never been to Boulevard and was quite happy about counter position and was looking forward to the experience.................. From here on it was all headed down hill ~ very sad as Boulevard is a SF mainstay i have enjoyed many a meal there and now can't imagine ever going back.
    Our server an experienced, middle aged women could not have cared less about us, Handing us our menus, mentioning what they were running out of, then asking what we might like to order for dinner, REALLY?? you literally just handed us the menu, alas she granted us a few moments to review the menu. She left then returned asking for our order, when asked she recommended the most expensive starters & main courses, (which we did not order, just on principle actually) took our orders, started to walk away I had to stop her to ask if we could order cocktails......her response, "Oh of course! would you like some water too? This IS NOT the service i am used to at Boulevard, as i feel sure no one else is either.
  Drinks arrived timely, starter also and dinner as well all brought by the food runners. She wizzed by to check on our meals and over to key in an order, and back for dessert order also delivered by another server, guess she was busy elsewhere. Then that was it, dessert dishes retrieved by a busser and for 23 minutes she wizzed by many times never stopping, the food expediter who i believe was a manger also just looked past us..... we were the last 2 people sitting at the counter, you couldn't miss us!!really quite irritating. I did FINALLY gain her attention after 23 minutes (did I mention this?) to ask for our check, that was delivered promptly, paid with cash & credit card which seemed to throw her off, signed the cc receipt left a 20% tip & left sooooo disgusted & angry on what should have been a fun dinner, turned sour like week old non refrigerated milk.
    The city of San Francisco has to many restaurants to tolerate this type of service, especially in this price range, if you prefer this type of food i would recommend Absinthe in Hayes Valley, quite DEEEEELISSSH and NOT near as arrogant in the service dept.
author: Becky L.

description: Very nice place great food great atmosphere superb service highly recommend, Looks like very old place, a lot of energy, great view
author: Boris F.

description:
Good experience, but not sure if I'd come here again.

Started off the meal with the scallops and soft shell crab appetizers. The scallops were cooked very well, but I didn't enjoy the hard texture of the bed of beans/corn it came on. The soft shell crab was amazing and flavorful.

Ordered the salmon and prime rib for the main course. The salmon was good, but it came with  a green sauce that made it too salty. The quinoa mashed potatoes and vegetables that it came with were really tasty though. The prime rib was average, but came with the best cornbread I've ever had. 

Also ordered a peach and shortbread ice cream sundae and a cocktail with gin and white peach purree. Both were pretty good! 

Service was great as well.
author: Jessica T.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary last month. It was a wonderful experience.

Atmosphere:
This place is dimly lit, perfect for a romantic evening. The gentle hum of jazz and other romance-inspiring sounds mask the murmur of voices chatting over their meal.

The service:
Our server was phenomenal. She was knowledgeable, friendly, attentive, and her timing was always perfect with the delivery of each new course.

Menu:
The wine list is daunting, plenty of options, and a sommelier to answer your every question or pairing curiosity. The food options each sounded amazing; we wanted to choose so much more than just 2 of the entrees! We ordered the duck, steak, and chocolate mousse for dessert. Every single bite left us wanting more! (We left full and satisfied though - it was just THAT delicious). 

Price point:
Our meal for two that included a bottle of wine, appetizer, 2 entrees, and a dessert rounded out to about 350$ after tip. Definitely a "once-in-a-while" kind of dinner for us, but considering the special occasion it was certainly worth it.
author: Taylor D.

description: Absolutely superb! From the wait staff to the food and wine list we were extremely happy! The bar made perfect martinis too! Our group even order 2nds of their dessert! Ha! We had a wonderful time. Will be back again next time in SF!
author: Annalee H.

description: We heard that this place was a fine dining experience for hipsters and all food lovers. It did not disappoint. Four of us had four different entrees and each of us loved our meals. The beat salad was a great starter. The halibut, lamb and other dishes were each prepared with finesse and had an excellent selection of vegetables. The restaurant was packed and buzzing. An excellent wine list, as expected.
author: Ivy C.

description:
Boulevard is one of those classic restaurants where you know food will be always be good. Its located in the heart of San Francisco overlooking the bay bridge. My date and I came here on a weekday at 9:00pm and we got seated right away. This waiter came by, explained the menu and said we must try the pork chop since it's their signature dish. I am usually not a pork chop type of girl but figured it's their signature dish, so why not (lesson learned:  be adventurous!!)
OH BOY, it was one of the juiciest pork chop I have ever had. This is the exact description of the dish and it sounds very complicated. 

"Berkshire Kurobuta Pork Prime Rib Chop with wood Oven Roasted Calvados mutsu apple fritto, cold pressed apple miel, poppy seed spaetzle, half moon bay brussel sprouts & edwards virginia bacon. Deviled red kuri squash & roasted sage pork jus"

My date got the lamb chop which was also excellent. It's cooked to perfection, chargrilled on the outside and pink on the inside. Since he was eyeing on my lamb chop, I had to offer him a piece even though I would love to hoard the entire pork chop.  He tried a piece and instantly fell in love with it. 

For starters, we got the abalone pasta which was too salty for my liking. Texture of the pasta was great, abalone was well but it's just not for me.
author: Cindy H.

description:
The lunch we had today was perfection. I started with the Gnocchi, and my friends had the Tuna Tartare. We all said the dishes were delicious.

For mains, I had the Paella with Seafood, and my friends had the Salmon. We agree again, the dishes were fabulous.

The service was perfect, and to summarize, it was a wonderful meal in every way.
Highly recommended!
author: Richard T.

description:
I've dined here 3 times in the past 2 yrs as there are so many amazing restaurants in San Francisco.  This one never ceases to amaze me!

Both the Ahi tuna and scallops are mouth watering good. 

The sole with Crab meat is what I had each time here, this is one of the most delicious sole dishes I've ever had!  

The pork chop is also one of our usual orders and a must try, so tender and full of flavors....

The ambiance is a little noisy, service is excellent.

I always recommend this place when I have friends in town in the Embarcadero area.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Sky was our waitress she was great!  She was very personable with great customer service.  I also had great food experience.  They altered the Menu  just the way I asked, and I also made a specialty black berry lemon drop just for me. 
The bartender was amazing every drink was awesome! Please forgive my poor memory I think his name was Dylan.. This place is definitely a go to when we come  back to visit San Francisco
author: Jessica F.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for months and finally made it in.  I was absolutely not disappointed.  The food was amazing, even for me who doesn't eat meat, I still had options.  The service was perfect, friendly and attentive but not overbearing.  Again, the food was amazing! I got the salmon and my husband got the pork chop, both of which we devoured.  The lobster raviolis we'll be talking about for the rest of our lives.  Ambiance was great also.  We told them it was our anniversary and they brought out a dessert wishing us a happy anniversary, cute gesture.  Expensive, but you get what you pay for.  Highly recommend.
author: Jared P.

description:
I went to Boulevard a couple weeks-ish ago with my boyfriend (I was visiting San Francisco at the time) with the hope of trying an upscale restaurant in the Bay Area-- needless to say, neither of us were disappointed.  First, Boulevard was located near the water front and has windows pointing out to the Bay, we were impressed with the view.  Now, we knew Boulevard was an upscale restaurant, and even though we were going for lunch,  there were tables filled with people in business attire (maybe having meetings?) and it was quite a sight to see.  I would suggest wearing something close to business casual coming here or else you might stand out a bit!

The waiter that greeted us at the door immediately off the bat congratulated us on our  anniversary.  The thing is, we only told them about it once while making the reservation so the fact that they remembered and cared shows a lot about their service.  Our waitress was very nice (a little awkward but it was endearing).  We ended up ordering Northern Halibut and the Sea Scallop and Capellini Nero (basically Squid Ink pasta).  This was my first time ever having squid ink past and I highly, highly recommend to EVERYONE to try it once-- it was amazing and honestly, very very worth it.  The halibut was well-made too but didn't make as big of an impression on either of us as the squid ink pasta. 

At the end of our meal, we ordered a dessert (forgot the name, but the picture is attached), and it was quite good and even came with a customized chocolate sign they made.  All in all,  a wonderful experience (although on the pricey end).
author: Laura Y.

description: This place is by far one of the best eataries I know, great food, service and atmosphere, highly recommended
author: Igor R.

description:
It's amazing to me how a restaurant can be around for 24 years, and still be as good, if not better! than it was in it's opening act. This was the perfect choice for a dinner-to-remember. My partner's birthday dinner had to be just right, and Boulevard was a bullseye. 

Traffic was a nightmare, so we called ahead and they made us feel very welcome even though  we might be a little late. That was a classy way to help us avoid any anxiety, at least for me, I believe punctuality conveys respect. 

So a fine meal starts out with fine service. From greeting, to seating, to eating, we were treated with the dignified professionalism one would expect at a fine dining house such as Boulevard.

Everything is right there on the daily menu, so there is no memorizing the specials, which complicates the choosing process. You know what I mean. 

We started with a celebratory bottle of true Champagne from their wine list, which set the tone for the evening and made choosing our courses an adventure. Meanwhile, our wait staff decanted the 1996 Cabernet that we had brought from our home collection. The wine service was masterful and, I must say, respectful of the quality of the wine. Corkage; $30.oo.

Before I get to the courses, I want to share this with you. In our party, we had a 9 year old girl who is no beginner when it comes to fine dining. The staff treated her like she was an adult, which raised the level of our dining experience. I commend that. They even have a nice non-alcoholic drink list that goes far beyond the typical Shirley Temple genre., with selections worthy of the adult crowd, especially if you want to pull off the cocktail "look" while still qualifying to be the "Designated Driver."

May I suggest that you go on line, beforehand, read their menu, so as to avoid hyperventilating. I found myself wanting one of everything, and had to calm myself before ordering. I was too cool to show it, but my excitement was palpable. So, the Fois Gras was heavenly. It came with a small smorgasbord of accompaniments including a grain filled "granola" cake was like nothing I had ever had before. I made that one last. By the way, if you're not in the mood for a big meal, the appetizers make for a entree in, and of, themselves. The entrees for our table included, the Filtet, which was rich and cooked to perfect. The Lamb was a home run, and the Halibut was a big hit (it looked great, but I did't get to try it before they polished it off). Everything was masterfully prepared and presented.
  
The desserts were rich and somehow simultaneously light. The mango sorbet was my favorite that night because it didn't overwhelm the meal that was still echoing softly in my mouth. We had a final course of Vintage Port and Tawny Port to round out this perfect experience. I left there thinking, "Yes, I deserve this." (and it wasn't even my birthday!)

Can it be expensive? Well, that's relative, ... but yes.  But, you deserve it!

Dining Time: 3 hours+, no rush
Tab for 5 people, well fed, with Tip and Wines and Port: $740
author: James G.

description: I can't help myself, I LOVE the Boulevard. I've travel all over the world and I accredit this place with the best Filet in the world. I know, I know... That's a bold statement but there is certain care and attention they take to produce a very high quality piece of meat. I love their starters and it is hard to beat the drinks and wine from their bar. When I go here I ONLY sit at the bar. I made the mistake of sitting at a table once and it felt very stuffy. The bar is vibrant and Patrick the Bartended is master a his craft. He's fun to talk wines with along with life in general. He's a busy guy so don't be too put off if he doesn't sit down with you for an hour. I wish I was at the Boulevard right now.
author: Craig P.

description:
Came here for my birthday dinner. It's actually one of the boy's favorite restaurants. That says a lot because he's totally a Taco Tuesday over bougie fine dining guy. We had reservations at 6pm, arrived around 5:30pm -- table was ready whenever we were but of course, we grabbed drinks at the bar first.

Our hostess led us to our table and handed me an envelope that had a Happy Birthday card inside. I've never been to a restaurant that did this -- usually it's just a 'happy birthday!' or dessert on the house, which I rather prefer, but it was a very sweet touch to the dining experience.

We ordered:
Sea Scallop - really delicious and flavorful
Frutti di Mare Ravioli - not my favorite, a filling was a bit mouth drying
Berkshire Pork Prime Rib Chop - SO BOMB. It's one of their most popular dishes. Literally saw plates and plates of it coming out at the front kitchen
Lamb T-bone - I'm not sure how I feel about this one. I love the tenderness and flavor of the meat, definitely no gamey taste at all. However, I really didn't like the hummuses it was served with. I tried a bit and I couldn't. I moved the lamb to the side of the dish so it wouldn't touch the hummus.

Wish we ordered:
Maine Lobster & White Chanterelle Risotto - this had been a huge recommendation from our friends but I don't know how I missed this. Would choose this over the ravioli
Angus Filet - would choose this over the lamb t-bone

Dessert:
Butterscotch Pudding - I couldn't stop eating this. I loved loved loved the little truffles, rice crispies, and chocolate marshmallows. 

Highlight: As much as this makes me sound like a peasant, the bread and butter was so. ridiculously. delicious. Hory Mory. 

Service: I've been to restaurants with better service. Our server didn't seem to care much for our table and often looked distracted talking to us. Normally, this would have thrown me off but my night was going good for the most part and I didn't particular need anything either.

Price point: Yes, it's four $ signs but it's comparably much more worth it than other high end restaurants.
author: Nadeen H.

description:
Wonderful atmosphere, amazing view and delicious food.  Great wine list and attentive staff.   Topped off a great day in the city.  

We were a bit underdressed after a day of sightseeing, but the staff was kind about it.  Next time we will change into something more suitable, because we definitely would love to go back.
author: Patricia O.

description:
Very busy
Service couldn't keep up
Food was COLD 
Even after manager came over and reheated same plate -still lukewarm 
Try some place else
Not worth it
author: Gary B.

description:
I like to mark every 100th Yelp review of mine with a Michelin-starred establishment. While Boulevard no longer has a star, it's still a solid place to dine, whether for lunch or dinner, and it's a good way to mark my 2400th review. 

Particularly at lunch, it's not really expensive when compared to more luxe places elsewhere in the West Bay. Salads and other apps are reasonably priced given the portions and ingredients, as are the entrees. Even the more expensive ones at lunch ($30 or over) are bona fide seafood entrees, while the burger is quite reasonably priced for an upscale establishment at $15, and decently hefty and juicy at that.

Service is engaging and professional, as befitting a classic, lively restaurant. While the decor and the interior aren't the newest, you can tell that this is a venue that lots of people have enjoyed and still do. A solid experience overall.
author: Vincent L.

description:
This was my 2nd time dining at boulevard and I was highly disappointed in the service. We were celebrating 2 birthdays and the service couldn't have been more strange. At one point while setting down the silverware it was borderline thrown. We were in a rush to catch a show and when we said we will look at the dessert menu in the meantime the response given was I can't bring out the menu till everybody is done...umm ok?
The vibe with the service was just off, the food was decent but I'm most definitely NOT going back.
author: Sunaina b.

description:
This place was one of the first "grown up, fancy" restaurants I was introduced to, which started my LOVE affair with food.  I was in my very early twenties and a few years or so have passed and this place remains just as fabulous as the first time.   I've been here over a twenty times, from business meetings, dates and birthday celebrations.   
Highly recommended!!!
author: Rachel R.

description:
I ordered the porkchop entree, perfectly done juicy and flavorful.
Enjoyed my vodka Martini.
Good service and ambience.
author: Frances B.

description:
I finally figured out why this place lost their Michelin star in 2016. This was the worst dining experience in my recent memory. I chose to celebrate both me and mom's birthday here and deeply regret it. The night started off fine, but I will just fast forward as to why this place deserves zero stars.

For the main course, we order 2 Kurobuta porkchops and 1 Pacific Corvina Sea Bass. Our server Tim H., misheard us and only brought out 1 porkchop and 1 sea bass, which was fine as we let him know and he placed another order for us. Within 10 minutes, the second pork chop was served. After we cut it open, we realized it was pink and obviously undercooked. We waived Tim down and he took a look at the porkchop and immediately brought it back to the kitchen. He came back and changed our plates and utensils as they have been contaminated. Again, we were understanding about it...mistakes happen. I was hoping he would at the very least address the situation and apologize but NOPE. He continued on without saying a word and pretended as if it did not happen. 

Just when you think it could not get worse, it did. He had the audacity to bring the same porkchop we cut open 5 minutes ago after shoving it back in the oven for 5 minutes. We were shocked that a restaurant of this caliber would make such a rookie mistake. We all looked at the porkchop and it was unappetizing to say the least. After 5 minutes, Tim saw that we did not touch our food and asked if he should just take it away. I nodded. Even then, NO APOLOGY. Needless to say we were both upset and disappointed. 

I can't help to think that if I was not a young Asian female, the server would have apologized or at least addressed the situation instead of shoving it under the rug. Negative million stars for this. 

Even without this fiasco, the food was not amazing nor worth the money to me. There are so many amazing restaurants in San Francisco, I would advise to dine elsewhere. There is a reason they lost their star. Never coming back. EVER.
author: Mandi H.

description: Nice place and descent customer service! I would give 5 stars but my steak was not hot or warm as it suppose to be. The side stuff on my entrée dish were very hot but steak wasn't, what makes me think they let the steak wait for the sides before it was served.
author: Nuno815 A.

description:
Boulevard was good! I came across this restaurant while looking on Utrip. After doing a little research about it and looking up photos I thought it would be a good place to try. My husband and I meet up with one of his friends that moved out here 2 years ago. I called and made same day reservations. Our reservations were at 8:15 PM and when we got there we were immediately seated. The staff and waiter was nice.

We started our dinner with appetizers. I ordered the Beet Salad. My husband ordered the Spanish Octopus with Calamari, and his friend ordered the Ahi Tuna. The appetizers were the bomb dot com!! Amazing! My salad was so light and refreshing while so good. It had mixed greens, beets (they seemed pickled), walnuts, blue cheese, and vinaigrette dressing. Everything played well together to create a nice flavor and wonderful salad. My husband's appetizer was very good as well. It was Grilled Octopus and Fried Calamari over a small bed of risotto. It was all cooked and seasoned well. A very nice combination. His friend's dish must have been good as well because he cleaned his plate. Lol. 

Next for our entrees. I ordered the Sole set like the Halibut. This means I ordered the Halibut dish but replaced the Halibut with the Sole. It was Sole over a bed of risotto with Asparagus and mushrooms with a fried mushroom on top. It was very good and light. The Sole was cooked perfectly and tender. The fried mushroom was a nice addition. The asparagus was cooked perfectly as well. An overall good dish. My two only suggestions/complaints for this dish is it could have used a tad more seasoning. Also, the risotto was a little more on the runny side. I like my risotto to be a little thicker. My husband and his friend both ordered the Lamb T-Bone. My husband said the lamb was good. I didn't try this so I don't know but I take his word for it. 

We ended our dinner with desserts. I ordered the Carrot Cake and my husband's friend ordered a scoop of their Roasted White Chocolate Ice Cream. The Carrot Cake was very good. Light but still had all the hearty goodness like cream cheese frosting, walnuts to add the perfect crunch, and the cinnamon cake itself. My dish was served with a scoop of the Roasted White Chocolate ice cream as well. The ice cream was very good. My dish also had a carrot crisp on top.

Overall, Boulevard was good and I would recommend them for others to try. I also really loved the portion of their dishes. Not too small but not too big either. I also liked that I could end my dinner with a nice dessert. I hate going to restaurants and everything is good then you get to dessert and it sucks or their menu options for desserts are lacking. Not the case here.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Boulevards food was well crafted, however lacking anything unique. We found that the appetizers were better than the main dishes but you'd have to order two because they are very small. We ended up ordering multiple appetizers and one main dish which was the perfect amount.

As for the service, the hostess was rude and unhelpful. She kept trying to seat us at the worst tables in the restaurant even though there were many tables available. Luckily, our servers were extremely attentive and they made up for her. I'm giving three stars because the hostess made our first impression of the restaurant rather unpleasant.
author: Jolene J.

description:
Two words: Rice oil.
That's what they purportedly use to fry up the french fries, and let me say, as a french fry connoisseur, these are the best. I know you're asking yourself why I went with the humble fry while dining at such a fine establishment, and to that I'll tell you the fry is a great barometer. Did they come out hot? (great teamwork and service), just the right saltiness? (they're tasting the food often enough to know how much seasoning to add), are they cooked perfectly? (someone is paying attention, even to the fryer), and finally do they look good? (people care about how their food is presented). 
We also had about 4 other items off the menu and some cocktails, all consumed at the bar. Everything was great, well-balanced, beautiful, wonderful use of fresh, local and seasonal ingredients and of course, the atmosphere was excellent. 
Go there, order the fries and be happy.
author: Andrea S.

description:
If you're looking for fresh, well-prepared and thoughtful seafood you found it. I visit SF every couple of years and Boulevard is one of my must haves.  Without fail the fish is cooked perfectly with just the right amount of garnish.  On this visit I had the salmon which was garnished with mushrooms and some type of amazing sauce.  I really enjoy the dish and would certainly order it again. 

The menu is small that seems to keep the quality high. The menu changes frequently depending on the season so don't rely on prior photos check the website for the latest menu.
author: Israel M.

description:
Excellent dinner. Service and presentation were friendly and professional.
Tuna Tartare was especially good. It was in its pure form. No avocado mixed in to muck it up.
Mains were pork Chops and Roast Quail. Very special.
author: Steve K.

description:
Boulevard is a very spacious and classy restaurant located close to the Embarcadero.  The food is amazing along with the service.   The creative menu changes seasonally so it's exciting to see what the chef comes up with.   On my visit, a couple of items ordered were:

Beef Carpaccio- very unique as it comes with Mushrooms & Burrata.
Dungeness Crab Spaghetti- absolutely divine as it comes with a light butter sauce.
Duck Gumbo with Shrimp & Sausage- heartier meal full of flavors.

The food was beautifully plated and amazing!  I would say the price is on the higher end but for a work lunch or special occasion, Boulevard fits the bill. $$$$
author: Melanie N.

description: Their food is really good. I ordered starter (forgot the name, it was salad with peach and the white thing that tasted really good) steak and strawberry cream brûlée.
author: Gung S.

description: I highly recommend Boulevard.  This place lives up to its reputation.  I stop by for drinks and dinner whenever I am in San Francisco.  The bartender Patrick is friendly and funny.  He always has great drink recommendations and provides excellent service.
author: Emily H.

description:
very good food and service, but has a business dinner (i.e., expense account) vibe. they lost their Michelin star two years ago

the menu is a bit limited, which it odd to me since it means return trips will be more spaced out

the standout for us was the burrata. it's served with pine nuts, crispy rice, kale and lemon zest. a unique and beautifully prepared dish. everyone who ordered it loved it. the filet was very good too

wine list is huge, heavily weighted toward European wines. desserts were nicely proportioned, the cheesecake was great
author: Bob U.

description:
Went there in 2015 for my birthday, it is nice, but small table, crowd space. The environment is ok, food is good, we had steak there. Service was great. Easy to get reservation, which is a plus for downtown. Pretty relaxing.

Right next to Bay bridge, beautiful scene.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
The heirloom tomato and burrata salad was refreshing. The grilled octopus was flavorful. 
I asked for my pork chop entree to be cooked all the way. Though it was still  delicious, it came medium  well and pink in the center. My husband's lamb steak was very rare, when he asked for it to be cooked medioum.
We had two desserts. The chocolate bread pudding with berries which was just okay, but the milky way bombe was really the bomb! 
Service was impeccable and the ambiance was wonderful!
author: Malu D.

description: Wow what an experience. Ahi tuna that melted in my mouth, perfectly cooked lamb, butterscotch for dessert. Complete experience was flawless. Not a inexpensive  meal but well worth it. Shout out to my mother for raving about this place. (She was president of the NZ food writers guild so knows a few things about good food!)
author: Nick S.
Miko B.

description: Came here for a work dinner. I loved the classic vintage decor, the lighting, and how close it is to the water. Service was phenomenal. Our servant was very knowledgeable with every dish and recommended wine  to go with it. I had the roast duck breast - so tender and juicy, and just the right amount of food after the appetizers. If you order one appetizer, the sea scallops are the one to choose. It was probably the best scallop I've ever had. So tender and flavorful. I can't even begin to describe the sauce... I would definitely go back, but only for a special occasion because it is a bit pricey.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
A great place for a super fancy meal on special occasions. The ambiance is very festive during the holidays and the staff working at the restaurant is very friendly and inviting. 

We started the meal with the scallop appetizer and this was my favorite dish of the night. The scallops were slightly crispy on the outside and very moist and soft on the inside. The scallops were topped with prosciutto, which gave the dish a perfectly smoky flavor. The beans beneath the scallops were also very fragrant from the renderings of the prosciutto. 

For my entree, I ordered the lamb T-bone, which was cooked medium rare. The portion was small, but filling. It came with a side of roasted white carrots and sautéed chard. The T-bone could have had more seasoning, and the medium rare seemed too rare. 

The dessert options were bountiful, but I eventually settled on the butterscotch pudding. It came in a large, ceramic disk, and was covered with crispy, caramel coated cereal clusters, fresh whipped cream, chocolate marshmallow toppings, and chocolate truffles. Also, it was generously drizzled with salted caramel sauce. It was very good at first bite, with the crunch of the crispy rice, the sweet caramel and the soft pudding as well as the bitter truffle. There were many textures in one bite, but after one or two bites, it became too sweet. I recommend the pudding, but it should definitely be shared. 

When I came last time, I ordered the bon bon and these were delicious! They look like a cake pop, but it has ice cream and a cookie inside. The flavor varies, but the combination of a chocolate coating, ice cream, and a crisp cookie is always a winner.
author: Sandra S.

description:
Old guard classic manners staff elegance sets you on a tasteful dining. I enjoyed lunch but was taken back to such a trend setting menu from the Business man to travelers, woman lunching  you can see, Nancy is the Chef she wants you to experience what taste and service is, We were so happy to enjoy this amazing dinning at lunch that so many had shared over the years Dinner couldn't happen 
I could see this as a beautiful romantic place to family sharing food are as treasure memories
 it has a balance  The classic cheeseburger I truly enjoyed with risotto as an appetizer The foodie in me was impressed that I was that a Michelin  restaurant
author: Jeni K.

description:
Historically I have really enjoyed this restaurant, truly amazing, but it is the first time I've been in a year or so (Jan 2018).

Tonight, they seem a shell of their former self.

When I showed up, they informed me that the one and only vegetarian dish, which was a pasta with truffles, and oddly only on the appetizer menu, was sold out.

I asked if there was anything they could do for me, being vegetarian, and they pointed at the beet salad (saccharine and weak, really...if you want a beet salad, take a walk a few blocks away and go to Prospect...wine list is just as good and the veggie food is waaay more inventive), and offered butter noodles. "We do it for kids all the time!"

Gee, thanks.  Such a luxury.
author: David M.

description:
What happened to their single but still prestigious Michelin Star that they've held onto every year since the Guide started to rate restaurants in the US circa 2005?  It vanished in the 2016 listing, but my second time dining here was just as good as the first a few years ago.

ATMOSPHERE:
The bar area is simply gorgeous with its concave brick ceilings, wood moldings, and mosaic & wood floors.  The middle part of the restaurant boasts marble floors and counter seating with a view of the bustling kitchen.  The rear part where we sat had plain old carpet but an enviable view of the Bay Bridge which was totally lit up and twinkling.  Add in the Christmas decorations, and the place looked like a true winter wonderland.   

MENU:
It changes daily, but we had selections of seafood apps, foie gras, soup, salads, fish, quail, lamb & pork chops, filet, and dessert.

FOOD:
House Bread - Soft and fluffy squaw with butter and sprinkled rock salt.  Good but don't fill up on bread alone!

Buratta, Coraline Endive & Dragon Arugula - A tickle for your stomach.  Subtle yet good flavors from the creamy buratta, crisp corona beans and black tahini (sesame seed) paste.  The arugula and endive acted as garnishments.  

Little Gem Lettuce, Green Goddess & Avocado - A caesar-like salad, albeit a mini one.  The lettuce is similar to romaine, just smaller.  The dressing is clear as opposed to creamy white.  Good, but I'd pass and stick to the seafood apps!  The bite of scallop I had off a friend's plate was just divine.

Lamb T-Bone - Holy tiny, Batman!?  3 medium-sized chunks were served off the bone, medium rare as suggested, but had a very odd, smoky/charred flavor, somewhat metallic even, but not gamey.  Weird.  The side of creamed parsley leaf was delish, as were the caramelized chestnuts, and wilted endive.  I didn't read the description well and just saw "wild rice" which actually was "wild rice lamb jus", that looked and tasted like a minuscule teaspoon of mashed potatoes.  I should've gone with the Kurabuta Pork Chop which I thoroughly enjoyed years ago, but I wanted to explore.

Brent Wolfe "King" Quail - Now this was tasty!  The quail "wings" were perfectly pan roasted and seasoned, with slightly crispy skin and juicy meat.  The buttered nettles combined with sautéed Napa cabbage were a great veggie accompaniment.  A puddle of mustard crema, slightly sweet and savory, balanced out the flavors.  Highly recommended!

Italian White Truffles - This was their special of the night, and special it was!  Their al dente house-made pasta which is a little thicker than angel hair, was laced in a creamy, buttery sauce, and topped with shaved parmesan and fresh truffles.  Me, the truffle oil hater, LOVED the fresh slices!  Orally orgasmic at 3 grams for $39, or 5 grams for $69.  Tiny, tasty, to-die-for!

DESSERT:
Chocolate Cream Puff Sundae - Traditional puffs with scoops of pumpkin ice cream in the middle.  The chocolate puffs were good though I'm not a fan of them in general.  Now the ice cream, that was my fave.  Talk about spot-on taste!

Mandarin Orange Vanilla Swirl - A lonely scoop of creamsicle-flavored sorbet was sprinkled in sugar crystals and cookie crumbs with a biscotti-like cookie to the side.  Very refreshing.

SERVICE:
Bartender service was absolutely professional and friendly.  The male server was professional and informative.  Waters were constantly filled and vacated seat napkins re-folded.

TIP:
Some restaurants in San Francisco add on a service charge that supports the city's employer mandates, which is a shared pot of money used for healthcare costs.  Good idea if you ask me.  Here, they add on 5% for "SF Employer Mandates" & "Healthy SF".  

OVERALL:
Beautiful ambiance, nice food presentation, great food.  A favorite of ours.  4.5 stars and still a one Michelin Star in my opinion!
author: Vince N.

description:
Amazing customer service! We had already eaten dinner by the time we saw this place. We decided to go ahead and step in for coffee, green tea, and an ice cream sundae. Jessica was the waitress/bar tender that assisted us at the bar area. Great personality, attentive, fun, and courteous. We will definitely be back!
Oh and the bathrooms were in tip-top immaculate shape! Thanks, Jessica!
author: Anonymous A.

description:
I'm sure there are better restaurants someplace, but I'm having a hard time remembering them because Boulevard just gave me an exquisite case of food amnesia. The food was just familiar enough to be recognizable while being fresh and surprising.  That's not easy.  

Rarely have enjoyed such a consistently strong meal.  The appetizers (the ahi tuna tartare with various inventive crispy side notes and the wonderfully put together figs beets and Gorgonzola cheese) were welcome rifs on old friends. 

We felt like honored guests as we dug into the multi flavored Halibut, Salmon and duck.  Yes the halibut had a bed of greens, but what the heck is the potato doing in a squash florette?

The desserts were also perfect - peach tart and key lime cheesecake.  Great way to end a meal.  Top 10 experience.
author: David S.

description:
Another phenomenal meal at Boulevard. With a choice of over 4,000 restaurants in San Francisco, I knew where I wanted to celebrate my birthday, while living out West for several months on assignment. 

From the beautiful and intimate corner banquette to the personal note delivered to the table, the welcome was warm and the service impeccable. Janelle offered knowledgable and refined service and Eric helped my husband whittle down the 4 Pinot Noirs he'd researched online before coming, by offering more in-depth descriptions of each. 

Foie gras, burrata, the pork chop and lamb t-bone: yummy and special. Thank you for altering the pork chop so that it would be gluten-free for this woman with celiac disease. The "Happy Birthday" chocolate and sugared pear topped off the meal and were a very nice touch, since we were simply too full to order dessert.
 
I've been to Boulevard quite a few times, working for Genentech for many years. Each dinner has been very good, but this one was particularly special, with the holiday decorations, the special spot and the kind attention to detail that surrounded my birthday celebration with my visiting husband. Thank you so much.
author: Maribeth S.

description: By far it's the best restaurant ever. Excellent quality food. The raviolis to di for. Scallops incredibly delicious. Great experience
author: Cristina F.

description: I love this place! I've celebrated many occasions here since young and I've always enjoyed the restaurant's elegance. The food presentation is excellent, but more so- their food is great, consistent, and flavorful. Every time I come here, It's a lovely dining experience. They have superb service, & oh I also love their desserts!
author: Samantha A.

description: To judge a restaurant that has stood the test of time (20 years now or more?) with each time as good as the last... the expectation, excitement and anticipation of a first kiss only better after time, comfort and trust that indeed, this is our favorite restaurant in SF. We have never been disappointed and can't wait until our next time.
author: Kenneth F.

description:
I came here with 3 coworkers for dinner on a Wednesday night. We were unable to get a suitable reservation for Tuesday night, as they were booked until 9:30. When we called on Tuesday they said they only had openings at 5:30 and 8:45, but we checked again the next morning online, and 8 pm had freed up, so we took that reservation. 

The restaurant was absolutely beautiful, even more so because it was decorated for the holidays. There really was a very charming ambiance that's hard to capture with words; I just know I loved being there. When we arrived, it took them a few minutes to seat us because they were so packed. We were seated right behind the hostess podium; I would have loved to have gone farther into the restaurant to see more of the decor, but it wasn't too bad where we were. The restaurant was actually quite large and appeared to go really far back, even though it was completely packed. I really had to scoot in since there was so little space between our table and the tables around us. Since the restaurant was so popular it was really, really loud-- it was hard to carry on a conversation.

For an appetizer, we got the burrata cheese, which was really tasty. I ordered the steak, while all 3 of my coworkers got the halibut, which they described as melt-in-your-mouth, almost like butter. My steak was tasty and done just as medium rare as I wanted. The potatoes that came with it were so, so good and flavorful; I honestly liked them even better than the steak. We also got a bottle of red wine to share; the server was able to help us pick one from the frankly overwhelming wine list.

I didn't pay so I don't know the exact cost of the meal, but my steak was about $50 and the halibuts were about $30-something each. My boss, when paying for the next night's meal at an upscale Italian restaurant, joked that our Boulevard meal was about double the price (although we only got 2 glasses of wine at the Italian place, rather than a whole bottle, which would have contributed to the price). Overall, I'm glad I got to try such a well-reviewed and beautiful restaurant, but the price, crowding, and noise level knocked it down from 5 to 4 stars for me.
author: Connie L.

description: Boulevard is solid! Everything on the menu is very good. Came here for lunch and had the crispy chicken sandwich and it was delicious. Very good vibe and atmosphere. Great place for lunch and dinner.
author: Michael C.

description:
Great experience here on a Saturday night.  This was one of the few places in SF I had been intending to get to for years, I had only heard good things, and had never gone to for whatever reason and it certainly did not disappoint.  Service was great, laid back but at the same time the second you need something they were right there.  

Our waiter had fantastic recommendations for wine and also did a great job of explaining how the filet mignon would normally be cooked so my pregnant wife could order accordingly so it wouldn't be undercooked yet also so it wasn't completely destroyed by overcooking such a great piece of meat.  

I was also surprised that the pork chop that I ordered would normally be cooked medium-rare with significant pink which is not how I typically like my pork, so by telling me that and having a conversation about it I knew that medium-well for me would be the right order and both came cooked perfectly.  A great example of wait staff working with the customer and the cooks applying that information in perfect harmony you just don't always see.

Both the filet and pork chop were amazing, the sauces were certainly present and very tasty but also subtle and not overwhelming the meats which should of course be the stars of the show and the sides were excellent.  The peach pie/crumble dessert was also fantastic.  The lobster/shrimp ravioli appetizer with truffle was good but a bit of an afterthought after the main courses I have to say more because the latter were that good.  

Long story short, I would highly recommend Boulevard, and fortunately it is not an impossible reservation to get and I would say that the quality significantly exceeds the typical price point in SF for what you get.
author: Joshua D.

description: Ambience and setting were fine. Service staff was kind. Lunch food was underwhelming. We were a party of 5+. Apparently the lunch burger is good.
author: Andrew H.

description: The best things were the appetizers! Our soft shell crab was decadent. The scallops were delish! The entrees were fine. The dessert was good, although I thought goat milk ice cream was weird...
author: Michelle K.

description:
I came here for an anniversary dinner and the experience was alright. We had reservations and it took us 30 minutes to get seated, only to get a table right next to the door facing, not the Bay Bridge, but the street parking lot. 

Food - Some plates were great, others were decent. I hate to be blunt, but I can see why this restaurant no longer has a Michelin star. All in all, the food was good considering the price per plate is not that expensive (Ranging from $20 - $40 per plate).

What we ordered:

Appetizers -- 
Dungeness crab - Light and refreshing taste. (4/5)
Foie gras - Probably the best foie gras I've had. (5/5)

Entrees -- 
Lamb - For "the best" entree on the menu, I was disappointed. Not too memorable. (3/5)
Halibut - The halibut didn't melt in my mouth as I had hoped. The side vegetables were meh. (3/5)

Dessert -- 
Chocolate "Pie" - Don't be deceived, the chocolate pie wasn't really a pie. It was more like three chocolate truffles, with a scoop of ice cream. Pretty average selection. (2/5) 
Carrot Cake - I love carrot cake, but I never knew how much better carrot cake can get. Hands down, best carrot cake I've had. (5/5)

Service - Our waitress was great. She gave us good recommendations and was very personable. However, the service of the bartender and the two hostesses seating us was subpar.
author: Diana C.

description:
One word: Exemplary.  

The atmosphere was perfect, wait staff helpful and knowledgeable and the food was superb. We will be back for an anniversary dinner next year!
author: A L.

description: One word - amazing. My friend and I had a reservation for 9 pm. While waiting to be seating, unexpectedly, the host kindly asked us if we wanted to check in our bags. After about 5 min, we (party of 2) were promptly seated for our 9pm reservation. The waitress was extremely kind and professional; she was experienced with the ins and outs of the menu. She had no problem answering any questions we had and always stopped by politely and with a smile. For starters, we ordered the Maryland Soft Shell Crab and that was one of the best crabs I've ever tasted. The mix of sour of the lemon, crunch of the celery, and the softness and crispy of the crab was perfect! I ordered the Lamb T-Bone for my main. The lamb was extremely tender and cooked perfectly. Added on with the ceci bean hummus and artichokes, it definitely was pleasant to the taste. For desert, we ordered the raspberry  bon bon which was the "cherry-on-top" to the dinner. A hard white chocolate and sweet cold ice cream played off to the savory tastes we had prior. The portion sizes were perfect, I walked out extremely satisfied but not overly full. I don't recommend visiting here daily but definitely worth the experience on a special occasion!
author: Wallace L.

description:
Food, service and decor were all wonderful. I do have to say that comparably for the price, there may be better restaurants out there - but Boulevard is definitely a great spot for a celebratory dinner. The ambiance is lively, there's great energy and noise but you definitely feel like you can sit and chat for quite some time without feeling rushed. Service is impeccable and our waiter was lovely. I had let the restaurant know ahead of time that it was a going away dinner and the waiter knew exactly what to do, was super helpful such a charming gentleman. The food is delicious but in terms of wow factor, I don't think I was blown away by the dishes and flavors, it felt safe and solid so no complaints, but if you're looking for the extra oomph, I might suggest some other also high quality restaurants in the bay area. 

Drinks: We tried some of their specialties like the hibiscus moscow mule, cucumber gimlet and dolores swizzle - all great choices and provided an excellent atmosphere to start off and went fine with all our orders. 

Appetizers: We ordered the sea scallops, as well as the sweet white corn and dungeness crab ravioli for our starters. The scallops were delicious and very flavorful - highly recommend. The ravioli was delicious as well, but smaller in portion than what I expected.

Entrees: Halibut with fingerling potatoes, brussel sprouts and lobster mushrooms. This was wonderfully cooked and seasoned but again nothing that will blow your palette away. The Lamb T-Bone was delicious medium rare with eggplant stuffed burrata. tomato and basil (I really enjoyed the stuffed eggplant!) and lastly one of my friends ordered something that was like a pasta dish with truffle and I really cannot remember what it was called, so sorry! Again, everything was tasty, but just didn't blow us away. 

Desserts: We got the strawberry icecream bonbon which was really yummy! I don't normally like strawberry ice cream, but it was matched so well with the white chocolate hard shell covering it made for a such a scrumptious bite. We also ordered the peach and vanilla tart and it made for a wonderful closer. It wasn't too sweet and topped off the night just right.

Overall, great experience, atmosphere, friendly staff - did i mention views of the bay bridge? location is great if you want to walk around along the water, and even stop by the ferry building area after I would say that it's definitely a worthwhile place to visit but set your expectations accordingly! 

~chow!
author: Deanna S.

description:
WHATS UP YELPING YELPERS,

My name is Kyle, and while I am fully capable to write a review on the deliciousness that was my Scallop + Risotto creamy, gooey, perfectly cooked indulgence, this post is not about the food at Boulevard. 

This review is about Gabriella our waitress. She IS an incredible human being. From the warm and authentic greeting to the laughs and sincere space all the while a sound professional in the restaurant realm, my business/life/lunch partner and I ended that meal by embracing Gabriella in a hug. She truly has a gift and this review goes out to your entirety. Gabriella is a BEAMING light to this world and I write these words with immense humility to the dining experience she shaped for us last Friday. Thank you for being you. 

I would encourage (if she wants to) that the Boulevard team receives a training on customer satisfaction from Gabriella, she crafted a memorable experience at the Boulevard that we are hungry for more, and perhaps some more risotto too.

Rock on,

Kyle "I would like gnocchi, risotto, scallops and more risotto" Edquist 

*carb Loading; next week is a salad...
author: Kyle E.

description:
Went here and had the Steak Dinner.  It was much better than I anticipated. My bar is set pretty low on low fat steaks but it was tender and delicious. My bar is set low because my favorite cut is a Rib Eye, but hat's on me not Boulevard.

My Bartender Dillon was fantastic as was the rest of the wait staff. It was on the expensive side but in the end well worth it.

If you're in town or near by go here. I can highly recommend it.
author: Steven T.

description: Went to Boulevard to celebrate my wife's academic achievement. The restaurant has a great location opposite to the ferry building on the embarcadero. We were seated immediately thought we arrived a little early for our reservation. The staff was very courteous and very attentive. Food was great. I had the lamb and my wife had the risotto, we strongly recommend both. The buratta for an appetizer was also very good. The place is pricey but that was expected. Strongly recommend
author: Hussain A.

description: This is still great food, how ever the service has slipped. I was there for lunch last week with a friend. Our waiter (with a pony tail) could care less about the service he gave us. The only positive thing he did was suggest a couple of good wines. Other than that he ignored us. Last straw was when we ordered dessert he didn't bother to ask us if we wanted coffee. All the servers were very friendly and helpful. I called the general manager and left a voice mail. He did not return my call. I just won't pay that kind of money for substandard service.
author: Bill M.

description:
We went here for our anniversary dinner. The service was fine, and the food was okay, but we left wondering how Boulevard could have a Michelin star. Uh, that's because it doesn't anymore.. Not that Michelin stars are everything, but for the price, I wouldn't have minded going elsewhere 

Here's what we got:
- Ahi Tuna Tartar Starter: Looked cool, but you couldn't taste the tuna at all. 
- Octopus Starter: Good. I liked the potatoes and the sauce with it, but wish the actual octopus was more tender 
- Kurobato Pork Chop Entrée: By far the best dish of the night which was not what we expected. It was seared so it had a really nice crust. The sauce & mashed potatoes were good. Only critic would be that I wish the peaches and bacon on top were warm 
- Salmon Entrée: it was okay. Nothing special about it 
- Dark Chocolate Cream Puff 'Croquembouche': Are cream puffs always so tough? When I bit into it, I had to do that thing where you have to turn to your face while holding it in place to tear it apart. 
- Bon Bon Black Sesame Ice Cream: it was like a cake pop. It wasn't perfectly round and was super sugary. 

If I went back, it would be for the pork chop. I could see this as a good place for business meetings though
author: Angela T.

description: Visiting from NYC , good friends recommended giving it another try(we had tried the place a long time ago and saw shockingly rude service).  Very good service this time - professional and friendly.  Overall there were sublime moments and some not so much.  Main dishes were terrific- refresh, clean ingredients, wonderful prep and presentation.  First courses , however, were over conceived.  For example, I had the snail ravioli.  Good, but I tasted no snail from everything else on the plate.  Same thing with burrata.  Desserts were kind of a mix:  deconstructed carrot cake was great, but you'd be hard pressed to find rice in the rice pudding cake.  All in all, worth the trip but not worth going out of the way for
author: Norman H.

description: Went here for wife's birthday.  service was great. Enjoyed the ambience and food.  It deserves 4.5 stars
author: Jeremy R.

description: Top notch dining, just a few steps from the ferry marketplace. I was perfectly comfortable sitting at the chefs table in my traveling jeans & t-shirt, though dressier business attire seemedthe standard. Chef & crew will take good care of you. The sole with crab thighs left me speechless. Treat yourself, it's worth it.
author: Nicole L.

description: Best restaurant in the city. Food is amazing. Ambiance is amazing. Wait staff is professional and amazing. My husband and I celebrated our 9th wedding anniversary a while back and going here made our evening. One of our best anniversaries yet.
author: Tara H.

description: Get to try this place for my birthday lunch. Surprisingly the price is not so bad. I guess I expect a super expensive like around $30 per plate but it is pretty decent around $15-$20 for this elusive place.
