The interior is really old school exclusive club, remind me of the house of prime rib. In terms of food, it is super yummy and also the service definitely super friendly and attentive.
author: L D.

description:
Boulevard has long been an SF institution for fine dining.  The dining room is unique with its barrel roof made of bricks and bar that could have been serving customers in the roaring 20's.

I've been to Boulevard many times over the last 20 years and I noticed on a recent lunch that I'd never written a review.  Shame on me!

My colleague and I started with the Dungeness crab tostada and a split of champagne.  The crab is sourced from Washington due to the problems with this years California crab season.  Crab, avocado and a bit of spicy heat on a tostada shell, yes please!  This was a delicious dish.

For 2nd course, we had the tuna tartare.  Fresh chopped tuna with a jalapeño ponzu sauce; it was also delicious.

We each had the halibut as our main course.  It was a bit dry and didn't live up to the quality of the first 2 courses.  I'll write this off as a fluke since I've had so many great meals over the years but I will likely be hesitant to order a grilled fish here in the future.

I would not hesitate to bring friends, family or clients to Boulevard for a casual meal.  Boulevard is that special breed of SF restaurant that long held a Michelin star but is still affordable and unpretentious.
author: Lance W.

description:
I have been here so many times but realized I never left any notes for myself for the future visits and I think it's time to boil down my dining experience over the years and leave a note for the future me.

Ordering appetizers and splitting main course halibut was amazing idea. 
Foie Gras was nothing special
Soft shell crab was a deep fried mistake
The truffle tortellini were loved by everyone at the table. 
The crab meat rolled in the cucumber skin was very delicate.
Service was polite and prompt,
When I ordered wine he poured the last drops from the bottle with all funk on the bottom.
With the price tag, I think it's 3,5 stars for me. But it's not bad.
author: Anelya S.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the food and service at Boulevard. Nice view of the Bay bridge, excellent cocktails. It was a great celebration, and they amped up one of our ordered desserts with a nice congratulations decoration made of chocolate. We brought our own wine and paid $20 corkage.
author: Mike P.

description:
I personally believe that Boulevard should have been placed on a Boulevard and not a street, just kidding. Otherwise, this place was nothing short of perfection.
My best friend and I came to San Francisco on a mission. To eat good, and have fun. We wanted to at least go out and have one 'boujee' night on our trip and after looking at several Michelin Star Chef restaurants, we decided on making reservations at Boulevard and we were certainly not disappointed!
To start things off, Boulevard has fantastic customer service and such a unique vibe to it. It's a very relaxed yet high end restaurant with beautiful floor tiles and intimate lighting. They also have coat service and bar service while you wait.
When my friend and I were seated we were immediately tended to by our waitress who took our drink orders. My best friend was pregnant, so my friend notified our waitress and our waitress made sure all of my friend's food was thoroughly cooked, and even so the food was amazing.
We ordered the Scallops for the appetizer, and even though they were fully cooked, they had such a buttery melt in your mouth taste! It was perfectly seasoned, we just had to make every bite worth it. For our entrees I got the medium rare Lamb T Bone, and my friend got the Halibut. The Halibut came with this phenomenal cream sauce. That sauce was no joke. I need a lifetime supply of it so I can smother everything in it the way people obsess Nutella with desserts! And the Lamb T Bone? Don't get me started. My stomach still growls over it. I cleaned the plate! I vacuum sucked that food straight to my stomach. (Just kidding I actually tried really hard to not eat so fast because I wanted to savor every moment)! It was cooked to perfection. You can still see lots of pink which I love, the seasoning was amazing and everything just blended so well. There was a perfect amount of savory to sweet and some starch from the Yukon and some crunch from the veggies. I would have to say that was one of the best plates I've ever eaten. I actually even helped my friend eat all of her food because I couldn't get enough of it!
Finally we knew that no matter how full we were, we had to get dessert! We ordered the Peaches and Cream sundae to share which was incredible. Layers of fresh peaches, storm fruit, bruleed Toffee and cake bites. It sounds overly sweet but the tart from the fruits really brought it together. 
Also I must add that one of the staff members that was cleaning our tables I believe his name was Josef and he said he was from Mexico was super awesome. He was extremely friendly and attentive. He had many customers to work with but still managed to make each one feel special and that is a difficult feature to uphold. 
Overall, Boulevard wasn't just that one crazy night that my friend and I said "TREAT YO SELF". It was actually very memorable and I think all of the staff had very high standards to make it that way for each and every customer and I applaud that. San Francisco really wasn't my personality, but I would definitely come back just to eat here. Definitely one of the highlights of my trip!
author: Violet H.

description:
My boyfriend took us here for our anniversary and I was blown away. I consider myself a foodie but I had never heard of Boulevard so when this was our surprise dinner spot, I didn't know what to expect and didn't have a chance to research online or on Yelp. My first impression when walking in was how BEAUTIFUL this restaurant is. It reminded me of some of the Gaudi buildings in Barcelona. It was dim and very romantic with bowtied waiters and well-dressed patrons. I am used to nice restaurants in SF being full of people in jeans but here, everyone was in cocktail dresses and many men were in suits. A felt underdressed in a collared shirt and a pair of grey chinos. I will say that I was wearing heels and the floor, especially next to the kitchen and bathroom, was a bit slippery and I was worried about my heels getting stuck in the tiling so just a warning.

Anyways, we were sat for our reservation at a two-top with a great view of the kitchen and were given our menus and the wine list. The wine list at Boulevard was extensive and, to celebrate, we ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir (it may have been the cheapest on the menu but shhhh). We were brought bread which was delicious and crusty and proceeded to order our meal. We ate:

-Chilled Dungeness Crab ($21)-We shared this appetizer and I loved it. It was light and had a nice tang. It was a good size to share and primed us for our main courses. A wasn't necessarily a fan of the grapefruit in the dish but I definitely think it is worth ordering. It didn't pair well with the wine we ordered but, of course, that's on us and not Boulevard.

-Quail ($39)-This was my main and it was delicious and served beautifully. The flavors went well together and it was perfectly comforting on a cold, SF night. It was savory with a touch of sweetness and was perfect. The Quail was cooked really well and I was quite happy.

-Kurobuta Pork Chop ($39) - This was A's main and it was HUGE. Easily double the size of mine but he had no issue polishing it off. This was delicious and I couldn't stop sneaking bites. The meat was cooked well and the flavors were cozy. A was very happy with his choice as well.

Since we were celebrating, we also ordered dessert even though we didn't *really* need it. We had the Chocolate Silk Cream Pie ($12) which was FANTASTIC. Whoever is the pastry chef at Boulevard deserves Kudos for this delicious dessert. It was rich but the texture was airy. We devoured it in 2 minutes and, if the environment were less fancy, I think we would have wanted to lick the plate. 

In addition to the wonderful food at Boulevard, the service was great. A lot of nice restaurants have stuffy service but we felt like the service here was friendly and unobtrusive. Our water glasses never were empty and we received a second serving of bread without asking. I think it's a quality of a nice restaurant to have great service where the wait staff reads your mind on what you need.

The final bill was pretty reasonable for the restaurant of this calibre considering we had 3 courses and a bottle of wine. Obviously we would never come here for a random meal (too expensive for that) but both of us would love to come back, especially since their menu changes regularly. I don't know why this place lost its Michelin star considering it was a better experience, to me, than other 1-starred restaurants but rest assured, a meal here is a real treat and if you get the chance, it's worth the visit.
author: Carrie W.

description:
After having dinner at Prospect a few months ago, we decided to give Boulevard a try.  Its a large, loud restaurant located at the end of Mission St at the Embarcadero.  Like Prospect, Boulevard seems geared toward meat lovers, especially pork chops!  Nancy Oakes (the chef-owner) once published this amazing vanilla brine for cooking pork chops at home.

We started with the Spanish octopus with squid-ink tortellini filled with potatoes.  Octopus was cooked really tender and seasoned well - just wished there was more of it!  Tortellini had an interesting briny taste but otherwise very good. 4 stars.

The pork chop didn't disappoint - a Kurobuta thats incredibly juicy and flavored with pickled cherries.  The other surprise is the use of candied popcorn!  It was mixed in with the corn as a garnish and the mashed up with cheese and polenta and then fried.  Its maybe a tad behind Prospect's pork chop but this dish is still a top-tier version.  5 stars.  (TIP: Pair with a glass of pinot noir, since the cherry-flavors of the wine goes well)

I was slightly disappointed with the King Salmon. Cooked medium rare and seasoned well, but it just lacked the wow factor.  Add a few asparagus spears, a pea mash, and some shaved truffles and its a pricy dish at about $40.  I should have had the lamb or beef dish. 3 stars.

The Blackberry and White Chocolate dessert was amazing, due to the many elements.  Coconut foam, Black Sesame Ice Cream, and this interesting cake of white chocolate and matcha.  Then, some real sweet blackberries.  This dessert goes well with their house coffee.  5 stars.

Boulevard remains a classic SF place that's really good with pork!  Service was friendly but the kitchen tended to be a little slow after apps came out.  Overall 4 stars.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Boulevard- an oldie but NOT a goody.

Food was okay. Nothing spectacular and definitely not Michelin worthy. They appropriately lost their Michelin star rating in 2016. 

I ordered an unmemorable kale chopped salad, a slightly dry king salmon, and a tasty Milky Way bombe for dessert (visualize an edible chocolate bath bomb)

Service was slow, inattentive and akin to being served by a tortoise; definitely not up to par for a   $$$$ dining establishment. Our server stopped by to introduce himself and to get our drink orders, and it was just downhill after that. Dinner dragged out due to the scattered service. We had to flag our server down a few times to remind him to bring our water and bread.

There's too many other great dining options in SF so save your hard earned dough and go someplace else. I definitely would NOT recommend this place.
author: shatier x.

description:
I was always intrigued by Boulevard's classy and old time-y exterior, so I booked reservations for Mr. Joy's birthday once. It still took a while to get a table. While we waited around the bar, I did some people-watching. The dining area was dimly lit and intricately decorated in somewhat of a French-Louisiana style. Even though we were only a couple of minutes late, we weren't seated until about half an hour later. When we finally sat down, we were definitely ready to eat.

Angus Filet - w/ sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes & corn, red peppers, & roasted beef jus:
The filet mignon was excellently cooked to a nice medium rare, a little pink on the inside and quite juicy. It seemed a little on the small side. The accoutrements were also tasty.

Kurobuta Pork Chop - apple fritto, apple miel poppy seed spaetzle, brussel sprouts, bacon, squash & roasted sage pork jus:
Pretty good chop, I'd say. There was a lot going on with the sides, but the flavors seemed a little lost, with the exception of the double smoked bacon, of course. Perhaps I'm not a fan of spaetzle.

Dreams Never End Bon Bon - rye whiskey & pear ice cream, almonds & cocoa nib:
This dessert was overflowing with sweetness. Mr. Joy enjoys liquor-flavored sweets, but I find them to be too much for liking. The whiskey-flavored mousse was especially strong. The bon bons were the best part for me, because they resembled little bite-sized truffles.

The meal ended with a birthday surprise dessert, so we definitely had our fill of sweets. It was a candle in what looked like a serving of semifreddo, accompanied with rolled-up crepe cookies, and a white chocolate rectangle, piped with "Happy Birthday!" It was cool and refreshing compared to the cloyingly sweet previous dessert.

Service was excellent. Our server was very friendly, sweet, and chatty, albeit at times, a little too chatty. We left feeling full from the food and full of knowledge about the waitress's life story. 
Overall, the meal was great. The filet and pork chop were delicious, but I wasn't a big fan of our desserts. Compared to the plethora of dining options around, I didn't find the menu selections very unique or exciting, but that's not exactly an issue since they serve mostly classic dishes.
author: Joy W.

description:
We stumbled upon this place because we were staying at Hotel Vitale directly across the street. I didn't know anything about it, we were really lucky to get dinner reservations...this is a place to make advanced reservations. The food is phenomenal! Our waiter knew absolutely everything about the menu and the wine list. 

Our daughter goes to SFSU, and we made reservations to eat here a second time and it didn't disappoint. Pricey, but you get what you pay for!! Costumers for life. 

Try the pork chop! My daughter got it the first time there, it was so good that she was extremely stingy on sharing a bite, I got a nibble. The second time there, I got the chop and it was to die for!!! No regrets.
author: Mari R.

description: Food is stellar. Setting is beautiful though loud. Mostly, we were just sort of shocked at the mediocre service ~ slow and disinterested. Slow to take drink orders. Slow to take dinner orders. Slow to bring water. Slow to check on status. Slow to bring bill at the end of the meal. At $100/person minimum, not ideal.
author: Phoebe W.

description:
If everything happens for a reason: Boulevard is $$$$ for a reason, and I like to think of myself as a food critic (wannabe) who ended up dining here for a a reason :3 Anyways, regardless of whether or not I have a good reason to spend time writing a lengthy review, here it goes:

1. Bread & butter | Mmm so simple yet so good. The rustic crusty bread boasted an incredibly fluffy interior, reminiscent of Josey Baker perfection. It was well complemented by the creamy butter with coarse salt flakes. Salted butter on bread is not the most haute fine dining, but it was flawless take on a universal staple that opened up the meal nicely.

2. Salad | Curiously, there was no assortment of toppings, and the salad relied almost entirely on leaves. Composed of finely chopped kale, palatable butter lettuce, an assortment of other earthy and bitter leaves, and some ribbons of sweet onion, this was an artisan salad with much thought put into it. The quality was fresh and crisp, the variety of ingredients was original, and the textures were tantalizingly diverse from the friseé to the wilted kale, all dressed in a sharp, tangy vinaigrette. 

3. Wagyu steak | The quality was superb, as you would expect for wagyu. I like how the cooking style was minimalist on butter and seasoning, bringing to focus to the beef itself. The minimal use of butter foregoes the outer crisp, but as a result it was a more sophisticated cut: tender yet lean, flavorful and mildly juicy. There was also a smear of avocado (which made a delicious sauce) and a sprinkle of broccoli floret bits (which seemed really random to me).

4. Sides | My favorite side was the mashed potatoes. Instead of the typical creamy, buttery (and almost semi-synthetic) mashed potatoes at most restaurants, Boulevard employed creative ingredients in a memorable homestyle version. Big chunks of potato evidenced in-house mashing from scratch, superimposed with an unexpected crisp from thin radish slices. Additionally, there was a side of purple potatoes but in the dim lighting it looked burnt (I didn't realize it was purple until I opened my box of leftovers at home!); there was also broccolini which was good though a bit oily.

4. Panna cotta | Initially I thought the unwieldy goblet of pink layers looked slightly tacky, but this turned out to be an outstanding dessert. The layers of soft cake, whipped cream, and sliced strawberries mixed with the berry sorbet (in a perfectly spherical form!) blended together in a scrumptious yet elegant rendition of strawberries and cream shortcake. It wasn't too sweet, instead predominantly fruity with a hint of floral. I inhaled my goblet, and it was a very satisfying way to end the meal.

5. Ambiance | It's fancy with intricate details and European design, but I found the atmosphere bordering on too metaphorically stiff--dining her almost felt like stepping into a movie in which I was training to be a proper young lady! I guess that's part of the $$$$ dining experience?? Nonetheless, all the servers were exceptionally polite and professional.

The verdict: Bouge in all respects. Boulevard is well equipped with an army of well-known chefs, as detailed on their website, and the food obviously will not disappoint. However, whether it is really worth the hefty price tag is questionable, especially given the small portions. I have the impression that guys have a love-hate relationship with Boulevard: they are glad it's a good date night place to impress girls, but deep inside they probably resent how expensive the food is and how small all the plates are. (At least the presentation is stellar, so girls will get well-liked Instagrams)
author: Edna C.

description: I made open table reservations for my husband's birthday. We had the calamari, lobster bisque, wagyu bavette and lobster paella. Everything was good. Service was good. We ordered the Indonesian Creme Brulee which was really small however it came with a happy birthday sign. We were charged for a "refill" for ice tea that's the only I did not like but maybe it's just the way how these nice restaurants operate. I did order an ice tea with a slash of lemonade that was $5.75 on top of my drink.  Overall I would come back the food was great and quality was good.
author: Jane C.

description:
My husband and I were super excited to try this place. We went for dinner Friday night, and sad to say we were a bit disappointed. 

Let's start off with the positives. The restaurant is gorgeous. The decor is beautiful, and the service was even better. Everyone is very attentive and nice. 

We first ordered the Beet Frisée salad which was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Tasted like any other beet salad I've had at past restaurants. The burrata salad was amazing, and definitely one of the best I have ever had. The flavor profiles were mouth watering. 

Next, we both ordered the Porcini mushroom milanese for our entree with ricotta gnocchi. The gnocchi was excellent, but the dish was a flop. Mushrooms were all very saturated, fried and greasy. After two bites, I wanted to be done with the dish.  The menu is a bit deceiving with this entree. It's described as a milanese preparation, so I thought the mushrooms would be lightly breaded, but it was heavily deep fried. And I believe the dish only had 3-4 gnocchi's, so all you were left with were deep fried mushrooms. 

Leaving off with a good note, the desserts were excellent. Very unusual, and very good. We tried the dark chocolate & almond and the dark chocolate pudding. Both were delicious. The server was super sweet and brought us complimentary cake pops and candies at the end of the meal, which was a very nice gesture. 

Underwhelming due to the reputation and the main entree. But I'm sure the other dinner entree's are much better.
author: Elina D.

description: Food is great the staff is friendly,parking valet ,it's pricey but worth it .Life is short I've always wanted to eat here I'm glad I finally did.
author: Terance C.

description: Celebrated my birthday here Saturday night.  The food was wonderful but the service was even more amazing.  Ben, our server, went above and beyond to ensure our group had a wonderful time.  We did and it was a simply memorable night.  Kudos to Viet as well.  The private dining room was perfect for our party.  We'll be back in the near future.
author: Almie P.

description:
Waste of my money... thought to treat my husband to a lovely birthday dinner but maybe my expectation were too high. I heard of this place on a tv show about the best restaurants in SF. But to be honest the food was just ok , I had the fish and my husband had the steak, and it was just ok. Nothing special in my opinion and it was very load in there. 
The bathroom is like underground behind a secret door which was so confusing and unnecessary. 
Our waitress was not talkative or cared to check up on us at all or recommend  anything. The busboy was actually great and was the one to recommend the food to us. 
Anyways if you are looking for a nice fancy dinner go somewhere else.
author: Deezy P.

description:
How have I not reviewed Boulevard yet?!? We had our wedding reception there! And when I say reception, I mean dinner for 14 people. We rented the wine vault and it was spectacular.

What I loved about this is that we didn't need a set menu. We gave everyone a menu, told them to get whatever they want and had a friend in charge of making sure the wine kept coming. It was PERFECT.  That was Nov 2015. We of course went back for our 1st anniversary in 2016 and we will be going back for our 2nd anniversary this November. The staff was wonderful. 

I can't comment on all of the food because between us and our group we probably had everything. But I can say that there were no complaints. I had a filet, my husband had the lamb. We had several cheeses, desserts, starters. It was a smorgasbord. I may have mentioned this. It was perfect. 

Worth every penny and it's now a very special place for us.
author: Brie P.

description:
Amazing world class charm ... 
great service and food ......
Was amazed how fast out appetizers and meal came out even though they had a full house
author: Ali S.

description:
my husband and I ate there last night for our 35th wedding anniversary. service was OK nothing like it used to be. we used to feel special now you are just another patron.  I ordered raspberry lemonade that was so sour I could drink it.  If our server was attentive she would have noticed and offered another beverage.  The same with the entrée.  While the lamb was delicious the rice concoction was in edible as was the under cooked broccoli.  Instead of asking if she could pack up half of my meal it would have been more appropriate to ask if everything was OK.  This was a special night and it would have been nice to have a more attentive server.  Nice touch with the pre-made anniversary banner though.
Don't think we will be back anytime soon.
author: Ann T.

description:
Finally got to have dinner at Boulevard for the first time last night after years of hearing rave reviews from people I know. Overall, I expected to be more "WOW'd" by the food itself which is why I'm giving this place only 3 stars.

SERVICE--Impeccable and fantastic from beginning to end. We originally had reservations at 6:15p but ended up wrapping up our day early so called to see if they could move us up. They accommodated for us to come at 5:30p with no problems. There was not one moment where we felt ignored in this place between our server, the bread guy and whoever else came by to bring our food and drinks. Definitely Michelin quality service from beginning to end. They knew it was my birthday so had a special birthday card for me at the table and added a Happy Birthday chocolate on our dessert with a candle. 

FOOD--The food was cooked well but both my husband and I found it a bit bland. Maybe we've just been spoiled by all the great food in the Bay Area but I really was expecting to be floored because this place has won so many awards. Everything was cooked to perfection but seasonings were a bit too simple for my taste. Best thing we ate were the scallop appetizers but for $25 for two scallops, we definitely won't be coming back. Salmon was very small portion for the hefty price as well. Pork chop was cooked to perfection and very juicy and flavorful but nothing that would get me to return. Best part of the meal was the dark chocolate pudding we had for dessert. It came with a peanut butterfinger stick and chocolate pop rocks which was something I've never seen before. 

Overall, the meal was good but unimpressive. For the price, there are other restaurants in San Francisco that I would opt to eat at rather than coming back to this place. Glad I finally got to go and can cross it off of my list of places to try.
author: Betty R.

description: First time diner. Came here with our Lloyd's syndicate Underwriters. Pricey, to be expected. Beautiful presentation on the food. It's a little pretentious,). Typical SF techie/investor relations type of establishment i.e." we have a lot of disposable income" type crowd. Overall, I would recommend. Food was solid, faux French decor was pleasant enough, wine list was solid, starter plates seemed definately the way to go.
author: Claire S.

description:
When we lived in the city this was our go to spot. I don't know what all the fuss is about in previous reviews.

Make a reservation! They book quick for dinner so get on it! Their menu does change seasonally. If it's a special occasion let them know when you make a reservation.

Bar- they have a great little bar area, one hell of a wine menu and they make killer cocktails. We always go here for a drink before dinner.

Dinner- food has always been top notch the numerous times we've eaten here. Appetizers are a little small so I'd suggest getting 2 and sharing. They do serve bread w amazing butter and sea salt so don't fill up! I've gotten the filet mignon and duck confit both were outstanding. Their desserts are on another level. Do get the bon bons ... yes I said bon bons. 

Service- we've always had incredible service. I'm one of those people that thinks you're treated the way you're treating the server ... so be nice and understand that everyone makes mistakes once in awhile even at nice restaurants ... big whoop. 

Location is great. It's right on the Embarcadero so if you're visiting as for a 2 seater on the bay side. :) 

Great spot for a fancy night out or special occasion
author: Mal L.

description:
I was a lucky girl today, my office buddy let me join her on a rep lunch at Boulevard! (of course - right when we had to leave to meet there an emergency for the big boss came up - but I slapped it out and ran  to lunch)

I had the lemonade of the day (with raspberries) - something i would not normally order, but when someone else is paying - heck yeah I'll try it.

Kinda annoying that they don't have the menu online so you can peruse and figure out what you are going to get ahead...but BREATHE - you CAN choose an entree without pouring over the Yelp photos beforehand.

My friend said I could not take photos (bummer). I ordered the risotto with artichoke, and burrata and added seared scallops (the 4 scallops were amazing - I forget the up charge for them, but totally worth it.

The portions are not large, but plenty.

I was the only one at the table who ordered dessert...yes, I am that girl, it was a frozen chocolate mouse slice atop some sort of crust, served with a teeny scoop of (coffee) ice cream -  not my favorite flavor - but i managed to choke it down.
author: Amy W.

description: This was a great place great food we only went for lunch but everything was delicious I got a perfect seasoned salad not over dressed and some perfectly crispy fritters. I also loved their fruit iced teas perfect for a sunny lunch
author: Jennifer V.

description:
This was our first time here after eyeing the place for years. Our expectations were high and Boulevard did not disappoint. Desiree and team delivered great service. 

We ordered wine by the glass, one Cab Sauvignon and three Zinfandels, all very good. 

We enjoyed the farm grown abalone appetizer with a sauced green pasta. 

Mains: the lamb was super delicious (California Lamb T-Bone Wood Oven Roasted, Served Off the Bone - Broken potato with crispy jacket, nuvolina cacio e pepe lambs quarter greens & broccoli romanesco green peppercorn lamb jus). The pork chop (Berkshire Kurobuta Pork Prime Rib Chop Wood Oven Roasted - Calvados mutsu apple fritto, cold pressed apple miel, poppy seed spaetzle, half moon bay brussel sprouts & Edwards Virginia bacon. Deviled red kuri squash & roasted sage pork jus) was very good.

We enjoyed a caramel chocolate desert with extra scoops of ice cream to accompany it. Very nice.

The weather outside was liquid, it was raining very hard. Still, the place was on a roar.

They have a variety of seating arrangements. Our table for two was perfect for us, but we also noticed booths for two where both diners face outward, and a lot of diners were going to private rooms. 

What do you think?
author: Reyn J.

description: Amazing! Five stars. The decor and ambience in this place is so great. The service is excellent and the food is great. I recommend for a fancy lunch or dinner.
author: Shenna J.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in SF. Always sit at the Chef's counter. You will always learn something new. Food is always great. Great wine list and service never fails. Will always be a go to restaurant for me.
author: Allan B.

description:
Dining alone isn't an activity I'm really accustomed to (although I learned on Friends that it's great and I should do it more often), but I just finished up a solo meal at Boulevard. My dining experience was fantastic. 

I showed up at 8:30 on a Sunday and the restaurant was basically dead. I pulled up a seat at the bar and the two bartenders immediately got me taken care of. They were both very friendly, and mostly left me to my own devices. When I passed on ordering a drink and opted for water they were completely cool with it which isn't always a given.

I ordered a three course meal starting with the Red Abalone. This is something I was completely unfamiliar with but my grandpa who spent a lot of time in SF between deployments in WWII told me I should try to track some down while I'm here. The sauce they were served in was super tasty. I completely cleaned the plate (which is a theme for this meal).

The Kurobota Pork Chop was also excellent. It was cooked perfectly. The smoked bacon and brussels sprouts were also great (the parsnip mash was okay, I could have done without it, the pieces weren't evenly cooked). Once again, completely finished the dish.

For dessert I had the Chocolate & Caramel. This was basically three separate desserts served together: ice cream, mousse, and devil's food cake. Again everything was fantastic. 

Finding restaurants like this when I'm visiting places is always a little sad because I know I don't have access to eat at them regularly. Although at the price point that probably wouldn't be an option anyway. It was totally worth the money though.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I swear google maps keeps #trolling me bc I was trying to go to BOULevard but got sent to BLANDevard instead. #dgmw the menu *sounded* cool, the plating *looked* interesting, but my taste buds said otherwise. Hoping it was an #offday bc the food's still intriguing in theory.

(^_^) Arnold Palmer $4.75 (http://bit.ly/1NH5CrB)
Straw too short for the glass. #thatswhatshesaid

(-_^) Calamari & Charred Octopus $15 (http://bit.ly/1Osg2yL)
::shrugs:: Was expecting a tentacle. #thatswhatshesaid

(-_^) Apple Juniper Kombucha $7 (http://bit.ly/1YIr3vf)
Light not heavy.

(-_-) Seafood Double Decker Sandwich $17.5 (http://bit.ly/1NH5Gaw)
Stiff bread, overall low flavor.

(-_-) Lobster & Hearts Of Palm Fritter $14 (http://bit.ly/22sZIlw)
Texture kinda neat, not much taste.

(-_-) Coleslaw $w/Sando (http://bit.ly/1MAFtXn)
Tongue fell asleep.

I'd actually planned #atribecalledquest -based review draft but lost the inspiration to write it upon tasting my dishes. Still rounding up to 3 stars bc my waitress had good customer service in a hectic environment. What was with all the drinks spilling everywhere?
author: Dan B.

description: What a beautiful, unique restaurant- old world charm with a modern twist. Brick ceilings a gorgeous bar with red stained glass and an open kitchen to see the magic occur. The service was pleasant; the food was a roller coaster. The "Mother of Dragons" drink was incredible. A beautiful concoction of spice, sweet, and the black salted rim added another dimension to this amazing drink. The tuna tartar was beautiful not only in presentation but in flavor. The tuna was top notch and the melon balls added a wonderful element to the protein that kept the taste surprising. The rice cracker and squid ink puff was artistic, imaginative and was a perfect vessel for the Tuna. With such a great start to this meal, I only expected for the roller coaster to continue its climb... but instead experienced a rapid descend. The petrale sole dish was a disaster. The fish was a touch over cooked and because of the lack of sauce or acidity it was incredibly dry. The potato squares that rested on little globs on lemon aioli did not work with the dish. The charred octopus was a cool element. This dish tasted like the Ocean - but not in a good way. Leaving one's palate with an overwhelming flavor of fish and salt. It is safe to say I would never order this dish again, and neither would my dad. Throughout the night I observed that the tables around us were given free chef desserts ( lolly pop bon-bon's and salted carmel candies) however, our table did not receive such complimentary sweets. Apparently, you must to be "VIP" to receive this. I don't like restaurants that do this. We are all dinners, therefore we should ALL receive such treatment. It really is insulting that they select tables to receive this treatment, and frankly this place should be embarrassed of such behavior. Since my table simply was not VIP worthy, even after spending over $300 for dinner it is safe to say these dinners will venture to other places who appreciate our business and who treat All their diners with the same courtesy-  because that is excellent customer service and that is how you keep and get new clientele. So as this ride started in the right direction it finished sadly and left one feeling as though they just swallowed their stomach because of the vertical drop.
author: Allie P.

description:
This 3 starts is just for our host ,otherwise , food was great and I give them 5 *for food and wine selection.

ordered T-Bone Lamb which was great . Appetizer fresh calamari and for dessert we ordered ice cream and pie and cream brûlée. 
Unfortunately our server was horrible..,  in one point I was thinking : may be a candy camera around me , too bad to be true ..
I have very good gay friends and always have respect for all of gay people but this black dude was something ...
I am sure the management knows about that and they should really consider to fire him . 

If you are in SF  I highly Recommend them but make sure you ask for a better server .
author: payam b.

description:
I learned about Boulevard from reading articles about the best restaurants in San Francisco, and this restaurant was consistently listed as being one of the best. That is why I did some research and discovered that not only does it have a tantalizing high class French food menu, it also has stunning views of the Bay Bridge as it is located near to the Ferry Building. Once I had learned all this information about Boulevard, I was convinced that this is the restaurant where I wanted to celebrate my 22nd birthday.

And I'm happy to say that I was not disappointed. The decor is upscale vintage with romantic lighting -- as soon as I walked in, I felt like a movie star from the 1960s walking into the lobby of some luxurious hotel. We were seated at a comfortable table that had soft couches and plush seats, and we had a direct view of the Bay Bridge, which looked absolutely stunning that night. The only thing that could rival that beauty was the long dress I had donned for my special day (at least, I like to think so!)

Our server was incredibly professional and knowledgeable about the dinner and drinks menu. I wanted some bubbly with my dinner, and he picked out the perfect sparkling wine to go with my meal. The appetizers were really luxurious -- Boulevard likes to use premium ingredients like truffles with their food, I noticed, and we liked one of their truffle appetizers so much that we ended up ordering it again. 

I had a seafood dish for my entree which came with a squid ink rice pilaf and a mussel with caviar dripping from it, and it was the best seafood dish I've ever had -- and that is a BOLD statement. For dessert, I ordered a glass of pink moscato and bon bons, and the restaurant was kind enough to decorate the plate for my birthday. 

Our meal came out to be just a little over $100 per person, which is reasonably priced considering we shared several appetizers, had our own entrees, and ordered drinks and desserts. Boulevard is as classy as it gets in San Francisco, and this is a special occasion restaurant I would recommend to anyone who wants to feel glamorous and luxurious for an evening.
author: Pooja M.

description:
For a long time, this place was on my radar along with many other restaurants in SF. I finally decided to go here one day because we were conveniently right at the corner of this restaurant. 

We ordered:

- Soft shell crab = light and crispy with some greens. 

- Sea Bass = with grilled octopus, risotto, and veggies. Very salty dish.

- Lamb = fried blossom squash with pesto sauce. This was our least favorite dish due to the over cooked lamb. 

Skip the dessert!

To wrap things up, the food was just simply bland and boring. Not to mention, OVERPRICED! I feel bad since my friend paid for my meal as always. Eek!

As for the service, I agree with many of my fellow yelpers that they need to lose the attitudes. KTHANKSBYE!
author: Owie N.

description: Food was great and plenty of flavor. Atmosphere was classic and warm. However, the main reason why I took the two stars off is the slowness of the service. We sat down a bit before 7pm but didn't get our entree until about 8:30pm. I understand restaurant is extremely busy on sat night but waiting for over 1.5 hrs from sit down to appetizer to entrees is really way too long. Our waitress came by but no apology or status update on our meal. Not something I expected from this place as we've hear plenty of good things about it. Not sure if this is one time thing, but with the expensive menu, not sure if we would come back again.
author: Grace L.

description:
Lunch Review:

Eeek. This place was super disappointing. We ordered two apps and two entrees. Both entrees were underwhelming - one was served cold. For mains we ordered the scallop risotto entree and steak sandwich. Each meal cost $28 and $24 respectively. I could have easily made better food at home...that's not something someone should say eating at a restaurant. The scallop risotto just tasted bad. It was also plated and served with a huge streak of risotto climbing the plate almost to the rim...my dining companion and I looked at each other and laughed. Who expedites, sees this on the plate and thinks "this is ready to be put in-front of a customer". It would have been more funny if I wasn't paying for this meal. 

Commentary made during the meal:
"the apps really were better than the entrees"
"with food like this I would never gamble on a dinner here"
"the service is amateurish given the price point"
"why does this place have the reputation it does given the quality of the food."

If there's one thing SF has going for it is that we have a wide selection of decent restaurants. Save yourself the disappointment of this tired place and go somewhere that actually tries to earn your business.
author: Darin E.

description: Absolutely fabulous with exquisite food and service. This venue has only gotten better over the years. Try the lamb or pork chop for a special treat. When in San Francisco, make this a priority. You will not be disappointed.
author: Eileen M.

description:
Went here with my co-workers for a special lunch.

This place is amazing. The atmosphere is great, service was good and food was delicious!

I also love that it's right along the embarcadero so if you feel up to it you can go for a nice stroll afterwards.

Will definitely be back.
author: Kathryn Y.

description:
4 1/2 stars. A few drawbacks, but otherwise excellent. Superb food & service.

Started with lemonade. I wanted something cold after walking all the way from War Memorial Opera House (on heels!) and their cocktails looked pretty potent. Although I suppose with a full bar they could have mixed me up a drink to order, but having lemonade meant I could get a glass of wine - I am definitely a one drink person.

The hardest part? Deciding among so many things that looked good! I have not had quail in years and considered that. Helpful waiter described dish. Uh oh. Stuffing mixed with sour cream. I absolutely don't like creamy things with meat. He started to say not really creamy, well, yes, it is sort of creamy. I appreciate the honesty. So got avocado/manchego etc. salad and it was great, a lot of different kinds of greens, greens & cheese all shredded to same size, chunks of avocado and slices of mini kiwi with lots of nuts, I think some other seeds? Great salad.

Entree, do I want duck or lamb? Duck is a favorite but I'd had a duck salad at lunch. OTOH, I've eaten chicken twice in a day, why not duck? Two nice slices of duck breast, morels stuffed with duck sausage, a side of grains with chicken skin, tiny turnips poached in red wine. Loved all of it. Had glass of Syrah. 

They bring bread to table, really good bread, and butter with flaky sea salt. I'm going to have to try that some time on butter because it enhances the flavor. I ate all 3 pieces. They asked if I wanted more but I did not want to get filled up on bread.

Service attentive, maybe too attentive - everything is fine, great, you don't have to keep checking! 

Time for dessert and MORE tough choices. Damn, everything looked good. Settled on the pineapple because it was so unusual. Pineapple, pecans, rice, caramel, ice cream, all working together like a symphony. Or a ballet?

Portions not huge but sufficient and when food is good it satisfies without needing to be stuffed. I really don't need to walk out of a restaurant feeling like an overstuffed tick.

OK - why not five full stars? 

Two small things. The duck was medium rare which is fine but IMHO duck is better when skin is seared. Duck skin has so much fat underneath, searing skin melts some of it off. As it was, there was a thick layer of fat still present. Also the cake was just a tad dry. Like maybe one stir too many in mixing. Definitely more than edible but short of perfect.

Minor. Still want to go back and try other things, maybe come a bit early had have a drink at the bar. 

I have a friend in SF who takes me to dinner on my birthday....
author: Carol S.

description: Michelin star restaurant close to ferry building. If u like meat this place is for you! Always packed and touch to get a reservation but persistence pays off! Fantastic wait staff and customer service! Kid friendly!!!
author: Annalisa T.

description: Excellent service. Food was amazing good. My favorite was the octopus appetizer, the textures and different flavors! I tried the homemade lemonade which was nice and tart without being overly sweet. The halibut entree was so tasty, I'm not crazy about cauliflower because it's usually served on the soft soggy side but their it was served crunchy and crispy. I also had the blood orange sorbet which was perfect with honey underneath it. Our waiter was super attentive and helpful. Clean bathrooms and eating area. They also gave us a complimentary salmon appetizer and desert which was really good and nice surprise. We definitely look forward to going back.
author: April A.

description: Very good food from the appetizers to desert. The pork was cooked to perfection and the service was great. This place has some history and is in the heart of Frisco.... Definitely recommend
author: Ernesto M.

description: Went for a belated birthday celebration.  They seated us right at the corner with a view of both the pier building and the Bay Bridge.  Birthday girl got a birthday card and they customized her dessert order.  Really nice touch.  Service was consistent with top tier restaurants.  Every dish was delicious.  Pricing?  Well, you do need to pay to get top quality.  The memorable occasion was priceless.
author: Forest G.

description: Very nice place for the group. All the food ordered was delicious and cooked according to the orders. The steak was tender and cooked to perfection. Crab salad was very good. Everyone in our party was satisfied with their food, cocktails and wine.
author: Gwendolyn G.

description: Hands down on fabulous service, went to Boulevard for a business luncheon; mentioned to the organizer 3 mins before it stated that I'm on dairy free diet. They made my 3-course lunch completely separately DAIRY FREE!! Very impressed and satisfied. #michelinstandard
author: Fanny Z.

description: One of the best meals I've had in the city. Perfect service. Wine list is amazing. It's always like this too. Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: K K.

description: Had the steak and potato and seafood crudo with avacado.  Both were excellent.  Amazing lunch.
author: Michael E.

description:
I met a co-worker for dinner on a Saturday night and as expected it was extremely busy. 

Service was excellent and the food was very good. The portions are quite small which is why I rated it very good, not outstanding. I felt the value for money was a bit light. 

I had the lamb. It was excellent, and would order it again. 

It is still a place very much worth visiting.
author: Melly C.

description: Fabulous dinner last night. Beat salad, squid appetizer, pork chop all delicious, beautiful presentation and good service.
author: Dan S.

description: Ok, To start with I love the wait staff there. They are personable and knowledgeable about the food. I started with the baby beet salad and that was great. I had the duck and it was scrumptious, tender and flavorful. I of course had dessert and we both ordered the pineapple rice pudding that had many wonderful flavors to it... from the crystallized ginger...... ice cream and yummy ness! I will be back real soon.
author: Teri D.

description: Came here for presentation. Very great food. Amazing service. I had sea bass and cheesecake. Probably one of best I've had.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Let me say this... I made a reze here last min .. the day before I had my girlfriend fly into San Fran (I live 40 min away) 

we had a lovely day touring around San Fran .. and ended up at boulevard... the food was absolutely delicious... service was great.. she had the filet.. and I had the pork chop (which is what I was recommended to get)  

The pork chop.. honestly.. was one of the best dishes I've ever had. We are now waiting to get served our dessert 
(Chocolate silk cream pie)  

I don't write reviews often. But currently sitting at table writing this.
author: Jeffrey W.

description:
Boulevard was suggested by a friend so we went.  First off, $15 for valet parking.  Guess where my car was parked? 30 ft. away across the street!!!  Nice racket going there.  

So I'm going to have to rank this establishment mainly on bang for buck.  This could be a five star easily, as the food is fairly decent, however the bang for buck is absolutely terrible!!  

I thought Beverly Hills was bad, but wow four scallops for your main entrée, really???  Our appetizer was bigger than the appetizer however that is due to the deep fried squash. $28 for four scallops???  WOW!!!  Come with your card as this puts Beverly Hills to shame, bang for buck!  Just mind blowing on how small the portions were.

The chef was kind enough and made two nice plates for our two vegetarian's.  In fact, their plate looked better than my friends scallops.  The Bavette meat dish, was delicious, however very small portions.  I'm not into pretty food that leaves you wanting more.

They also seem to have an affection to nuts as nuts are in many dish's including the desserts.  The apple crisp was not your traditional Apple Crisp.  It was a mixture of ingredients put together and served as an apple crisp. I added the butterscotch gelato to it and wow, what a let down.  Such a small dessert and the Gelato was a tablespoon rolled up.

Décor - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars 
Food quality and taste - 4 stars
Bang for buck - 0 stars

Our lunch for four was $240.00 and this was with no drinks, just water.  Unless you have a deep wallet or want to be near the wharf for lunch and you want to walk around afterwards, I could not in good conscience recommend Boulevard.  Add a bit more substance to the plate and this place will be a five star.
author: Larry H.

description: There isn't enough good things to say about this place! The service was 5 stars, the food was 5 stars, the wine was 5 stars! Delicious, flavorful, and a true experience. We decided to get a bottle and ended up having the bottle opened by the restaurant's Sommelier and wine blender himself! Truly an awesome experience.
author: Talita G.

description:
Came here recently after a baseball game. It was still early, so we had to wait at the bar for about 30 minutes until the kitchen got going. After a refreshing cocktail, it was time to sit at the chef's counter. The restaurant filled up quickly, but the staff was still attentive. It was really interesting watching the 10 or so different staff members cook and assemble the plates. Good harmony and flow for a busy Sunday evening. 

The Food
Our group shared the scallops 5/5 and seafood raviolis 4/5 for appetizers. Everyone seemed to enjoy those. I had the salmon 5/5 for my entree and it was fantastic. The others ordered the signature pork chop 3.5/5 , the halibut 4/5 and the lamb tenderloin 5/5 A++. The halibut was great, the lamb was some of the best I've had, and I didn't try the pork chop, but my dad said it was on the dry side. That's unfortunate because I really enjoyed it the last time 5/5 eating there and I recommended it to him. He raved about his beet and fig "salad" though, so that was good. Overall, I thought Boulevard was excellent. I'll be back if I'm down in the emb
author: Jeff M.

description: boulevard screams old nyc which is one of the many reasons i love it. the cocktails are well made and the dishes are fantastic- highly recommend the lamb, it completely melts in your mouth. dinging one star, maybe should be more, because i found a hair on my plate and mgmt did not do anything about it!! mgmt if you're reading this contact me - thats just not acceptable for a restaurant at your price point.
author: Alexandra K.

description:
Had a leisurely lunch here -- definitely a spot for expense accounts. Started out with the seasonal squash blossoms, deep fried and stuffed. They were actually pretty large enough for a light meal, and were definitely the highlight. Scallops followed - but while they were perfectly cooked, they were underseasoned. 

This was also the week they had guava lemonade - so I tried that. A bit tart for my taste though, and it seemed to be mostly nectar. 

If you must have a nice bistro experience but don't want steak frites, and have an expense account, this will do, but I might try something else in the Financial District.
author: Heidi L.

description:
Dined at Boulevard for lunch. I do not recommend.

Overall: Come here if you have two hours to spare for lunch - most of it waiting for your food. We spent $80 on two apps and two entrees - no drinks, no sodas, just water. 

Price: 1 star. I rarely rate on price but feel I need to for this restaurant. I ordered the appetizer salad because it looked appealing and asked to add chicken. One of the entrees had rotisserie chicken so I thought perfect, they can throw some of it on this salad. I was wrong. I spent over $20 on the salad below, and you thought Mixt Greens was expensive!

Food: 2 stars. I ordered the ceviche and the appetizer salad pictured below. The ceviche was solid. I enjoyed the flavors and selected seafood. Then after 40 minutes the salad arrived. The salad was awful. It was small but the dressing was blah and the chicken they added tasted like they took a bag of Tyson freezer chicken strips and thawed them. It tasted and had the texture of plastic. My friend ordered the fig appetizer which he enjoyed and the burger. His burger was fine according to him as were the fries that were finally cooked.

Service: 2 stars. I understand computer systems go down. I do not understand though not updating your customers after waiting 20 minutes. We waited over 40 minutes for our food. We watched as the kitchen remembered that they didn't add the french fries to the fryer. We watched as they served the people right ahead of us in orders get served 15 minutes before us. The only reason I did not give this restaurant one star in service is because they did apologize and extended free cake pops as their olive branch.
author: Jessica C.

description: I heard great things about this place and was very excited to try it. It is a large restaurant down by the water in the financial district. Very romantic setting and this lighting greets you as you enter and take your seat. The kitchen is open and a bar wraps around it. There is an extensive wine list but not much for craft beer fans. When you come here, know that this is not a cheap meal. My husband ordered the Quail and I went with the Halibut. Quail was a hearty dish, filled with winter crops and harvest flavors. My halibut was seared perfectly and it flaked away with barely any pressure of the fork. It was creamy and light served with a Blueberry Jus with Tarragon. I did not get much blueberry flavor at all though which was disappointing. The portion sizes of both dishes were appropriate to finish in one sitting. This place is meant for you to slowly enjoy a meal and lose track of time. For the price though, it may be best to enjoy a small plate or appetizer here and find a different spot for your main meal. Our entrees were good but they were just not that memorable. Compared to some of my favorite spots and the hype I had heard about this place, I left wanting more. It was worth stopping in to see the beauty of the restaurant but not a place I would frequent often.
author: Megan H.

description:
Decided to come here short notice on a Thursday evening. We were able to walk in without waiting and were seated at the Chef's counter. We made it just in time to beat a middle-aged, statuess... Impatient couple to a table. It was about 7:30-8pm and the place was busy and lively, full of older distinguished couples enjoying their mid week date and sipping on wine. The ambiance is very cozy and warm feeling; it felt like Christmas to me when we walked in.

I was so happy that we were seated at the chef's counter because we got the chance to watch the chef's prepare, cook, and plate the food. Very organized, non-stop work these people. You can see the hard work and care and concentration in the food that they put out. 

We were given a complimentary zucchini bread for taste and it was light and cleansing, easy on the palate. 

We ordered an appetizer of the foie gras. I can NEVER pass this up if it's on the menu. It was served with a sweet persimmon and whole wheat sourdough. Which the serving of foie gras was more generous (who doesn't, honestly) but I've had better foie gras elsewhere. 

I ordered the filet mignon with polenta done rare and it was cooked perfectly. Tender, red center, warm, and juicy. The spinach and polenta meshed perfectly.

My boyfriend ordered the pork. I had a bite of the prime rib pork chop which was very thick and juicy. He LOVED it.

I had asked the waitress to recommend a wine for me, I have a preference for sweet reds. I have a very sweet tooth. She suggested a I think it was a boulase? The downside of dessert wines, they are only 2 oz. pours. It wasn't my first pick but I wish she could have recommended something better. Well can't really blame her, not everyone is a sommelier or has a specially in wine selection. Man, I wish they had a Canadian ice wine on their menu. 

All in all. I love the ambiance. The service as good, we may have waited a little longer than usual I feel for our food to come but still came out in a timely enough manner. The presentation of the food was beautiful, like art on a white canvas. Finally, the taste was good, with top quality preparation.
author: A Z Flor H.

description: Excellent foodie and service experience. It was our Anniversary and the staff presented an happy anniversary card.  Very nice touch.  Started with some lovely cocktails along with some starters, Sea Scallops and Brent Wolf Quail.  Both dishes were cooked perfectly and they were delicious.  Going to the Main, we ordered the Northern Halibut and the Kurobuta Pork Chop. The Halibut was cooked right with nice flavor.  The Pork Chop was moist and tender.  Perfect evening.
author: Speed R.

description:
There are times where bad service results in an overall terrible experience but this time wasn't it. I was with two others and had dinner on a Saturday night. We ordered the soft shell crab and the tuna tartare as our starters which were both fantastic, then a long delay for the entrees was not the greatest but when we brought to our waitress attention they actually responded like they cared and were great in dealing with the situation. 

Just a side note - I was a third wheel so I had extra time to analyze every detail of everything. Shoutout to the NBA on TNT guys in the building.
author: Milad S.

description: Very nice space for a group of ten to twelve guests. All food ordered was delicious and cooked as ordered. The steak was tender and cooked to perfection. Crab salad was very good as well. Everyone in our party was pleased with their food, cocktails and wine. Probably one of best I've had. You won't be disappointed!
author: Priscilla M.

description: Solid. Wasn't blown away by anything in particular, but good food in a fancyish, business atmosphere (at least at lunch, when I went) restaurant.
author: Jason B.

description:
It was hard making reservation over thanksgiving weekend at a bunch of restaurant so it was really cool that they allowed walk in at a nicer restaurant. 

The restaurant was very classy with there Christmas decorations it felt a little odd stepping in since the crowd is more of a older people. 

I felt like off about the vibe I got from our waiter I wasn't sure if it was sarcasm or anything but thank god the food was better the feel the waiter gave us. 

I read about the California lamb T-bone so I knew I had to try it. It was cooked perfectly to a medium rare and was very well seasoned it wasn't actually on a T-bone since it cut into small pieces. My boyfriend got the Berkshire Kurobuta pork prime chop which was also very moist, perfectly cooked and I almost wanted to eat all of his dish. 

For dessert we had their butterscotch pudding with pear sorbet I wasn't a fan of the pudding since it was bitter but mixed with the sorbet it was a match in heaven.

Even though I really liked the food here it didn't really give me a welcoming vibe not sure if I would come back.
author: Annie N.

description: It really sucks be writing this review! I came here Tuesday evening for my 30th birthday, with my husband and two close friends. I was sadly disappointed by the dull service and how long it took for us to receive our food. Our server was very mono toned and not thrilled in the least that it was my 30th birthday. We asked him to display candles that were in the numbers that he refused, they were sparklers so i understood the fire code, however he could have at-least placed them on the cake for photos. Again very dull service! I came here for a very special occasion and am very disappointed. This is San Francisco and I expect the bill to be $400 plus but when i have to ask multiple times for water and pay $10 per slice of cake I brought and paid for I expect you to put the candles I brought. Very disappointed. The food was good I will say that. Service was mediocre.
author: Amber S.

description: Worst service ever! My fiancé and I went here and asked for a menu, and an old lady with grey hair (who was wiping decorations near the bar) gave us attitude. We mistakenly came through the wrong door, and she yelled at us for "scratching the patina" which I'm guessing was the old door we came in. We'll never come back to this place again
author: Jordan S.

description: Everything about this lovely dinner experience will bring you back to the old days of true fine dining with serving staff that are knowledgeable, elegant and polite and proud of what they do.  Then comes the wonderful food prepared with care and pizazz, but without fuss, fusion and confusion.  All ingredients are classic and traditional, yet not boring.  Every mouthful delicious and the wine paired was also just superb.  This is an institution SF should be proud of, and never let it change.
author: Moon G.

description: Never ever disappoints. The halibut with sunchokes was out of this world... and I had the best dirty martini of my life. Great service great atmosphere. Perfect birthday dinner.
author: Carrie P.

description: Food was fantastic!  We were in the private dining room which is lovely!  The only reason I haven't given 5 stars is because the service was a bit slow - had to wait and at time actually find wait staff.
author: Cath D.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants. The service is always good and the food, well, it's always so flavorful and delicious. 
We had the sea bass and steak. We will be coming back soon!
author: Kiwi T.

description: The food here is amazing!  Service impeccable!  We didn't have a reso and they were very accommodating!   I was really impressed with every aspect of the experience!!
author: Rachelle T.

description:
This is a San Francisco landmark. Easily worth the investment of time and money for the result. 

I entertained a group of eight. Start with service. Spot on. Polite and attentive without pretentiousness. The know the meno and represent the restaurant. 

Wine list. Super solid at a very reasonable price. We compared Amarone with a 'neuf da pape and they were great vintages.  

Everyone had appetizers.  Personally i had the foie gras. Perfectly cooked. Balance of acid and other counterpoints. Edible flowers.  Great. 

Entree. Lamb. I asked for slightly more than medium rare. Perfect.  Flavorful. Good portion. Saw the Quail, Sea Bass and Pork Chop. Not one complaint at table. 

Dessert. Port and Ice wines.  I had the butterscotch pudding which was to die for. 

I thought the price point was exceptional for what we enjoyed.

Back again easily!!
author: Tom K.

description:
Literally one of my favorite places to eat on the planet.

The food and service here is amazing. The wine selection is top notch.

I have been coming to this place for years and frankly if you want a well served meal that is amazing? go here....
author: John C.

description: I never knew about this place until tonight. We celebrated my buddy ken's bday. I'll never forget this night - not only for the moment with good friends, but the food quality and presentation + timing was on point!!!
author: Martin P.

description:
Saturday night, halloween weekend, my fiancé and I got lucky cos we called in the late afternoon and we got a table for the 2 at 9.30 pm. Starters: I had sea scallops, very tasty and perfectly cooked; my fiancé got the octopus and calamari and she was esthetic(shes a chef ). As a main course: I got the angus filet that was simply divine as well as the  side of potatoes.
She got the quail that was very moist and so soooo good. Service was super nice and professional thanks Dennis xo .The first drink my fiancé had, wasn't really on her taste so she asked to change it and they did not charge us for it, so another thumbs up! The dessert was great as well, we had the dark chocolate and hazelnut tart to share (nice portion for two), with a crunchy chocolate quinoa base! Thanks for the dinner, we will for sure come back when in San Francisco! Grazie !
author: Giulia A.

description:
Michelin star restaurant never fails shine!

I was quite apprehensive on coming here for lunch as I imagined long lines and long wait time given how busy this place usually is. The first question the asked when I sat there was if I had any time restrictions. I said I hope to be done within the hour. No Problem he said.

I got the wagyu beef, which got my pallets wagging non stop for more. The beef was so tender and melted in my mouth. The reduction sauce was just perfect, not too salty and not too overwhelming.

Ambiance and service was top notch.
author: Benson T.

description:
Boulevard is an institution that relies heavily on its reputation from yesteryear. Let's start with what works well. The restaurant has nice ambiance that feels warm and rather spacious for SF. We found the abalone to be unique, tender, and delicious. The sourdough bread is also spot on with great butter. 

Okay, now that we got the good stuff out of the way let's go deeper. The service is okay although the food itself comes out very slow. Food arrived warm, not hot like one might expect. My special person ordered the duck, but she thought it wasn't up to her standards. I had the salmon which was nothing special. I felt bad for her duck situation so I took the duck and gave her the salmon. I don't know why or how, but I was able to eat the duck. Note, I would pay the price shortly thereafter. 

After pushing through an average dinner my person decided she needed desert. She ordered the brownie with ice cream (after confirming with the waiter it was a hot brownie) and a Bon Bon.  The brownie was cold and just okay. The Bon Bon was filled with warm melted mint ice cream, which exploded all over upon biting into it. Upon asking the waiter about the Bon Bon we were informed the chef is still trying to perfect the recipe. Interesting to find a restaurant serving a desert they are still trying to get right. 

Anyway, I find myself compelled to give this place two stars because of the ambiance and the abalone and bread were satisfying.  If I were to come back it would be for happy hour. Too many options for a great dinner in this city.
author: David L.

description:
This restaurant is obviously popular and crowded- but it's resting on perhaps undeserved laurels- apps fine - but 3 of 5 of the dinners - lamb- was ice cold-2x!!
Very inconsistent and not worthy of the accolades in the earlier reviews.
author: Tony C.

description: Nice traditional ambience. Most dishes were very good but not "wow". Will eat here again though. I prob chose the wrong dessert because it's wasn't good to me.
author: Gloria T.

description: Our tab was $600 for a party of four which wouldn't be an issue if the food was out of this world, but it wasn't all that great. I probably won't be back.
author: JC P.

description:
Lovely atmosphere, and excellent and attentive staff. However, my lunch was disappointing. I ordered the lobster bisque and the grilled wild king salmon. The lobster bisque was very good, but the portion was rather small. The grilled salmon tasted a bit fishy to me. I probably should have sent it back and gotten the halibut, which my friend liked a lot. The  mushrooms, broccoli "romanesque," leeks, and wild rice that accompanied my salmon were all mixed together, and though the overall taste was OK, it was hard to distinguish one component from another. The  total amount of these accompaniments amounted to a few tablespoons. I wonder what was "romanesque" about the broccoli. The three tiny broccoli florets tasted no different from slightly undercooked steamed broccoli.

My dessert, the flourless chocolate cake, was good. The two small scoops of malted nougat turtle ice cream were nothing special.

With tax, tip, and the 5% surcharge, the bill for two came to $160. I felt that was too much for a less than stellar lunch.
author: Allan L.

description:
This restaurant is so accommodating! I'm the events coordinator at my job and one of my duties is to find restaurants that can hold up to 60 people for our annual Holiday party! I wanted to have our Holiday party here at this restaurant and Pam was such a big help! She answered ALL of my questions! She was so patient and I would recommend celebrating at this restaurant! 

The day of our Christmas dinner, they allowed me to come early to set up! They also allowed us to have a karaoke machine for us to get a little wild after having a few drinks since our party was open bar. 

Our waiters and our bartender was so nice! We can tell our bartender was getting a little headache from all the crazy out of tune singing, but he was such a sport! 

The menu we picked out was so delicious!! 

For appetizers, we had crab cakes, heirloom chicken, chorizo and cheese frittata, and fried shrimp! I am so mad at myself for writing this review so late! I forgot what these appetizers were called! All I know that everything we ordered was so delicious and out of 60 people, there was no negative comments at all! 

For dinner, we got to choose either a filet or lobster. I ordered the lobster and my husband ordered the filet, so I got to try both!! I can say they were both so delicious! So tender and juicy!! Lots of rich flavors!

For dessert, we had two options. We had ice cream topped with berries or a chocolate cake. Since I planned the party, one of the doctors said I can have both!! Yay! Again, I forgot what the correct names for the dessert, but I'll post a picture to show you! 

Everything we ate was so delicious!! I hope to come here again real soon!
author: Darlene M.

description: Goodness everything I've had here is DELICIOUS.  Upper class restaurant, high class clientele.  Wonderful bar staff, great service.  Had the octopus (amazing), sea bass, delicious and the lobster salad, wow, so  good.  Had the Chenin blanc wine, too.  Just love this place but pricey of course so can't come often.  Love this gem of a place.  Thanks.
author: Neveen B.

description: Iconic restaurant.  Always a great evening.  Perfect attention to detail from the 2-day reminder call to the gracious front of the house hospitality. Lovely accommodation to a change from two to three when my guest showed up with a second guest.   Love the salty butter and bread.  Experienced professional server.  Great food: tonight soft shell crab and sole.  Quiet table at back left excellent opportunity for conversation.  Can't wait to return.
author: David B.

description:
Eaten here dozens of times over the years, including many wonderful meals.  They are just coasting now.  Last two meals have been a big disappointment.  Food is mediocre at best.  Lunch today.  Lots of empty tables at prime lunch hour on a Thursday.  That should tell you something.  People who know good food have stopped coming.  And for good reason. 
 Heirloom tomato salad:  Tomatoes were ice cold, meaning this came out of the refrigerator.   Refrigeration kills the texture, and indeed, the tomatoes were mealy and flavorless.  Alaskan halibut:  Tiny portion.  Nicely seared, but fish was bland and accompaniments were just weird tasting.  Service was blah.  Banquet was covered with crumbs and stained with dry crusty sauce.  This place is so not worth the prices.  Save your money.  Go somewhere that actually cares.
author: Carl C.

description:
What a shame.
Reminds of the carnelian room without the wine list and the view. 
Service mechanical. 
Food mechanical. 
Boring.
Overpriced.
Outdated.
author: Jeff B.

description: I think this place has earned the good rating they have online. The food is consistently delicious. The service is always on point and the ambiance is just right. I will definitely be returning.
author: Jeromy C.

description:
Food and service were top-notch. Unfortunately, this restaurant is engaged in the dishonest (but sadly common) practice of tacking on an extra 5% charge buried in the fine print on the menu.

I would happily pay 5% more for food of this quality but no restaurant should be trying to cheat its customers for an extra 5%.
author: Arev I.

description:
We were her two weeks ago, Saturday. I made reservations about a month in advance. The layout is wonderful and there is no bad tables in the house. There is such a great vibe here as well. We brought a friend here for her birthday dinner. 

We shared the appetizer abalone and calamari along with the Maine lobster. Both were excellent, however the portion was meager for the lobster - just one liny claw and a couple of loose pieces of lobster meat over angel pasta. The abalone and calamari was more to share but tiny pieces as well for the fish portion. 

For the entrees, I had the Liberty Farms duck breast, my friend had the Lamb T-bone, and my husband had the Kurobta Pork Chop. All the them were excellent. My duck entree was creative as it was served with squash blossoms stuffed with wild rice, duck confit and mushrooms. All the entrees were excellent and creatively prepared. 

For desert we ordered the carrot cake and cheese with almonds. We ordered wines by the glass and I can't remember what they were as they were just ok, nothing memorable to say the least. 

Its a must to make reservations in advance as this place was still filled when we left 9pm.
author: Laura V.

description: The service at the bar was terrible. We asked for the check several times.  The bar tender Patrick only paid attention when it was the time for the tip -
author: Mark K.

description:
This is truly one of my most favorite restaurants in all of San Francisco.    Had the Foie Gras, Quail and an unbelievable Kosta Brown Pinot Noir.   Bypassed dessert due to just being very full but witnessed some impressive desserts come out of the kitchen.   Don't wait!   Go now!!!   If you have a small party or even by yourself ... eat at the counter of the kitchen and watch a world class, culinary show.   

bucket list experience ... !
author: Mark P.

description:
Very good food but maybe not the best value considering the price. Each dish was incredibly detailed and sculpted. 

Service: 5/5
Presentation of Food: 5/5
Ambience: 4/5
Taste: 4/5
Value: 3/5
author: Avery A.

description:
What an amazing restaurant. The menu is heavy into meat. A few fish and vegetarian items. The service is very attentive, the good portions small but very good quality.
A very good dining experience.
author: Susan S.

description: Terrible experience.  (1) Everyone around us was presented with an amuse-bouche after they were seated - except us.  We asked the waiter and he replied that it's management's decision in sending out (somewhat appeared to be rolling his eyes as if questioning the management practice).  We were well-dressed and cordial but didn't make the cut.  It's a terrible practice to selectively provide to some and not others, regardless of the reason. (2) My main dish appeared to be about 2 ounces of Salmon surrounded by garnish.  I've never seen such a small piece of salmon as a main dish, ever. The dish was not a main, it was an appetizer.  For $39, I expect a main-sized dish. (3) My wife's main dish looked like it was literally thrown on the plate in a very sloppy manner.  It looked nothing like the other same dishes leaving the kitchen.  Reminded us of the show "Chopped" when the host is saying "1 minute Chefs, better be plating", and some Chef is saying "I just need to get this onto a dish".  I personally don't care about presentation, but it's my wife's dish and she does.  We'd also like to think the Boulevard does too.  My wife did tell the waiter and he pretty much agreed how it should look - no corrective response though.  I recently moved to San Francisco.  I will not go back.
author: Brian P.

description:
To get a quick dinner reservation I recommend you use Opentable. Anyways, having heard this restaurant was Michelin rated I was excited to eat here. Our server was in a rush/hurry, which based on their other Yelp reviews seems to be common. The service was not the best- but it was still pleasant. The food was good but safe, meaning it lacked flavor and the pizzaz you would normally expect from such a well rated restaurant. 

-Boulevard was underwhelming for the high expectations I had
author: Michelle T.

description:
I really want to give this place another try because of all the great reviews but for my first time I was a bit disappointed. It seems the major problem is execution. Granted I did go during the work week right when all the business let out for lunch. I will hand it to the staff for keeping a stress-free and happy demeanor despite the overwhelming number of customers coming in and out. It felt a bit cramped for this reason (and that many patrons had very large backpacks). 

 My friend and I both ordered the same dish, I think it might have been a penne that had a pesto sauce but it was ok. Both came out vegetarian but only mine should have been. It was a while before we could get the waiter's attention. It wasn't too noisy that we couldn't hear each other. 

The setting was very beautiful and classy. That was definitely a plus for the restaurant. 

All of the people that worked there were very nice. They offered to take my bag but it took them a while at the end to return it. This created a very awkward stand-at-the-door scenario with people coming to check if we had been helped. 

Overall I was happy with how nice the waitstaff was and their professionalism despite the lunch-time stress. I would give this place another chance if I have an opportunity.
author: Anya R.

description: Such a great place. Good service and the food was severed hot and delicious!
author: Louie S.

description: This is where all the locals go for great fare. After being recommended this place from San Fran's locals we had to try it for our anniversary dinner when visiting San Fran. The service and food did not disappoint. The Art Deco theme brings a fun atmosphere that can either be dressed up or down.
