We saw people there in suits and dresses to casual clothes just there to get amazing food. Every bit was delectable and the service just made it that much better. I can't wait to visit again.
author: Sarah D.

description: We came for appetizers and drinks. Great selection of wine and the food was spectacular. Definitely will be coming back for dinner on a special occasion. On the pricier side but well worth it.
author: Alexis G.

description:
This place was one of the first "grown up, fancy" restaurants I was introduced to, which started my love affair with food.  I was in my very early twenties and a few years or so have passed and this place remains just as fabulous as the first time.   I've been here over a dozen times, from business meetings, dates and birthday celebrations.   

On Christmas eve, two of my best girlfriends and I were here to celebrate my friends birthday.  We ordered several appetizers and entrees and shared each one.    I LOVE that when I go out to dinner with my best girlfriends that we always end up eating family style.  This way we can try as many dishes as possible without breaking the bank.  We ordered the following dishes for appetizers and split them: 

ITALIAN MOZZARELLA & DINO KALE SALAD
Treviso Radicchio, Napa Cabbage
Roasted Meyer Lemon & Garlic Dressing 
Review: I loved this dish and will probably chop up my kale the way they did.  Very light and refreshing. 

BEER BATTERED ARGENTINIAN RED PRAWNS
Salsa Molcajete, Lemon Aioli 
Review: There were about 5 prawns and there were 3 of us.  
We each had 1 and then tried to fight over the 2.  Ha!  In the end, we just cut up the other 2 into tiny pieces and split those. These were delicious. 

SPICY SESAME AHI TUNA TARTARE
Miso Cucumbers, Charred Shishito Peppers, Lime Aioli
Shiso Tempura, Nori & Taro Chips 
Review:  This was OK and nothing to write home about

Lobster Bisque Soup
Review:  LOVED dipping my bread into this soup and the waitress mentioned this is their specialty.  It wasn't on the menu so you may ask your server if they have it. 

For our main entrees, we ordered the following: 

GRILLED SWORDFISH
Calamari Stuffed with Clam & Pancetta Panzanella
Sauteed Spigarello with Artichoke Hearts, Roasted Tomato Relish
Extra Virgin Olive Oil
Review:  This was just OK and I will probably not order it again.  My friends felt the same

SEARED HOKKAIDO SEA SCALLOPS
Golden Beet Risotto, Vacca Bianca Parmesan 
Review:  This was my FAVORITE dish.  I loved the risotto and will return soon for this dish.  Delicious! 

BRAISED BERKSHIRE PORK RIB CAP with ROASTED GULF PRAWNS
Spanish Style Paella with Roasted Tomato, Green Garbanzo Beans & Chorizo
Smoked Paprika & Pork 
Review:  I seldom eat pork so I didn't try the pork but had the prawns and paella and it was just wonderful. 

For dessert, we ordered the following: 

BUTTERSCOTCH PUDDING
Dark Chocolate Bavarian Cream, Pecan Shortbread
Wild Pecan Granola, Vanilla Chantilly 
Review:  I DIDN't want to share this dish.  It was that good.  Definitely try this.  You will LOVE.  Our waitress said this was her favorite dish. 

CHOCO-LICIOUS
Baked Hot Chocolate Cake, Mousse, Wafer
Dark Chocolate Ice Cream & Meringue 
Review: If you like dark chocolate, definitely try this dish.  I wasn't in love with it but it was definitely good! 

Our meal was amazing as always and I will return. Fun fact:  Jay-Z and Beyonce also dined here during their 2014 On The Run Tour.  I saw it with my own eyes in a picture on an article somewhere haha.  No really they did, it's even stated on this SF Eater article:  http://sf.eater.com/2014/8/7/6173823/where-beyonce-and-jay-z-ate-during-their-sf-visit  So if you want to dine like hip hop royalty, definitely try it out. 

Love and highly recommend this place!
author: Christine P.

description: I normally review restaurants based on their category and their delivery. Boulevard is a high end, restaurant that delivers at the house guest level. I got the chance to experience the line  while sitting at their stylish bar. Their chefs are well trained and every aspect is treated with respect. 5/5 will come back.
author: James S.

description:
I ate here a year ago but never got around to reviewing it till now, so the menu may have changed a bit since then. Nevertheless, I still want to give my five stars for Boulevard because it was one of my favorite fine dining experiences yet!

I tried the wild boar and hand rolled pasta, roasted artichoke soup, Kurobata prime rib chop, Pacific seabass, and a few other things that I can't quite recall - but I do remember that every dish was delicious! Portion sizes were enough to leave me feeling full by the end.

Service was impeccable and the ambience is perfect for a date or fancy dinner with family. There seemed to be a lot of businesspeople as well. There is an ample amount of seating, as well as a bar area, but it's a popular place so you'll definitely want to make a reservation.
author: Ivonnie S.

description:
We decided to eat here to celebrate one of our friends birthday. Our original reservation was at 9.30pm, but when we called in and explained the situation, the restaurant was kind enough to move our reservation to 8.30pm. 

We ordered butternut flower risotto thingy (forgot the name) the risotto was really creamy and the butter nut flower thingy was perfectly executed and the overall presentation and flavor was really good. We also ordered the Ahi tuna tartar. The tuna was flavorful, you can taste the soy sauce, seaseme oil and all other ingredients that marinade the tuna. The ahi tuna was also blend with all other kind of fruit and vegetables as well. You can taste the lightness  of the fruits and vegetables and at the same time you can taste the freshness of the tuna. Overall the ah I tuna is no overpilled and you can taste every bit of everything. 

I ordered the halibut, the fish was great. Not too dry but then the vegetables was okay. One of the friend ordered the prime rib pork chop and the other peered the t-bone. Personally I think out of these three dishes the best dish is the prime rib chop. Others are only okay. 

The dessert was awesome as well. But a bit too sweet .
author: Jeff H.

description:
We were there for a company event, which is kinda hit-or-miss I think. Some restaurants just don't handle crowds well. We had a pretty set menu; salad, salmon or steak, lemon/berry sorbet or chocolate.

Salad was as plain as a salad could be. I understand if you're allowing for dietary restrictions (nut/dairy) but it was just lettuces with a whatever dressing. Very disappointing.

Then we waited FOREVER to get our entrees, something like 30-45mins after our salads were done. The entrees were excellent though, our steaks perfectly med-rare. Really interesting puree and even the potatoes were amazing.

Desserts were definitely not afterthoughts here. What seems like pretty simple dessert menu staples were taken to another level. Like "omg I would buy a whole bag of this granola." Again took awhile for them to get our desserts out.

Service was on point. I really loved the decor in the main dining room. I'd definitely give it another shot. It's my cousin's favorite restaurant and she's not usually wrong.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Tons of hype around this place so was expecting a fantastic meal. The appetizers were great (we had tuna tartare, stuffed squash blossoms, and the artichoke). For lunch, I had the sea bass which was just so-so. My friend had the burger which looked good but he also said it was so-so. Two people in our group had the scallops which looked super good and I heard good things but it was a tiny portion. We also had two desserts, which were pretty good! One was a strawberry thing with a donut like cake on top, the other was a red velvet cheesecake I think? They were both pretty good!

All around just a so-so experience. Pretty expensive and not a very extensive menu. If you're in a rush at lunch, this is not the place for you.
author: Julia M.

description: The golden boy got us so excited...I don't know if I can possibly eat anywhere else...ever.ever.ever  Yes. Yes. Yes. My stomach's having multiple orgasms, every bite taking on it own somersaults of joy. My palate standing erect in constant stimulation!  My mind completely blown...then comes dessert and it starts all over. My bodies moaning in pure delight. More more more, yes yes yes!
author: Shannon F.

description:
Visited today at 9:00pm with my boyfriend,
Food we ordered were foie gras as appetizer,  pork chop, and t-bon lamb. All of them were tasty and plating was interesting. 
I wish i can visit again
author: Chloe L.

description: I came here on a work trip and sat at the bar. Expensive food, but good. I had the salmon and was pleased - I would order this again. Service was so-so; not especially friendly, but satisfactory.
author: Michelle B.

description: Excellent dinner with friends on a busy Friday night. I had the lamb and my friend had the Pork chop. So tasty and cook exactly perfect!
author: Amy W.

description: If you ever in the Bay area,  I highly recommend Boulevard, I was there in a bussiness lunch and the food, ambience,  service are outstanding. It's located near the embarcadero with a nice view.  Great wine selection and desserts are the delightful. I will definitely go back.
author: Amada M.

description: I went here for lunch the other day with a good friend. Service was top-notch. I loved the pork dish with mash potatoes and the calamari (ordered as appetizer). Portions are good and cost was not bad at all. The only thing I didn't like was how the bathroom was not connected to the restaurant; creates a strange, unpleasant out-of-design vibe.
author: Juliana P.

description: This place was a lovely surprise! Not only is the food phenomenal, but they were great at accommodating our parents surprise. Very please with the service and menu. Will definitely be coming back next time we are in San Francisco !
author: Chris S.

description: I just had one of the best meals of my life. Not only was the food excellent (quail appetizer, duck entree) but the service is impeccable. We keep coming back to Boulevard for special days and we are never disappointed.
author: Pia R.

description: Consistently excellent food for over 10 years in my experience. Ridiculously bust so book ahead. I love the old world vibe inside, the fresh flavors and apropos wine list. Always a hit with friends and clients. A great spot in SF.
author: Jim M.

description: Food was just ok, lack of creation in my view, service was nice.  Overall not too bad. Friend was comparing this with Gary Danko, which I have to totally disagree as it's definitely not as good. Gary danko definitely beats this place by 2 stars, but I am being generous here to give this place a 4 stars.
author: Kelly L.

description: Very pleased with our visit. The service was top notch and the food was phenomenal! Courtney the manager was exceptional. She was hands on in explaining the menu and helped on pairing wine with our dish. Dino our waiter was very professional and on top of our needs. Very romantic place with the view of the wharf and the Bay Bridge. Awesome!
author: Anthony G.

description:
Just had lunch here today while taking care some business in the Embarcadero. I was welcomed with warmth from everyone the moment I stepped into the door to being seated. Unfortunately, things went downhill from there. 

Soup of the Day: Lobster Bisque. Came promptly as I was sitting at the counter right next to the soup and salad prep area. Strong lobster stock presence and nice balanced flavors. I was hoping for at a least a small amount of lobster. For 10 bucks, it feels overpriced without any the meat. I wouldn't have mind shelling out a little but more for it. 

Almost 30 minutes later, my Wagyu Burger came. It was a really long wait. I sat across and noticed pretty slow movement from the grill cooks. The house wasn't even full. There shouldn't have been such a long wait. The salad and appetizer cooks were a lot more efficient. 

Burger had high quality Wagyu beef and reminds me of Nopa's. Unfortunately the execution was off. Ordered a medium rare and the center was still cold and rare. Not only that, the juices 'sogged' up the lower bun. These two reasons are why Nopa excels better than Boulevard. The soggy bun made a very unpleasant lunch experience, even though I ate with a fork and knife. 

Fries, $6, were crisp and  good. I like how they presented in a copper sauce Mauviel sauce pan. But for 6 bucks, it is overpriced. 

Special White Peach Ice Tea, $5.50, just ok. Fresh bits of peaches but lacked flavor and overpriced.

For a little over 40 bucks, Boulevard is overpriced for the quality. There are much better restos in the area for what you pay. I'll probably give it another try for dinner. Improvements for lunch should start with the grill and oven area. The cooks were slow and technical executions were off. 

2.5 Stars.
author: Stan L.

description: I lived in NYC for a decade and generally find SF restaurants disappointing.  Not Boulevard.  Best dining experience in SF.
author: Michael S.

description:
More like 3.5 stars.

I've been here twice now and depending on the chef, the meals are definitely different.  I felt like the first time I was here for my filet mignon, it was absolutely amazing.  It came with a side of corn over mashed potatoes and some grilled peppers which made it even more divine.  The second time around, I ordered the same main course, but the beef came out a little more dry than expected even though I asked for medium rare.  The accompanying sides were also different.  There were 2 fried potatoes.

Finally, foie gras is back so I had to try it!  Unfortunately, it came out more of a jelly substance, and a little undercooked for my liking.  I was expecting a hard slab of foie gras - which I'm use to, but I am okay with skipping it next time.  Sorry.

But as a starter, I highly recommend the beet salad.  That was delicious.  It has chunks of creamy cheese, beets and some greens.

Be prepared to throw down some dough when you come here - it's great for special occasions and drinks.  Enjoy!
author: Julie C.

description: great food upscale glad i was able to sit at the counter and watch all the chefs cook great food
author: Donnae K.

description: This place was a lovely surprise! Not only is the food phenomenal, but they were great at accommodating our parents surprise. Very pleased with the service and menu. Will definitely come back next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Paola A.

description: I went there with my family on a Saturday night.  We were seated right away.  In additional to the extensive wine list, they had a good list of cocktails, both alcoholic and nonalcoholic.  My kids were excited that they were having something other than 7-up or Lemonade.  The waitress came soon after we sat down and asked if she could take our drink orders while my kids were still browsing through the menu.  We told her we were not ready yet.  When she came back 15-20 minutes later, she was cold and rude.  We ended up ordering our drinks and dinner at the same time.  Some of the drinks were good, some were tasteless.  My husband and my son both ordered the halibut.  The portion for the halibut was so small.  I don't think it was even 4oz.  When I look at the pictures so people took, I wonder if the split the dish into 2 plates.  My bill still showed I paid for 2 halibut plates.  I will not go back for some time.
author: Lisa C.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. They never disappoint. The food is amazing. The menu varies by day, but they always have at least one fish, chicken, lamb, and beef dish to choose from. The many appetizers are well worth the price. Make a reservation as this place is quite busy, especially on weekends.
author: Mimi J.

description:
Very nice restaurant, located a block from the pier. Nice decor, upscale atmosphere and very friendly staff. The menu is very limited in my opinion. Just a handful of entrées, apps and salads. Not a lot of choices. I opted for the tuna tartare as appetizer, which was amazing, and the pork chop entree. It was good, but not excellent, and a bit undercooked. The accompaniments were really good.
Our desserts presentation was great, but they weren't as good either. Overall, a good restaurant, with great service, but lacks variety.
author: Tairyn A.

description:
I think if San Francisco had flashy gangsters like John Gotti or Al Capone, this is where they would have gone to eat.

There's a vibe about this place. Not only a suit and tie kind of vibe, but a boys club kind of old school vibe.

Came here with a co-worker of mine for dinner with reservations and we were seated at the counter. This place was packed on a Monday night and they were turning people away.

We started off with the softshell crab appetizer. It had a little too much breading for my taste, and my co-worker thought it was just warm and not hot. The crab wasn't soft or that crunchy like a nice softshell crab should be, so we weren't impressed by this dish.

Our next dish was the appetizer homemade truffle raviolis. This dish was tasty with a blend of pine nuts and truffles that made it rich and decedent without being too overbearing.

My main entree the seabass was too overcooked in my opinion, and didn't have that melt in your mouth tecture. It came with some corn and asparagus which complimented the dish and was cooked well.

My co-worker who had the lamb said it was cooked medium and tasted great.

During our meal we were served this complimentary chip and dip starter, which although I laughed at first (since I thought getting ONE single chip as a complimentary appretizer was supremely funny); I wound up thinking it was the best chip and dip starter I've ever had. Wish it was on the menu so that I could have ordered more.

During my meal, and I'm minusing one star for this, the busboy spilled my water all over my suit, and walked away forgetting to get me napkins. And they didn't even offer to dryclean my pants.

Yes, I know it's water, but still, I had to clean it up myself without any help since our waitress was nowhere to be found, and the busboy was probably thinking that he didn't want to deal with it, so he left and never came back.

I expected more out of Boulevard and like it's street name, had I known, I would have kept on walking. Nothing special here.
author: Jack R.

description:
I remember when Boulevard was the new kid in town.  It was the early 90's...

Everyone oohed & awed.
Everyone gushed.
It was "so beautiful!"
And the food was "so unbelievable!"

A former colleague of mine & I used to have dinner together almost every week after work.  Boulevard became part of our rotation.

He was hooked on their sweetbreads & the filet mignon.  Sweetbreads aren't even my thing, but they're unforgettable here.  
I usually went w the salmon, or the sea bass.  
Or...the foie gras.

Boulevard is a restaurant that can, & does, prepare a supremely decadent dish, like foie gras, & a pedestrian comfort dish, like a hamburger, w equal parts excellency.  The former rich & tender to the point of divine, the latter taken up a notch (wagyu beef) to the same point.

Desserts.  The desserts here are not backseat or afterthoughts...they are stellar.  Nancy Oakes uses the same care in employing a pastry chef as she does with the rest of the kitchen.  Even if you're full, order dessert.  Trust.

Why not 5 stars?  Service.  Service can be an odd mix of professional w amateur; of cold w accessible.  

All in all, a classy, classic restaurant.
And a great venue for both business or pleasure.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Ok, first the good. The halibut was actually awesome. And the wine list has some good stuff on it. And in general, I really like the vibe of the dining room. It is warm and nice with great privacy per table. 

But in general I would say the food was pretty disappointing. Really great presentation on everything but I would say most dishes were not good. Not actively bad, but not good. And the cocktails were similarly unimpressive. 

I really want to like this place as I enjoy the atmosphere and there are not a lot of dining rooms like this in sf. But there is so much better food elsewhere that I think it is a pass.
author: Amjad S.

description:
My server, Jay, was warm, thoughtful, and personable. I dined solo tonight, and she and the staff made me feel right at home. Cooking fans will enjoy the view at the chef's counter. I'd sit there again as a party of two, but not alone since the action inspires commentary.
Ambience was romantic, with soft lighting and old world charm.
Salmon and asparagus were perfect. I ate every bite, and as much sauce as possible.
author: Molly M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place... I didn't like my first visit but since so many people love it and it has a Michelin star... I decided to give it another try. However, I didn't totally enjoy my second visit either. 

Here's what I liked about it: 
Pretty good food, nothing overlooked and all the flavors worked together. But nothing special really... I could easily confuse food here with any other restaurant in the city.

What I didn't like:
The whole ambiance felt like a worn down senior home. Perhaps they are shooting for the rustic or museum-ish feel... But it just felt stuffy and, well... Outdated.
author: Betty T.

description:
My husband, daughter and I had dinner here and I must say that it was worth the visit.
The bread was super fresh and the drinks were delicious
Service was excellent and they were very attentive
Food was prepared to perfection
I thoroughly enjoyed this place
author: Julia F.

description:
This place is great!  We were seated at the chef's table, which at first I wasn't sure how dinner would go being seated there. However, it made for an awesome dining experience. It was amazing to watch the food being prepared and seeing the amount of detail that goes into each dish. The chef's were very talented and friendly. 
Great ambiance and made for the perfect restaurant to dine at on the night of our wedding anniversary!  Highly recommend this place!!
author: Matt W.

description:
We just went to the Blvd last night with out of town friends who ended a Celebrity cruise.  Got there prior to 5:30 PM reservation and had drink in bar while we waited for friends to arrive.  Service at bar was gracious and quick.  We had hardly sat down and a waiter was there to ask us if we wanted a drink.

Our friends arrived and we were seated next to a window (as requested), waiter arrived.  Very professional and friendly.  Ordered a bottle of wine, talked about the menu for a moment and he left for the wine.  

We ordered specialty salads to start with  along with our mains.  Two halibuts, one pork chop and one quail. All were cooked to perfection and portions were plenty large.  We were ecstatic while complimenting on how good the food was prepared and tasted.   

We did not have desert, but did have a couple of cappuccinos.  Not that the dessert menu was poor, just full and contented....

Read prior reviews and am very disappointed.  Have now eaten there three times and always great.   IF you have a problem with the food, say something while there, not back stabbing later on yelp.  IF it is too expensive for you, go somewhere else that more accurately fits your budget.

I cannot recommend the restaurant, staff and food enough!
author: Steven N.

description:
Just been here for lunch, and all I am going to say is- food was WOW!!
Really impressed.
Had butternut squash soup, which tested amazing and scallops with risotto.
I have to say probably the best risotto I ever had.
My friend had petrale sole with finger potatoes and vegetables and it was done to perfection.
Coming back for lunch for sure!!
Our waiter was not really happy to be working, but honestly, for as long as the food is fantastic, don`t really care about the  moody waiter.
author: Bianca G.

description:
Sat at Bar. Attentive service delicious food. Ate scallops. No swordfish. All desserts have ice cream. Good 4 me No dessert. 
I'll b back a lot
author: JoAnn W.

description: Reliable stalwart of a restaurant. It's near my office so I pop in for lunch alone, with clients and coworkers. The food is always excellent, lots of choice for everyone and everyone loves it. The food is the perfect combination of current without being ridiculous, and isn't pretentious, which I love. They do everything right. An American classic. The service can be inconsistent, but it's a lunch crunch, so they are more than forgiven, just don't expect to do lunch in an hour. But really, why would you?
author: Pearl R.

description:
Such a great spot for celebrating a special event, and I don't just say that because it's fancy. I say that because of the extra few surprises they curate. I will let you go and figure out what those are! 

The food and service both are excellent, it was such a wonderful experience.
author: Thomas R.

description: Amazing food n ambience. Everything was so presentable from starters to dessert. Just loved it. Lamb was so delicious , and rivviololi is must try.
author: Neetu P.

description: I went here with a friend a while back to cash in on an IOU. I had been curious if the place was any good as I walked by it frequently. This place is fancy and the waiters are very attentive. That is excpet the shared bathroom with the adjourning establishment (it was an odd setup). Nevertheless, the wine menu was awesome and as many other reviews state the place was busy! We grabbed a seat at the chef bar so you can watch the guys cook the food. I had a pork chop and my coworker had the duck and foie gras. I sampled both (duck/goose) and the food was very rich. I'm not sure if this was too fancy for my palette or just average. That average rating is excluding the chop it was cooked to perfection and served with some fried kale creation. OMG it was amazing. The wine was also great. The thing is although I didn't pay the food & wine was pretty expensive. If Boulevard was more cost effective I could give 4-5 stars. But 3.5 stars seems fair; don't get me wrong I get your paying for an experience. Yet, with such a hefty price tag I want write home to mama this is amazing, or never in my life have I eating something like this food.  I will go back and give this place another try someday just to be fair to the establishment.
author: Andre F.

description: I cannot say how this establishment treated us other than to say the word discrimination comes to mind. My husband was in shorts and instead of saying there was a possible dress code they put bus at a small table in the corner... Put a table cloth and brought silverware after we were there for 20 minutes....then took our order..I had a appetizer of scallops.. For 2 scallops it was 42.00...skip this one and head to the wharf or Chinatown..you'll be treated much better!
author: Wendy K.

description: What an amazing meal :) lobster and crab ravioli was absolute great start and the calamari and octopus was to die for. The lamb for my entree hit the spot. Had no room for dessert but enjoyed a nice espresso. Thank you Timothy for the great service
author: Rachelle R.

description: The waiters  were rude food was ok but a poor couple had wine dumped all over them the man at the four top table  was so disrepectful to the older woman she tried to dump water on him he raised his hand to her. The woman at the table told him not to do that. It was horrible ruined our evening and I'm sure theres.
author: Christopher V.

description:
These Beluga drinks are amazing.

Salad was amazing
Calamari ok
Steak was amazing
ceviche was amazing
author: Justin I.

description:
We came here to celebrate a birthday dinner and the foods were delicious. I wish there are half stars and I would give them three and a half stars for foods and extra half star for excellent service. Our waiter was very knowledgable about the menu items and knew them well. 

We ordered all of the appetizers on the menu (one of everything) and shared them. They were all delicious! My pallet was a bit overwhelmed by all of those foods. My favorite was the bisque and sea scallops. I had the prime pork chop for my entree, but we shared our plates. I think the pork chop could have been better. The Filet Mignon was a bit too dry and the swordfish was too fishy to my liking (I grow up eating lots of fish, and it is too fishy even for me) The risotto was the best! So creamy and tasty. 


Deserts were delicious too and pairing with a cup of cappuccino made it even better. The special lemonade was very good. 

We had the private dining room that could have fitted 14 people, and it was very nice as we had our quiet place. All in all, nice place to try a restaurant but I could have gone to a better fine dining restaurant. There are too many of those in sf. 

This review is updated for our second visit for a friends bachelorette party at the same wine cellar private dining room. I downgraded from 4 star to 3 because the food quality was not as good as my first visit. My friends were not very satisfied neither. My friend and I ordered the steak for both medium rare, mine was okay, but my friend's was overcooked to almost well done. We spent about $160 per person and we just thought it was not worth the quality and we could have gotten better food at another "fancy" restaurant. I am disappointed at my second visit. Probably won't be back again if I were to book the restaurant.
author: Lena H.

description: My friend and I were lucky enough to have been able to get in here on just a few hours notice. 8:45 is a great time to dine... the chef and staff are usually "over the hump" by this time after the initial 'peak'. Energies neutralize, balance, settle down, and art begins to form, manifest and erupt. We wound up sharing each selection... the bread was spectacular, although my friend thought the butter, initially presented, was much too hard or frozen. However that soon remedied itself... then seared scallop app; White Truffle Ravioli app; Berkshire Pork Prime Rib Chop and Lamb T-bone main course... chocolate moose, Graham's 20 year old Tawny port and it was a pretty good day so far. Dana and the staff ROCK!  Professional service with excellent tolerance (staff allowed us to switch tables 'mid-stream) through our meal. My friend really knows how to push the envelope when it comes to the 'service' industry folk. I wish it were different, but he's a good egg, from another culture. Anyway, the food, atmosphere, and service at Boulevard appear to be simply what the, this, their, those hearts desire. The wine list is quite special to say the least. Something for almost everyone in the mix. So thankful for the knowledgeable and respectful staff. Cheers! Just go here and celebrate your life for once, twice or weekly. No disappointments. Kudos to you "Boulevard"!
author: John A.

description:
I'm a foolish college student who just turned 21. We had a late dinner reservation so we stopped by a bar while we waited, and drinks were stronger than expected. Do you see where I'm going with this? For my first ever Michelin experience, I was completely smashed. 

And it was awesome. 

Drunk fine dining is highly recommended for the following reasons:

1. Be completely underdressed, and don't even give a damn. No tie, no worries. Our server was complete off the charts amazeballs nice. Didn't even bat an eyelash at my jeans or his lack of suit jacket. The service at the place is outstanding which makes sense given its rep. She offered to give us additional small plates so we could share the main courses we ordered. It's a small thing but I know restaurants that charge for this. So cheers to you Boulevard!

2. Drink more while you're already hammered. We ordered more wine at this place. It was a good decision. No further explanation needed.

3. Drunchies: Defined as drunk munchies. And it's so real. But instead of stale chips and salsa, we dined on gourmet quail and lamb chops. At this point, things get a little blurry. But I do remember being amazed that the quail was stuffed with more quail. QUAILCEPTION. And the lamb was like sinking my teeth into a lamb flavored pillow. So freaking tender. 

Overall, drunk fine dining (especially at Boulevard) is a must for any budding alcoholic. It allows you to get rid of the inhibitions and bask in the glory of a fine piece of quail.
author: Willa P.

description: Very nice ambiance and food was decent though servings were small for the price. Service was extremely douchy. Every person from the coat checker, waiter, runner and water re-filler had an attitude. Will not return and wouldn't recommend anyone spend this type of money for poor service. Prices this high should be accompanied by smiles and hand over foot service - didn't happen at this place.
author: VegMaster F.

description:
We came as a celebration of a work dinner.  It was a difficult client but we were able to finish most things by this dinner. 

We ordered a great pinot noir which I agree was delicious.  It was an expensive one, but since it was a work dinner, I didn't worry about it too much. The bottle was great though. 

I ordered: 
Scallops - it came with a squid ink pasta which I had thought would be a weird combination of food flavors, but it actually went pretty well together.  The scallops were wonderfully caramelized. I love a good scallop dish. 
Salmon - it came with a corn succotash with truffle and a squash blossom.  The squash blossom was delicious, but I did wish that I had more than one though.  The truffles and corn went very well together.  The salmon was definitely the best I've had recently.  I definitely enjoyed the slices of truffles though. 
Dark Chocolate Tart: the ice cream portion of it was the most interesting and the best part. The tart was pretty good and it was so pretty looking and I definitely enjoyed this last piece of the meal. 

Overall, the service, food and everything about the dinner was great. It's definitely one of the best restaurants in the area. 

Protip: just go. It's a great Michelin starred restaurant with great service and food.
author: Nina Y.

description:
I've been wanting to try Boulevard for a very long time.  It's location and proximity to the Hotel Vitale could not be better.  On Valentines Day my GF and I were traveling from LA so we celebrated it a few days later here.  Perfect!

I enjoyed a nice Stoli Martini at the bar while we waited for our table.  She had glass of some awesome Pinot Noir.  $19.50 per glass, wow!

We got seated at a smallish two top down the center of the restaurant.  A little bigger table or a booth would have been preferred.  We started with two appetizers-

Pear & Endive Salad with Hazelnuts, Capers, Dried Cherries.  At $14.25 we were not that blown away with this.  Good though!

Calamari Stuffed with Lobster & Shiitake. For $17, I wanted to pull an Oliver Twist and say "Please, sir, I want some more".  It would have been nice if there were two stuffed squid, one for each of us.  We just cut it up and it was gone in a few bites. Tasted great.

I didn't feel either starter was really worth the price paid, but that's fine dinning.  

My GF the Queen of Reseda had her eye on the Kurobuta Pork Chop.  We typically don't order the same entree so we can share, so I ordered the Petrale Sole.  Bad move.  Not that the Sole wasn't good, it was.  Very good.  Just not as good as that friggin Pork Chop.  Oh my that was perfect.  A symphony of flavors that just went so well with the $19.50 a glass Pinot Noir!

Our waitress was great.  The restaurant is upscale but still comfortable.  We both agreed we'd like to return again someday. We will be getting our own pork chops next time!
author: Jamie V.

description:
One of my top three restaurants in the city so far - I will certainly be back.

Side note* I no longer eat meat and I had plenty to choose from!
author: Jazmyn W.

description: This place is really nice...but very expensive place to eat...I ordered Angus Filet, Alaska Halibut for Starters we ordered Prawns and Lobster Ravioli...with Vodka Martini. For desserts, banana caramel chocolate. All were perfect!!
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
I guess this is what you call a classic! The food does not disappoint but it is pricey given its Michelin star. I'd heard so much about this place ever since I was born and people rave on and on. Personally, I did not think THAT highly of my food. It was solid and everything was good but not wow-ing. My qualms are that the ambience decor are in dire need of an upgrade! Maybe it's just my taste, but I wouldn't want to bring someone here for a special occasion. 

Not sure I would come again. So many finer establishments around! I think I should be able to be choosy if I'm paying $$$$ prices.
author: Farrah N.

description: Delicious! Absolutely delicious! The flavors are to die for! This place was so special. Loved the holiday decor. Great place to celebrate a special event. They place a personal signed card on your table and customized dessert. The food is like a top rated cooking show. I can't describe the flavors but it was well executed to perfection. The Forrest wood one with mushrooms was the best mushrooms I have ever eaten. The lamb was over the top. The butterscotch pudding was a perfect end to a great evening. Thanks to my brother for the recommendation.
author: Deborah P.

description: First time visiting San Francisco. We found Boulevard to have a cool, casual atmosphere. Staff was very knowledgeable, attentive and polite. Food was very good; portion sizes were on the larger size. Octopus appetizer was phenomenal! They offer some Fun drink options- "the word" was delicious! My husband and I Found it to be a little noisy though so wouldn't recommend it for a "quite romantic night out" but definitely worth a try for a special night out
author: Jessica T.

description:
3.5 stars. Food is delicious but I couldn't give a higher rating because value is so-so.

I absolutely love the Audiffred building and was excited when we had reservations here for a joint birthday lunch some months ago. The interior of the restaurant is just as beautiful but you definitely pay more for ambiance and decor. I guess I'm a creature of habit because I ordered the sea scallop risotto with peas and later also ordered the sea scallop risotto at Prospect.

The portion was rather small, but the scallops and peas were very fresh. I think I prefer the sea scallop risotto served at Prospect, because it included mushrooms and the portion felt slightly larger (price was also several dollars cheaper).
author: Bella L.

description:
Blvd.

Revolving doors.  Beautiful architecture. 

Balanced, tasty cocktails.

Oyster and beef carpaccio appetizer melts in your mouth. 

Perfectly cooked scallops and filet mignon.

Comfy couch seating for couples (from our seats, we could kitchen-watch). 

Loved the banana sorbet and the marshmallow fluff in the icebox cake dessert.

Minus one star for service. The staff was very welcoming but our waiter had a brain fart and totally ignored me when I asked him a question about the menu. Also, when each of our dishes was delivered to the table, all I heard were mumbles from the wait staff when they were explaining what the dish was. I do expect more when I'm shelling out the dough.
author: Maya S.

description: This is one of our favorite places every time we visit SF.  It doesn't disappoint every time we visit.  The ingredients are the freshest and the combinations are always delicious.  The portions are not huge so you have space to have appetizer, entrée and dessert -- and not feel completely over stuffed -- just happily full.
author: L N.

description:
This is a very unique classic restaurants that I feel could be featured in a movie. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and located at a corner. Not much valet but that's all of SF too. 

The food is small in quantity on big dishes just as all rich highly overpriced restaurants do. But thankfully for me that night I wasn't very hungry. There's a lot of wow factors about this restaurant. The view for one side of the restaurant you could see the bridge. The very extra but classy way to go to the restroom via elevator or stairs. The bathroom itself. And some of the food.
We had a ravioli mushroom type of appetizer and it literally made me and my boyfriend say wow by the first bite. It was funny cause some person to the left of me did the same reaction to some other dish. Main dishes were good but if that appetizer was bigger in size I'd stick to that.
I think the best part about this restaurant is that they have this bread crumb scooper that servers use and it's just so useful and a fun additive to a big establishment.
It was our One Year Anniversary and our server gave us a little treat for dessert that celebrated that. 

Aside from the food being obviously overpriced though it's to be expected for any type of 4+ star restaurant, there were two main issues that made me mad about this place. My boyfriend made a week in advance reservation to be a surprise and sit next to the window with the view, the hostess apologized and said she gave us the closes she could and it was a complete joke of a table. We thought maybe it's because they only allow bigger parties to sit there but not we saw an older white couple sit there later on. Maybe they were more "deserving" of the table. But then our table was sticking out of the corner of this fence they had. I felt like people would've knocked food over David or just run into him cause that was a main passage way. No food was knocked over, but people were hitting him cause we were sticking out. Maybe I'm thinking to much of this, it's possible. But for such a high praised place I expect the best, and it was close but not there.
author: Jazmyne N.

description: Wow.  Northern halibut w beet risotto.  Amazing dish.  Excellent salad and very attentive service.  A great experience.
author: David G.

description: I've been going to Boulevard for 16 years, and would have happily given 4+ stars in the past. Our last visit was really disappointing, though. Specifically, our reservation was handled very unprofessionally. Fifteen minutes before our reservation, the restaurant called to ask if we were still coming. We replied that we were on our way and would arrive on time. Then, the hostess called AGAIN five minutes before our reservation, as we were walking in from one block away. Again we told her we'd be on time. But when we walked in (ON TIME and not one second late), it was obvious that our table had been given away! We were forced to wait in a cramped and chaotic space near the bar for nearly 20 minutes. No apology was given. It was my birthday, and I was really disappointed. I politely told the hostess I'd like to check in with a manager after she seated us. I've never had a restaurant call even once, muchless twice, to see if I am still coming, when I am showing up on time! And then to have them give away our table after all the trouble. Crazy. The hostess said she'd have a manager come by, but no one ever showed up. To be fair, our experienced female server was lovely, and the food was of course good, but we had to rush through dinner for our babysitter, and we felt disappointed and offended by how our reservation had been treated. It was terribly inhospitable behavior, in my view, and also really a shame that a manager would not have wanted to check in with rightfully unhappy guests. Badly done, Boulevard.
author: Kate R.

description:
I came here with a friend for dinner yesterday, the ambiance is nice, however, the place is loud, but the food was superb. I ordered a mixed greens salad (which was surprisingly large enough fot my friend and i to share), the Local King Salmon with the chanterelle mushrooms and spoon corn fritters. The salmon was cooked to perfection and all of the sauces blended together perfectly with the dish.  Also, my had friend had the t-bone lamb, and they absolutely loved their dish as well.

Furthermore, our service was Excellent, and I look foward to trying this place again in the future.
author: Tell It Like I.

description: The location of the Boulavard is ideal.  It overlooks the Bay Bridge and the Ferry Building Clock Tower.  The food and service are just as good and the ambiance is a perfect match as well.  If your looking for a nice restaurant for a special occasion or a restaurant that makes being in San Francisco special, then go to The Boulevard.
author: Brandy H.

description:
This restaurant has been my favorite for years and I have never had a bad meal here. I love the ambiance and vibe of Parisian bistro and I love food that is never the same but always constantly good. I can't name a favorite dish as everything I tried has beed superb. Service is consistently good and friendly as well. Never pretentious or rude - never, and I come here a lot! Through the years I  ordered octopus, abalone, tuna, pork chop, duck, quail, filet mignon, lamb, tomato salads - all my favorites are  always with a new twist. 
Deserts is a separate story: always great. One thing is missing a French soufflé. But that is all I can ever complain!   
It may be hard to get a reservation on a weekend but if you walk in after 8 pm you will be seated within 30 minutes or less and no fuss will be made about you not having a reservation. Great place all around.
author: K Z.

description: The restaurant was stunning, the staff was fantastic, service was on point. But, I felt the food presentations were a bit dated as well as the choices like "steak with bearnaise", the mushroom Milanese was terribly deep fried and said nothing about it being deep fat friend on the menu. Milanese is typically pan fried in a small amount of olive oil.. After two bites, I wanted to be done with the dish. The apps however were good, very simple and straight forward, stuff you can get in many places. Desserts were good, again, no big deal on the presentations. I guess I just expected a bit more from a restaurant that holds a Michelin star. Maybe a bit of edible gold flake on the desserts would have spruced them up a bit...
author: Jay R.

description:
How the mighty have fallen.  

From being awarded the James Beard Foundation Award for restaurant of the year just four short years ago, to now losing its Michelin star, Boulevard seems to neither notice nor care.  

The $37 you pay for a three ounce (sic) portion of good but not great salmon is indicative of Boulevard's contempt for its customers.  The revered signature pork chop is fine, but not 39 dollars fine.  The appetizer of morels ($17) is just large enough to get stuck between your teeth, but not sufficient to satisfy.  

If all three of the various mixed drinks we had were put into the same glass, they would amount to the volume of one drink at many other establishments, and would possibly taste better than they did individually.

So, in summary, over the past few years Boulevard has come up with a unique marketing strategy:  significantly higher prices, markedly smaller portions, and hope that no one notices.
author: Donald D.

description:
Quite expensive for your average college student, so wait a bit when you have a stable job. 

The place was really busy so our table(s) for about 15 people were interesting. They put 5  tables together that fit only 2 people. We squeezed in 3 to a table and still didn't have enough room. 

When we got to the menu, there weren't many vegetarian options - just 3 and 2 ld them were appetizers. 

We got the truffle mushroom ravioli (appetizer) for our main. It was delicious but very very small. Let's say, we were quite hungry afterwards. 

Next time I go, I hope to be bringing in a bit more cash so I can try it all. 


Nonetheless, good food.
author: Laura C.

description:
The sauces they make here are really the star of the dishes.  Normally I like the dish to speak for itself and I'm glad when it's used sparsely.  Here the dish wouldn't be the same without the sauce.  I'm not a big fan of mint on my lamb but in this case the sauce was totally delicious and totally gone.  It was the same for every dish.  

The desserts were a bit of a disappointment which takes this down to 4.5 stars.
author: Brad S.

description:
My husband brought me here for an anniversary dinner and the thing I really like about high end restaurants is how they give you a card in celebration of your occasion. It's just a small personal touch that makes you feel special and it's also a little souvenir. 

We were seated at a table along the side walk by the window and there is a sweetheart bench against the wall. Nice seating for a romantic dinner so you can sit close with your beau. 

For appetizers we had the Ahi tuna and the soft shell crab. The Tuna was good and it was new to eat it with grapes and hummus. I could pass on it next time though. The crab however was freakin delicious. It had so much flavor without being too pungent or overwhelming. The whole time I ate it I kept repeating, "omg this is so good" because I couldn't get over how good it was!

My main was the pork chop and I didn't like it. It was gamey and I think I tasted goat cheese. I don't remember if the menu said goat cheese or anything, perhaps I over looked the description. So why the five stars? Their lamb, holy cow- or holy lamb. It was bomb. When I saw it on the menu I thought it sounded delicious, except I hate the gamey taste of lamb so I skipped on it. I tried my husbands just to taste it and it had no gamey flavor whatsoever! My mind was blown. 

For dessert we had the berry creme brûlée and it was so delicious!!! I practically licked the plate clean. 

Soft shell crab, lamb, and berry creme brûlée- make those your choices. You're welcome.
author: Annissa H.

description:
I think, on balance, the thousands of people who have reviewed Boulevard are correct: it's about a four star experience, maybe slightly lower.  I guess what you have to ask yourself is, "Can I get this quality of food, service, and ambience for less money elsewhere?"  I believe the answer to that question is a solid YES, but that doesn't take away from what Boulevard has to offer.

The squid tortellini app was fine, it was good.  The pork chop was the highlight -- really juicy and delicious.  The chocolate desserts, again, were fine.  And for this the bill was slightly over $100 per person before tip, and not including wine as we brought our own.

So there you go.  It's sort of an elegant steak house vibe.  Kind of clunky interior decor, service perfectly good but nothing outstanding.  Front of house staff were enthusiastic, so perhaps management heard previous complaints and fixed that problem.

This is the place to take your dad if he's in town and not a real adventurous eater but you want him to feel like you took him somewhere special that he'd like and be comfortable.
author: Stephen K.

description:
This review is only for the drinks at the bar.

We came here to meet some friends before a party and had a few drinks.  Drinks menu is great and service impeccable.  I wish I can remember our bartender's name...  he was so great!

I've been here for dinner a couple of times but that was years ago.  Sadly, the meal here are not memorable for me.  I'm seeing some great recent reviews here so I need to come back and have a meal here!
author: Susan C.

description:
We needed a place that could accommodate a large party (14) without having to make reservations months in advance,  pay some kind of exorbitant private dining room fee and/or have a ridiculously high minimum tab.    Luckily I found Boulevard which ticked all the right boxes.   I was able to reserve the private dining room about a month in advance and the only requirement was to have a minimum tab of 750.  We didn't even have to order from a set menu.  We could just order from the regular one.

The service was excellent, the drinks were solid and on average people gave their food a thumbs up.   

I had the octopus appetizer which was actually only average at best but the Steelhead salmon was really good.    The lambchops were great while the halibut was a little overcooked/dry.   The best dish of the night seemed to be the king quail,  it was truly exceptional.   

The only bad thing was that the waiters came and cleared the table without asking if people were done with their food and they actually took my wife's plate which had a sizable piece of uneaten quail on it.
author: Ben Y.

description:
The other reviews say it all, not much left to add at this point.  I got the filet, it was well cooked and seasoned lightly and had great flavor.  
The wine guy (not going to try to spell it) was wonderful, pointed us onto some great wine and spent plenty of time answering one of my coworkers questions. 
Great atmosphere, great food, wonderful selection of wine and spirits. 
The only downside for me was that the dessert just didn't do it for me
author: Cory S.

description:
I tried Boulevard for lunch on a weekday. Overall I was fairly impressed but not blown away.

I started off with the ahi tuna tartare. It was served with macadamia nuts, dried pineapple, and hearts of palm. Though I am a big fan of tuna tartare in general, this dish left me barbell markedly disappointed. The tuna was very fresh but the flavor missed the mark. The nuts distracted from the fish rather than complementing it. The taro chips were not noteworthy, but the nori chips did improve the dish with their flavor. Not quite enough to salvage the dish though.

The lobster bisque was fairly well done. It was creamy and rich. It was finished with clams, and that worked well with the lobster flavor. Not the best lobster bisque ever by any means but no complaints.

For my main course, I had the wagyu beef bavette done rare. The meat was cooked beautifully: very tender, juicy, and flavorful. My only issues with this dish were with the secondary ingredients. The potatoes were served in thick slices with Fourme D'Ambert cheese. I'm not a fan of blue cheeses, so I won't hold that against the dish but the potato was pretty boring on its own. I'm being pretty nitpicky and maybe if I liked the cheese the potato would have been better. Still, I do love when I enjoy every part of a dish on its own as well. The radicchio was way too bitter for me to eat at all. The tomato slices were very juicy and flavorful though.

I also tried a bit of the boneless Berkshire ribs and coconut shrimp. The ribs were tender and flavorful; the fish sauce was used very well to create a unique flavor. The coconut shrimp was just sweet enough. The lemongrass rice with sesame seeds, pine nuts, and shallots was delicious both in flavor and texture. The rice was just the perfect amount of crispy.

To wrap things up, there were some misses here but mostly hits, and the price is very right if you can manage to make it here for lunch.
author: Kevin T.

description: Amazing food, fantastic wine list and impeccable service. I've been here over several dozen times and this restaurant never disappoints. I highly recommend Boulevard restaurant.
author: Lily M.

description:
Genuinely mediocre food. 
I wish someone would have written this review before I had gone here. 
The service was great but there is nothing else to be said.
author: Brandon R.

description: This place had very poor service and no one was really even in here! The bartender took forever to take our drink orders and acted like he was doing us a favor to take the order, after 15 minutes of waiting (mind you, only two people were at the bar) ! If they've upgraded on staff, I might try it again, as the ambiance is cozy and classic!
author: Madeleine E.

description:
I came to eat lunch at The Blvd. with a business associate after receiving a call that RN74's oven wasn't working (bummer). For a place as nice and well established as The Blvd. I would have expected MUCH MUCH better service....

Our waitress was terribly rude and kept rolling her eyes, like she was annoyed with us. I am not sure what we did to receive the service that we did. We asked for honey with our tea at the end of the meal and she snapped, saying "I have to help this other table now, so later ok?" ...I don't think I've ever been spoken to like this in a restaurant.

Additionally, NUMEROUS times they tried to clear our plates with food on the fork! What the hell is going on? They also were in such a rush to clear out the appetizer that still had half the food still sitting there. What's the issue? Why doesn't this place better train their staff? The Blvd. is not a cheap place, where I would brush off such service (not that I feel anyone ever should, but sometimes, you don't expect much). I came in with very high expectations and found everyone to be very rude and unprofessional, even the hostesses - very hostile and snooty. I would rather take my business elsewhere. The food is nothing special, there are plenty of well established, delicious restaurants that take pride in amazing service.
author: Nikki R.

description:
For a michelin star restaurant, I was expecting more from Boulevard, but my overall experience here was a good one. Came here for my birthday, and ordered three dishes to share: Sweet Corn Risotto, Wild King Salmon, and the Berkshire Kurobuta Pork Chop.

The risotto was quite delicious with roasted mushrooms, crispy rice, and pine nuts. It also came with battered squash blossoms filled with gooey cheese. ($28)

The wild king salmon was oven roasted, and was very tender and juicy. You could really taste the flavor of the fish which was nice. The dish was pretty plain, and I wished there was some kind of sauce to brighten up the plate. I also thought it was a small piece of salmon that they gave us, so not sure if it was worth the price. ($37)

The pork chop was also oven roasted, and I thought it was okay. I enjoyed the crispy skin of the pork, but overall, I thought this dish was also pretty plain. It was a bit hard to cut, and seemed a little overcooked. ($38)

For dessert we ordered a caramel pudding type dish, which I forget the name of. It came with little bits of pudding cake, caramel chocolates, and a little scoop of ice cream. It all tasted great, but I just wished there was more on the dish.

Service was super and very accommodating.

It was nice to try this place out, but I don't think it's worth coming back.
author: Minna S.

description: Excellent service and food!  The decor is also warm and elegant, making for a wonderful lunch experience.  The wagyu bavette was tender and succulent, and the dessert was decadent without being too much.
author: Jon H.

description:
We enjoyed a group dinner in the downstairs area.  It felt a little odd to be heading down the small stair case to the basement.  But the space was nicely decorated to be warm and inviting, especially with the mirrors made to look like windows, so we didn't feel cramped at all.

The night started with wine and passed bites.  The service was great - servers walked easily amongst the guest with the trays and bottles to keep the wine flowing.  My favorite bite was the tuna tartare, which had a nice spiciness to it.

Dinner was a choice of swordfish or chicken.  Being on the coast, I opted for the swordfish, which was served with some delicious mushrooms.  The fish was firm, but still flaky, and paired nicely with the velvety texture of the mushrooms.  The light amount of sauce provided just enough flavor and moisture to bring it all together.

The highlight of the evening for me was the strawberry shortcake with rhubarb coulis.  The shortcake was light and fluffy, the coulis was so flavorful, the berries were just right.  

Again, the service, particularly for our large group, was impeccable.  All the dishes arrived at the appropriate time, everyone got the right place without having to raise hands, and all the dishes were hot!

I'd worried about what group dinners would be like with this crowd, particularly whether I'd miss out on any SF gems, but thanks to their excellent selection, I look forward to many more delicious evenings in the years to come!
author: Angela M.

description:
1st Michelin Star!  Hmm, I wouldn't quite say it lived up to my expectations, but overall it was still a good experience. 

TIP: make reservations.  We made reservations 3 weeks in advance and the only available time closest to 7pm for 2 were 6:15pm or 8:45pm. Crazy huh?

ATMOSPHERE (5/5): Classy and old fashioned. I liked how the tables were nicely spaced out, white tablecloths, nice red lighting, romantic, even better if you sit by the big window facing the bay bridge.  We came at 6pm when it was still bright out in the summer, so you couldn't really see it while eating.  But after eating, it's walkable distance to go out and see the bay bridge lights for yourself.  Better view outside anyway.

SERVICE (4/5): Nice, polite, knew the menu, and did her job well. But, it wasn't anything spectacular.  If i"m eating at a Michelin star restaurant, I expected the server to be excellent with a BIG smile on her face and extremely friendly to add to our experience.  Service is surprisingly a significant factor to dining out. 

FOOD (4/5): Everything was good, nothing was bad.  Average main dish were ~$37.  

*Choices of main dishes consisted of:
3 seafood: halibut, seabass, salmon
1 poultry: quail
3 red meat: pork prime rib chop, lamb, filet mignon

Pork chop was better than the lamb.  Pork chop was so juicy, actually really good (4.5/5) and the lamb was good as well but just not as tender (4/5).  The sides included in the lamb weren't good either, but the pork chop had a sweet polenta that was also delicious.  Definitely get that pork chop for its juiciness meat, though the sauce could be better. 

*Appetizers: BRANDADE IN THE SEA SCALLOPS! (4.5/5) That tiny brandade was actually the highlight of my whole meal lol. I had a taste of that and my taste buds and eyes were just enlightened.  I had to ask the server twice what it was.  It was like a soft potato full of flavor, and it tasted even better than the scallops.  I still liked the scallops at Isa better.  Scallops were good, the sauce was good and spicy, and that brandade, knew found discovery, was excellent. 

Fava Bean & Parmesan Raviolini (3.5/5) were like pot stickers with rich cheese inside.  If you really like cheese, this is the dish for you.  Eddie K loves cheese and said this was the highlight of his whole meal.  For me, I liked all the different ingredients along with the raviolini to make it a dynamic dish, like the mushrooms, squash, and radishes, and the raviolini itself was good too, but I still couldn't get over the fact of how wonderful that brandade tasted.  Wtheck is a brandade anyway?!

DRINKS (3/5):  I'm only rating based on the Moscato D'Asti, which was good, but holy crap that was the most expensive portion ever.  It was in a dessert wine glass and wasn't even filled half way, and that costed $12...that kind of ridiculous.

OVERALL: Nice atmosphere, good service and food. Would I come back?  I'm curious to see how the seafood tastes, but if the highlight of my meal was the size my pinky and was an appetizer rather than a main dish, I think I'd rather go to another Michelin star restaurant.  But it was a good and nice dining experience.  Thanks Boulevard! And thanks Eddie K for dinner.  Read his reviews!  He's a great detailed writer :)
author: Raquel Y.

description: I can't express enough how much I enjoyed the food tonight however I ordered bottled water and it smelled like a wet dog. At the end of my meal I explained this to the waiter whom gave me half off my water. What a joke. The water smelled like a wet dog, why should I pay for this water at all? End of the day, service simply sucked because of this.
author: Kevin R.

description: This was one of the better meals in my life! We came because it was very close to our hotel on the embarcadero and has a Michelin star. With reservations me and my gf were seated right away under a beautiful ceiling in a massive booth. My drink was the strawberry lemonade with vodka, amazing. Simple but I would come back just for that. We had a tasty grilled octopus app, it was perry good. The star of the meal was my pork chop recommend by the waiter. One of the best things I've ever had. Please get this. My gf had halibut which was nice and light. Deserts were top notch. I got some chocolate pudding I really liked. For a 100$ per person meal I expect very very good food and service and decor and this certainly met if not exceeded that criteria.
author: Max G.

description:
Came here for a corporate lunch. The daily menu was quite extensive and made it hard to choose because it all looked so good!

I got the beef bevette, which was slightly mediocre in my opinion. The meat was more fatty than I expected and it came with two small potatoes (which were delicious!). 

The redeeming factor was that all of my colleagues' food looked amazing and the appetizers and desserts were top notch. 

Awesome, high-quality restaurant that is a must-try!
author: Nico C.

description: I came here during a work function and we sat in one of their private rooms upstairs that has a wine cellar. It was such a nice, cozy room. The service was very good. They were attentive and very nice. I ordered their signature pork chop and it was absolutely delicious. It was juicy and savory. The garnish is also tasty. I highly recommend it for romantic dates or work functions.
author: Toni R.

description: Came back here for the 2nd time the other week. Service was top notch, and every dish was still great. It's one of those restaurants that's a mainstay because of its consistency.
author: Kazu O.

description:
There are things about this place that are pretty darn good. Execution, sadly, is not one of them. 

Generally the food ranged from decent to great, but a slightly undercooked foie, and a dramatically undercooked quail, put a damper on what should have been an amazing meal. 

If I'm dining solo and dropping 200 plus, I expect perfection. What I got was far from that.
author: Sy N.

description:
Boulevard is definitely one of those quintessential five star San Francisco restaurants. Unlike all those trendy restaurants that pop up left and right so fast you can hardly keep up, Boulevard has been around since 1993 and is a staple for fine dining. 

I actually had reservations here years ago but ended up staying home and watching tv and thought I wouldn't make it again for dinner because I had a cold but I'm glad I felt well enough to dine here with my boyfriend and his grandma visiting from slo! We were actually just talking about this restaurant when we walked past it on the way to the farmers market and a week later he told me his grandma invited us to dinner there! What are the odds?! 

This restaurant is huge! I feel like I could easily get lost in here because the seating arrangements aren't really in a grid. We ended up getting an awesome table in the corner with a perfect view of the bridge! Well my back was against it but his grandma and her friend had the best view. 

I started off with the avo and crab. I wanted the butternut soup but my boyfriend wanted it and for some reason I hate getting the same thing. I want to try as many things as possible! His grandma also got the soup and they pour it over a gruyere custard at the table. I'm looking at the menu while writing this review and holy crap my appetizer was like $20! Most restaurants are prix fixe unlike Boulevard so its crazy seeing everything broken down like that. They have a filet mignon entree for $45!! 

Even though I don't like ordering the same things, my boyfriend and I both ended up getting the scallops except I got mine sans bacon. It was so good!! Everything here was solid. I think my boyfriend said he didn't like this place the first time he came for a business dinner but he really enjoyed everything he got this time around. 

Oh and I also had a glass of their Malbec. I think its quickly becoming my favorite wine because I order it every where! We were COMPLETELY stuffed by the end of our entrees but we still ordered dessert. Yipee!! No dinner is complete without dessert. My boyfriend and I shared the sweet cream cheesecake which I see is no longer on their menu anymore but it was really good! He almost always opposes dessert but then eats like 80% of it!!! 

Service was pleasant but honestly nothing special! I suppose solid would be the word. Solid solid solid.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
A little disappointing at lunch. Classy place, with everything in place for good service. Our starters were excellent -- crab salad and the hamachi crudo tostada. 

But the mains were overpriced and artifacts from an earlier generation of food. It's not that they were bad, but food culture has advanced and maybe spoiled my palate. American wagyu burger medium rare, was the order. What came out was a mostly well-done, spongy and somewhat moist, pre-formed (looking frozen, frankly) circle of meat on bread. It wasn't a terrible burger but after having excellent burgers with a blend of freshly ground brisket and chuck, hand-formed and perfectly crumbly... this is disappointing.

Are my expectations too high? I don't think so, given how lauded it was and given it carries a Michelin star. 

My wife had the bavette (hangar steak) with morel mushrooms and it was pretty solid, not blow your mind. But the wagyu burger was really disappointing. 

If you want to take a client to a blast from the past, maybe it's a good power lunch.
author: Edward S.

description: This place is FANTASTIC. Stopped in on a Saturday night for a late dinner around 9:00... the place was still packed, but still felt intimate. Halibut and the pork chop are to die-for... I only wish you got more! The red-velvet dessert especially was a little too-lean. I can't wait for my next trip back.
author: Jenn S.

description:
Our dinner at Boulevard was amazing, well deserve of Michelin rating.  Staff were very professional and attentive.
For the appetizer we had the Sea Scallop which was perfectly seared and the Foie gras with the Semolina Biscuit was DELICIOUS, melt right in your mouth and it goes really well together with the berries.
Pork Chop was delicious but slightly on a dry side, the Cauliflower, Kale and polenta was delicious.  
The Filet was spot on, at first I was thorn between the Filet and Lamb T-bone, guess i will have to come back again soon.
We ended our evening with sinfully good dessert.  Dark Chocolate and Almond, the homemade cherry jam ice cream was super smooth, flourless chocolate cake and the almond nougat which keeps us going back for more.  What a way to end our dinner.  
Also we received a complimentary house made fresh mint and chocolate chip icecream...Thank you for the sweet treats.

My next trip, I will have to order the Lamb T-bone.....yummmmy
author: P C.

description: Celebrated my birthday at Boulevard on 4/15 with family & friends - WOW! What a treat and awesome experience. Being in a similar industry I can be a bit picky; however this place has it spot on. Reservation was at 645, arrived at 630 and immediately sat. Table had the best view in the house (pictures to follow). Service team, spot on! Recommendations given and food selected was presented beautifully. I do not have one negative thing to say about my dining experience at Boulevard. Thank you to the entire team for making this such a memorable birthday!
author: Brandon J.

description: Yummy!!! Another fabulous visit.  Classy ambiance and the feel of what fine dining in San Francisco has been for decades.  Fabulous food for all tastes and wine pairing.  Desserts to die for, however I prefer a nice after dinner cognac.  Service is always the most professional.  My top clients greatly appreciate me when I treat them so good,
author: Conan P.

description:
It lost a star due to attitude of certain staff.  Get over yourselves, you work in a restaurant, you are not leaders of countries or champions of world peace.  That said, I loved the decor and ambiance.  We went for lunch on a Tuesday, our greeting was formal and stiff.   There were beautiful booths that sat empty but we were led to a two top that was designed more for a cup of tea than a meal.  The "I'm too old to be sporting the pony tail look" gentleman that guided us to our table waited impatiently as I tried to get into my chair with coat and purse.  Literally I had to sit side saddle and could not comfortably adjust anything as he waited to give me a menu.  So awkward and so so unnecessary.  Is this your way of making guests, who are helping you to make a living, feel comfortable?

The gentleman who filled our "tap water" was so down to earth and friendly and was the only one to make a very positive impression.  After perusing the very short menu, we were ready to order, but no one came.  The initial server was female, but after an unnecessarily lengthy span of time a male server arrived to take our order.  He was borderline pleasant but not someone we felt at ease with.  When my husband inquired about his opinion of the soup of the day his sole response was "well it is quite creamy."  So here is a server who has a slight attitude issue but he can't even eloquently describe a dish.  I thought either he was inexperienced or he was dumbing things down thinking we could not or would not understand a more comprehensive culinary description.  

The food arrived and it was time to sample the highly regarded goods.  I had a stuffed Monterey calamari starter that was delicious.  The two small squid pouches hid a crab and artichoke stuffing and was accompanied by a tiny fresh Mediterranean salad with fennel.  I was so impressed with the variety of flavors and textures.  Every bite was more satisfying than the last.  My husband's swordfish was so fresh, tender, and moist.  All in all a superior lunch.  Oh yes and the sour dough bread with a surprise salty crust was perfect.....Airy and dense at the same time with a crackling crust.

It's time to lose the attitude though folks.  Servers in Paris are more pleasant then your staff.  When we dine at our favorite 5 course restaurant in Washington DC, our servers feel like family as they are so down to earth and engaged.  Your food may be of the highest caliber, but I would not return for a  repeat visit as the pretentious attitude is just too hard to swallow.
author: Regina S.

description:
16TH MICHELIN STAR EXPERIENCE: CALIFORNIA FOIE GRAS DELIGHT

"My First Review of the Year"

Last year in 2014 was a great year for my family. My cousin who was unemployed for more than two years was hired at Futuris, a company Tesla contracts to, in June. His older brother had his first born son. My nephew earned his GED in December. On Christmas my sister and her husband announced they're expecting their first child. Me? I didn't go to Brazil for the World Cup as I had done for the three previous World Cups: Japan 2002, Germany 2006, and South Africa 2010. However I went to Las Vegas twice for free, but I would have preferred going to Brazil for the World Cup. In terms of Yelp accomplishment I did receive my first Elite status. However I'll take family accomplishments any day over personal achievement. What will 2015 entail? This year is my high school reunion, which I hope to go. As a horse racing fan I would love to go to Louisville, KY to watch the Kentucky Derby live in person. My ultimate goal in 2015 is to get accepted to an MBA program. 

So far 2015 has started great because last Wednesday US District Judge Stephen Wilson decided to strike down the California ban on foie gras as he deemed it unconstitutional. So my first Yelp review of this year is fitting because of the foie gras ban that was lifted. 

I decided to eat here because I had foie gras after the ban was implemented. I ate here last night to eat my foie gras legally for the first time after the ban was lifted. The seared foie gras was smaller than the last time I had it. Would the foie gras be as memorable as last time? I ate my first bite of foie gras legally in more than two years. It was heaven in my mouth because it tasted like butter. The analogy statement it tastes like butter fits perfectly with my first taste of foie gras in long time. What helps the buttery texture was the toasted seeded sourdough that was with the foie gras. Those two combinations were like eating butter on toast, but in a luxurious manner. I wanted to savor each bite of the foie gras because I didn't know if I was dreaming. Ok I know it's just duck liver, but it tasted great even more so because foie gras is legal again. To compliment the foie gras I had it with a glass of sauternes. 

Regarding the main course I had most of the main courses at Boulevard before like the prime rib pork chop, quail, and lamb t-bone. I was hoping there was filet mignon topped with foie gras butter, which was on the menu before the ban. I decided between the California swordfish or the local petrale sole. My server described the dishes by stating the swordfish is meatier while the local sole is more delicate. I decided the swordfish. I was glad I ordered the swordfish as I overheard from another server that the sole was eventually sold out. The best swordfish I've ever had was at Firenze by Night, an Italian restaurant based on Tuscan cuisine at North Beach, because it reminded me of sliced ham due to the presentation and the texture. From appearance the swordfish at Boulevard was smaller than the one I had at Firenze by Night. However I was worried about the swordfish at Boulevard because my first bite it tasted dry on the outside. I thought I had made mistake and maybe shouldn't ordered the prime rib pork chop, which I had the first time at Boulevard and was the best pork chop I ever had. As I continued to consume the swordfish it was moist in the inside. I tasted broth inside that made the swordfish more delicious. 

How much was I craving for foie gras? I looked at the dessert menu hoping to see if there was a foie gras as a dessert. Since there wasn't any I decided not to get dessert. 

The verdict? When I had foie gras at Boulevard illegally I rated my rating experience as five stars in spite of the foie gras ban. However since eating foie gras legal again in California I have to be objective. It was a very satisfying dinner. The foie gras was delicious and while the swordfish was slightly dry in the outside was juicy inside.

I enjoyed my first foie gras meal after the foie gras ban was lifted. I'm starting off in 2015 in fashion with my foie gras eating adventure.
author: Gerald R.

description:
Great place, great wine, great meal. The reviews are accurate on this San Francisco gem. From start to finish everything was exceptional. We started with Martinis with everyone choosing a different vodka. All were superb and they even had the blue cheese stuffed olives for mine.

We shared the crab ravioli and while small for two it was delicious!

I ordered the pork chop my wife and friend had the lamb and his wife had a fish. All were great though my wife thought mine was better. 

To sum this is a solid dining experience which will likely deliver 4-5 stars in food and service to all that dine there. A standby and place I will return next time in town.
author: Scott I.

description:
This is my second time dinning at Boulevard during lunch hours and it certainly did not disappoint. 

For Starters, I ordered the Halibut Brandade Fritters (2 fritters), which consists of romesco, green garlic aioli, lettuce and halibut...delicious! Definitely recommend this dish for starters.
