For Mains, I ordered the Dungeness Crab Raviolis. I was a bit bummed about the portion size. I was deceived when I saw the waiter coming my direction, slowly coming towards me with the big plate...little did I know...I saw 5 raviolis and a few mushrooms that were already sliced in half! Sigh...if I would have known I was going to nibble on 5 pieces of raviolis, I would have ordered the Grilled Wild King Salmon or the Wood Oven Roasted American Wagyu Beef Bavette. (...next time) 

Last but not least, dessert. I ordered the Flourless Chocolate Cake, which consist of Chocolate Mousse, toffee ice cream (it was between toffee or vanilla), chocolate stout truffle bar almond nugget and caramel candies. Yummmm! 

Boulevard definitely has a nice touch of the romantic dim ambiance and you're basically paying to dine in that kind of environment (as stated from other yelp reviewers). The staff were all friendly and welcoming.
author: Diana L.

description:
Boulevard is the epitome of San Francisco. From the sparkling bridge view through its windows to the classic and timeless decor inside. 

We came here Valentines evening with a group of 3 couples, all hungry and ready to eat some 1 Michelin star food.

 The service is on point. Our waiter was very timely, knowledgable and pleasant. We never felt like we had to wait for him. 

The food is truly good. Crab bisque was one of the best I've had and the foie gras is melt in your mouth delicious. Entrees ordered were quail and lamb chops, and both were prepared perfectly. I couldn't resist dessert so I had their red velvet ding dong which I devoured in under a minute. A must order alcoholic beverage is a Moscow mule. I was basically not sober after 1 drink and it tasted good going down :)

Overall a great night with friends. Highly recommend this place for a romantic evening out, special occasion or just a fun night out with friends. 

5 stars, Boulevard!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Before entering i saw the building i was worried about the view of the place. When i got in the view of the bridge wasnt that great.  But the atmosphere was a fancy place. Got greeted when i walked in. Everyone was dressed and looked nice. Not a simple casual lunch or dinner according the people watch i observed maybe just one person with a polo short sleeve shirt on. 

Got seated and then ordered. I got the waygu beef burger and requested med rare and french fries. The burger was 14 bucks and french fries was 6 bucks more. i asked for different selection of fries like garlic or sweet potatoe fries. They only got regular fries and the server said it was good. I doubted her when she said it. 

Next they served the bread. The bread wasnt good it was hard and not fluffy. I believe it was sour dough. The butter they served had sea salt so it tasted better. 
My burger came out and it was delicious on first bite. The meat was pink and medium rare. The meat was juicy and can taste the char grilled flavor. The burger was cheesy and the bun was soft and fluffy. the grilled onion was burnt. I believe its the bslamic vinegar on it. The tomatoe was dark as well.

The fries was excellent. Like it was very crisp and light and golden brown. The fries was fluffy and not hard or soft. The texture was perfect. Its not the meaty fries it just natural skinny fries without the skin. Doesnt seem like its worth six bucks tho. 

I do like the atmosphere and vibe and feels classy and fancy and more of a dress up place. The view is not too great but the service inside makes up for it. I like the location convenient and nearby all the hotels. I will return again and try something new next time.
author: Alex T.

description:
A hidden gem.  Food and service were great!  I started with the Ahi Tartare, awesome presentation and great flavor.  My husband had the Lobster Chowder, the process of pouring the soup onto the lobster was beautiful.  For dinner, I had the Filet, cooked to perfection but the potatoes were a little spicy.  My husband had the Pork Chop.  It was seasoned and cooked to perfection.  Huge wine list...my husband had a couple of beers and I had a glass of their Pinot.  For dessert we shared a lemon meringue, it was just enough to complete our meal.

Our server was very attentive and personable.  Made our experience that much better!

Would definitely be back!
author: Helen Y.

description:
Been here twice- once two years ago for lunch and again recently for dinner.  Both experiences were fantastic.  It is expensive, but the food is great and we were able to find a really good bottle of Bordeaux for under $100 on their list.  

Our waiter was perfectly attentive and paced the meal well (we had 5:45pm reservations but left around 8:30 because we wanted to take our time- at no point did we feel rushed out).  Definitely make reservations and enjoy the atmosphere!  It is a beautiful building that has a lot of history.
author: Amy J.

description:
Delicious, consistent food and awesome, compassionate service! Couldn't ask for more.  We've dined here several times over the years but tonight the generous service stood out - from late arrival (took 1/2 hour to get around the block due to road closures (yay new condos! - SF needs more of them!) to kids not feeling well from hot weather. 

We ended up getting our orders to go and the food was delicious after we dug into it at home!  From our past experiences, Boulevard's food and service are consistent. Would definitely recommend!
author: M G.

description:
I will not be dining here.  Whomever is in charge of the reservations communication is extremely curt and rude.  I emailed to ask about the NYE menu and was met with a 1 sentence response.  I emailed again to get clarification and was told that the menu was not yet prepared for NYE.  My last email correspondence asked when would the menu for NYE be ready (considering we are 10 days away) and I was met with "hopefully soon."

Thanks but no thanks.  I will be taking by business somewhere else until they hire someone who is capable of sending and receiving emails like a professional person.
author: Qtshee Q.

description: Incredible food, service and dinning experience.  Thank you for making my evening splendid.
author: Gregory H.

description:
The staple of San Francisco dining.

Incredible food, service, and atmosphere.
author: Bernard W.

description:
I am so very disappointed about my experience tonight.
I tried this place a few years ago. It was good. Tonight I made reservation for my friend's birthday. I requested a specific table and called twice to confirm. The host on the phone was very accommodating and said it's possible. When I showed up for my reservation at 9pm, they requested I wait for a bit. So after a valet and two unfinished drinks, the host tells me I have to wait for 45min for my table. Really??? Really??? They didn't seem to give a sh*t. Too bad for for a place that used to be one of SF best!
author: Sahar B.

description:
My best friend just turned 18, and to celebrate his birthday, he and I came here for dinner.
I was worried that because we were the youngest diners, the waiters would ignore us for that big party of startups that was probably tipping 30%.
Our waiter was great! He made sure that the menu was tailored to my friend's allergies, and that the experience was very 18th birthday-worthy.

For beverages, we ordered an Elderflower Press, and the Black Currant Soda.
For the meal,
HUDSON VALLEY FOIE GRAS: it was amazing. Everything was put together nicely, and well worth the price.
RISOTTO: not listed on the online menu. Although this was listed as an "entree", we chose this as another appetizer, because we were hungry and it looked very good.
BRENT WOLFE KING QUAIL: was stuffed, filling, and very satisfying.
CALIFORNIA T-BONE: was very rich, and a generous portion.
DARK CHOCOLATE TART: was creamy, but a little smaller than the other options.
CHERRY BUCKLE: heavenly! It was very buttery, and served with a small slice of savory cake.

Online, the pictures make the food look small, but after ordering an item from the Starter Menu, an item from the Entree Menu, and a Dessert item, it should be plenty for one person.

Our meal ended up being a little over 200 for the both of us.

It was totally worth it!
author: Anders Z.

description:
We dropped in last minute to have some late dessert.  The staff was more than accommodating and found us a table.  

All the desserts we tried looked beautiful.  My favorite of the night was the butterscotch pudding.  I know butterscotch pudding doesn't sound very exciting.  Let's be honest, it stirs up memories of pudding cups in elementary school lunch boxes.  But this was the most exciting butterscotch pudding I have ever had.  It was perfectly rich and creamy without being too overpoweringly sweet.  

Try the butterscotch pudding!
author: Kathy C.

description:
A very cute restaurant that reminded my wife and me of Paris.  Beautiful interior..dark woods, gleaming glass.  Great service from the Valets to the Hostess to the Bartender to the Waitstaff.  Had a great Bloody Mary to start....

Appetizers, Entrees, Dessert were all top notch.  Definitely a Michelin Starred restaurant.  Well deserved.

Spoil yourself and make a reservation!
author: Scott L.

description: Love this place, great for client dinners. Consistently good food and service. Quiet and private tables.
author: Alexander G.

description:
it was  over priced ! But still there was a line outside 

Appetizers were very small ! 

Entrees

I liked my cod  special , but my co worker did not like it ! And you don't really have to many  entrees to choose from!  There are Only 4 entrees listed in the menu ! 
But i did not  want filet for $49!
End up paying over $400 for4 people !
author: MATT K.

description:
This place is overpriced. I had the sole, this was a 30$ dish. I was expecting something very special. First thing you can't help noticing is how small the piece was and I doubt that it was fresh. I had a lot of hope on how it would taste and It was bland with a "compact" texture. The veggies were nothing special. I liked the artichoke.
The restaurant itself is very charming inside, art nouveau style, I loved it, and we had a view on the illuminated bay bridge. The service was perfect. But none of that justifies the price. 
Putting the word "French" in the description of your restaurant  doesn't magically make the food taste amazing. If the quality can't increase, at least be generous on the quantity. And don't forget that people come for the food first, not the decoration. Too bad.
author: Marion P.

description: I've been here many times and it is always good. It's very busy, and doesn't feel quite as relaxing as I wish it did. The servers can appear a bit stressed out. However it's a great place and if you have never been is highly suggested.
author: E C.

description:
No wonder they're so popular after all these years. Boulevard consistently hits on all three points; food, service and hospitality.
We had an exceptional experience and would go back more often if we lived in San Francisco!
author: Gregory P.

description:
Though this has been on my list for years... we wound up here rather spontaneously, as their other restaurant, Prospect, was closed. We walked in without a reservation and the very friendly front of the house sent us to the bar and had us seated within 20 minutes or so.

Our server, Jay was wonderful... super friendly, knowledgable, and all of her recommendations were spot on.

We started with the Sea Scallops, served with Celery Root, Smoked Sturgeon Remoulade, Golden Caviar and Vodka Cream.  Adding a 4th scallop, since we were sharing, was the right thing to do!  They were cooked perfectly and so delicious.  Scallops cooked this well may just be my favorite thing.

Though I much prefer getting different entrees, so we can taste and share... and the California Lamb T-Bone was calling my name... my friend and I each opted for the Berkshire Kurobuta Pork Prime Rib Chop... Good call, as I would have been jealous... maybe... This was Wood Oven Roasted, and served with Calvados Mutsu Apple Fritto, Cold Pressed Apple Miel, Poppy Seed Spaetzle, Half Moon Bay Brussel Sprouts & Double Smoked Bacon, Deviled Red Kuri Squash & Roasted Sage Pork Jus.

Well that's a mouthful... and was... a most DELICIOUS, SUCCULENT MOUTHFUL!  The pork was beautiful, tender and juicy... and yet as good as that was, I saved my last bite for all the other things, that were bursting with such stunning flavors.  Wow.

Glasses of the Riesling went perfectly with these amazing dishes.

We were full, but had we skipped the dessert we would have been disappointed... Thanks for pushing us, Jay.  

The Butterscotch Pudding With Dark Chocolate Bavarian Cream. Pecan Shortbread, Wild Pecan Granola and Vanilla Chantilly was nothing short of heaven.  

The room, the decor, the service, the staff and of course the fantastic food make this a place to remember... and return to... I hope!!!
author: Marc G.

description:
The appetizers were delicious. We had the best salad, chicken and kale fritters along with the empanadas. All were amazing as usual. Unfortunately the entrees were not as flavorful. I had to add salt to my spaghetti w/crab plate and the halibut lacked flavor. They're food just wasn't as amazing as before. But the dessert was off the hook and our waitress added a candle and birthday banner for me.
I just had to take away one star after thinking about the entrees
author: Shirin T.

description:
After hearing so much about this restaurant, and having enjoyed their sister restaurant Prospect, I was eager to try Boulevard. I was extremely disappointed by my experience.

For a restaurant of this calibre, I had high expectations across the board for food, ambiance, service and overall quality. Ultimately, I felt like what was delivered would have been adequate for an "average" restaurant but certainly not a fine dining establishment. Fellow yelpers that talked about having "the best x" really had my hopes up high too.

We each ordered cocktails (Mule and gimlet) and they were good but nothing special. The complimentary bread was delivered swiftly to the table but not warmed and the butter was rock solid. 

Appetizer was the scallops which were cooked perfectly but the accompanying garnish was mediocre (I can't even tell you what it was, it was that unmemorable). At $20 for 3, I expect better.

Our entrees were the pork chop and the filet mignon. The pork was tough, unflavored and so disappointing that we just stopped eating it. The filet was cooked to a perfect medium rare but the flavours were unremarkable. And again, the accompanying sides for both dishes were lackluster. 

While our server was polite, I felt like she was too busy and we were always looking for her. I did appreciate her coming by to sweep the crumbs off the table with a crumb scraper.

Overall, this was not a 5 star restaurant and certainly not worth the huge price tag. $49 for that filet is robbery. Looking around the restaurant, I saw a lot of older people and business people. Perhaps they've grown accustomed to coming to this restaurant but haven't noticed it going downhill?
author: Colene C.

description: Loved the tomatoes and burrata, the halibut and the brownie sundae with banana ice cream. A little noisy but great food and service.
author: Alexandra J.

description: Boulevard never disappoints: great food, creative dishes, changing menu, pleasant ambiance, and professional service. My wife and I keep coming back. One of our favorite places in SF. Not cheap, but worth every penny. Highly recommended.
author: Sergio E.

description:
We made reservations the requisite month in advance for this "top 10 SF restaurants". We were seated promptly and had a courteous server.  My wife ordered the duck and I ordered the lamb. Both dishes came out within 20 minutes and we immediately noted that they were not hot, but rather room temperature. We got the attention of our waiter, explained the situation and he immediately sent over the maître de. He apologized and took the plates back to the kitchen.  Twenty minutes later he returned with two hot plates and still very room temperature duck and lamb dishes (our original meals-reheated). We explained that we were very dissatisfied and he offered to start from scratch and get us "totally new entrées in 5-7 minutes" as he would "jump the line" for us. Twenty minutes later, we received our very mediocre "new" dishes. The food was okay, but not four star. Upon paying my bill I told the waiter I was very disappointed and regretted walking in the door. He took the two drinks we had ($26) off our $200+ bill and scampered away. No apologies. Boulevard Philosophy: get them in and get them out. 

This restaurant is living off its long-forgotten heritage. Stay away!
author: Bart D.

description:
Had to wait 45 minutes for our table even though we had booked prior. Not impressed as the hostess just left us standing and waiting - but once we sat down, our server made us feel very welcome. Polite and attentive, food was excellent, nice presentation and tasted amazing. 

Would come back again but make sure we had a bite to eat prior.
author: BettyLou H.

description:
Great spot for a Saturday evening with my wife. The fresh fish options have always delivered. Service is great. The wine list is above average.

Valet parking has been a problem with time to get our car. 

Business dinners have also been memorable for all the same positive attributes. One of my favorite price performance SF restaurants
author: Jim C.

description: FINALLY, I got to try this place! We made last minute booking and we got it for Friday nite! The restaurant seemed full when we were there around 8.30pm. We got really nice cozy small booth area for our dinner. Nice lighting, next to window, see full view of the kitchen. We had best service from 'Ben' - he took really good care of us plus we got a mini birthday treat after the dinner. We had Tortellini to share for appetizer and Pork Chop abd Quail for main. Quail was amazzzing and pork chop was just melting in your mouth. Wow, wow, wow!  The meal seemed small, but super filling. The quality over takes the quantity. We were so full after the meal, we didn't have room for dessert! Great selection with wines!  Definitely come back for other dishes!!!! Highly recommend for those who wants the premium quality meal experience in San Francisco.
author: Suzy H.

description:
It was a week before our 2 year anniversary, and my boyfriend and I had yet to make reservations for dinner. After our first choice (Gary Danko), second choice (Foreign Cinema), and third choice (Mason Pacific) were all booked up, we decided on Boulevard since they were the first restaurant that had a 7pm reservation for Saturday night.

Ambiance:

Very classy, like a vintage hotel in Hollywood. While getting ready we weren't planning on dressing up, but were glad that we did once we got there. Dimmed romantic lighting. It was a nice setting for a celebration or romantic dinner. The restaurant also left a happy anniversary card that was signed by their staff on our table. Nice touch. :)

Drink/Food:

Cucumber gimlet - Love love love! 

Scallops - Delicious! But sad our appetizer portion was so small. It was gone too fast, too soon.

Pork Chop with Brussel sprouts - Satisfying and yummy. It was good, but I didn't get that "OMG droolz so good" reaction I was anticipating.

Angus Filet - Not the best and not worth the money. It lacked a lot of flavor and the mustard seed did not help this meal at all. 

Warm Sticky Toffee Pudding - Did not like this and it seemed like false advertising. When we got our dessert we thought at first it might have been a mistake because there were no signs of pudding anywhere. My boyfriend said it was more like a warm granola bar with ice cream on it.

Overall, we were kind of bummed with the food considering the price we paid, especially for our 2 year anniversary. We've been to other really amazing restaurants where we had mouth-watering steaks and desserts for a lot less money.

Oh well... we came, we saw, and we won't be coming back.
author: Sabrina P.

description:
1 star michelin rated

Parking around this area can be a pain.  The thursday that we went, valet was not available so we were directed to a parking garage nearby. The decor is old-fashioned chic and simple.  The service is excellent.  The bathrooms are a tad of a pain by making you take the stairs or elevator, but it is in a historic building after all.  I ended up drinking 2 of their cocktails, where one of them were the vieux carre. Excellent choices.

Ordered:

1.  Starter: Caviar with fettuccine noodles topped with sturgeon vodka cheese sauce- This was absolutely delicious.  The starter was to die for.  A perfect balance of the richness from the cheese and caviar.  
2.  Entree: California lamb with pistachios- cooked just right for medium rare.  It wasn't a wow dish but tasty nonetheless.
3.  Dessert: Warm summer berry crisp- super sour and I barely saw any crisp to this.... and they gave me a tiny scoop of the bourbon ice cream.. It totally didn't balance the flavors out at all! // Italian summer bonbon- peach flavored.. the only thing that was decent and simple.

I would say the most disappointing part of the meal were the desserts.  We tried several, which were the bonbons and berry crisp.  If i were to come back to Boulevard again, I would not order dessert again.  I rather go somewhere else post dinner!!  Overall, solid pick but have to explore other venues before wanting to go back here!

Make sure to make reservations!!
author: Kathy D.

description: Gorgeous old space, fantastic attentive service.  Tasty cocktails.  Delicious seared scallops, husband had foie grass which he loves.  I had a mushroom tagliatelle with truffles & burrata.
author: Art-Suzanne R.

description: We went to Boulevard for my birthday and it was such a great experience! Every dish was a wonderful creation, so delicious and beautiful. The service was impecable and the ambiance so elegant! I definitely recommend Boulevard if you are in San Francisco, don't miss it!
author: Susana Z.

description:
Prime rib pork chop.  Definitely a well put together dish. All the flavors and taste will send your taste buds into overload.
Apps: all three were DEVINE.
I'm glad we had the chance to try this place while in San Francisco.
author: Curtis B.

description: My favorite restaurant, the food is impeccable, the service flawless. We been enjoying Nancy's done she owned "Avenue" Restaurant.
author: Chef H.

description:
They had me at foie gras...

The ravioli with winter truffles was another excellent starter. We also shared an amazing quail dish and a more average sole. The chocolate dessert looked better than it tasted. Overall though, it was a great meal in a fancy old school setting with top-notch service, and I would not hesitate to return.

I highly recommend the Moscow Mule here, which is made with a pear-infused vodka.
author: Jia H.

description: Tasty pork chop with fruit and veggies. The sauce wasn't too sweet and worked well with everything on the plate. The bread that comes out initially was cold as was the butter which is not my favorite. The fig, beet, and blue cheese salad was good but had a lot of cheese and very little produce. It was very pretty though. All in all this place is a good little restaurant that uses good ingredients but is very expensive and served nothing that blew my mind, sadly.
author: Melissa D.

description: Good but not great. Bar scene is great, bartender great, Food was excellent, wine list is awesome, atmosphere is good. BUT, we were rushed through our dinner. 6pm seating and you would have thought they wanted us out of there by 7pm. Service is key, for an establishment like Boulevard they can do better.
author: Andrew B.

description:
So my birthday is in the beginning of September. But I tend to celebrate all month long. Last year, I decided to reserve the day before my birthday for Boulevard. I'd never been, so I was excited to try it! I made reservations well in advance since I wanted to secure a table around 6p on Thurs night.  We ordered:

-Zabuton beef carpaccio & crispy monterey calamari ($16.50) - Lightly pickled armenian cucumber, fermented garlic & nori paste, buttered korean hot sauce.
-Ravioli di mare ($19) - Maine lobster & rock shrimp cappelletti, savory sweet corn pudding & cognac fennel milk.
-Sea scallops ($18.25) - Job's tears, cloud ear, petite shiitake & clamshell mushrooms, miso, lemon & hon wasabi.
-Soft shell crab (half) - Pepita & sumac dredge, lime crema, smoked carolina rice grits with huitlacoche, frying pepper salsa fresca.
-Angus filet mignon ($45) - Wood oven roasted. Rancho gordo tepary beans, white sweet corn & gypsy peppers, yukon gold potatoes & roasted king trumpet mushrooms, grilled early tomato & beef jus.
-Eden valley berkshire (kurobuta) pork prime rib chop ($37) - Wood oven roasted. Black rice & chorizo stuffed sqaush blossom, fresh shell beans & pole beans, marcona almonds, px vinegar, roasted pork jus.
-Sweet cream cheesecake ($11) - Local blackberries & blueberries, summer corn cookie, lime sorbet.
-Chocolate funfetti cake bon bon

It was just me and the roommate, but I loved that we tried a variety of things on the menu. Our server was awesome! Super funny while still being attentive and on it!  Parking can be difficult, so we just valeted the car. The atmosphere is a little old school, but since my Dad's French restaurant had that feeling, I found it cozy.

Thank you Boulevard for a great birthday dinner!
author: Elena N.

description:
Great food and service. Expansive drink menu for anyone into libations w/ a well stocked bar. We were seated promptly and our waiter was very attentive and friendly.

Our party had the salmon, swordfish and pork chops. Salmon and swordfish tend to be lean and easily overcooked but both fishes were expertly cooked and came out very moist. The star of the menu was the pork. I'm not a huge fan of pork but this is the juiciest pork chop I've ever had. 

Minus 1 star for the long trek to the bathroom (have to go through the doors and down the elevator) and the dessert. I had the S'mores and it was not what I expected. Visually it was great. Texture and taste wise, it fell under.
author: Julie L.

description: Visited San Fran recently and decided to give a well known place a shot.  I am absolutely thrilled I chose Boulevard.  Our waiter was exceptionally friendly and made us feel right at home.  He even gave my girlfriend and I two separate seats together by a window.  Beer selection was decent and wound up going with the 90 minute IPA which I easily paid 4 times the price.  I ordered the Korean Porkchop and my girlfriend ordered a fish dish.  Forgive me I do not eat much fish so I can not accurately say anything about it.  She loved it however.  My pork chop was cooked perfectly and too be honest I wasn't even sure what it came with.  I wish I knew because it was amazing.  Overall the experience was pricey but a real unique, romantic experience.  We ordered two cake pops for dessert which were bite sized as expected and fairly tasty.  Our waiter went one step further and even got us a cab when we were ready to leave.  Classy all the way.
author: Black P.

description:
I visited this restaurant the evening of July 25th.  I had an event to go to at the Hotel Griffon next door, and a friend recommended this restaurant to me for dinner prior to the event.  I went with no expectations, having just skimmed the menu prior to arriving.  

I was very impressed by the ambience, the waiters, and the food.  The cooks were also very friendly.  I sat at the Chef's Table, which I would recommend to anyone who is by themselves or in a small group (2-3 people max).  You get to sit right in front of where the chefs are cooking your meal.  They asked me questions, checked in on how I liked the food, and they were happy to answer my questions about what they liked to cook.  I was by myself, so they were my entertainment. Lucky them! :P

My waiter was very attentive and stayed nearby at all times.  I only had to wait a few minutes before my clean plate was picked up, and she asked me if I liked the food each time I finished a plate.  She was also able to help me out my gluten intolerance, which the cooks also asked me about as my meal was being prepared.  

The food - I had the octopus and the lamb, as well as a beet and pomegranate salad and a flourless torte for dessert.  Everything was delicious.  I have never had octopus before, and it was to die for.  The lamb was the best I have ever tasted.  I actually didn't know what was in my salad (they told me, but I wasn't paying attention), and when I found out that it was beets, I was shocked - I normally hate beets.  The torte was really good as well.  Nice flavor and presented so prettily.  Everything was, actually.  Hard to decide how to start eating.  I didn't want to mess up the artwork.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Its that time of the year where one must celebrate their birthday. Not just any birthday, their quarter of a century birthday.  

Yep, that's me. I'm officially an adult. (at least on paper)

Man friend decided to bring me here since we both have been hearing great things about this place on a Tuesday night.

We were seated right away, towards the front of the restaurant in a corner. Well, their was some kind of cold air blowing near us, which I let go, since I figured the place will fill up soon enough. 

Starters:
Ahi Poke Salad: Delicious! Comes with beets and an avocado puree.
Scallops: Probably my favorite dish of the night. Scallops were perfect and buttery.

Mains
Quail with biscuit, yam, chard: The skin was fried in a very odd batter. My boyfriend peeled it off and put it to the side. The bird itself was juicy and tender.
Lamb T-bone with spinach&fried squash: I asked for medium, and I got medium. I wasn't a big fan of the fried vegetables, but it was a solid dish. 

Dessert 
I chose the hidden financier with apricots: Not a huge fan of the sorbet, but the ganache was delish.

Three things irked me throughout the night. 

1. The ambiance was not my favorite place to dine in. Mostly business men and woman filled the place and were extremely loud. 

And I get it, San Francisco is a casual city, but please, at least make some effort and dress up when you go out for dinner.  I wish restaurants had a stricter policy for dress code.

Jeans? Plaid shirts? T-shirt!? These are the times I wish I lived in NYC. 

2. We needed some time to explore the wine menu because it definitely was quite extensive. That being said, our server was definitely pushy. It's like he had somewhere to be.  We even had to ask for bread. Sheesh.

3. The hostess knew ahead of time we were their for a special night. I wish they made somewhat more of an effort and sat us near the embarcadero view.

With that being said, if your their for a birthday, anniversary, etc.. shouldn't dessert be on the house? Especially if your spending this much money? They don't comp desserts for any occasion. 

I really wanted to like Boulevard, but their was no wow factor to this place, just very lack luster. For an overpriced place, I expected an amuse bouche, and outstanding service. 

Their are way too many great restaurants to be explored, and I'd rather save my appetite and hard earned cash spent their instead.
author: Nika K.

description:
"OH WOW!!  WHAT'S THE OCCASION?"  

This is always the first thing to come out of anyone's mouth when I tell them that I lunched here.  Funny how Boulevard has always been known as the special occasion spot.  Did you know that you can have lunch at Boulevard for less than lunch at..... Hog Island or Anchor & Hope?  But you would never ask what the special occasion was if I dined at either of these restaurants, correct?  

Perhaps it's because the implied prestige of Boulevard that automatically makes one think that dining here is too steep for their pockets. The reality is that I can share an appetizer and have my own entree for $30.00 including healthy sf tax/sales tax/tip, while I'm paying $40 for a similar order at Hog Island or Anchor & Hope.  

The lunch menu at Boulevard is quite extensive with items ranging from sandwiches, burgers, seafood, and appetizers.  The great thing about this place is that most of the appetizers & starter salads are priced from $9-13 and the majority of their entrees are under $20.  Last time, I ordered their squid ink pasta with soft shelled crab for $16 and shared an arugula salad for $13.  Both dishes were satisfying and delicious.  Other times, I've enjoyed the beef carpaccio, fresh crab salad, and tuna tartare. Best of all, it's all packaged with their impeccable service. 

Next time someone asks you where you want to lunch, don't be shy...say Boulevard!!  One might  seemed shocked at first but you'll get the last laugh when the check comes because it's not as pricey as people may think!!!
author: Wina K.

description: This place consistently has good food every time I'm here.  The price is decent. Service is ok, not overly superficial like some high end places.  But.. The food is just as good as those michelin star's restaurants.  I'd come back here again anytime.
author: Jeannie T.

description: One of my favorite restaurants, I asked my wife to marry me here. Just a beautiful restaurant with excellent food, wine and staff!
author: Reuben C.

description:
Boulevard first came on my radar when it won the James Beard award for Best Restaurant. With a trip planned to the Bay Area, I put it on my list. The prices were very reasonable during lunch, so it was a (somewhat) guilt-free fine dining experience.
 
From the revolving doors to the brick vaulted ceiling and Art Nouveau Paris Metro signage, every choice in decor seems deliberate and thoughtful. The end result is a dining room that feels spacious but warm, cozy but not cluttered, and formal but not stuffy. The exposed kitchen allows a glimpse into the chefs' prep work, and the only flaw I could find was an oddly situated restroom in the far reaches of the building, and down a set of stairs.
 
The service was exceptional. The hostesses were warm, our waiter was perfect, and the meal timing was flawless. We had a table overlooking the hostess stand, and the catty critic in me checked on the hostesses a few times to try to overhear a crackle of snark, a morsel of personal life drama, or a whiff of unprofessionalism. Alas, they gave me nothing.
 
The food was delicious as well. To start, we were given a generous basket of sourdough and butter with sprinkled sea salt. Everyone got a lunchtime mocktail, which were served in very tall thin glasses and garnished like their alcoholic doppelgangers. Hubby's pomegranate mocktail had a rim of sugar, and my Arnold Palmer had the color fading combination reminiscent of an icy Caribbean cooler.

We started with some shared appetizers, and I delighted in a creamy spoonful of lobster bisque. I moved on to crispy soft shell crab, which was paired with fried green tomatoes, a savory remoulade, and an herb mixture. This dish was fantastic! For my main course, I chose the "paella", which was deconstructed to a fancy chicken and rice dish. All the flavors were there, the chicken was cooked to absolute perfection, and the only thing I missed was a little socarrat on my rice. But this is getting really picky; my meal was great. I also had a bite of the lamb scallopine, which managed to somehow be both fried and light at the same time. Not one hint of grease there.

My discerning fellow diners all loved their meals, and one said he's really most interested in restaurants that have a "wow" factor. We all firmly agreed that Boulevard has that "wow" factor, and I hope our paths cross again.
author: Meghan A.

description:
First Yelp review ever :)

We went here for a friend's bachelorette dinner. Overall not worth it. 

Party of 11. Service was OK.  The waitress was good in the beginning but didn't see much of her afterwards.   Overall, a polite wait staff.

Wine list. Good selection at standard high city pricing.  The waitress' knowledge of the wine list was outstanding though. 

Everyone had appetizers.  Personally I ordered the artichoke with mozerella salad.  It was mediocre.  Other girls in the party had salads and they mentioned that it was basically just lettuce...for $14.  Complimentary bread served with dinner tasted stale.

Entree. Ordered the sole and my piece looked considerably smaller than my friend that ordered the same thing.  Fish cooked well, but overall lacked unique flavor.  I appreciated that it wasn't drenched in salt. 

For my part I paid a little over $100.  And that's for one glass of wine, a lower than rated appetizer and a mediocre entree.  This was true pricing for my part since we all used an app to pay only what I owed across 11 people.  I understand that this is one of the finer restaurants, but I left still hungry.  Overall, not worth it.

I hear so many good things about this place, but still deciding if I should return again!  Had a meh first experience.
author: Janelle B.

description: Not what it used to be and we won't be back. We moved out of the neighborhood and hadn't been for a while. We were really looking forward to it, but the meal was disappointing. The tomatoes in the Tomato & Burrata salad were not ripe. They were green in some places. One entree - lamb and vegetables - was lukewarm. The knives were so dull they were hard to cut with. (Really, how hard can it be to get flatware right?) The service was excellent aside from the waiter seeming stretched a bit too thin. Overall, the dinner was not up to Boulevard's old standards. Unfortunately, the prices haven't changed so we paid for a premium experience and got a lukewarm experience. You can do better elsewhere.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Man, Boulevard lost their michelin star this year and I can kind of see why. Is it pathetic if I want to assert that I went in 2012 when they still had the star?! I'm cool, I promise! 

Not hating on old people or anything, but the average age in this restaurant was like... 60. That combined with the rustic(?) mature(?) decor just made the entire place seem so outdated. I imagine fancy old white ladies with pearl necklaces drinking $30 soup there. 

While everything tasted fine and was cooked well, it was just... fine. The menu had your typical upscale fine dining items (scallop, swordfish, lamb chop, steak) but nothing screamed innovation or creativity. The most interesting thing was the ground up coffee sprinkled next to my filet and that was just weird.
author: Xinxin W.

description:
Food:  Amazing.  Just Amazing.  I had the pork prime rib chop and it was one of my favorite meals of all time.  It was one of those meals that is so good you wish it wouldn't end.  

Service: The service was great.  The whole staff worked well together and really took care of us.  They threw in a bunch of extras bites before and after the main course and were very helpful when we were trying to pick out our entree and wine.

Ambiance: Ok.  The restaurant is beautiful.  Very well kept and upscale.  That said, it was slightly out of sync with how great the food and service was.  I would say the ambiance was a bit underwhelming in contrast to everything else.  If these guys want to get their second star I really think they need to consider an upgrade to the decor.

Value:  I think the prices for the area and what you get are extremely reasonable.  This is a great value for someone looking for a wonderful night out.
author: Mike O.

description:
Boulevard has been on my "to try" list for a very, very long time. Came here on Valentine's Day with the BF. They did not have a prie fixed menu as I have hoped for but props to the BF for making this reservation oh so very well in advanced. The service was excellent and our waitress was very attentive. The ambiance was lovely and the food was wonderful. I had the quail and it was perfect. Of course, we had our usual bottle of wine and did not need to refill it ourselves since they were so attentive. 

One thing I must warn you, though, is that the bathrooms are veryyy hard to find. We felt lost like we were walking into a part of the restaurant where we were not supposed to be in. And this was BEFORE the wine, mind you.
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
This place has a great menu, food, service and an amazing wine/drink list. 

With that being said, this is a great place if you are a client and the vendor/recruiter/whatever big dawg wants to take you out to lunch/dinner in the Financial District and says "wherever you want to go, pick, and I will meet you there"...aka "I want to win you over in this deal, so pick a spot that I can do so, because I am paying". Lol;) 

On the food front, every time I have come here, the food has been amazing, and quick to serve, even though it's the prime lunch hour when I come here for lunches. 

The drinks, non-alcholoic or not, are amazing. They do some very delicious, creative non-alcholic beverages. But I do love their wine list, I have even come here after a meeting or work to simply grab a glass of good french wine at the bar, each wine I have chosen or they suggest to me is spot on, love!

Ok, I have gushed enough about this place. So go already! You won't be sorry. And oh....ask to see if you can get a corner seat by the window, to get the full SF experience;) 

Cheers!
author: Sonia A.

description:
I am so happy I ate here.  The evening before, I ate at a restaurant ranked higher.  My experience at that other restaurant was not very good.

Boulevard was amazing from the second I walked through the front door.  I did not have a reservation.  The restaurant was around the corner from where I had a business meeting.  It was a Friday night.  So, not surprising, every table was taken and there was no room for me.  The bar area was packed.  But, to my luck, a table in the bar area just opened, which I was seated at once I agreed to sit there.  The hostess was really nice.  Frankly, I was afraid I might not get great service sitting at a little table in the bar area.  Honestly, I think I got more attention from the staff than the customers in the dinning room.  The waitress was excellent.

I had a drink of wine (needed it after that long day).  The waitress asked if I wanted another when it was about 1/4 empty and I told her I was only going to have this one glass  The glass sat for a while with just a little bit left on the bottom.  I was so happy no one took my glass away until I finished that last sip.  My glass of water was never allowed to get more than 1/2 empty.  This was excellent service.  

The food was outstanding.  I was so happy with every bit.  I started out with the tuna appetizer.  It was so fresh tasting, creative.  It was really amazing.  I then had the Lamb.  It was really, really good.  One thing that jumped out at me, it seemed as if there were more sides on the plate than the lamb.  I ended with a choco-licious dessert.  It was very good.  Again, I thought there was more of the sides than the main chocolate cake.

The price point was good for a place of this type.  If I am every back in San Francisco again, I will absolutely go back to Boulevard.
author: Robert S.

description:
Not sure how this place has a Michelin star. 
Went here for a work lunch with a group of 9, i got reservations easily, and the person taking the reservations was very nice and flexible.

When we got there we were seated pretty immediately and the waiters and the hosts were very hospitable. 

We order apps, the got squash, tomato burrata, and scallops. the scallop risotto just comes with one scallop for almost $20 bucks. but got to say it was mighty delicious.

I got the Sole fish and had tried some of the Salmon. Sole is a must have if you are here, it is really good, melts in your mouth well made and perfectly cooked fish. the salmon on the other hand was a bit dry. i expect perfection from a place like this and it was not close to it. 

for desert i got the butterscotch pudding, really good, another co worker ordered white peaches and brown sugar ginger cake, it didn't look like a dessert more like a peach fruit plate. 


I may not come back here as its way to expensive for food that is good but not all that special. but if you have to try it def get the scallop, sole and butterscotch pudding.
author: Anuj C.

description:
There is no perfect occasion to try this place but on my boyfriend's birthday. Although this place is upscale, the touch of french country flair in its interior makes it a little laid back but cozy. 

The dishes are simple but artfully put together! I enjoyed my King Quail. They served the leg part crispy, almost like deep fried and the breast part, roasted. Best of both world! The leg part was topped with prosciutto and the breast was on a bed of delicious orange puree. We didn't get much appetizer because we had it at The View in Marriott Hotel but the Sea Scallop was irresistible! 

No regrets on the Vanilla Bean Mouse for dessert, perfect with what it was served with: Strawberry Vanilla Sorbet Swirl. 

Service: excellent and not annoying. Thanks! We had an amazing time!
author: Lora M.

description: This is a very nice restaurant that's fun, upscale and classy.  We ate in the wine vault room and that was a great experience.  Superb service and helpful staff.  They are worthy of their 1 Michelin star.  5 stars for the above but 4 stars for the food.  Just comparing this food against other 1 Star restaurants and I found the food missing in creativity and a Wow factor.  My foie Grau was slightly undercooked and needed more sear.  The pork chop was delicious but I was expecting to be wowed and I wasn't.  It was very good but not memorable. The toffee pudding was the weakest dish of my meal and it looked like a chemistry experiment.
author: Steve T.

description:
(Friday lunch review)
We were in the area and thought we'd drop by for lunch. Hostess was very nice and seated us promptly even without a reservation. 

Cherry, arugula & camembert salad - refreshing! Cheese could melt in your mouth
Kobe beef burger - good but I prefer Burger Bar's personally but the fries were excellent and even better than Bouchon's :)
Brown sugar angel food cake & rhubarb crisp ice cream - give me more!
Choco pot de creme - too rich for my taste

Last but not least is the story of Scallops & shrimp risotto:
Risotto came out nice and hot but scallops were cold and undercooked. Found a piece of shrimp shell in the risotto which was unpleasant.  Instead of firing another order, they put the same whole plate in the oven. So my meal was hot alright except now every bite was dry and needed to be washed down with water.  

Must be my luck to catch their renowned kitchen on a bad day.  Nice service from our waitress, Victoria, and the support staff.
author: Allen C.

description: Went there on my 5 year wedding anniversary. We ordered the lamb and salmon dish. Great food and great ambiance. Highly recommended!
author: Asad B.

description:
Awesome place to have a nice fancy lunch. The service was great, the food was amazing, and the atmosphere was electric. 

I made reservations about a week in advanced and they only had limited amount of times and days available. My suggestion is if you really want a time or date, call in advance. 

The food was on point. I had the soup of the day, lobster bisque. Creamy and delicious. And for my main dish I had the wagyu beef! Sooo good! If you love steak, you have to try it. The only thing is it's served medium rare, but it was a lot more on the rare side. 

The service was fantastic. We were seated quickly and attended really well. 

The atmosphere is a little fancy so I wouldn't come here in tshirt and jeans. 

Overall it's a nice place to splurge.
author: David B.

description: Top Notch !!! Excellent service, ambience, food!
author: Ally M.

description: No, not gonna go here, not with the hundreds of ridiculously delish restaurants in the city. Here's the deal: if you go, you'll get a decent, if unmemorable and unremarkable meal--for a boatload of money. The preparations are quasi-refined, striking a balance between American homey and haute cuisine, but the entire time while I'm there, there a little voice in my head whispering, "Is this all? Where's the dazzle and razzle? No fireworks and shine?"  The service is sorta courtly; notice my qualifier here, "sorta," because they don't successfully pull off genteel charm, in fact, the one night we were there, our server was an auto pilot, phoning  it in, likely couldn't wait to get off his shift. I was completely unimpressed with our food, the lamb had little or no seasoning . . . ho hum. I do love the interior, which manages to be intimate and classy, old-worldly and oddly has a Parisian feel despite the American cuisine. The prices are waay too high for the quality of food--no value here. If ever there was a case of the emperor has no clothes, this restaurant is it. If ever Boulevard had cache and sheen, it's lost the luster.
author: Ranjan P.

description:
I like the ambience of the restaurant. If you are by yourself, you can eat at the bar by the kitchen and watch them cook or ask for the table by the window to enjoy the Bay Bridge view and the bay. 

The restaurant is convenient located a block or so away from Market street and Embacadero street. If your hotel is around Union Square, hop on F line $2-3 per person on Market street toward Fishermanwharf and hop off when it reaches Embacadero street. It is close by the Ferry Buiding that is filled with gourmet food kiosks and small pier to take the Bay Bridge picture. After the meal, I took the F line to stroll around Fishermanwharf and Pier 39.

White Truffle Risotto is superb as well as the grilled lamb. I ended the meal with salted caramel dessert and orange vanilla sorbet to refresh the pallette. The service is impeccable. The bread kept coming, though it was not warm.
author: Ann K.

description:
My family took me to eat here for my birthday. It was definitely worth the 2 hour break from finals studying. Ugh biochem, need I say more?

Since it was for my birthday, my family wanted to dress up, but they don't have a strict dress code and will seat you even if you're in jeans and a t shirt. The restaurant has a very nice trendy ambiance. We were seated right away. My mom made reservations, but I heard they happily take walk-ins.

We decided to share an appetizer, I chose the scallops. YUMMMM they were good. We also had a complimentary appetizer, a hamachi shooter which was very good. I wish that was on the menu, I would have asked for another. They then gave a palate cleanser before the entrees.

My entire family ordered the filet mignon and steak. I ordered the squab. Portions are on the smaller end, which I prefer so I don't feel pregnant afterwards. The squab was cooked a perfect medium rare. It was very tender, juicy, and not too gamey. I LOVED IT.

Since it was my birthday, they gave me a complimentary dessert. It was beautiful as well as delicious.

It's located right on the border of financial district and embarcadero. Not too far from the ferry building. Parking wasn't hard to find especially around dinner time. I can't remember if they have valet or not.

Prices are reasonable for the quality and presentation of the food. It's not as expensive as Gary Danko, but not cheap either. It's definitely worth the buck.

Overall, I had a wonderful experience. Service was impeccable. I don't know why I haven't gone back yet, but this is a reminder to go back and try what's new on their menu. I feel it deserves a Michelin star if it hasn't received one already.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Boulevard has become my birthday restaurant for the past 3 years in a row.  This year was no different.  I love everything about this restaurant.  The exceptional service, the delectable food, the artistic presentation, the old-fashion charm and details - everything simply exudes Michelin quality dining.     

A must have appetizer: SEA SCALLOPS - Zuckerman's Ultra Thin Asparagus & Asparagus Mousseline Lavender Gem Tangelo & Brown Butter
- We get this every time we come here for dinner.  It's perfectly seared and buttery soft.

Fish options are usually my first choice. 

LOCAL SWORDFISH, GRILLED & WOOD OVEN ROASTED - Baby Artichoke Fritter with Castelvetrano Aioli, Potato Coins & Arugula Pesto, Plum Tomato Raisins, Currants & Pine Nuts 
- Swordfish tends to have a bit denser texture than most fish.  It's not your buttery sea bass, but it's still a wonderful dish in it's own way.  Definitely recommend it for anyone who has not tried it.

ALASKAN HALIBUT, A LA PLANCHA - Caper Spaetzle with Sprouted Lentils & Quinoa, Coal Roasted Fennel Puree & Bloomsdale Spinach, Baby Zucchini A La Plancha, Buerre Vert with Pickled Mustard Seeds 
- My second favorite fish.  Grilled to perfection and married with such beautiful flavors.  Totally a fan.

PACIFIC SEABASS, PAN ROASTED - Vialone Nano Risotto with Celery & Celtuse, Bacalao Fritta & Smoked Aioli, Steelhead Roe & Horseradish 
- My absolute favorite fish dish.  It's buttery and flakey and everything you would expect a perfectly cooked fish to taste.  Simply divine.  

If you like fish, you really cannot go wrong with any of their choices.  But I would typically default to the bass :)

PAN ROASTED CHICKEN BREAST - 'Panzanella' Sauce, Vine Ripe Tomatoes, Green Garbanzos, Baby Zucchini & Melted Garlic, Chicken 
 - The chicken was really succulent.  Very well seasoned.  Mixture of both dark and white meat.

LOCAL PETRALE SOLE A LA PLANCHA - California Asparagus, Colcannon Mashed Potatoes, Fondant Leeks, Watercress Hollandaise 
- This was a lunch item and it was perfect on a warm sunny day.  Of course, sole tends to be very mild and light.  So the watercress hollandaise, the mashed potatoes, and the asparagus kind of gave the whole dish more oomph.  

WOOD OVEN ROASTED AMERICAN WAGYU BEEF BAVETTE - Delmonico Style Yukon Gold Potato, Sauteed Bloomsdale Spinach, Warm Mushroom, Bacon & Bourbon Onion Slaw, Beef Jus 
- This.Was.Amazing.  I like steak, but I don't LOVE it.  Ok, I lie.  I do love steak, but I'm not well rehearsed when it comes to the cut and grade and all that other stuff.  I just like to eat it.  But wagyu bavette is UH-AMAZING!!  It's so juicy, and tender, and perfectly marbled.  Gah, I just made myself hungry at 12am :(

Just another little added bonus to dining here on your birthday - they always make sure to include a special little dessert at the end of your meal to say happy birthday.  Thanks Boulevard!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
I came here with my mom and sister for my sister's birthday. Though I made reservations, the first not so great moment was that they didn't ask me if there was a special occasion. I had to walk up to the front to tell them so that they could write happy birthday on the dessert that we ordered. I thought about this one for a while and think I'm going with 3.5 stars rounded down. For a michelin star restaurant, I think I had slightly higher expectations. 

For appetizers we ordered the scallops and gnocchi w/ egg. I think these were by far the two best dishes of the night. The scallop was cooked perfectly and the gnocchi was extra flavorful and soft. 

For main entrees my mom had the pork and my sister and I got the salmon. The fish was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Texture wise it was pretty nice, however flavor wise it was way too salty!! Each bite really felt like a big spoonful of salt. There was some very under-seasoned vegetables on the side to counter the heavy salt, but this made it so each bite tasted salty and bland at the same time. Overall I was not too impressed.

My mom enjoyed her pork a lot and dessert was good. We ordered a berry crisp and peach ice cream bon bon. Nothing mind blowing though. Prices are pretty cheap here, esp. for a michelin star, but I think I would rather pay more next time to go elsewhere if that means the food is better.
author: Sophia H.

description:
We came here to celebrate a family member's  graduation from Veterinary School.  The warm, elegant décor set the tone for the beautiful and elegant food.  

Every dish was delicious and beautifully presented.   I was especially impressed with the way the food showcases top quality fresh, seasonal ingredients with so much flavor.  I had the Dungeness Crab Salad & Wild Red Prawn and the Berkshire Pork Prime Rib Chop with roasted chanterelle mushrooms, seminola gnocchi, fresh Rainier & pickled Bing cherries and hazelnuts.  I also tasted the Fig, Beet and Walnut Salad and the Quail with pan roasted breast and crispy fried leg, buttermilk biscuit, yams,  chard and wild pecans.   The table also received complimentary appetizers of the Burrata and Tomato Salad, the Corn Ravioli & Summer Truffles, and the Ahi Tuna poke style.  For dessert, we received complimentary  ice cream bonbons with a "Congratulations" sign and strawberry gels.  I would love to know how they capture the fragrant essence of fresh strawberries in gel form.  

The service was impeccable.  It might have helped that our table was next to the wait station, but while we were still enjoying the champagne and somebody said "I wonder if I should order wine...", a server showed up in seconds with wine menus.

Everyone had a great time, and we are so glad we picked Boulevard for our special celebration.
author: Priscilla Y.

description:
This must be in the top places in San Fran. Dining with 3 others we sampled a good selection across the lunch menu - pork carnitas, salmon, California sword fish. I also had a wonderful salad of avocados, beautiful greens and perfectly ripe pink grapefruit with two Spanish cheeses - completely orgasmic. Yes - orgasmic and maybe even organic too.

The pork was chunks from their famous pork prime rib - slow Cooked crazy tender with volcanic flavors, served over a white corn polenta type preparation which I think had some cheese in it. Can't tell you just how good it was. Nicely charred crust of pork over succulent meat. I will be back for the full pork prime rib dinner soon. 

One of my party is a vegetarian from Malaysia and asked whether they offered an appropriate dish - which as I told him was like asking for holy water in a Catholic Church. Hey - it's San Francisco after all. He wasn't disappointed. They served a selection of every veggie side on their menu - beautiful to behold and cooked and seasoned to perfection with nice fresh greens. Fantastic. 

Fish dishes were super fresh and like other dishes really shows not only the quality of the raw ingredients used here but the skill of the chefs in applying heat - truly demonstrating the "art" of cooking and not just applying heat till done. 

Desserts over the top, polished and beautiful. Clearly a world class pastry chefs hand. 

Excellent wine selection altho being with clients we didn't imbibe. But thankfully for me I have a local office and staff here and will return very soon for the full dinner experience in this beautiful, polished but warm place. Wait staff top notch, professional, friendly and perfect. Congrats to all for fantastic place.
author: Pete M.

description:
Boulevard has become my family's destination for family dinners. Overall, I would say service was mixed and food was decent but not memorable. 

Pros:
- My two favorite dishes for the evening were the pea ravioli and the cheesecake with huckleberries
- Server was nice in putting up with our table half-filled with kids

Cons:
- I was underwhelmed by the host. When I arrived, the restaurant was 40% full and I was asked to wait for someone to show me to my party's table. After waiting 5-10 minutes while other parties were seated ahead of me, I found my family on my own. 
- Given the food quality, it's not worth the price (~$35 entrees, ~$20 appetizers).
author: Wendy L.

description:
Consistently good. Service is very considerate and not intrusive. A crab appetizer was good, and so was the sea bass main dish, both of which had good juxtaposition of textures with accompanying vegetables.  Dessert menu is good -- as well as the cheese selection.

The portion size is modest, which I prefer.
author: Dan C.

description:
My girl friends from out of town wanted to drive up to SF and try Boulevard. I was super excited to try it after hearing about how good their food was. We booked lunch reservations for their visit. 

Parking is super expensive whether you decide to pay for the meter or get valet. It's ridiculous. The restaurant is beautiful. It makes you feel as if you're dining outdoors on the "boulevard" of a European street. The tables were nicely set for us when we got there. So you instantly get the vibe "I'm paying for this not the food". 

We ordered the tuna tartare two ways, crab salad, wagyu burger, crispy duck breast, and salmon. 

The tuna tartare was so pretty and the seaweed chips were super delicious, as for the actual tartare there was about a tablespoon of each. It was really bland as well. This isn't an appetizer that you can share.

The crab salad was the best thing here! It was either kale or chard. I'm not sure but it tasted awesome tossed in the vinaigrette dressing with a little bit of crab salad. The crab salad was made with actual crab meat and the shape of the crab legs were perfectly preserved without its shell. I highly recommend this appetizer to share with one person only. 

The entrees were all very simple and over priced. But the duck was the most disappointing entree. It basically tasted like chicken katsu. It even looked like it with extra breading with very little meat. It came with an extremely bitter/burnt reduction. I wouldn't order it again.  

The service here is great but I wouldn't want to come back to this restaurant only to leave with an empty stomach and empty wallet. Also it's not a child friendly restaurant.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Main Impression: Boulevard seems overhyped and the dishes are pricey for what you receive. I felt that the entrees were mediocre entrees and not Michelin quality; however, the appetizers and desserts were tasty. My rating for now stands at a three given that any Michelin ranked restaurant should be able to deliver solid entrees.  Service was great and the atmosphere is warm and elegant. 

******
My boyfriend and I were so excited to dine here after hearing all of the rave reviews.  Perhaps our expectations were too high, but Boulevard did not live up to the hype.  Our main entrees were mediocre; however, they were bookended by solid appetizers and desserts. For entrees, my boyfriend and I shared the roasted local swordfish and the kurobuta pork chop.  I found the swordfish to be a bit bland in both flavor and presentation-- I felt like you could get the same dish somewhere else for much cheaper. If I'm paying $33 for a small piece of swordfish, I'd like each bite to be amazing.  This may sound strange, but the pork was a bit "soggy".  I believe that we did not finish the plate.  

Though the entrees did not live up to the Michelin star hype, the appetizers and desserts left us wishing we had skipped our entrees all together.  Each bite of the california squab was bursting with flavor and I definitely fought for the last piece of the mouthwatering, crispy sweetbreads.  If I could have supersized something on the menu, it would have been the sweetbread appetizer. For dessert, we shared red velvet cake and another chocolate dessert. I don't condone this at nicer restaurants but my boyfriend, the resident chocoholic, literally drank the chocolate sauce out of the mini gravy boat and licked the plate clean.  

Staff were very attentive and made sure to get us to the symphony on time, despite us running late, ordering 3 courses, and adding an extra appetizer at the last minute. 

Though the main entrees were underwhelming, I would probably come back to enjoy the atmosphere. Many restaurants are unable to achieve the balance of charm and understated elegance while still feeling warm and welcoming.  Whether you dress up or dress down you'll feel right at home--though I don't think a hoodie would necessarily be welcome here. .  We were among the formal crowd since we were attending the Symphony but I saw people wearing an assortment of cocktail dresses, dark jeans, sports jackets, and polos.
author: Kristin C.

description:
One of the more upscale places that I've been to. My roommate took me there for my birthday. Located close to the water, you can get a view of the bay if you're at a window table. I was greeted with a small birthday card as well. The server was really friendly. The food was fresh and delectable.
The downside was they had only one vegetarian dish for the entree and that too with squash (something I usually dislike), but I was pleasantly surprised. My roommates quail was delicious. The beets & burrata appetizer was good too. The drinks nicely made and the dessert was amazing (butterscotch chocolate pudding I believe).
author: Nikita G.

description:
I've been to Boulevard multiple times over the years and it's such a classic spot with great service and food that you just can't go wrong.  The latest time I went for lunch for again was not disappointed at all.  I had the swordfish which was recommended and I really enjoyed it.  

Great spot for a true San Francisco experience along the Embarcadero with delicious food and great service.
author: Blake B.

description: Still the best restaurant in San Francisco. We just hosted my son's wedding dinner at the Boulevard. Pam was so helpful with the planning, flowers, wine selection and food selection. Richard and the other two waiters were awesome. Everything was on time and the food was super.  What a great night. We will remember it forever.
author: Bruce K.

description:
I went there for my birthday dinner with my friends and it went well. The place is warm looking and the staffs were welcoming although we were just 8 weird international students arrived with a limo(for my bday) with a black dress code (that means we are like super weird) but the staffs treated us seriously hahahaha that's good enough for me! We ordered everything on the menu.. And it was good! The scallops definitely. 
We sat in the little private room because we have so many ppl.. The prices were reasonable for me (cause I am paying for the bill lol) i mean it is close to my expectation:/ about $1000 (tips included) for 8 ppl I think it's pretty fair for fine dinning
author: Haley C.

description:
This is a classy establishment. That said, it's not trying to be hip. It's not cheap. And, it's not for everyone.

Here's what it's good for:
- If you're going on a first date after work, and you want to grab drinks somewhere classssssy
- If your parents are not really city-folk, but you still want them to come see where you live.
- If you're having a business lunch or dinner (and your business is paying)
- If you want to thank someone for referring you to a job by taking them out for white wine and shellfish (I actually did this.)

The bread is delicious. Sit at the bar, if you can. Enjoy a cocktail. This place is a classic and I hope it stays that way.
author: Shanee B.

description:
The only time I'd haphazardly drop $100 on a random post-work dinner with colleagues would be... at Boulevard. A great place to impress a client, a date, or even close friends/family, this place is appropriate for any nice dinners. 

Recently, here's what we ordered:

White truffle rissoto - 5/5 a seasonal delicacy starter. The earthy flavor of the truffles balanced the al dente grain and was smothered in a hearty sauce. Creamy, delicate, and so damn perfect.

Angus filet mignon - 5/5 a classic. Cooked medium-rare with Crisp Spanish Style Potato & Soft Potato Aioli, and Bloomsdale Spinach, this was equally scrumptuous

Sea scallops a la plancha - 4/5. Hearts of Palm & Roasted Celery Root and Amarosa Potatoes & Burgundy Truffles with Celery Root & Buttermilk Mashers. It didn't have as much oomph as the filet or the risotto.

Between the delicious sourdough (?) and the indulgent food, we were too stuffed that we opted out of dessert. Although, I had eaten here previously and, I must say that, their dessert were equally amazing.

Overall, one of top restaurants and a personal favorite in San Francisco. Winning Restaurant of the Year in 2013 was no doubt deserved for this top-notch establishment.
author: Carloalexi M.

description: I mostly enjoyed my experience here. The food was pricey with moderate portion sizes but high quality. Location is good but not particularly great view. Huge wine selection for bottles and a good 10 or so wines offered by glass. Servers were friendly and knowledgable, on top of silverware/plate changes but lacked attention to water which personally has more of an influence on my enjoyment of a meal than whether I am using a salad fork or dinner fork. My water was empty after 20 mins (after appetizer but before entree) and didn't get refilled until an hour later which by then was within 5 mins of leaving, entree plates already cleared. Good spot to take those who highly value Michelin starred restaurants or other such titular means for gathering attention but as a local, I've definitely eaten at restaurants with equal food quality, larger dish selection, and better views within the city; may not have been Michelin starred though, my apologies.
author: Shav S.

description:
Wow! Stumbled upon Boulevard looking for a nice spot near the Ferry Building and what a wonderful stop it was. This was a restaurant experience that was as close to perfect as they come. Lovely ambience in an architectural gem of a location, beautiful and special art deco interior with nods to an earlier romantic era and tasteful and lovely holiday decorations. Gorgeous bar and tables. 

Now for the food. First, I have never walked into a restaurant that smelled so divine. With a semi-open kitchen we were treated to the smells and sights of a master kitchen. 

We started with cocktails: me a Sidecar and my friend a cosmo. Finally, someone can make a proper sidecar. Great cocktails. 

Next, tortelloni and ahi appetizers to share. Ahi was fresh and flavorful. Tortelloni was an A+ for presentation and the sauce was to die for. A really nice dish. 

For main course, I had the filet mignon and my friend the lamb. Both plates were perfection. Perfect, tender, flavorful meat. Perfect temp. Perfect mashed potatoes with Camembert cheese. Perfect sauce. Perfect greens. Just an incredible elevation of steak and potatoes. 

Service friendly, warm and outstanding. Server helped me pick a lovely glass of wine to accompany my steak. 

My friend said it was the best lamb she's had. 

Definitely will go back again. It was a really special evening and perfect spot for dinner with a dear friend. Thank you Boulevard.
author: Kristy C.

description:
I wanted my 400th review to be 5 stars and I was really hoping Boulevard would live up to expectations and it REALLY REALLY did!  First if your driving they do have valet parking which is MUCH cheaper(11$ I believe) than any other parking options in this area.  I made a reservation for 8:15 on Monday about 2-3 weeks in advance with no problem.  The restaurant décor is beautiful and very unique.  You get a great view of the ferry terminal building and the bay bridge- absolutely gorgeous!  We were seated right away and greeted by our waitress.  We had some cocktails while looking through all the menu which was the perfect size.  The wine list was also great and we got someone to help us pick a bottle of delicious red wine for our meal.
Now onto the food we started with two appetizers: the foie gras and the soft shell crab.  Oh my gosh both these dishes were AMAIZING!  There were 4 of us so this was the perfect way to start our meal.  From looking at the pictures on yelp it seems like the menu changes all the time but if you see foie gras or the soft shell crab with corn I really recommend.  The sauce with the crab was beyond delicious and it came with a chorizo, scallop, and shrimps sausage that literally blew me away.  I could have ordered that again for my meal and dessert!  

For our main meals the table ordered the stuffed quail and the lamb T-bone.  Both of these were delicious, but I can not explain how amazing the lamb T-bone was, it really blew my mind, the flavors were great and it was cooked perfectly.  I believe it was stuffed with a feta cheese and artichoke, it also had some potatoes but I could barley eat them the lamb was so good.  My husband had the quail and I tried that as well, So good!  I loved the cous cous that came with the quail, all of the components fit together so well!

Finally we had to get dessert.  We had the berry crumble dish, chocolate pot, and the chocolate tart.  They were all good but I loved the berry crumble dish with buttermilk ice cream and delicious fresh fruit on top.  We were soooo stuffed but I really do recommend the dessert.  
This really was a great meal for a special occasion and I would love to come back here.  Its reasonably prices for the quality of food you are getting but you will spend a lot of money here.  Totally worth it in my opinion!
author: Kate F.

description: This restaurant left my with nothing less than amazement.  It was super busy but the staff made sure I was 100% comfortable, 100% of the time.  When my entrees arrived, I didn't want the food to end!  I ordered the lamb and it was one of the best, if not the best, meal I have had in my life.  The meat was so tender and the pairings were amazing.  The scallops were also to die for and the home-made ravioli was spectacular.  For dessert I had the butterscotch pudding and it was very flavorful as well, especially paired with a recommended dessert wine.  Boulevard is definitely a destination restaurant that needs to be checked out if you're in San Francisco!
author: Matt N.

description: We were very disappointed by the food. For the reputation and cost, we expected much more.  The appetizers were very expensive ($25) and small, barely enough for one person. My husband got the filet which was supposed to come with Bernaise sauce but didn't. It was quite dry and had no flavor. It was almost $50 and didn't come with anything more than a small pile of green beans. I had the halibut which came with a very bland lemon sauce. The cocktails were good but very pricey and about half the size of an average cocktail. The service and ambience were the only saving grace of this former Michelin star restaurant.
author: Karen K.

description: This is my second time dining at Boulevard and while the ambience and service is on point; I found the food (for being Michelin starred) under whelming.  The foi gras was quite interesting as it was served on the sweet side w a waffle and blueberries. Tried both the halibut and lamb for mains, both great but neither was an "omg must have again".  Drinks were on point and service spectacular.  Will give this place another shot in a few months as have heard wonderful things about the chef and was impressed with  the ambience, service and drinks.
author: Justina L.

description:
Oh la la Ladies and Gents... Get pretty and dine on pretty things.  I am so lucky my husband decided to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary here.  We honeymooned in Paris so this was quite fitting for the taste and senses of a year ago...  

You're taken in by the beautiful layout of the restaurant, the open kitchen lined with good looking people making delicious things.  And who can complain about the view if you sit close enough to the windows facing the Bay Bridge all lit up on Embarcadero.  

We were greeted by a lovely waitress by the name of Jay I believe.  We ordered our French wine, then stared at a menu that was perfect in selection but so difficult to pick.  Folks, you will want everything on the menu.  We settled for the lobster and sea scallops.  If you're gonna go rich, go all the way I say.  

As for entrees, I went for the halibut and my husband had the quail.  The plates were presented like a delicate piece of art.  We returned those same plates back as if they were blank canvases without shame.   The waitress reassured us that we were not the only people who ate everything on the plate, happens often there.  (wink wink)

By now we are full and happy.... until the dessert menu sneaks up.  One can not pass up on such experiences and opportunities.  We ordered the butterscotch pudding that was silky, smooth, and guided you into some sort of sweet bliss. Ahh we ate too much of just enough.  Splendid indeed.  

I can't wait to go back there again..."First Wedding Anniversary" dinner was set high.  Just confirms why I married him.

Merci Boulevard! ...And praises to all your amazing prizes that you don't throw in your guest's faces...You are more than that!  Classy!
author: Zin M.

description:
I met up here with my friends who were staying in W for the weekend.

The restaurant is styled to look as if it's the 70s, which was a little unexpected, since I don't think that was done on purpose. I did find parking pretty easily, but I think I just got lucky, because there was one spot in front of the restaurant, and I don't expect to get this lucky again. Ever.

The service is polite and pretty quick, also not something that I expected, I thought that they would take their time, but seeing how the restaurant was packed, my guess is that they needed to free up the tables, yet we didn't feel rushed at all.

As for the food, I liked the tuna tartare, it wasn't the best I've had by a long shot, but my friends were not impressed by either of the dishes.
author: Anna P.

description:
Really enjoyed this dining experience. Great atmosphere, great food, and great service!

We started with the calamari... I loved the cucumbers and potatoes and the sauce was light, but flavorful, and really complimented all of the ingredients. My boyfriend got the quail, which was good, and I got the lamb, which was SO SO SO DELICIOUS! It was so tender and juicy. I'm not really a big lamb person, but for some reason that night I decided to go out on a limb and try it and it was a great decision. I think the best lamb I've ever had. For dessert we got the berry buckle which was very cute and yummy as well! The ice cream and the creme brulee were good... and berries are berries.
author: Terra C.

description:
Came here to grab dinner with a few friends. Located in Embarcadero, it definitely fits into the neighborhood with its upscale ambiance. Food and service were both mostly solid, with only a few hiccups. 

Although we had a 9pm reservation, we were still asked to wait for at least 15 minutes before our table was ready. Although there was a bar area to stand in, it was rather crowded and we had to shuffle around occasionally to make way for passing servers. 

The food was very good - nothing too outstanding, but certainly what you'd expect from a restaurant of this caliber. For starters, we opted for the scallops and tuna tartare to share and both dishes were executed well. The scallops were seared perfectly, and the tartare had plenty of flavor. The swordfish that I had for my main was seasoned and cooked perfectly as well. We opted to skip dessert as we were rather full, and none of the dessert options really stood out to us.
