The streusel topping was too sweet/sugary, and didn't pair well with the fruit filling, which was more sour than I expected.

On a side note, access to the restroom seems more complicated than needed, requiring you to go through a hallway and down the stairs.
author: Audrey G.

description: Fantastic service and amazing food. Our waiter was spot on with drink (wine) pairing with appetizers and our main courses. One of the best meals I have had. Truly superb experience.
author: Jamie K.

description:
The food was amazing.. and the dessert was delicious!

I'll come back here definitely!
author: Nayila A.

description:
"Woohoo! As good as it gets!" is right!!! THE best restaurant in the City. The food is consistently excellent and the service superb.

We were first served a two bite portion of butternut bread with cream cheese, fig jam and country ham. 

The four of us order appitizers; Beets/Burata/Cara Cara, lobster raviolis, mixed green salad.

The entrees; lamb, pork chop and petit filet mignon.

Dessert; lemon bar and buttersquash pudding.

Each dishes presentation was beautiful and tasted even better than it looked.
author: Mary J.

description:
The chef really has to work on their Vegan options.  I was served up a sub-par risotto with a few mushrooms in it that wasn't very good.  Serving size was very small and very expensive.
The women's bathroom was dark and dirty.  Not what I expected from this restaurant1
Only good thing about my experience was the Valet!!
Save your money and go somewhere else....this place is all hype!!
author: Kathryn L.

description: Gorgeous restaurant in a great location.  Had the Risotto which was delicious.  Red Velvet cake topped off what was an overall great meal and evening.  Recommend calling for reservations.  They got us in at 8 pm on a Saturday with about an hour notice.  Nice bar and drink selection as well.
author: Don H.

description: Came here with friends of ours that recommended this restaurant.  Place has a great vibe and then food is top notch.  I had the tuna appetizer and the prime rib pork chop while my wife had the ravioli with truffles and the halibut. We had the bon bon's for desert. Everything was delicious. They have a great wine selection and the sommelier was very helpful in helping us pick out a few fantastic bottles of wine. This place is hopping so make sure to make reservations ahead of time.  Definitely looking forward to coming back next we come back to San Fran.
author: Robert C.

description:
Came here for 3 year anniversary, and it was a decent experience. It really deserves 3.5 stars, but I couldn't justify giving it 4. 

When we arrived, I was surprised to see that the restaurant was a little cramped as we made our way to our table. The staff was very polite and attentive. They were very quick with getting our food, but I felt slightly rushed.

The food was okay. Nothing was spectacular, although a couple of dishes were well loved. Deserts were nothing note worthy.  

Pan Seared Scallops: The scallops were well done! They were lightly seared and melted in your mouth like butter. If only they had a pan seared scallop entree. 

Pork chop: Juicy and tender, it had was beautifully made. The meat was so flavorful and my bf really enjoyed himself, and I did too when I had a small bite. 

I'm not sure if I would come back; maybe much later down the future but not any time soon. The overall experience was just okay, and the food is not worth it in my honest opinion.
author: Thuy T.

description:
The tables by the doors ar no good, we had to ask to be moved and the chairs are too high for the tables ( or you need to order higher tables). Maybe there is a reason for your madness, who knows? that is simply my opinion.
The food was good. I oredered a glass of red wine when the server brought it to the table all he said was enjoy, he did not tell me what hte name of the wine was.
author: LJ E.

description:
Wanted to give this place 1 star solely on the fact that this is the hungriest I have ever LEFT a restaurant after completing a full meal, but that wouldn't be entirely fair.

I don't have a large appetite. I'm pretty sure i'm in the lower half of the avg male in their 30s. Typically, when i order Filet Mignon, i expect to leave about 70-80% full...and I am fine with that. Yes, I know FM are small... this is probably the 15-20th different one I have ever tried.

Ordered the Filet Mignon. It was seasoned and cooked to my liking. I go with med rare-med. If i feel snobby, I throw on the plus [only did that once for an impression, sue me]. I digress.... this was the smallest cut of Filet I have ever seen in my life. I cannot compare it with any place I have ever tried. I guess... 3 years old child's fist can appropriately explain the size.

Had a few bites of chicken breast. That was good too but couldn't pull my disappointment from my own dish. Killed the bread, twice. 

Left about 50% hungry [pessimism noted] and went to in n out to have a double double.
author: Brandon N.

description: This restaurant used to be great, but there has been a significant drop off in the food. The general consensus was that the food was bland and significantly overpriced. The service is good, but I was very disappointed overall and would not go back.  It's fairly clear why they lost their Michelin star.
author: B S.

description: First time ever.  Celebrated my wife's birthday so they gave us a nice table with a view of the bay and bridge.  Friendly staff, great service, and the food was everything I had hoped for and then some.  The crab and avocado, scallop, and abalone starters featured generous portions of seafood, taste galore, and beautiful presentations.  Petrale sole and filet mignon entrees were right sized and tasty.  Must mention the perfectly chewy sourdough bread and salted butter.  Glad we saved room for yummy Meyer lemon icebox cake and chocolate mousse with pistachio sorbet.  Will definitely return sometime soon.
author: John C.

description: Always a stellar meal. This place never disappoints. Menu constantly changes. This is a top 5 SF establishment.
author: Christina O.

description:
I'll preface this by saying that I very, very, rarely come to restaurants in this price tier, for the simple reason that, over the years, I've been convinced that the $10/$30/$10  three course dinner marks the point of diminishing returns. Dishes generally don't become significantly more amazing afterwards - one is generally paying for things like hospitality and ambiance by that point, which means little to me next to the quality of the dishes. So, that said, I came to Boulevard to join two friends who had prior plans here, figuring it'd be worth a try, given the rave reviews I'd heard.

After two of us ordered some cocktails to start, we ended up going with a crab salad, foie gras, and lobster for starters; duck, pork,and lamb for entrees; and finished off with an ice cream cake and seven layer bar. Without going into particulars (I can't remember details now anymore, anyway), all the dishes were good, but not stellar, and certainly not better than places like Marlowe, Zero Zero, or Frascati, which all fall into lower price tiers. In fact, the only things that stood out here were the desserts, which were actually quite tasty, and the cocktails, which were made rather well.

Unfortunately, while the food itself was not bad, at around $80-90 per person after tax and tip, I can't see myself coming back, considering that's worth two amazing meals elsewhere. Well, no, I suppose I can see myself coming back just for their dessert - yes, they're that tasty - and, for that, they get 2.5 stars from me.

Service, while not as wowing as some restaurants I've been to in this price tier, was pretty good. Also, be aware that, for those in wheelchairs, the accessible entrance is actually via a side door (they'll show you the way, once you make them aware).
author: Johnny W.

description:
We ordered the halibut, soft shell crab, beet salad, pea ravioli, and two desserts because we couldn't decide. Seascape strawberries and the chocolate pot de creme. The chocolate was forgettable, the vanilla bean mousse with strawberries was incredible. Sinful but light. 

I didn't think a beet salad could be memorable- but this one was. 

Our table was in a middle row between the bar and tables along the wall. Hectic, high traffic area. I was envious of those with the booths against the wall. It's a busy loud restaurant, as expected. An amazing dinner, can't wait to go back.
author: Jane R.

description:
The restaurant has great decor and an upbeat atmosphere, very lively. They have this really cool board where every time someone purchases one of their really expensive wines, it goes off. It was neat the first time, but after a while I realized that everyone in there was the 1%, except me. The food is great. I had the Eden Valley Berkshire Pork Chop this time around. I'm usually not a big fan of pork because it comes out dry. The Berkshire Pork Chop was very flavorful and juicy. It came out really good. 

I'd definitely come back again and again.
author: Alfred K.

description:
I wish I could go more stars, but here is the deal - my swordfish was perfectly cooked and really good. My wife had the halibut - again, perfectly cooked, but it was under seasoned. Another friend had the filet - cooked really nicely, but not the best he's ever had. 

The food was good, not fantastic. And the prices are for more than fantastic food. I spent $150 for a disappointing experience.  The building was beautiful, but the service was slow and the worst part was, you would think for $18 an appetizer and $30-45 an entree, the server would have at least smiled.  I would have rather gone to Outback, and gotten what I expected.
author: Ryan K.

description: The beau surprised me to a lovely dinner at The Boulevard, his last night in the bay. Everything was very delicious. Service was good. Loved the lighting decoration. It was a pre French dinner before leaving to Paris
author: Ginger M.

description: This is one of the best restaurant experiences in San Francisco.  It has been since it opened.  This is a tall order to maintain given the quality of restaurants in SF.  The presentation is great as is the taste, of course.  Service is great.  My only compliant is that it can get a little loud. This  depends where one is seated.  If you are visiting our wonderful city, don't miss the opportunity to experience Boulevard.  If you are local, treat yourself -  you run the risk of it becoming a habit.
author: Dionisio M.

description: Absolutely everything about our visit was superb: service, wine, appetizers, entrees, dessert and ambience. Would highly recommend.
author: Mike F.

description: We usually end up with a reservation here every time we go to the city. The atmosphere is incredible, the service great, the drinks amazing, and the food is so spectacular that we enjoy every morsel with intense concentration. The flavor hits every taste bud imaginable. Simple yet so very refined. Something only a city of this magnitude can bring you. Elegance and grace in every step of the meal. One of those dining experiences you never want to end. We try and stay across the street at Hotel Vitale and end up getting dessert to go and walking it up to our room. A wonderful atmosphere I highly recommend!!
author: Critical M.

description:
Food is very creative and delicious. Small portions, of course... but it's perfect for me and my small appetite. 

Service however... is not the quickest.... maybe they need a few extra servers to do the job. 

Also, we ordered a $200 Champagne service and it was served warm. :-/
author: Charliena B.

description:
This is far and away my favorite restaurant in SF. It's been a staple in my family for the past 10 years. I've eaten at almost all of the tables, the bar and in both private rooms. I have never once been disappointed. The service is impeccable and the food is always amazing. The menu changes through out the year depending on the season, everything I've eaten here has been delicious.

It is on the pricier side but the food, service and atmosphere make it all more than worth it. You usually have to make a reservation but if you get there on the earlier side you can sit at the bar and get a full meal there. I always enjoy myself at Boulevard, personable servers, yummy drinks, phenomenal food and a happy inviting atmosphere. Definitely an A+.
author: Lizzy U.

description:
Great service and food.  The staff went the extra mile to make it a great evening.
As you would expect there is a nice wine selection as well as Port on the desert menu.
author: Zed Z.

description:
Let me start off by saying that Boulevard is absolutely fantastic.  I will be happy to return when I am in San Francisco again.  

The service was prompt, efficient, friendly and professional.  

The wine list is phenomenal, like mind blowingly phenomenal.  The sommelier, Eric, selected two excellent bottles of Burgundy for us based upon my description of what we were looking for that evening.  And, while a little pricey they didn't break the bank.

The food was almost perfect, almost which is why I am giving four stars and not five.  The Hudson Valley Foie Gras was beyond reproach.  We had two people at our table who truly do not like offal but they wanted seconds of the Foie Gras.  I tasted the Halibut and Riso al Salto and both were perfectly prepared and seasoned.  I saw the Berkshire Kurobuta Pork Prime Rib Chop and if it is true that you eat with your eyes first I was full at the first glance.  I ordered the California Lamb T-Bone and the potatoes, romanesco squash blossom baba ganoush and the lamb jus were excellent but the lamb itself kind of missed the mark.  It was recommended by the server to be prepared medium rare but it came out very rare.  I normally don't mind very rare meat but with the lamb it was just kind of chewy.  It was not displeasing to the taste, and the sear was nice, but it disappointing from the perspective that when I go out for a spendy meal at a Michelin Star rated restaurant I expect them to nail the meat temperatures every single time.  So, while it may seem harsh, I am knocking them down from 5 to 4 stars based upon that (I would prefer to do 4.5 stars but yelp* does not allow for that).

Now the deserts were, once again, irreproachable.  The "Sticky Caramel Toffee Pudding" was decadent and delicious and the I can only describe the Cherry Buckle as redonkulously good.   Seriously, it was incredible.  It may be the best desert I have eaten in the past five years, certainly it was top five.

I look forward to returning.
author: Gregory O.

description: Overall its good, not outstanding or innovative. The steak was sub-par in quality. I was surprised it has a Michelin star. I probably should have ordered the pork chop, that looked good. The ambiance is excellent. Service impeccable.
author: Ali S.

description:
Over 900 reviews now.  Wow!

On Monday the finalists for the James Beard awards were announced.  SF had three restaurants in the Best New Restaurant category which is quite impressive.  Boulevard was a finalist this year for Best Restaurant.  I hadn't been here in years and decided to have lunch here with my mom.

Three things make a great restaurant: food, service and atmosphere.  Boulevard has them all in spades.

I ordered the wild halibut and my mom ordered the Scottish salmon.  Both were cooked perfectly and looked like pieces of artwork on their plates. The strawberry rhubarb cobbler for dessert was wonderful.

Service was attentive and very professional.  Definitely a notch above what I experience in Phoenix.

To top it off, the entire experience is set in a beautiful Parisian style building.

Nancy Oakes already has a JB award for top chef and Boulevard gets my vote for top restaurant.
author: Patrick H.

description: much like Gary Danko or something similar, there's no drawbacks to this place. Amazing.
author: Samir K.

description:
I ate here on a Friday night with some girl friends and had a great time. It was filled with diners and seems like a great date night or family dinner venue.

My general feeling is that the appetizers were very delicious but quite overpriced for the portions. We tried the lobster ravioli, which turned out to be my favorite, but I was disappointed and shocked to find that only 3 pieces of ravioli came out. They weren't even big pieces! However, each bite was indeed delicious and filled with lobster. Was the dish worth ~$20 though? I wouldn't say so...

Another appetizer we tried was the witches hat with uni. This was a very cute dish and although I'm not typically an uni person, even I found this dish pretty tasty. The witches hats were also very cute and it was my first time eating them - they tasted a lot like wood ear (as I'm typing this, I realize how weirdly named these foods are). 

For my entree, I had the swordfish and risotto, which I did feel was worth the money (~$30). It was light and refreshing and the portion was fair. 

The desserts are a steal! Each dish is around $10 each and very delicious. I had the apple pie with ice cream - I swear my stomach refreshed when I smelled the apple pie, even though I was feeling so full from the apps and entree.
author: Jenny M.

description: I hope they get over themselves soon. Food was good, No complaints there. Service left ALOT to be desired. Menu adequate but not a robust array of choices.  One Market would have been such a better choice.
author: Louise P.

description: We came here when it was still a one Michelin star restaurant. Long story short, great service, amazing food. I ordered the foie gras here right after it the ban was lifted... Yummmmm.
author: Joy Christiana B.

description:
My husband and I finally got to try Boulevard after wanting to try it for years and years!

Usually after something being much anticipated and built up over time, it'll fall short no matter what. But not Boulevard, holy crap, I LOOOOOOOOVE this place! It's so worth the $$$. If you're on the fence about it, do it, you will not regret it!

To start with, we had one of the best waiters ever. In my life, seriously, I am not even just using that as an expression, he was one of the best waiters I've ever had at any restaurant. I think his name was Kevin, I hate myself for not knowing for sure.

We ingested some of the most delicious foodstuffs including:

AHI TUNA TARTARE - I even risked my slight seafood allergy to try this!
CHESTNUT & KABOCHA SQUASH SOUP - Husband kept stealing it from me!
ANGUS FILET MIGNON - We both had the same, mine cooked properly and his bleeding, so there were no fights here.
MEYER LEMON MERINGUE BAR - So much lemony goodness, I stole a lot.
ICE BOX CAKE - Delicious and gorgeous.. almost too pretty to eat, but, we did.

We cleaned our plates. And their drinks were very tasty as well, including a wonderfully spicy Port that our waiter recommended for me.

In addition to the impeccable service and food, we felt so Comfortable here. It's one of the more posh places around, highly rated for this that and your mother, takes a month for a reservation, a place to be seen, you get dressed up to go here yadda yadda yadda.. But the people here are Nice and Polite and really make you feel at home. We could have easily just gone in our work clothes and no one would have taken a second look. No snooty booties allowed, I like that, it's got that thing. 

We can't wait to go back! Thanks for being a fantastic place, Boulevard!
author: Paula S.

description:
Now I understand what all the fuss is about.  It's been a long time in the making for me to finally visit this place and it was absolutely perfect.  The food was simple and classic and boy did it taste good.  My fish was perfectly cooked and my plate was basically licked clean.

The interior decor reminds me somewhat of a wine cellar that was turned into an elegant home.  The bricks on the ceiling and airy feel from the wall of windows looking out into the streets of San Francisco make it urban enough to enjoy a "night out on the town".

The attire is business casual and I don't believe they'll turn anyone away.  This is San Francisco after all.  Valet is right outside for those hard-to-find parking spots so no need to plan for extra parking time.  This restaurant is truly a gem within a city on the bay.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Dessert was definitely my favorite part. 
Had the Petrale Sole as my entree and it was light but not as flavorful as I was hoping.
author: Mara M.

description: Located in the Audiffred building, a designated landmark, this restaurant has a unique and welcoming atmosphere that lends itself to a variety of occasions, for business or pleasure. I have been here for lunch and dinner several times, with friends and for professional meetings. The food (appetizers, entrees, desserts) has always been perfectly prepared and wonderfully surprising due to creative flavor combinations. The seafood is excellent. This place is upscale for sure, but whether I showed up in dressy attire or in less-than-dressy jeans and my trusty converse - I have been treated in the same friendly and respectful manner. This is what (in my book) makes this a truly classy place.
author: H. W.

description:
I recently visited San Francisco with my wife for a little get away and we both agree that Boulevard was our favorite restaurant on the trip. That's saying a lot because I'd give the other restaurants we went to on the trip 4-5 stars also.

we ordered 3 apps and a main to share and the waitress asked if we wanted it to all come out or if we wanted each dish to be split up so that it can be coursed out. Since we didn't have too much planned for the night, we opted for each dish to come out separate and the waitress and kitchen did an extraordinary job at pacing the dinner and timing each dish. I really give extremely high marks on the wait staff, she was very attentive and always made her presence and attention accessible but without being in our face or getting in our way. The waitress just did exactly as you wanted and never forgot a thing, she really made our experience very pleasurable. She also gave great recommendations based off what we liked which is always a plus

The appetizers just blew our hats off to start the meal. We started with:

Beef Carpaccio with fried oysters, topped with house made hollandaise. This was a decadent, rich and flavorful dish. At first taste you get an amazing creamy and smooth rich texture, but balanced with crispy crunch and fresh citrus bite to the dish. The dish was definitely thought out and balanced well.

Lobster/Shrimp ravioli was our next dish and was equally amazing. You can taste every layer of flavor in this dish when you bite into each ravioli. The ravioli dough had the perfect chew that you get from fresh made pasta, and the stuffing was perfectly seasoned. I felt like I had an ocean of shrimp and lobster flavor in my mouth. But to put this dish over the edge, it came with a browned butter sauce on top and underneath it was a sweet corn pudding that just went so well with the rest of the dish. Again perfect balance, and each ingredient played on each other so well. The sweetness of the corn really brought out the sweetness of the seafood stuffing.

The next dish was a homemade tagliatelle with truffle (Not truffle oil, they had real shaved truffles). This dish was very good but it unfortunately was overshadowed by the first 2...I think that if this had came out first, it would've had a different impact on the meal. It was still great pasta dish, it was just underwhelming after the first 2 courses we had.

We then got the Lamb T-bone which was a braised fall off the bone lamb. It didn't have any lamb funk to it which I appreciated. And again, this was another one of those dishes that just seemed to have gotten a lot of attention and thought before it was even put on the menu. The little fingerling potatoes and the side nuts and cauliflower salad just went so well with the lamb. Every bite had to take a little of everything in it. The rich moist and tender juicy lamb, with soft potatoes with the crunch of the hazelnuts and cauliflower and vinaigrette...i mean, seriously?

We finished the meal with their "ICE box cake". My first thought when I bit into this dessert was that if a tiramisu met a chocolate covered frozen banana and had a kid...it would probably be  this dessert. So yeah, it was good.

Great restaurant, highly recommended for a nice night out.
author: Calvin C.

description: Nice place and good food. I had the scallops special (almost our entire party of 6 did). The dish was delicious, was well priced for the size of the meal. The only complaint is it that it is very loud in the restaurant and it's difficult to have conversations.
author: Chas Y.

description:
When here with the fam for my sister's birthday.  Boulevard is one of those restaurants that I've heard about for a long time but never went to...mostly because I'm not someone who likes to blow a lot of money of food.  I'm much more of a hole in the wall kinda guy, but I'm always down for a great culinary adventure.  Upon walking in, I was surprised to see that the restaurant was almost full the day before Thanksgiving.  The decor was very nice, very high end looking and feeling.  Upon being seated we were greeted by our uber pleasant waitress who was one of the highlights of the evening.  On to the food.

STARTER

Pan Seared Fois Gras - 3 out of 5 - The dish is pan seared Fois Gras served with a spiced chocolate toast, honey roasted pears, picked squash and toasted nuts.  The dish was very good but fell a little short in my opinion.  I can see and appreciate the thought process that went into the dish, having a bunch of contrasting flavors and textures to play off the richness of the fois gras, personally I didn't like the spiced chocolate toast.  I thought the toast was way to big and I wasn't sold on the flavor of it was kind of bitter and chalky in flavor and texture.  The size of it also made int difficult to shave a piece off the whole and get a bit of it, the fois gras and everything together.  When I could the balance was nice...but that only happened 2-3 times.  Less could have been more...especially at $30 for an appetizer. http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xaaVVhZv97illMU8Pbk93A/l.jpg

ENTREE

Oven Roasted Lamb Prime T-Bone - 3 out of 5 - Lamb T-bone that is oven roasted and served OFF the bone with crushed potatoes, sauted chard, broccoli romanesco, tokyo turnips and a rosemary lamb jus.  The lamb was very well cooked but lacking in a bit of seasoning and overall flavor.  I really wanted to like it but ended up thinking all the other sides on the dish packed a lot more flavor than the lamb.  http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/r4WGq0rDiJS-oqqls1FUzw/l.jpg

DESSERT

Dreamcile Brulee  - 4 out of 5 - Vanilla custard topped with mandarine oranges brulee  served with a tart sherbet "ice cream sandwich." The highlight of the evening.  The vanilla custard was delicious and the mandarine oranges added a nice punch of citrus.  The sherbet was a nice contrasting flavor that brings out even more subtle sweetness out of the brulee.  Very well done.  http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GqSk0iuMWPvPDqUVQ2rWMg/l.jpg

SERVICE

Service was excellent.  Our sever knew the menu back and forth.  She explained and described the dishes well and constantly checked in with us.  Also our waters never got more than halfway empty before they were filled again.  

OVERALL

I understood and can appreciate what Boulevard was doing with their food... the beautiful plating and contrasting flavors and textures on the plate, but somehow the food didn't feed my soul.  I appreciated the meal more than I liked it.
author: Rob P.

description:
We have a goal: visiting 1-2 Michelin rated restaurants a year. Sometimes we meet our goal and sometimes we don't. Hubs had a birthday, it was the perfect excuse to go grab dinner at a special restaurant. Often with these restaurants you are having an experience, sometimes it's one that you treasure but don't necessarily need to repeat, sometimes it's one that you treasure, and would gladly repeat. Boulevard offered us an experience we will happily repeat.

We thought (eeeeek... sorry Boulevard) that it might be stuffy and over-rated. We were wrong, so wrong. Boulevard delivered. The interior is beautiful, in a way it's like a stage set, but a real-life working one. I like the open kitchen concept, it's nice to see the kitchen working away. Another plus, the chef de cuisine and the chef/owner are women, and there were women in the kitchen. Our server was very professional, but without pretension. She was warm and friendly, and offered fantastic recommendations upon request (sorry I don't have her name, she was young blond, awesome, working near the kitchen on Friday 7/11/14). And then there was the food. The food was so very good.

We had:

Scallops: 5/5 stars 
Delicious, perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned. As the offerings in the restaurant are seasonal, the accompaniments will change, but the scallops I will still be perfect.

Corn Ravioli with truffles: 4/5 
The corn was wonderful, the ravioli dough was a little too much.

Pork Chop: 5/5 
This was the best pork chop I have ever eaten. Ever. Perfectly cooked, we ate every last bite. It was divine.

Sea Bass 5/5 
Poor sea bass. You were excellent, but you had to go up against the pork chop. Honestly, the sea bass was wonderful, that pork chop was just. so. good.

Butterscotch Pudding 5/5
Delicious. If I ordered it again, I'd hold the chocolate. 

Cheese Plate 5/5
Hubs ordered The Bomb and something else. They were both wonderful.

Thank you Boulevard for such a spectacular meal. 

Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of amazing restaurants in the bay area that are not rated which are amazing and we love them too.  It's fun to get out every now and then to see what all the fuss is about. So far we've been to six Michelin rated restaurants. Boulevard is one of two rated restaurants that we would go back to (Aziza is the other).  The whole experience was wonderful.
author: Lani N.

description:
I have to rate this place a solid four stars.  No more no less.  Boulevard is located in the heart of San Francisco and boasts a long standing track record of great service and food.  Although the venue may look a bit dated, they offer quite a selection of contemporary American dishes at a great price.  

Arrugula Salad w/ Goat Cheese & Pommogranate:  A
Very fresh.  Goat cheese tasted top notch and paired extremeley well with the pommogranate and bits of grapefruit.

Roasted Lamb:  A
Cooked to a perfect medium rare and definitely didn't skimp on portions.  Paired nicely with a syrah for the gaminess.

Seared scallops and mussels over rissoto:  A+
Scallops were cooked perfectly golden brown.  Mussels were so tender that they seemed almost braised.  The seafood flavors were present in the rich rissoto, which also did not fail to disappoint in texture and seasoning.

I would say this place has alot of San Francisco character.  Its set up like one of those old school steak houses, and the service here is top notch.  I would be back here again because I know they are consistent in quality.
author: David C.

description:
Came here on a beautiful sunny day with my bf for his pre-birthday lunch. The restaurant is very beautiful and I would love to come with him for a romantic dinner. 

We started with the sweet corn soup and fig salad. Both were superb and perfect to begin our lunch. The corn soup was one of the best I've had. Then we had the scallops with nettle-infused risotto and the Kobe burger. The scallops were good but I didn't love the nettle flavor in the risotto. The burger was delicious and the house made bun was awesome. 

For dessert, we had the turtle sundae and a chocolate peanut butter bon bon. The bon bon was okay but the sundae was magnificent. The brownie was perfectly soft and the butter pecan ice cream that accompanied it was mouthwatering. 

They have quite a variety of cocktails and a nice wine list. I had the Ramey Chardonnay (09 I think) and it was so great with my dish. Overall, I'd say the food was at least a 4 but the service was a 5. Our server was extremely friendly and made our dining experience that much better. I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Sheeva G.

description: From the friendly and professional service to the perfect preparation, this San Francisco institution has not lost its touch. You can't go wrong here.
author: Alexander L.

description: Dinner, service and ambiance were simply perfect. We had the crab bisque and hamachi tartar for appetizers and the t bone lamb rack and quail for entrees. We topped it off with the butterscotch pudding for desert. Every single dish was amazing and perfectly cooked. Presentation was also incredible. Definitely worth the buck, amazing place overall.
author: Sara C.

description:
Great place in great location.  First time we tried to get in it was closing and had to go elsewhere.  Second time last night was special and enjoyed it very much.  All the food was super but a bit pricey.  Service was great.  The soup of the day that others told me was super was not available last night (perhaps all gone???).

Definely worth trying if in the area.
author: Jack P.

description:
I've been to Boulevard before. Probably about 10 years ago. Now I remember why I haven't been back. Food was good, not great. For that price, I expect great. Not out of this world great, just great. But it wasn't even close. We ordered two thirds of the menu (for a party of 4 to share) and only two dishes were decent - the BEEF CARPACCIO & CRISPY OYSTERS and BRENT WOLF KING QUAIL PAN ROASTED DOUBLE BREAST, BACON DRESSED LEGS. 

Service was mediocre as well. Take your money and taste buds to Gary Danko.
author: quynh n.

description:
Always heard about this place because my old boss used to eat there.  He was a finicky eater, so we knew it had to be pretty decent.  He used to rack up $60+ alone, so we knew we were in for a bit of a splurge too.

We decided to drop in one day midweek for a lunch.  The place gets pretty busy, and most of the patrons were in business attire and the conversations were revolved around work.  The reception staff was nice, but without a reservation we were quickly seated at a tiny table in the corner.  Not a big deal, but there wasn't much elbow room.  Our server was nice and attentive.

We went for two nonalcoholic drinks (black current french soda, so good!) one lobster bisque, the crab cake appetizer, the seared scallops entree, and the oven roasted sirloin steak.  

Overall the food was pretty good, although a bit on the salty side.  It started out with the bread and butter.  The butter was lightly salted.  Then the bisque came and that was delicious the first few bites, but then the salt started taking over.  By the time we finished up the crab cake and moved onto the main lunch entrees, we were also halfway through our drinks--I was combating the increased thirst with my supplemental ice water.  

The scallops and the steak weren't extraordinary, but were still quite good for lunch fare.  The steak portion was pretty fair, enough to definitely fill one up if they've already had an appetizer.  The meat was extremely tender, though somewhat lacking in flavor.  The scallops were good, but there were only four medium sized scallops with some beans, bacon and sauce around them.  Definitely nowhere near a large enough portion.  I could have easily had another plate of four scallops before getting satiated.

We ended the lunch with two coffees and tried two of their ice cream scoops.  The vanilla was particularly good and helped to cap the meal and take the salt edge away.  Overall the lunch was north of $100 for two people.  A good experience, but we'll likely only be back for special occasions or parties.
author: Al C.

description: Would have liked to go 25 years ago when they were rolling. Still really solid, but I nothing was absolutely mind blowing. That being said, still a very very good restaurant experience worth the visit.
author: O H.

description:
Wow, what great food!!! It's right on the embarrcadero with a great view of the water and bay bridge so make sure to get a table at the end of the Resturant. 
I went here with 2 other couples on a Thursday night it wasnt too busy and had a great time. I got the Filet which was delicious, they had these tomatoes bruschetta thing on the top which was SOO good, my husband had the swordfish which I had a few bite of and that was really good too!
I would defiantely recommend coming here
author: Yesenia C.

description:
We did dinner here early on a August Saturday night. Arrived shortly after they opened at 5:30. We'd no reservation, so we assumed we'd sit at the bar but a table for two was what we scored. 
We ordered fois gras and heirloom tomato burrata as appetizers. AMAZING. buttery texture, subtle flavors. The figs with the fois gras had a guava reduction. It was just a delight. 
We followed up with the lamb t-bone and the quail with quail sausage which had a compliment of diced plums. DELICIOUS. Again, the textures and flavors were so beautiful.  We savored our dishes S L O W L Y.  Along with dinner I had a Boulevardier, their take on a Manhattan.  Now my BF does manhattans so I've had my share. This was subtly balanced.  WONDERFUL.  Again, I sipped gingerly enjoying watching the crowd.  
Okay, so we spent $250 for dinner for two. I'm rather frugal but BOULEVARD delivered a fabulously complex meal and evening I'll remember for quite awhile.  
Definitely worth it and I'd go again in a minute.
author: Harold S.

description:
Great place for a (very) special occasion :)
They have several tables with Bay Bridge views. Food is amazing,but portions are very small and pretty pricy. Service could be a little bit better (we were waiting for awhile to order & our waiter was kind of "too busy" all the time).
author: Ellie J.

description:
We had an ok meal here, but I expected more for the price.   The ambiance is ok - kind of loud & more casual than I expected.  They did give us a really cute little 2-person booth so we could sit side by side looking out on the dining room - that was cool.   The bread is average but they did have good butter topped with sea salt.

My husband had the lamb t-bone ($37), which he enjoyed.  It came with a variety of interesting sides including grapes, cauliflower & purple potatoes.   I had the local petrole sole ($30) with crispy kale, porcini butter, pecans & lemon. The sides were good (if a bit salty) but the fish was not great.  It didn't taste like other sole dishes I've had before which were light and flaky; it was a very dense, chewy piece of fish and a very thick fillet (I'm confused about how it was so thick because sole is such a thin fish).  It tasted more like swordfish (which I don't really like) than it did like other sole dishes I've had in the past.  So that was a disappointment.  

I was really excited to have their flourless chocolate cake & olive oil ice cream ($11.50) for dessert - I love flourless chocolate cake & really wanted to try olive oil ice cream.  The dish was beautifully plated and had a lot going on (in addition to the cake and ice cream there were chocolate pistacho truffles, caramel rice krispies, olive oil powder, olive oil gum drops and a chocolate mousse wrapped in a chocolate shell) but didn't wow me.  The "flourless" cake didn't have the dense, fudgy flavor I normally associate with such cakes - it was light and spongy and tasted more like a cake-like brownie that didn't have a particularly strong chocolate flavor.  The ice cream had a good creamy consistency but I didn't get much olive oil flavor (maybe this is common for olive oil ice cream? I've never had it before) and it basically tasted like vanilla ice cream.  The other things on the dessert plate were similarly lacking in flavor; my favorite part was probably the chocolate mousse.   

Service was very friendly.  We did not get any amuses or treats with the bill.  4% SF health insurance service charge.  The menu in the restaurant matches the one on line, except the prices are mostly a dollar or so higher (pet peeve of mine) . There is a valet for $15 or you can find street parking (we found free parking with no problem, but we were there on a Sunday).
author: A M.

description:
I had a late night dinner here with a friend and the food was amazing!  I'd give it 5 stars if it weren't SO pricey.. but I'm still debating whether the price was worth the pure deliciousness of the food.

My friend and I both had the halibut, which was perfectly cooked.  If you're a fish fan at all, this is a must-try.  The waiter recommended it as one of his favorite menu items too... and I was just about to order the salmon!  The potatoes on the side were good but the star was definitely the fish.  Meaty but light and flaky, and the lemon and garlic aioli was the perfect complement to the light entree.

we also had the abalone appetizer with pork riblets which was very very tasty.  A little heavy for an appetizer for me but PACKED full of flavor.

With drinks and a shared appetizer and the entree I think it came out to be about $85/person, which isn't an everyday dinner price but definitely worth it if you're looking for a treat!
author: Kelsey H.

description:
My wife took me to Boulevard for a birthday dinner. We rushed against traffic and then couldn't find parking--luckily they were able to hold our reservation, because we were quite a bit later than the customary 15 minutes. We ordered the following:

- Sea scallops, brandade croquette, choron bernaise sauce, tomato lime relish & garlic chips
It's hard not to love sea scallops--these were no exception. Light creamy sauce, delicious fried croquette (like an actually yummy version of a tater tot). My only critique is that the little garnishing leaves on top had no distinct flavor, whereas the best dishes consider every aspect, and the tiniest leaf is meant to evoke a particular flavor so as to balance the dish.

- Roasted beet salad, jeune autize goat's milk morbier cheese, pickled cauliflower, caper sultana raisinette
I love beets, and these were wonderful, especially the smaller lighter colored ones that I thought would be tomatoes. The cheese was a great balancer for savory and creamy. The pickled cauliflower was good, but not pickled long enough and not big enough. Once again, the leaves used in garnish were flavorless, and we felt that golden raisins were unnecessary due to the inherent sweetness of the beets. Still, it was really great.

- Eden valley berkshire (kurobuta) pork prime rib chop (wood oven roasted), anson mills heritage polenta & biellese lardo, italian pine nut & saba pearl relish, roasted blueberries, napa cabbage with colatura, roasted pork jus
My wife works with a lot of really rich doctors who head up Kaiser's management board--they love fine dining and speak of it often. One such doctor said that Boulevard was one of his favorites, and that the pork chop was his "last meal". So it was with this introduction that we partook. I mean, it was wonderful (and I don't even like pork chops generally), but I'd challenge this as being "last meal" quality. It was a really great cut of meat, no gamey flavor or gristle chunks, but it needed a little sauce of some sort. I don't really remember what that little polenta cake with the lardo tasted like, but I'm sure it was decent. The pine nuts needed a good toasting. The best part of the dish was the roasted blueberries--hard to argue with that.

- California lamb t-bone (wood oven roasted, served off the bone), grilled monterey artichoke, carrot & beldi olive panzanella with our pancetta, mixed farros with creamed artichoke, cynar lamb jus, mint & orange
Once again, great cut of meat, not lamby at all--the sauce was rather normal, brownish, and not awe-inspiring. The artichoke was good (as all artichokes are), but nothing about the presentation or flavor surprised me. I did like the farros with creamed artichoke, very unique and managed to taste healthy and creamy simultaneously.

- Dirty girl alpine strawberries, brown suger sour cream mousse, almond brown butter biscuit, strawberry "pudding", balsamic vinegar gelee
This dish had so much potential, but the strawberries were quite sour, as was the sour cream mousse (not enough brown sugar?). Biscuits--boring and soggy. It could've been so beautiful.

- Flourless chocolate cake, olive oil ice cream & gummies, pistachio truffles, caramel brown rice crispies
The waitress swore the chocolate cake was light--she was wrong. It was rich and yet dry, with what tasted like odorless flour on top. But whatever the heck that chocolate thing on the left was, it was amazingly moist and potent. The crown jewel of this dish was the olive oil ice cream! I never dreamt of something so magnificent.

All in all:

It was quality--not Gary Danko or Coi quality, but certainly Michelin star quality. But where much is given (i.e. paid), much is required.
author: Elliott D.

description:
2.5 stars

Went here the other night with another couple and were looking forward to the experience based on recent reviews posted on Yelp.  

Unfortunately this place did not wow us and was very mediocre at best.  The only thing that was "good" was the beef carpaccio & crispy oyster and the ravioli appetizers.

The king salmon entree was very bland and nothing to write home about.  Very disappointing.  The other two entrees of lamb t-bone were just okay and small portions.  My wife's scallop entree was okay as well, but nothing special. 

We all shared their complete selection of cheeses for desert which were okay also but they skimped on the honey comb and other accompaniments that go well with various  cheeses.

I forgot to mention we brought 2 of our own bottles of wine and they charge $30.00 per bottle for corkage fee.

To sum it up...our $525.00 dinner for four was very overpriced for very pedestrian dishes.  We were very surprised that this place has a Michelin star.   Save your money and go somewhere else.
author: B N.

description:
What a fancy, lovely place! If you're searching for class & romance, this place seals the deal.

I got to try the Ahi Tuna appetizer - very elegant and nice, if only there was more! The Ahi was seasoned very well and had a good texture for raw fish.

Then for my entree I ordered the lamb. It was cooked rare, how I liked it, and it tasted great! It also came with a ravioli that complimented the dish well. 

For dessert I got a chocolate cake. It was my birthday so they added a candle and wrote happy birthday on it - definitely a plus! The chocolate cake was good, maybe a bit too heavy/thick tasting for me, but the ice cream on the side helped!

I understand these places are quality over quantity, and that's exactly what Boulevard displays. Although the quantity is small, the ambiance of the restaurant and the taste of the food make for a wonderful meal!

They also have a nice wine selection and the service is very good! Our waitress gave us some good wine suggestions as well as dessert.
author: Junel S.

description:
This is my FAVORITE restaurant in San Francisco.  I absolutely LOVE their mouth-watering, daily select menu.  The food is always fresh and portion friendly.  They are just the right portions and you always feel satisfied.  I love that their menu changes based on the chefs talents.  This is the perfect place to experiment with new foods.  Everything tastes delicious, even if I don't know exactly what it is.  The staff is friendly and the views are spectacular.  I recommend this place to all of my out of town guests. 

I recommend the cheese dishes as your dessert.  They have the most delectable cheeses from other countries, paired with the freshest of fruits.

The restaurant is a culinary delight and I can't wait to go there this holiday season, as it has become a tradition for us since we moved here a few years ago.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Extraordinarily disappointing. Not only have we had better, we have had better HERE - in the 18 yrs they have been open I have come here more often than to any other restaurant. Boulevard has always been our gold standard for a bistro....up until now.

No longer.

Foie gras hadn't been cleaned properly. Oversalted and overpriced, although the combo of fresh cranberries beat sibling Prospect's attempt at foie gras with grapes a few months prior.

Lobster ravioli: adequate but not exciting. Thick pasta shell somewhat overwhelmed the delicate lobster, and a foam sauce?!? Blech.

Veal 'schnitzel' with sweetbreads was a muddled concept of too many ingredients and some sour flavors that were completely inappropos with the delicate flavor of sweetbreads. Waiter's description of dish was inaccurate, a first here.

Red abalone starter tasted brined, it was so salty. And the two delicate little slices of abalone disappeared into the messy cioppino-like concept.

Lamb T-bone was lovely as were the beautiful vegetable sides of sauteed chard with colatura (salted anchovies) was good, as were the baby Romanesco broccoli and halved baby turnips. But the mashed Yukon Gold potatoes with nettles and Parmesan were ridiculously salty, even for my DH who loves salt. 

King salmon was accompanied by a too salty wilted spinach salad. It's the first time we have ever encountered so much salt used in Boulevard's kitchen.

But worse was to come. The dessert was terrible. The chocolate bombe was sickeningly sweet and the chestnut ice cream was awful. 

And the bill? Well, let's just say that this dinner cost us precisely what it cost us to go to La Folie - except of course, the food at La Folie is ALWAYS perfect. 

When Ravi Kapur left, apparently the balance, creativity, and flawless execution went with him. The dishes were overwrought and poorly executed, where all the beautiful ingredients failed to combine into a masterful whole.

It will be a long, long time before we come back to Boulevard or Prospect. We'll be at Fifth Floor, Perbacco, One Market, La Folie....anywhere but here again.
author: Jean K.

description:
I popped my girlfriends cherry here. Her Foie Gras Cherry!!

We had a Sunday Funday in SF and we were concluding our day with a drink. She had dinner plans and I needed something to hold me over on the ride back to SJ.

Fortunately, Boulevard was the only restaurant in this area that opened at 5pm. We sat at the bar and each had a glass of wine. Friend kept telling me she had tried foie gras and didn't like it. Oh girl, I'll make you like it!! After putting on some persuasive moves she agreed to try.

Bottom line: Foie Gras is divine here. I fixed her up a crostini with fig spread and the foie gras and she gobbled it up, licked her lips and asked for more!!

That's what I thought!! Another newbie corrupted by yours truly!

I will return for dinner and re-review. I have read so many good things!
author: Lily M.

description: I'm speechless! I had the best fillet mignon here! It was just simply fantastic! All those flavors ... I had a lovely time. His place is soo good that on Monday night the restaurant as packed !
author: Majid D.

description:
Oh yeah I'm a fan alright. Boulevard to me feels like an upscale yet comforty establishment with great food and great service. The bar is a wonderful spot to catch a quick drink if you arrived early for your reservation like I was. My boyfriend and I had a late reservation, 9:30pm, and ordered a ton of food. 

- Ahi tuna tartare: There's nothing too special about this tuna tartare but it is a damn good tartare. Little cubes of perfectly fresh tuna paired with thinly sliced radish and cucumber salad that was to die for. It's just good solid fresh tuna tartare that I would definitely order again.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=acxv1N0i_7VBwvJNXcDs1A
 
- Sonoma Foie Gras: I really loved the peach glaze the foie gras sat on, it provided the right level of sweetness and acidity to cut through the fattiness of the foie gras. The foie gras itself was okay to me. The cut I had was a little veiny and I definitely preferred the one at La Folie better. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=Dd7Llk6smW1IID8SvSvDAw

- Monterey Red Abalone: I really love abalone, especially when it's cooked well like this one. It was melt in your mouth, taste of the sea abalone paired with the calamari. I could have used a bit more acid in this dish. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=lBs60lpRANuy2RH_UNc0Cg

- Pan Roasted Sea Bass: The boyfriend ordered this and according to him "it was okay, a little too plain but it was okay". Yeah... not much to go off on those comments. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=DhUPDvhCffpvsyyPHZp0yQ

- Liberty Farm Duck Breast: What can I say about the duck other than perfection?!?!?! Each bite was heavenly - the crispy outer casing of the pancetta with the tender, soft duck cooked to perfect medium/medium rare. Pair each bite with a few leaves of the sauteed spinach and it's like explosion of flavor.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=AidHKiq-YwDLVNi91nG4oQ

- Chocolate Pecan Seven Layer Bar: It was already a great meal and the desserts just blew me away. All you need to know is order this and you won't regret it. It looks great and it taste even more amazing. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=gIjZIe3tlQLzi6NfLu1dFg

- Strawberry Watermelon Ice Cream Cake: and order this too. I'm still thinking about this dessert as I speak. Lovely lovely layers of strawberry icecream, watermelon sorbet, vanilla cake, wafer crust. Such a perfect way to end an already amazing meal. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Tttm1r5Dw1sRMCfc3EQWPw?select=UPybqvbmE53bx6QXomG6dQ

Another notable aspect of Boulevard is the service. Each course was timed perfectly, with just the right amount of time between the appetizer and the main, the main and desserts. Comfortable and intimate.  Definitely one of the more impressive restaurants I've tried in San Francisco.
author: Kelly C.

description:
My bf has been wanting to come here so I knew I'd finally take him here for his birthday.  I made reservations weeks in advance and they got booked up pretty quickly, but I was able to get a table for 6:15 this past Saturday night.  Our waiter Jeff was superb and super sweet!  My co-workers have been here and they weren't kidding when they said that this place is pricey and kind of a tight squeeze.  

*Glass of Rose ($9.50) & Riesling ($10).  Easy to sip on!  =)  Oh, and our waiter informed us after we finished our glasses, they offer half glasses of wine too!
*Soft Shell Crab ($17.50): Fried soft shell split into two served with chili noodles with a coconuty lime light curry-like sauce.  Very good!  Fried nicely and not heavy at all!
*Filet Mignon ($39.75): Served with banana fingerling potatoes, little baby mushrooms, gorgonzola sauce & some roast beef jus.  It was okay!  I requested medium rare which it was more towards the center.  It was tender however not that juicy.  
*Pork Chop ($36): This was his.  It was cooked more on the medium side and was juicy and the fat on it gave a good flavor.  He liked his accompanying sides as well.  His was the better of the two.
*2 Dulce de Leche Bon Bons ($3.50/each): Yummy!  Nice dulce de leche ice cream with a hard dark chocolate shell.  Perfect sized dessert.

I thought of Boulevard more of a 3.5 stars as the dishes weren't spectacular but rounded up due to the superb service.
author: Cat C.

description:
Boulevard was a disappointment to me on this visit to San Francisco. In the past, I've tolerated the bustle of it all because the food's been terrific and the service commendable. This time, though, it seemed just too rushed, too much a tourist food factory - and the cooking was not commensurate with the price point. Maybef it was an off night? Whatever -- the bill was still the same.

Things did not start off auspiciously. Our server seemed hurried. A pear salad featured embarrassingly over-poached pears. My pork chop entree was juicy and flavorful, though a bit salty, as was my companion's salmon. We liked a couple of scoops ice cream for dessert.

Given the prices for food & wine here, I expect better. It used to be a favorite, but I'll skip it next trip - it felt too much like a tourist stop this time. There is much better food to be had for the mmoney in Marin and Sonoma...
author: Comensal A.

description:
Came here for work lunch (cellar room!) and had a great meal. 

- Butternut squash soup: 6/5. I think it's one of the best soups I've had ever.
- Local coho salmon: 4/5. It was clean and tasty. 
- Crème fraîche ice-cream with raspberry swirl: 5/5. Great way to wrap up the meal. Yum.
author: Christina C.

description:
Came here on my birthday and had a lovely experience! Even though I was getting a little bothered that the waiter kept telling me to eat my food before it gets cold...Does he not know a girl needs to take her IG picture first?! haha 

My date and I had :
-Soft shell crab
-Scallops
-Pork rib chop *
-Filet mignon 

I loved the scallops, more than the soft shell crab. I had to say though it was a really good pork chop! I loved that lemon fig sauce on top of it. It was light, but flavorful. My date loved his filet mignon as well. We ended the night with a cheesecake of some sort, and they decorated it to say Happy Birthday and all- a nice ending of the night. Will come back!
author: Alice K.

description: Food here was absolutely delicious. By far one of the best restaurants I have ever had the joy of eating at. The lamb steak T-bone was literally to die for. The service was great as well. Everyone seemed to work together to make sure we were comfortable. It is pricey...but you get what you pay for.
author: Frankie V.

description: Generally unimpressive.  Classic items were "overdone" with sauces and excessive garnish.  Quality of ingredients was good which helped save the experience.  Service was very slow and inattentive.  It took way too long to get basic water and bread,then sat for 15 min between apps and mains... Sat with empty wine/water glasses for 20 min waiting for deserts.  Generally unimpressed.
author: Ken W.

description: SUCH amazing food! The ravioli appetizer melted in our mouths! Perfect date night. Pricey but so worth it and fun to dress up for a night out. Our server was awesome and was really on it when it came to my food allergies. He made it a point to explain everything to me when bringing out our food.
author: Crystal R.

description:
I must confess, I'm in love with Boulevard the first time my taste buds meet the scrumptious and well-prepared dishes from this establishment. It's super hard to get a reservation but everything about this place always bring me back for more.

From the ambiance all the way to the way the food is prepared, I know quality is always on first priority. I've been here at least 3 times now and this place manages to wow me every time. How do  you do that? love.magic.awesome...

I can't wait for my next meal with you.
author: Taffany H.

description:
I have to admit my expectations were quite high for boulevard. We came here for my birthday the other week and right away we were greeted with a 'happy birthday Natasha' from the hostess (kudos) 
The service was outstanding! 
The food on the other hand was just ok
Unfortunately the appetizers were the most delicious part of the experience. The main courses were alright and the dessert was bleh. Starting off the night with bomb appetizers lead us to believe the rest of the dishes would be just as amazing but it wasn't :/
author: Natasha I.

description: This place is excellent! Well worth the wait to get a table.  One of the best restaurants in the Bay Area!
author: Dan G.

description: You don't see very many restaurants at full capacity at 6:00pm on a Wednesday; there's a good reason for it - it's outstanding!  I never order pork chops in a restaurant, in fact I don't think I've had a pork chop in 30 years but this one was well worth the wait. If you want a special dining experience with top notch service and delicious cuisine go no further.
author: Andrew L.

description:
For our annual holiday dinner we went to Boulevard this year.  I've heard many times that Boulevard was a great restaurant but didn't have the opportunity to try it out until now.  

The food at Boulevard is certainly pricey, but I enjoyed almost everything that we ordered.  The seared foie gras appetizer was cooked perfectly and the accompaniments helped cut the richness of the goose live.  The seared scallops and tuna tartare were good but very standard preparations.  The lamb chop, steak and lamb entrees were all seared cooked to the right temperatures, tender and juicy.  I thought the standout for the evening was definitely the desserts.  The cinnamon bon bons and flour-less chocolate cake were outstanding.  

My only gripe is with the staff at the host stand.  They were too busy chatting amongst themselves to greet me or to offer coat check for my overcoat.  After meeting up with my cousins and sister at the bar, since our table was not yet ready, I realized neither were they as everyone still had their coats with them.  I initially thought that they really didn't have a coat check until I saw a closet full of jackets near our table.  Good thing our waiter didn't share the same work ethic as the hosts, he provided great service throughout the evening and made the experience enjoyable.  

Overall Boulevard provides solid food and service for the most part, but quite pricey for what you are getting.
author: Wei K.

description:
Came here to celebrate my new job with my friends.  First thing i notice is how beautiful the ceilings are, and really just the restaurant in general.  Second thing i notice is the amazing service.  They were there to greet us right when we walked in, and we were seated promptly.  From the moment we sat down to the moment we left, we received amazing service.  the servers were polite and knowledgeable.  They were there when you wanted them, and not there when you didn't.

Food:

Scallops - were amazing.  the scallops themselves were perfectly seared on the outside and tender and flavorful inside.  The mix of veggies and/or fruits that was served with it was almost as good as the scallops themselves.

Red Abolone - First time eating abalone and i have no complaints.  Was coated in amaranth seeds and what seemed like a chickpea batter, but i could be wrong on that.  was served with delicious asparagus and on top of some type of pureed salsa verde sauce which was delicious.  my only complaint is that the salsa kind of overpowered the abalone a tad.

Burrata and squash blossom ravioli with shaved white truffles:  hands down the best thing we ate.  It was homemade pasta, and it had squash blossoms and burrata......and truffles....what more do you need to say?

Sea Bass - Done up with capers and lemon and served with favas, beech mushrooms, and a purple potato and on top of some really amazing asparagus.   It was a really good dish overall BUT i have had better cuts of sea bass.   it tasted fresh, and all of the flavors on the plate worked really well, but i didnt think that the actual sea bass had a ton of flavor.   The texture was slightly off too.  It was a little mushy, ie - it didnt exactly flake off when you put your fork in it, rather the flakes sort of disintegrated when you put your fork to it.  

Desserts:  we all shared desserts.  They were all amazing.  Had chocolate creme pot, some peanut butter thing and a brown sugar crusted angel food cake with rhubarbs.  All were spot on.....albeit rich.

Drinks:  hmmm......love the wine selection.  They were all excellent.  The cocktail program.....eh.  I know they are not known for cocktails, but, being in a city known for cocktails, i feel like they are lagging behind the competition.  Had a cucumber gimlet :-/  Ok, it was a good gimlet, but you can get that anywhere.  The other cocktails on the menu seemed to be total alcohol bombs or WAY too sweet.

All in all, this is a really solid restaurant.  I would go back, but i dont think i would get fish as an entree.  I have heard that Boulevard is better known for cooking meat as opposed to fish, and i was THIS CLOSE to getting the pork chop.  The only reason i didnt was because it was a nice day in the city, and the pork chop seemed like a really great dish for a cold winter day.  I understand WHY this place is an institution and why it has been here for so long.....long after many restaurants have come and gone.  Its a great place to bring a person who appreciates good food, but may not be the most adventurous eater (like mom or dad, or other family or maybe a business dinner).  But it is great for foodies alike as well.  It has something for everybody.  

Boulevard did not fall short of expecations....nor did it exceed them.
author: Christian C.

description:
Apps were amazing. Entrees meh. The one dessert we had was a major disappointment.

Overall not bad meal but for the price and the hype.. not quite up to expectations.

MUST-HAVES: lobster ravioli, fig & grape salad.

* Service
5 stars, as expected from an establishment like this. Always prompt, professional.

* AHI TUNA TARTARE - 4 stars
(Pickled Plum & Wasabi Tobiko, Avocado & Fresh Wasabi Root, Horseradish Rice Cracker, Hodo Soy Tofu & Lemon Ginger Pickles. $17.75)
Really really nice the way the tuna and avocado interacted. The tuna was fresh and tender. The cracker added some good texture.

* MAINE LOBSTER PYRAMID RAVIOLI - 4.5 stars
(Lobster Sabayon Sauce, Spicy Tomato Emulsion, Lobster Mushrooms & Opal Basil. $18)
Amazing. The ravioli was soft, buttery, and the lobster so fresh and full of flavor. Loved this.

* BLACK MISSION FIG & LATE SUMMER GRAPE SALAD - 5 stars
(Bucheron Goat Cheese, Pistachios & Mixed Organic Lettuces, Fresh Fig Jam with Rosemary & Smoked Salt, Honey & Aged Balsamic Syrup. $14.25)
Loved this so much! The figs/ greens/ pistachios/ goat cheese/ balsamic went AMAZINGLY together. Absolutely wonderful.

* PAN ROASTED CALIFORNIA WHITE SEA BASS - 3 stars
(Dungeness Crab & Mussel Beignet, Saffron Aioli, Black Risotto with Shellfish Broth, Roasted & Clarified Tomato Relish with Lemon Olive Oil. $34)
I had this dish 6 days ago now and I honestly can't remember a thing about it. That must say something.. it certainly wasn't bad, but didn't stand out very much. One thing I do remember was the risotto was just not what I expected (I guess I should've asked what black risotto was like) as it's much like black rice in that it is much harder in texture, and even though it's soaked in a broth, it was somehow dry and bland in flavor.

* WOOD OVEN ROASTED CALIFORNIA LAMB PRIME T-BONE WOOD OVEN ROASTED ON THE BONE, SERVED OFF THE BONE - 3 stars
(Hand Rolled Fregola Sarda, Market Squash & Ricotta Salata, Rossa Bianca Eggplant with Roasted Tomato & Grilled Padron Peppers, Almonds & Castelvetrano Olives, Lamb Jus & Roasted Red Pepper Sauce. $37)
While the lamb was really good, I've definitely had more tender steaks, especially at this price range. I don't remember much else about this dish so nothing really stood out about it.

* STRAWBERRY WATERMELON ICE CREAM CAKE - 2 stars
(Layers of Double Strawberry Ice Cream, Vanilla Chiffon Cake, Watermelon Sorbet, Orange Blossom Scented Cream, Vanilla Wafer Crust, Strawberry Pate de Fruit. $11)
Somehow my friends liked this, but I thought this dessert was SO cheap looking (and tasting!). For a restaurant of this caliber, I think frozen fruits are a huge no-no, and this cake was CLEARLY topped with frozen strawberries. The cake just had a weird thick and way too hard texture (like when ice cream has been sitting in the freezer for too long), and I really couldn't distinguish the strawberry/ watermelon/ orange flavors. There was a slice of watermelon on the side.. random, I think more to add to the physical appearance. Plus it wasn't that fresh or sweet either.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Been here twice and I have only great things to say about this place (except for their ambience which didn't really match up to the "Michellin star" rating in my head). Anyhow the staff was really humble, food was amazing both the times. We have had the Sea Scallops, Tomatoes & Burrata, Halibut, Salmon, Filet Mignon, Dark Chocolate with Honey Mousse Dessert and it was all just oh so impeccable!
author: Shweta M.

description:
I came here for a nice date night with my boyfriend and we had amazing service! Everywhere we go, it's our "anniversary" so we got a cute spot right in the front of the restaurant with the corner window, it was a really cute table to sit at.

I had the Moscow Mule and I asked them to add jalapenos in my drink, just the way I like and our waiter was able to ask the bartender to do that and also give me a side of jalapenos just in case it wasn't enough in my drink.

We had:
Sea Scallops - this was amazing, super fresh and all the little sides on the dish made it even more amazing
Steak - the steak was delicious for me, I didn't care for the grilled tomato, I LOVED the corn mixture under the steak
Pork Chop - the BEST THING EVER! I normally don't order pork chops, I find them to be dry, but my boyfriend ordered it since it was recommended by the waiter and it was amazing, the whole dish was delicious!!
Sweet Meringue dessert - we LOVED this! we cleaned up the entire plate. It was like eating soft marshmallows with sweet cooked peaches and sorbet with creme anglaise, sooo good! The waiter only poured a little of the creme anglaise and I ended up pouring the rest on the dessert!

We had an amazing date night at the Boulevard!
author: Jenny N.

description:
My first visit to Boulevard was when it opened in the early 90's. I was living in SF, totally mesmerized by the City. Boulevard was one of the places, like Farallon and Bix, that made San Francisco even more magical, like they were creations of the City and could only exist there.

Fast forward to a very, very overdue review...written from Chicago, where I live now, and countless dinners at Boulevard over the years.

Mesmerizing. More 'of the City' than I realized back in the day. 

I love the floor, the ceiling, the small bar, the lighting, the walls, having to go out the back and then downstairs to the restroom, the way Bay light infuses the place. Instead of big and open, it's long a somewhat narrow except in the back facing the Bay, like a mashup of speakeasy, diner and Orient Express dining car.

The food still rates 5-stars, a tough act in the restaurant business. So maybe 6- or 7-stars just for staying relevant and worthy.

The service still rates 5-stars. Discreet, not fawning, timely.

And they had a bottle of Elit Vodka in a room behind the bar....not bad because I can't find it anywhere and it is a nice alternative to a Grey Goose or Ciroc dry martini.

Highly recommended, no matter if you're local or visiting.
author: Hendrix B.

description:
I give this restaurant 5 strong stars for atmosphere, service, food, price and overall experience. 

Upon walking in the restaurant the building is super old and super cute. Inside the we were kindly greeted by a hostess. We had a 9pm reservation but it was a Saturday and the place was packed! We waited at the bar and had some specialty cocktails, which by the way were incredibly made and super strong. We ended up getting seated at our table at about 9:20pm, but it was really no big deal because, it was very apparent that every staff member was working their you know what off to get people seated, fed and served. 

We ordered two starters the Gnoccho Grande 'Carbonara and the Ahi Tuna Ito-ZukuriI. Both were great, however the Gnoccho was OUT OF THIS WORLD!!  It was perfectly cooked with an amazing blend of flavors that went perfectly well with one another. 

For our main dishes we ordered the Filet Mignon and the Wild King Salmon. Both were amazing in both taste and presentation.

Our favorite dish was definitely the Gnoccho though.

Our waitress was always very attentive and super friendly. 

The price for the two starters and two main courses and a small scoop of sherbert was around $140 not bad at all!!
author: Sydnee T.

description:
An excellent 5-star dining experience. I came here last night for a private event, where we sat in the room downstairs, which was lovely although quite dark. I only mention where we sat because when walking through the restaurant it was apparent that the volume level was rather loud. I don't know what it would have been like to have a conversation upstairs.

The service was exceptional and the food was incredible. We had the heirloom tomatoes (Caprese-esk style dish) as an appetizer and the halibut with risotto and mushrooms for an entree. Everything was delicious. 

If you have relatives visiting in the city and they want to go to a high-end restaurant, this is most certainly a place to consider.
author: Lauren J.

description: Great service. We were seated quickly. We were a party of 6.  For the price, I felt they could have made the portions a bit larger while still maintaining a tasteful display. People with medium/large appetites should be prepared to either leave hungry, or add on some appetizers and leave with a large bill. I was actually not hungry so I only ordered the crab salad appetizer. It was full of crab and prepared nicely.
author: Susanna C.

description:
Dinner tonight was nothing short of amazing. The lamb was so good,it will be remembered.
If you have the chance ask for Ethan as your waiter, he is a treasure for this restaurant. He made our meal one of the most enjoyable evening we as a groups has ever had. Try the apple cake for dessert, yum.
author: Luanne P.

description: The Boulevard is just a classic SF location and the professionalism starts out front with the valet. The finer points you just notice. it's always a #fridaylunch spot I look forward to going to again and again. People recommend (& I agree,) sitting upstairs in the back, but there is a table in the front in the corner that's pretty nice so long as the sun not shining directly in the window. Sat with a great colleague this Friday had the scallop risotto appetizer and, as usual, ahi tartare app as well. Both done to perfection.  But for the delay in getting my partner's 1st #whiskeysmash, near perfection for a getaway day.
author: Vince C.

description:
5 stars for this spot on just the lunch menu I will need to come back possibly for dinner haha

I was able to sample some of their items  during my lunch period with a friend. first impressions, snazzy outfit in the front kind of made you feel like you should be wearing 3 piece suit to eat here. after getting seated by the counter where all the action is because you can see all the chefs prepping the food and working their brillance onto plates, I then did not feel like I was required to be wearing a suit, business casual felt more acceptable haha

We got to sample Kobe Beef Burger, Maine Lobster Risotto, and some Scallops just for sitting right in front.

The Kobe Beef Burger was juicy one of the better burgers that I have had that bares the name of Kobe on it, bun was light beef was delicious and juicy, the burgers contents all meshed well together the bun was again light meshed well with the cheese they chose and the tomato also played a part in pulling the burger together, this is a definite must try if in the area

The Maine Lobster Risotto was what you expect in risotto, creamy buttery goodness with helpful hand of lobster.

the scallops were offered to us just for eating at the counter and watching and commenting the chefs on their craft. I guess they noticed and had us sample one of the appitizers. I can honestly say I have not had a better scallop made ANYWHERE, slight char creates a slight crunch on the bite, buttery all the way through and the flavor was amazing!!

I have to come back here for dinner definitely is a must, hats off to the staff and chefs, all of them

food ***** excellence you can taste it
price $$ pricey but delicious
service ***** from a spot like this even if your wearing jeans you get top notch service
ambiance ***** open, snazzy feel, again staff very helpful
author: Clarence A.

description: Nice space, and very pleasant staff. However, the food was nothing special (the swordfish suffered in comparison to what is offered by Sam's Grill), and somewhat overpriced.
author: Jethro B.

description:
I've only been here for lunch, but my three visits have been very pleasant experiences.  Even for lunch, I think reservations are a good idea. 

I love the ambiance - with the stained glass behind the bar, the brick ceiling, and the dark wood paneling throughout the restaurant you really feel like you've left the world outside.  There are cute booths for couples (you can comfortably and snugly dine next to each other).  

Sole = eh. The potatoes and greens (esp. the citrus on the greens) was really good, but the fish itself was not cooked well. 
Buratta heirloom tomato = amazing. The burrata was fresh and came with sea salt and some type of aioli - pinenuts on top added the perfect crunch. 
Ahi tuna lunch entree with the stuffed peppers - light and delicious. 
Ahi tartare appetizer - kind of hard to share with the table but really good.
Crab salad for 19.50 while tiny for the price is also really good (the mix of spices and coconut milk make the flavors stand out).

Also love their dirty girl alpine strawberries and berry crisp for desserts!

Finally, service is wonderful -- they are present when you need them, but in no way pushy.
author: Kimya P.

description:
I was skeptical to take my gf here for her birthday dinner due to some negative reviews I read on yelp. Unfortunate for some yelpers, they apparently did not receive the service they had expected for the price. My experience, however, stands apart from those reviews because of the professional and outstanding service we received upon our visit at Boulevard.

When we arrived, the hostess greeted us kindly and wished my gf a happy birthday. We were shown to our table, and our server (good-looking white male in his late twenties, maybe early thirties) kindly approached us. He was extremely helpful with our selection of our courses, as it was our first time dining at Boulevard and we were unfamiliar with the menu. 

I did a good amount of research aka reading through yelp reviews so I was warned that portions are on the small side. We ended up trying three appetizers and two entrees. Two appetizers and two mains would have sufficed, because the mains were actually decent sized for french american cuisine. We got the rabbit meat balls which tasted the best although I still can't mentally get over that I ate Bugs Bunny. Also the ahi tartar which consisted of the freshest ahi tuna I have ever tasted in my life, and the veal scallops (tasted good but its slimy texture freaked me out.) After sharing the three appetizers and having one slice of complimentary bread, I was already almost full (I don't eat a lot) so I guess this took away from my entree, the lamb chops, which I enjoyed but barely ate less than half. My girlfriend ordered the pork chop (which was the most popular item on the menu and most reviewed item on yelp) and she couldn't help but finish every last bite because of (I quote) "how amazing it is." 

Dessert we ordered (butterscotch pudding) came out with a candle and a "happy birthday" chocolate plaque. It was sooooo good.
