Overall it was a good experience, and I am so glad that service was extremely on point and the food was great. The only reason why I did not rate this restaurant 5 stars is because I recently had both Redd and Bottega in Yountville and I feel that the food was slightly better there.
author: Vicky H.

description:
Every once in a while I eat a meal that's better than me. A collection of food that's operating at a level that's beyond what my hundreds of reviews have even come close to experiencing in stupid Wichita, KS. 

While I can comment on how I was able to walk in off the street and grab a seat at the bar, and while I might be able to talk about the similarities in textures and shapes of the truffled mushroom dumpling, maitake and porcini sausage, and pressed hen; the complimentary flavors of the earthy mushrooms, gamey hen, and root vegetables, or how the jus worked to bring everything together, it's all probably a bit out of my element. So I will suffice with my knowledge that I have dined at a restaurant of a caliber that I rarely see outside of gushing talking heads on television.

PAN ROASTED CALIFORNIA GUINEA HEN PRESSE 
Truffled Mushroom Dumplings with Sage & Brown Butter
Roasted Maitake Mushrooms & Porcini Sausage with Kale
Soft Celery Root, Roasted Bird Jus
28.00
author: Brad S.

description: Everything on the menu looked wonderful. I had the pork chop which was amazing. The best jewel of the night was the Moscow Mule. Perfection!! I have it a four for the price and wait.
author: Kristy M.

description:
Here is why Boulevard earns five stars from me:

1.  The food was delicious! I ate every last crumb and scraped my plate clean.  We had the fillet mignon and swordfish.  The fillet was served with a steak knife but it truly wasn't needed.  Even using a regular knife that steak was so tender that it cute like butter, I'm not even exaggerating.

2. Jeff H. is an excellent waiter.  He is super knowledgeable about the food and personable.  And of course he, like everyone at Boulevard provided superb service.

3. I have a crush on Ms. Jessica Sullivan even though I've never met her.  She is the pastry chef and her Banana Cream Pie was crazy good (presentation and taste).

4. Since my date and I started the evening at Cliff House and Top of the Mark for cocktails and aps (and wanted to save room for dessert) we didn't get a starter at Boulevard but they brought us a complimentary yummy little plate of black chickpea hummus with baked lavash.

5. Even though the kitchen was open to the restaurant, and the restaurant was at about 95% capacity it wasn't loud.  My bf and I had nice conversation and couldn't hear anyone else's.  Perfect.

6. The decor is interesting.  It looks old but I understand it to be all artisan work done inside the shell of an old building.  Also, the kitchen is open to the dining room which I've always thought to be the sign of a restaurant with good sanitation.  Moreover, in this case, it was fascinating to see a brigade of eight-plus chefs on the line.  

7. When arriving for our reservation, we were promptly seated. The hostess took our coats for us table-side and brought back our coat check number to us.  When we were getting up to leave our coats were quickly brought to us.  I feel like its so rare now that I come across this type of table-side coat check service...but then again, I do live in San Diego. 

8.  A few days before my reservation the restaurant called to confirmed. I like a restaurant that is on top of the details.

The restaurant wasn't as romantic as I had hoped but maybe that is because we were seated next to the open kitchen but that is just a small nit.  I would definitely return and come for steak and dessert if nothing else.
author: Courtney K.

description: We dined at Boulevard last evening and the experience was pleasant for the most part. The cuisine was nice and our server was excellent. I'm conflicted with giving the restaurant three stars, but after speaking with the Better Business Bureau I've decided this rating is fair. The Maître D' made homophobic comments at the beginning of our meal which poisoned our experience. I didn't fly on an intercontinental flight to be subjected to inappropriate questions and offensive subject matter. After learning we were in San Francisco celebrating a bachelorette party Sheila took it upon herself to ask why I was invited. After the bride  explained I was her childhood friend and that the thought processes of the 1950s should not be used to pigeonhole us into superficial gender roles she proceeded to suggest I was only invited because I was the party planner. If there is truth in this world, I will not sit idly by while humans decide it is their place in a professional setting to pass judgment on others, let alone customers. My children will know a more compassionate world where their peers are treated with dignity and respect whether Boulevard's employees represent these qualities or not.
author: Zane L.

description: Great atmosphere for our Christmas Eve lunch. We've been here several times before and each time the food has been great. This time we specifically chose it because we had heard they can do gluten free, and my dad has celiac disease. The wait staff was incredibly knowledgable and helpful, and most of the menu was able to be made gluten free. Definitely a good find for gluten free!!
author: Claire M.

description:
My mother and I came here for dinner. It was highly recommended by friends who have excellent taste. We had an excellent experience. The ambiance was stylish. At the right table towards the rear of the restaurant, if you're lucky to be seated there, you will enjoy views of the bridge and the bay.  We were promptly seated on time for our 6 pm reservation. 
We sat across the open kitchen and could enjoy the aroma of deliciousness. I ordered a cocktail called the Bees Knees. This herbaceous gin-based cocktail was the perfect balance of sweet and sour with honey and citrus topped off with a sage leaf. 
My mother ordered the halibut which she thoroughly enjoyed along with a glass of Rioja. My mother is not an easy lady to win over either!
I enjoyed the Berkshire pork chop.  I would definitely come back and order anything off their menu. You can't go wrong!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Great place, great food, great ambiance - never eaten at a Michelin star rated restaurant?  Eat here!

My friend and I walked in on a random Tuesday night to have dinner.  A quick look at the menu showed that they lacked vegetarian options.  I was ready to leave but the maître d' said they could make whatever I wanted.  I made a couple of requests and I was still skeptical.  But I was pleasantly surprised when my food came out awesome!  They definitely showed that they earned those Michelin stars.  Great date place for the ambiance and location on SOMA.  But it's pricy so be prepared to draw extra cash from the ATM before heading over there.
author: Vijay M.

description:
Hmm, I am sad to give them only three stars, but the quality,service, and ambiance do not justify their prices. Plus with such a wide selection of "fine" dining in SF, Boulevard needs to step it up!!!

I have been to Boulevard twice, and the second time still disappointed me as the first time.

The first time, I came with a party of 10 (prob 4 years ago) and booked a private room in the cellar; Of course there was a minimum (that now I can't remember...it was like $1200 or something along the line--definitely a minimum of $100/person); we easily met the minimum with three bottles of wine and a three course meal.

This time around, we ordered:
1) Drinks: Prosecco (3/5) and raspberry lemonade (2.5/5)
2) Appetizer: Royal sweet scallops (4/5)
3) Mains: Alaskan Halibut (3/5) and Lamb Prime T-bone (2.5)
4) Dessert: Chocolate Pecan, Seven layers (4/5)
author: Jen H.

description:
I'm a Bay Area Native and know where to get amazing food, large portions, often for cheap. So, when I go to a high-priced restaurant--sure the service and atmosphere is important--but if the entree is "so-so" ... the whole package aint worth it.

My $33 pork chop was dry. 

For that price, every bite should transport me to another world. Not-so-much for me. 

Also, my partner's entree was undercooked ... they picked up the tab. Reviews like this are difficult to leave because the service was great, the atmosphere was very  nice and the drinks were cheap: A Bullit Rye Whiskey Manhattan was only $10. 

If you're from out of town, this place will likely rock. Locals ... you could get more creative and get a bigger bang for your buck.
author: Scott S.

description:
I went last night on a day spent in San Francisco and it was a great way to end the evening before me and friend headed back to SFO.  This place was suggested by a friend who heard how wonderful it was but never been to, now I can report back and say it was excellent.

We had to dine early, 5:30p (to make our flight).  It is just the type of restaurant I like, casual but elegant and was large enough and the noise level is just perfect to enjoy a good laugh and not feel you're the loudest person in the place.  The kitchen has a bar so diners can sit and enjoy the meal while watching the chefs create great dishes.

My friend and I ordered two appetizers to share, the lobster ravioli and the ahi tuna.  The ahi tuna is served with purple potato chips (you get only 5) but we felt we needed a few more, which our server was happy to oblige.  Both were very delicious and perfect to split among two people.  As for our entrées we ordered the quail (recommended by our server, a delightful gal who was super enjoyable and professional) and the filet mignon which was cooked to perfection.   We also split the flourless chocolate cake, which we promptly finished so we could catch the BART back to the airport in time.  (on the advice of our server, did I mention how much we loved her?)

We also ordered a bottle of wine, wonderfully recommended by our server and we loved that she didn't go for the most expensive choice but surprisingly, the least pricey one.  We enjoyed the selection with our meal and finished the bottle no problem. 

I loved the ambience really enjoyed our meal.  I would totally go again and the next time I'm in the city, I will be sure to make reservations there again!
author: C R.

description: One of faves to celebrate. Great atmosphere, service, and fresh food. Had a variety of entrees here and everything was great. A desert that made it in my memory is the banana cream pie
author: Richard C.

description:
Beautiful decor. Good service
Limited and expensive menu
The food was very good, but
given the price it didn't wow me
author: W K.

description:
Came here for the second time with the bf for a nice lunch date. They were just opening for lunch, so we got seated very quickly, along with a bunch of other people who had been waiting. Our waiter was very nice. Although he clumsily dropped the menu onto my dish in the beginning. He recommended some appetizers and entrees that just happened to be what we were eyeing, so we ended up getting all his recommendations. We had the seared scallop risotto and ahi tuna tartare as appetizers and the wood oven roasted pork and pan roasted swordfish entrees. My bf liked the fish, but my pork dish was really not that great. I stopped eating halfway through it. We concluded that the scallop risotto was the best out of everything. 

During my first time here, I got the kobe beef burger and an assortment of appetizers, including the squash blossoms, glazed sea scallops, and carpaccio. They were all good, but overall I felt that the food didn't live up to the expectations that their prices set for me.
author: Rose Y.

description:
Boulevard is one of those places where it's hard to give anything less than 5 stars.  No complaints.

Fancy and elegant.  The drinks were awesome and the food was divine.  Service was great.  I also sat facing the bay bridge and saw all the designs of the lights flash by throughout my entire dinner.  There is a reason why Boulevard earned a Michelin star.  

Best birthday dinner yet.  Maybe the ring I got skewed my review for Boulevard?  Loved it.
author: Shirley T.

description:
In a talk given in Lafayette, Thomas Keller said that food is all reference points, and indeed, he was right. Because once my teeth dug into the most tender abalone, once my taste buds became enchanted by the sweetness of a lobster scallop duo, and my senses experienced the most beautifully executed chocolate dessert, there was no turning back. No doubt in our minds, Boulevard deserved the coveted Michelin Star. It was a perfect way to celebrate our first Valentine's together. 

People believe dropping Benjamins on food that will only take a few minutes to devour is such a waste of hard earned money, but I defiantly disagree. Food of this caliber will resonate with me for life.

My memorable dishes:

Monterey Red Abalone, Roasted Abalone Mushroom, Clamshell Mushrooms, Chives & Lemon Aioli-Tender, tart, and savory. Whom ever created this dish was very well aware that the taste and texture would create the most satisfying combination. The mushrooms and abalone were so tender that I struggled to distinguish one from the other. The tartiness of the lemon aioli enhanced the overall dish while the chives and fried shallots carried the dish to the finish line, making it not only my first, but favorite entree of the night.

Maine Lobster & Royal Sweet Sea Scallop, Meyer Lemon & Limoncello Risotto, Black Trumpet Mushroom & Crispy Sunchokes, Lemon & Chive-Thus far the most naturally sweet and succulent lobster and scallop I've tasted. The ingredients used really brought out the flavor of the seafood resulting in a lobster and scallop triumph elevated by creamy risotto and crispy sunchokes.

Chocolate Macaron with Roasted White Chocolate, Chocolate Mirror Glaze & Chocolate Curls, Truffles, Pressed Pear & Pistachio Tuile, Pistachio Ice Cream-A busy, chaotic masterpiece. Simplicity is overrated and this dessert kept my attention because of its complexity. My eyes couldn't focus on just a single part of the dessert but hopped from the chocolate truffle and macaron, to the ball of pistachio ice cream and scoop of roasted white chocolate laid out on top of a platform of chocolate heaven. I'd love to meet the pastry chef who created such a divine chocolatey treat.

The quality food, delightful ambiance, top-notch service and let's not forget the cozy love seat booth, all lend to the amazing experience we had at Boulevard. A perfect way to celebrate our first Valentine's and mark the beginning of more great things (and food) to come.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Boulevard is on me and hubby's SF/Bay Area best 100 restaurant list....  Soooooo here it is (only 3 stars - sorry boulevard)

Great food - get the calamari lobster dish

Nice ambiance - business casual; mixed crowd 

Great wait staff/service - attentive 

Small portions - yep!  

$$$$$ - for the money should have bigger portions...I'm just saying:)

Oh dont forget Dessert - flourless choc cake - not feeling it! But the cheesecake is savory, light & decadent!!!!  I coulda ate 3 pieces!!!!!
author: Sasha T.

description:
Our recent trip to Boulevard was an utter let down.  It took over an HOUR to receive our entrees with no apology or explanation from the waiter.  When the food came out, it was cold and looked like it had been sitting for awhile.  When it came time to close out our tab, we sat at our table for over 20 minutes waiting to pay while we watched our server socialize and mess around near the bar.  Seriously?  Maybe if I was paying 10 bucks for my meal, not 100.

At a restaurant with the caliber of Boulevard's, the level of service and quality of our plates was complete garbage.  It's unlikely we'll be back.
author: Laci G.

description:
I would give Boulevard SIX stars if I could! My wife and I were visiting San Francisco a couple of weeks ago and we met up with a bunch of friends for dinner at Boulevard. There were 12 of us in our party (we did make reservations four weeks in advance). 

Our table was ready for us when we all arrived and it was spectacular. It was up on a raised section of the restaurant with a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge and the Embarcadero. 

While the setting was perfect (the decor is classy and tasteful), you can't taste beauty, so on to the food: In a word, it was delicious. You would think that with a huge party and everyone ordering something different, there would be one or two stumbles, but there was not a single one. Everything from the service to the wine list to the food was flawless. My abalone appetizer was amazing. And the pan roasted "king" quail was not only rich and succulent, it was filling! Everyone was raving about their dish and at one point, there was a pretty comical scene where we were all swapping plates around the table so that everyone could try a bite of every dish. The Sommelier (Jon) did an amazing job of picking exceptional wines to please a wide range of palates and plates while staying well within our "budget." 

I have had the pleasure of dinning around San Francisco over the years and I love Gary Danko and Quince and Frances, but Boulevard is the road to gastronomic happiness!
author: Scott G.

description:
I was there with my wife on this past Tuesday evening.  We were really looking forward to it.  We were with a group and had the 'Le Avenue' room downstairs from the main dining area.

For starters, the bar personnel couldn't have been more impersonal.  A place like Boulevard and no napkin placed under your drink???  No 'you're welcome' after saying 'thank you'???  These employees must be millennia generation (me, me, me).

Kept going down hill from there.  There were very good crab cakes being served as appetizers except there was one problem----you couldn't find any after the first serving!

Then came the dinner starting with what Boulevard considered a salad.  Most tasteless salad I have EVER had.  It had a concoction of some kind of creamed cheese in it with two of the worst tasting tomatoes sitting among lifeless greens and nary any dressing.  Terrible.  Inexcusable for a restaurant that has won so many awards.  Success has spoiled this place.

The entre was heralded on the menu as "Angus Filet Mignon".  Well, this old Angus steer must have been on a Jenny Craig diet before being destined for the dinner table because it was totally void of taste.  Add to the latter that it was dry and you had one unhappy diner.

You can have this place.  It saw my last dime.
author: Peter F.

description:
We had a private event here last night.  We had reserved their function room L'Avenue for the event.  Room was located downstairs under the restaurant.  It was kinda secluded but it was perfect for a group event.  Max capacity is 60, but it was great that our guests were under 50 because it gave us enough space to go around during cocktails.

Service was excellent!  Staff was attentive, courteous and very professional.  During cocktails, servers kept wine flowing and the passed hors d'eouvres were delicious -- we had the crab cakes and tuna tartar.   For dinner, we had the Burrata with figs for apps, choice of the pork chop or halibut for entrée, and choice of Pear Tatin or Butterscotch Pudding.  Food was good, not great.  We arranged for wines to be paired with the food like a simulated wine pairing so guest didn't have to think about what drink would go well with the food.  The sommelier helped us pick out the wines ahead of time when we finalized the menu.

All in all, it was a wonderful evening.  Our guests all seem to have enjoyed their meal and everyone had a great time.  Their catering manager, Pam, was super easy for work with.  Would definitely recommend for big parties (40-50 guests).
author: Christine A.

description:
I am amaze by the restaurant!!!!
The welcoming ++++
The service excellent
My food was excellent 
A big choice on the wine list
The atmosphere remind me a brasserie In France !!!!
Perfect I loved it !!!!
author: Pomme P.

description: I really enjoyed the food here. I came to eat alone and they have a nice section where you can sit and enjoy a good meal while watching the chefs prepare certain dishes. Next time I would like to try their selection of fish. Their filet mignon was cooked to perfection and they have a great desert menu. Definitely coming here again.
author: Pam M.

description: I like sitting down at the bar and enjoy watching chefs preparing the dishes in such an articulate way.  I usually pick seafood from the entree, but the meat dishes also look very yummy.
author: Kahori M.

description: I don't know who he was but all of sudden this guy (he was near front door. Not sure if he was a manager) came to our table and told us to turn down my son's iPad. The whole place was quite loud and I have no idea how he could hear the sound. I lost my appetite and we decided to come home without dessert. So sorry I lost one of my favourite restaurants in the city. I am not going back.
author: Amelie L.

description:
It's been years since I've been here. I remember pretty vividly their soft shell crab appetizer was so succulent. The dip it came with was an awesome compliment explosion in your mouth!
The chef was featured in the "Masters of food and wine"
author: Emily S.

description:
We unfortunately were not impressed by Boulevard. Let me start off by saying that we had been told it was a top romantic restaurant in the city and we definitely did not get that impression upon arrival and seating at our table. It felt very much more like an old established restaurant for business lunches and dinners. 
After we were seated, I ordered a drink off their specialty menu, only to be told they were out of the blood orange (immediately after being told the entire menu was available). So then I changed my drink to a Cosmo. But once it arrived, I had to send it back (which I never do), because it was just over the top with lime flavor. 
Our first course were the scallops, which were nicely done. Then I ordered the pork chops. I don't understand what previous reviewers were going on about over that dish ... My pork was tough and dry, bordering on inedible. I barely touched them. Luckily my husband's filet mignon was much nicer and he shared with me. 
After that experience, we decided to just cut our losses and skip dessert. Overall, we were disappointed by this restaurant choice on what was supposed to be the most romantic dinner of our trip. The night was salvaged by room service.
author: Patricia B.

description: My husband and I make often take a trip to San Francisco for the weekend just to eat at Boulevard. The food, drink, service and atmosphere is amazing! Some of the seasonal specials are just off the charts. There hasn't been one thing I've had here that hasn't made my mouth and my tummy happy! Make a reservation. It's always packed and a local favorite. If you walk-in, there will be an extensive wait or no availability.
author: AJ N.

description:
In a word- this place is Special. When you walk into the restaurant, you feel as though you are travelling back in time to an era where going out to dinner was a rare treat. All of the waiters are dressed formally and are there to accomodate you at every step of your visit- from taking your coat to walking you to show you where the restroom is (instead of just pointing or telling you). The restaurant itself is beautiful- from top to bottom. 

The food is nothing short of devine. I've been here twice and each time the food left me speechless. 

If you're in San Francisco, looking for a special place to dine- go here!
author: Nicky L.

description: Ok, we had reservations for a party of 7. We were celebrating a special occasion. Service was friendly and stupendous! We all started off with a appetizer each, drinks, entree, and dessert. Yes, the food possessed great flavors. I had the scallop appetizer and had the pork chop for dinner. Both looked mouth-watering and was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The cucumber gimlet was fresh and seemed like it was a perfectly mixed cocktail. Dessert-chococolate marshmallow and ice cream, and other "Congratulations" desserts that were given to the happy couple. Yes, it was a night to remember. We all enjoyed dining and being at the Boulevard!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
It is classic french in design.The space is wonderfully warm.And has a great view of the Bay Bridge near the front window.They source the best local ingredients.And there salads are spectacular in their clever ingredients combo, and simplicity.
It is pricey,but again,for a special lunch or dinner,very much worth it.
They have some solid wine choices under $40 which is quite a surprise.
Locals and foodie touristas alike love this place.
author: Mike H.

description:
Came here with another couple just to celebrate finally getting together since we had been wanting to do dinner for years and never had the chance. That's enough reason to celebrate! haha Food is delicious and everything is so crafted beautifully. It's a pricey penny but it's not unexpected. 

We came here with reservations for a very late reservation of 9:15pm but didn't show up until 9:35pm. I always wondered why people would ever come for dinner that late and now I was one of those people rolling in for a later dinner due to late friends, but oh wells. At least we didn't have to wait. 

Per my husband's research, we requested a table in the back near the windows so we could see the view of Embarcadero and the Bay Bridge Lights. Great recommendation and great seats! Good job hubby! :) Our friends loved it as well and were surprised. 

I think we already got on the wrong foot with our waiter when my friend wanted a strong drink and was recommended the Mule drink, it wasn't strong enough for her and tasted almost like a lemonade. Oh wells not anyone's fault really, it's a preference. But I think from there our waiter didn't like us and wouldn't chat with us and was very cordial but moved on. He almost had no tolerance to wait on us. 

My husband and I ordered as an appetizer the Porcinis & Crispy Pork Belly to share. Our friend had the King Quail and she said it was delicious. Our shared appetizer was delicious, so many great flavors with the wild rice and the pork belly with the porcinis. However, there was only 2 tiny pieces of pork belly on the entire plate... c'monnnn reeally? I get that it's about quality not quantity. But I barely got to taste the quality with a tiny piece of pork and was hungry for me. Luckily the wild rice kept my stomach happy. 

As for entrees, both the guys got the Porkchop and I ordered the Chicken and my girl-friend got the Lamb. Everyone raved about their food. The porkchop was super thick and was very tender and flavour. My guinea hen was super tender and delicious as well. My friend's lamb was really yum and not gamey. 

For dessert, I got the Apricot Bon-Bon and my husband got the Flourless Chocolate Cake. I liked how the Bon-Bon is a tiny ball and one item, it's nice if you want something sweet but don't want a full plate of sweets. My husband's item of the Flourless Chocolate cake was delicious and there was A LOT going on. There was a scoop of olive oil ice cream, pistachio-crusted truffle, gummies, caramel brown-rice crisps and of course the flourless chocolate cake. All very delicious!!! 

All in all a great meal of course. I would expect no less from a Michelin-star and from the highly raved Boulevard.
author: Grace L.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Boulevard for a long time and it's definitely been built up in my head. We came here for a business dinner, and this place definitely has an old school charm to it. It's a bit dark inside, and has a feel of deals getting done while people smoke cigars and sip their cognac.

For starters we ordered a lot of different things to share, and the items that stood out were the tuna tartare, the wild boar pasta (absolutely melt in your mouth delicious), the pear and endive salad and the salad with crab.

For the main, I had the pork prime rib chop. Let's start with the fact that it was perfectly cooked - absolutely tender inside and carmelized on the outside. The pears were a wonderful pairing and the sweet potato cannoli was a nice and delicious twist.

I ended the meal with the mocha caramel mousse, which is big enough to share, and thankfully didn't taste too sweet.

To say that it's pricey is probably an understatement, but overall, this is a great place for a special occasion or business event. And definitely worth a splurge if you've never been!
author: Maria G.

description:
Valentine's Day is major pressure especially if it's the first one with your special someone. You do your best to make the right choice and have faith in the restaurant to execute sublimely. Showing up on the day before Valentine's Day to celebrate, I must say this SF classic surely lived up to the expectations and more.

The night started off with a surprise as we were directed not to a table where we would sit across from each other, but to a loveseat booth along the wall. Didn't know how we were so fortunate to get one of these booths but it was pleasant to see. We were positioned as to see the open kitchen in action which fascinated both of us.

Appetizers:
Monterey Red Abalone, Roasted Abalone Mushroom, Clamshell Mushrooms, Chives & Lemon Aioli: My lady's dish and while I got only a couple bites of it, the abalone was amazingly tender. The lemon aioli brightened up the umami of the abalone and mushrooms. 

Lobster Bisque, Lobster & Mussel Fritters, Fresh Prawn & Aioli: Pure, intense lobster flavor. The bisque is poured tableside into the small bowl where a couple fritters and a prawn reside. It was lobster to the umpteenth level. The mussels were plump and juicy and the prawn was succulent. I wish I had more of all of those components.

Entrees:
Maine Lobster & Royal Sweet Sea Scallop, Meyer Lemon & Limoncello Risotto, Black Trumpet Mushroom & Crispy Sunchokes, Lemon & Chive: The lady's entree was a winner. It was a mixture of textures and flavors. The sweet lobster and scallop. The risotto elevated your tastebuds. The earthiness of the mushroom. The added texture of the sunchokes. It was the entree I had my eye on but I'm glad I chose.....

Wood Oven Roasted Heritage Pork Prime Rib Chop, Butterball Potatoes with Parmesan & Crunchy Prosciutto Croutons, Sauteed Swiss Chard with Garlic & Chile Flakes, Smoked Dates & Kumquat, Roasted Pork Jus with Rosemary: A healthy sized pork prime rib chop for a restaurant of this caliber. It was not tough and melted in my mouth with each bite. The potatoes were slightly bland and the swiss chard was a bit salty. The smokey dates were a surprisingly pleasant note to the dish. Reminded me of fruity bacon.

Desserts:
Chocolate Macaron with Roasted White Chocolate, Chocolate Mirror Glaze & Chocolate Curls, Truffles, Pressed Pear & Pistachio Tuile, Pistachio Ice Cream: It's a chocoholic's dessert. I could barely get a couple bites from my lady. But it was decadent and the canele of roasted white chocolate tasted similarly to caramel. 

Toffee Dusted Doughnuts, Vanilla & Butterscotch Pudding, Cocoa Streusel & Apple Caramel: I'm a doughnut fiend so when I saw this on the menu I had to have it. I enjoyed the toffee coating but the doughnuts were more dense and dry than I would have liked. I'm not a fan of butterscotch but I was happy with the pudding, which you scoop from the bottom of the glass to get all of the layered components. A wonderful ending to a fantastic meal.

I must commend the server and the busboys. They were top notch. The server (I wish I got her name, but she was a blonde haired lady) was very helpful when I had trouble deciding on menu items. She saw my lady's camera on the table and immediately offered to take pics for us which we gladly accepted. When I wanted to see the dessert menu again to get the descriptions of them to later compose this review, she told us she could give us a copy of it. We ended up getting an envelope with the starter, main, AND dessert menus to take home. The busboys were on point with refilling water, offering more bread, taking away plates, and even cracking a joke on how we hated the desserts when he saw our spotlessly clean dessert plates.

My lady loved the atmosphere, the meal, and thoroughly enjoyed our 1st Valentine's Day together. Thank you Boulevard for making it so memorable for both of us.
author: Randy T.

description:
Outstanding service but the food was dissapointing.
The crab salad was low on flavor.  The scallops were ok.
The angus filet was unaccceptable and the lamb T-bone even worse.
I hope the chef addresses their meat procurement and preparation.
author: A P.

description: Amazing food and ambiance.  Loved the restaurant and will definitely return!
author: Greg R.

description: We had a nice lunch in the beautiful private wine room. Simple French-inspired elegant cuisine - squash soup, kale and apple salad, and scallops, were all nice. And a great wine list. Nice ambiance.
author: Andrew K.

description: Is everyone drinking the kool-aid?  The food was great, of course, but I felt like I was sitting in a "dine and dash" diner.  It was as if I was eating in the middle of a freeway.  There were servers rushing past me on both sides, an over-the-top noisy dining experience where I felt a bit rushed by my wonderful server and, honestly, was seriously overwhelmed by how distracted and "not special" I felt (especially at the cost of the meal.)  Would I go back?  Maybe.  I WILL DEFINITELY NOT SIT WHERE I WAS SEATED SATURDAY NIGHT.  It was awful.  Food was good.
author: Peggy C.

description:
I celebrated one of my birthday here and enjoyed a wonderful comfort meal. You get all the great flavors, rich tastes within a setting that doesn't feel stuffy. You have those that might dress smart casual or in business attire. Our waiter was friendly and made sure we were happy over the course of our meal. 

We enjoyed the follow dishes:

Starter:
Ahi Tuna Tartare - Oro Blanco & Ruby Grapefruits, Fresno Chili, Ginger, Brokaw avacado, Citrus leaf, Salted Plum oil, taro root, matcha masago rice crackers

Main:
Brent Wolfe King Quail Pan Roasted Double Breast, Panchetta Dressed Leg - Parisian style beet gnocchi, roasted apple & turnip, red orach, toasted hazelnuts, pink lady apple, calvado pearls, foie blond bird jus.

Eden Valley Berkshire pork prime Rob chop wood oven roasted - roasted baby garnet yam & sweet potato cannoli, port poached Shinko pears & Grenache aigre doux, pepita pistou and roasted pork jus.

Dessert:
Mulled cider, chocolate and Meyer lemon sorbet

Icebox Cake - vanilla rum custard, house made chocolate wafers, roasted banana sorbet, cocoa nib cream

If you're looking for a tasteful meal this is your place!!
author: Kristina S.

description:
I went to Boulevard several years ago and was somewhat underwhelmed, but I went to Boulevard last night with some friends and I must say it was one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. We each had just a single starter, a main, a shared cheese plate, dessert, glasses of wine, and coffee, and somehow managed to stay and converse for 4 hours, felt perfectly nourished, and never experienced even a moment of pressure to pay and leave. Here's what I liked:

* Perfect Manhattan on the rocks at the bar.
* The chairs are comfy and the art nouveau decoration and amber lighting are evocative of Paris.   
* Our waitperson was bubbly, intelligent, and helpful on selecting items.
* There's just a list of starters and mains and absolutely no pressure to order first, second, third, fourth, etc. courses.
* They put enough on your plate to satisfy your hunger and there's a lot going on in terms of different flavors and textures in each dish.
* Their presentations are beautiful.
* The place is is lively. 
I won't bore you with the details of each dish, but everything was delicious, and we had the most amazing cheese from Switzerland, which is going to turn me into a cheese nut.

Here's what I didn't like: Nada.
author: Stan B.

description: Boulevard remains my most favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  It is beautifully situated with sophisticated decor and attentive service.  The food is always delicious, innovative yet comforting, and totally local, fresh, and sustainable.
author: Karen C.

description: I visited this SF classic for the first time today at lunch.  I had an new set of clients that request a "foodies" type of venue to dine.  After asking around the office Boulevard came up several times as a steady go to.  On short notice they were able to accommodate my reservation.  My group started with the tuna tartar - the portion was a bit small but the quality was very good.  Two of us had the deconstructed Paella - The seafood was great, with the highlight being the stuffed squid.  Definitely a four start entre.  The last member had the steak which was prepared perfectly.  I don't care if this place has been around for a while, good food is good food.  I will definitely be back here again.
author: Stuart B.

description:
Our dinner was on Saturday, July 25th 2015. Let me begin by saying that I would have definitely given Boulevard a 5 star if it weren't for the manger on duty. Everything from our meals to our service was outstanding! Ethan was our waiter, he was attentive, funny and his menu recommendations were right on point. There were four in our party, we started with the Grilled Spanish Octopus & Crisp Monterey Calamari and the Heirloom Tomatoes & Burrata. Delicious! Our main entrees consisted of the Berkshire Chop and the Wolfe King Quail...impeccable!! Dessert followed with the Berry Buckle and Dark Chocolate Tart...divine!! Here is my biggest complaint....(stop reading now if you are not interested) at the end of the evening when the bill came, I had a $100.00 gift card and a $50.00 gift certificate to use towards our meal. Apparently the gift certificate was a voucher, I was completely unaware of the small fine print, (as this was given to me as a birthday gift), I did not realize the voucher had to be redeemed online first before using it in the restaurant. Let's just say it was not very clear. When our fabulous waiter took our bill with all forms of payment, a woman returned, who I am assuming was the manager on duty,(I did not get her name). She was so rude and snippy toward our table. She said "I don't know what this is, but you cannot use it!" Her tone, facial expression and attitude turned our wonderful evening into a very awkward moment. I responded to her by stating that I thought it was a gift certificate and in her condescending tone, she responded, "No! You must redeem this online first!" She then asked if we wanted to put the remainder of the balance on our credit card, which is of course what we wanted...then she stormed off, ran our bill, returned our bill and did not even look at us. I was so, mortified and let me just say I left there with a very uneasy feeling. I did not like the way she made me feel at all!!! 
"People will forget what you said.  People will forget what you did.  But people will never forget how you made them feel." - Maya Angelou
author: Cathy G.

description:
Was really pleasantly surprised by this meal. I knew that Boulevard had good yelp reviews, but I was a little worried that the food would be average when I walked in and saw how big the place was and its sort of upscale Applebee's look (that's harsh..the front looks attractively Old World, but the back, where we were seated, lacks atmosphere). The food and amazing wine list changed my mind! 

Our group ordered a number of dishes, and the standouts were the Ahi Tuna Crudo (seriously amazing and so flavorful), the Swordfish, and the Scallops. Thoughtful and creative combinations of ingredients, beautiful presentation. 

Our waitress was wonderful and even threw in a free dessert for our table. 

Besides the atmosphere in the back, the only other downside was that it was quite loud and a little difficult to talk over the hubub at times.
author: Heather K.

description:
I hate writing anything but good reviews but this was a three star experience for a five star price. 
The food was fine but there was nothing that wowed me. I had the carrot-artichoke soup which was pretty good & the rabbit meatballs with orecchiette pasta. The meatballs were tough & the pasta was also. My husband had the karabuta pork chop which he liked.
Portions are small for sure.
Ugh...so we're restaurant biz people so we get it but the server immediately treated us as a "special occasion 2 top"...like he knew we were going to spend $150 & he'd never see us again...
Which is true:)
author: Rita I.

description:
Dinner was great. This was my second time eating here and it was spot on just like
the first time. I love a restaurant that is consistent. 

The wait staff was knowledgeable and attentive with out being intrusive. My friend and I were able to enjoy our conversation with out constant interruptions. 

Now the food was amazing, high quality and executed perfectly. I started with the tuna tartare and it was super fresh. The rice cracker and simple sauce was a great addition to the plate without over powering the star of the dish, the tuna! My friend had the gem salad to start and it looked good. Next time it will be the crab salad for me. 

I choose the scallops for my main dish and it was great. The buttermilk mashed under each scallop was so tasty and the scallop was cooked perfectly. I was excited my friend ordered the lamb chop as I had never tried it before. It was good, lots of flavor and again cooked perfectly. 

No desert this time, maybe next time.
author: Kelly P.

description:
I have been here a couple of times and it usually is good but not that I am dying to get back. Last week however I must have had one of the best meals there. We started with the summer truffles on papardelle and the lobster squid appetizer. Followed by the quail dish and the pork chop. OMG, everything was amazingly well prepared and I couldn't stop eating. For dessert was Dirty Girl Strawberries, which also were wonderfully different but oh so delicious. Our waitress was exceptionally nice, helpful, knowledgeable and honest. This is a place to impress. Clientele is very mixed, surprisingly actually, especially when seeing lululemon clad girls going out for dinner on a Friday night. 
In any event, at least once you must go here and enjoy the food and if possible the view of the Embarcadero and Bay Bridge.
author: Conny F.

description:
My husband and I celebrated our birthdays and had our wedding reception here last year. We were very pleased with the food and the service that Boulevard had provided.

My favorite appetizer was definitely the crab salad. It was very light but flavorful at the same time. We had a choice of salmon or filet mignon as the main course and we've heard so many positive feedback from our guests. Delicious food and BIG portion - Everyone was so full by the time we had desserts.

Boulevard has become one of my favorite restaurants. This restaurant is so much better than a lot of the other Michelin-starred restaurants we've been to. We are looking forward to celebrate our wedding anniversary here year after year.
author: Aeris W.

description:
I found this place from yelp and it was the best choice for our perfect dinner! People dressed up to this place and the place was packed. You'll see a lot banker a like people hang out here wearing suit and tie, after waiting for a while we finally got the table next to the bar. If you can, choose the seat inside or in front of kitchen for better view.

Food:
I ordered the pork chop and it was really the best I've ever tried in my life! It's amazing how their cook the pork like a steak! The sea bass and butterscotch pudding dessert was blast too!

Service: 
Brilliant 5 star service, they pay attention to details. Even you ordered just an ice tea, the glass the provided make you feel like you are drinking a whisky bottle.
author: Creative M.

description:
When you're feeling like indulging in the finer aspects of dining -- or your generous boss gives you a sizeable gift certificate for a milestone birthday (it ended in zero, that's all you need to know), Boulevard is as good as it gets.

Just walking through the front door elevated my mood. Old-school stylish, comfortable, welcoming, and classy without being high-brow. Service is incredible, both polished and friendly. First a martini (excellent) with cheese (wonderful) while Annabell enjoyed a wine suggestion from our server.  Then another round of drinks with starters of Sonoma fois gras -- heaven. The main course of lamb T-bone steak is the stuff Greek poets were inspired by. I declined dessert but had a bite of my companion's --almond butter cake, I think?  Had I room and a sweet tooth, I'd have ordered my own. 

Yes, $$$ pricey. But it's all about value, and the value is apparent.
author: John Z.

description:
I have left this great eatery in purgatory long enough.  I am over the strange corkage rules and back on the bandwagon.  

A solid top 10 still in The City
author: Trevor C.

description:
this is heresy but I cannot help but be disappointed with what used to be one of my faves.... as delicious as the food may be, my tummy is the boss of me, and it reminds me of how unsatisfying a meal is when it grumbles later. I'm not a humongous eater, but if I'm paying $350+ for 2, I'd better be SATISFIED.

most of the food is meticulously done. the pork chop - delicious with a perfect crust. the pear and blue salad? surprisingly refreshing. but: the ravioli - each $9 mouthful was wrapped in undercooked pasta. the sweetbreads were, well, rubbery. and I don't know if we were just steered in the wrong direction, but the liquid digestifs were much better than the desserts.

that being said, service was impeccable.  atmosphere is fun.  wine list is adventurous.  would I go back?  unfortunately, not soon.
author: Sasha R.

description:
True, bad reviews are exponentially more fun to write and read, but sadly, I am head over heels in love with this place.  So let this be my ode to one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco....

Boulevard, I LOVE YOU.

2012 is the pinnacle year of your long-standing success.  Knowing you are a James Beard Award Winner for outstanding restaurant after an unprecedented eight consecutive nominations makes me weak at my knees.  Abalone Benedict with a poached Jidori egg?  Just reading it on the menu made my heart skip a beat.  Eating it was a different story... the lush yellow-orange yolk spilling over a mouthful of abalone and prosciutto nearly sent me into cardiac arrest.  You pulling out all the stops for me just makes me blush and fall for you even more.  I can't go on right now... if I recount the time I took one bite of pork belly and mumbled "porkfatjizz" at the table, I would need a defibrillator very close by.

Although our love has been consummated on more than few occasions, for obvious reasons I cannot stay faithful to you.  But Sandy, you ask, why not pinch pennies and eat ramen every meal and solely patronize Boulevard?  I don't want to water down our romance.  But know you are my favorite and that I think of you always.

One of my favorite things about you is your utter lack of mediocrity.  Every time I dine with you feels like I've died and gone to a heaven where even among the glittery constellations of Michelin star-studded restaurants in SF, you shine the brightest and the truest.  

Friends of mine say I'm happiest when I'm eating.  This is true.  Boulevard, you bring me happiness in the form of sheer gastronomical delight.  Please don't ever leave me.
author: Sandy T.

description:
One of the first thoughts when I walked in: This place has 1920's charm meets Cheesecake Factory.  The place was packed full of business people on a weekday.

I had a 3 course meal, each dish more delicious than the prior.  

# Heirloom tomato & mozzarella salad

# Kobe bavette steak - I ordered mine medium rare.  I love my meat bloody, but this was probably the perfect cook for it.  The flavoring was amazing, and the varying textures of the mushrooms, corn, and tomato on the side were perfect.

# Flourless chocolate cake
I was honestly weirded out by the random bits of gummy candies that were adoring this cake.  The pistachio truffle on the side was delicious!
author: Jeanne L.

description:
TLDR:
- Well-executed dishes.
- Friendly and knowledgeable staff.
- Don't really need to say much more for this place.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I've wanted to go to Boulevard for years and finally had the chance during a work lunch today. 

They were gracious enough to put our big party in a separate room - they have a party room in their wine room which was awesome. It was like having our own private space with great food and service. 

I was torn between all the dishes, I ended up with the Duroc Pork Flat Iron. The Kabocha Squash was cooked perfectly, tender with it still packed with flavor. The pork was cooked amazingly and the braised bacon marmalade topped it perfectly. 

I ordered dessert - if I thought choosing from the menu was hard, I was torn between the red velvet cake and Baked Alaska. I had to go with the Baked Alaska because it made me think of Alton Brown. Of course it wasn't the same exact type of Baked Alaska he makes, but it was as amazing as I imagined. The chocolate sauce was a perfect pairing to the meringue covered ice cream, the chocolate wasn't too sweet, had a bit of bitterness that dark chocolate has (which I love).

I definitely want to go back to Boulevard again one day. The ambiance is great and the food is phenomenal.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Very elegant and fancy but very pricey. All of the dishes are presented with elegance and grace making eat bite tasteful and unique. 
I went there for lunch and the servers were all very friendly and open to walk-ins. 
I ordered the burger and it was largely portioned and juicy. The food was very special and dessert and beverage lists goes on and on! 
They also validate your parking which is always nice.
author: Coco L.

description: Staple. I have visited for lunch as many Friday's as possible for the last decade. Tim Q lunch chef is a master.  creative, always unique..menu changes often as the seasons and weather, he hand picks vendors for the most unique...tomatoes, quail, don't forget the cheese..it's on the dessert menu! First courses and second are a must, family style, go for it all, your mouth will sing..lobster bisque..the dollop of lobster and mushroom.. The staff is amazing and they have become family. Tim and staff also joined me on an amazing yacht party where he worked his chef skills in the kitchen's main galley, staffed passed his artistic creations..thrilling for the foodie. I *heart*. Xo
author: Jessie D.

description:
Had the quail!!! I've had fine food in many places and this place is 5 stars!! 
Excellent restaurant and even better atmosphere!!  Highly recommand!!
author: Neil L.

description:
Boulevard has been on my list for a very very, and I mean very, long time. Today, I was able to finally try it!

Boulevard is very deserving of 5 stars.. every single dish was delicious. There was not one bad dish. I came here with a group of 8 people and was able to sample a variety of dishes -- from abalone, scallops, to heirloom tomatoes, quail, and filet mignon, and more. They do meat here very well.  Their desserts were absolutely delicious, in the perfect portion size and amount of sweetness. The service was superb.

I would definitely dine here again!!

P.S., getting to the restrooms was a bit of a maze, but at least you get to see the whole restaurant!
author: J T.

description:
The white wine was warm, the food was luke warm but the service did sparkle!  

Boulevard has a lot of San Francisco hype to live up to and unfortunately they fell short on our recent visit.  The menu had innovative and very tasty food, however both our appetizer and our main course were served only luke warm... the same temperature as my white wine.  

Our server was a true professional and must be commended on her gracious level of service!  She was warm, engaging and created a lovely atmosphere.  

The plants and flowers inside were gorgeous but the juxtoposition against the tired uniforms the staff wore was jarring.  How many times can a vest be dry cleaned.  Apparently Boulevard is trying to find the answer!

In total:  It was OK.
author: Jory S.

description:
I wish I could give Boulevard 6 stars. Boulevard has been a SF classic for as long as I can remember and it NEVER EVER disappoints. I came here for a birthday dinner and we started off with a round of really creative cocktails followed by a bottle of wine. I love that their wine list is not as pretentious as other nice restaurants in SF (meaning you can find plenty of options under $75, a rare treat at a fancy restaurant). The service is always top notch - they're on top of everything and properly attentive without bothering you or being in your face. We all had fish, but the meat is equally good from past experience. Highly recommend the carpaccio to start and the Irish Coffee bon bons for dessert. SO GOOD! If you can, ask for a table by the window so you can look out on the Embarcadero and see the new Bay Bridge lights.

Choose Boulevard for your next special occasion. It may slightly stretch the bank, but the experience is so worth it and you will leave feeling like you really got to experience what San Francisco has to offer.
author: Meka A.

description: Off the charts. This is old-school elegant. I had the scallops then the filet mignon. Some terrific wines available by the glass including Pride Mountain Cabernet.    From the beautiful tile acoustic ceilings to the oak bars and upbeat staff in their ties and white shirts, this place is first class - first rate.
author: Matthew P.

description:
My boyfriend surprised me here for a special dinner last night. Just a note, but I would suggest getting a table where the elevated floors are. It's more quiet and romantic compared to the tables closer to the kitchen and the bar. 

We started the night with a bottle of Gloria Ferrer. All through the night our glasses were never empty because the waitstaff was so attentive. The bread that they served was very plain and too hard for my taste. The butter also had salt on it, which I'm not a big fan of. 

For our appetizers, we had the Ahi Tuna Tartare and the Sonoma foie gras. The tuna tartare was just ok, nothing special. In my opinion, there was too much vinegar. I would've wanted some sesame oil instead of all that vingear. The foie gras was so delicious! One of the best I've had!

For entrees, we had the lamb chop and the lobster with scallops. The lamb chop was delicious and even a non-lamb lover like me enjoyed it! The maine lobster and scallops came with a Limoncello risotto that complemented the dish very well! Everything was cooked perfectly!

We decided to skip on dessert because next door is Chaya and they have my favorite dessert of all time - chocolate croissant bread pudding. Service was excellent and the waitstaff was really helpful and attentive to our needs. Everyone from our waitress to the busyboys were extremely courteous. 

Overall, excellent service, good food, and a romantic ambience. It is a really expensive place for the quality and amount of food but I'd suggest everyone try it once.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The service and the food were good (not excellent).  My only gripe?  We had a reservation and arrived on time, but still had to wait about 20 minutes before they seated us.  Defeats the purpose.
author: Kristen S.

description:
This place is definitely one of my San Francisco favorites. I started out with the ahi tuna tartar which was so fresh and perfect with the accompanied black cracker. I also had the chance to taste a friend's lobster stuffed calamari and the dungeness crab salad, both wonderful dishes. My entree was the halibut (cooked to perfection) served with chorizo black (forbidden) rice and a crab stuffed mussel. Everything on my dish paired together wonderfully. 

Our dessert selection: Chocolate Angel Pie (It tasted like heaven, hence the name?)

The atmosphere and decor was warm and inviting.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Be sure to make reservations prior to the day of attending. The restaurant can get a bit crowded and loud due to popular demand, especially on thursday-saturdays. The hostess and servers were polite and formal along with their service. One of the waiters stumbled upon my conversation and saved me by explaining a certain Mexican dish that I was trying to describe to a fellow colleague. Props to him! 

The overall experience was delightful in terms of service, quality of food in comparison to the price and the elegancy of the place itself. My date and I ordered the "Verdure Farm Heirloom Tomato Salad" and split it, as for the main course we ordered the "Brent Wolfe "Quail" Pan Roasted Double Breast Pancetta Dressed Legs". The amount of freshness that the tomato salad portrayed was astonishing, but that also might have been entirely because it was indeed tomato season. This was the first time "quail" had met my taste buds and it tasted similar to chicken but with a different twist. A good one. The Flour less Chocolate Cake was satisfying, but not in a "full/tiring" feeling but in a "feel good" and light stomach feeling.
author: Valerie V.

description: Great cocktails, even better food! Excellent wine list. I suggest the soft shell crab and saving room for dessert!
author: Bre W.

description:
Much like rooting against the powerhouse team sometimes you want a meal to be bad just so you can say "oh, it wasn't that great". Damn you, Boulevard! You lived up to the hype. 

My girlfriend brought me here to celebrate and it was a spectacular meal and lovely gesture on her part. 

I am absolutely in love with NOPA's pork chop but Boulevard definitely gave NOPA a run for its money. 

If I were looking to impress I would definitely come back.
author: Carlos A.

description: my expectations must have been too high because i was not impressed with this restaurant. i like trying out restaurants with michelin stars in various cities and had high hopes for this place. i tried their scallops, ahi tuna, hen, and steak dishes. the scallops were good but the rest were mediocre. the service at this restaurant was good and our waitress was great though. would i come back? not likely.
author: Linda H.

description:
First of all- you must try the Elderflower beverage on the NA Beverage menu. It is so refreshing, I could drink that all day.
I have been to Boulevard for appetizers and lunch but never dinner- not until last weekend. We didn't have reservations but were sat quickly in the bar- which was perfect for us (party of 2). 
We had the veal/brussel sprouts (YUM), pear salad (double YUM), quail and pork chop. The food at Boulevard is unique in that you won't find dishes like this anywhere else. The chef uses a lot of care with her planning of the menu, I appreciate that. The flavors you get from the food are just incredible.
We will be back, but probably not anytime soon as it is expensive.
author: Janell D.

description:
what an amazing dining experience!

brought our work mama here for her birthday and we had a fantastic time! among our group of 3, we tried the scallops and wagyu appetizers, bacon wrapped quail, filet mignon, and lobster for entrees, and red velvet cake for dessert. everything was plated beautifully and was all sooo yummy! the three of us spent a good time ooohhh-ing and ahhh-ing each dish that came out

i loved the ambience of the place and the service was wonderful. ive been wanting to come to boulevard for the longest time and it did not disappoint. this is officially one of my favorites restaurants in SF! will definitelyyy be back!
author: Katherine C.

description: Dylan makes the best lemon drop shots with freshly squeezed lemons.   He is very professional and takes his time making the very best drink.  The bar and restaurant were very energetic and lively.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I am picky but boulevard really lived up to its reputation! Everything was done right! 
Food was well prepared and delicious. I had scallops, soft shell crab and filet mignon medium rare. The service was great. Everything was right on time. Had a great experience there.
author: Cheyenne G.

description:
Wow. I never thought I'd make it to this restaurant. Celebrating one year with my beloved boyfriend! We started off with cocktails at the bar. The cucumber gimlet was beautifully made. It had a very nice balance of refreshing cucumber and alcohol. We ordered the scallops which were out of this world! Also we ordered the lamb.. which was good but not as memorable. We had the gnocchi appetizer which was very savory and slightly crispy all at once. I could come back and just order 2 orders of gnocchi!! The burrata was good, I love beets and burrata so you can't go wrong. All in all a very special dining experience. 
Oh yeah, we were there celebrating our anniversary and the waiter brought out a "happy birthday" chocolate sign on our dessert without being prompted. How thoughtful. We were both tickled by his very kind gesture!
author: Kathleen T.

description:
You know when you have a really good food experience, you're reliving the food and flavors in your mind over and over again even after you left the restaurant? Yah... I didn't get that here. I'd been looking forward to checking this place out for awhile and finally made it here and was greatly disappointed. 

This place reminds me of One Market. It's one of those restaurants down in the Financial District catering to the business men and women who are in hotels nearby. It's supposed to be great, but only ok. 

Starters: 
AHI TUNA ITO-ZUKURI
*Hand Line Caught,"Ribbon-Cut" Ahi Tuna Yuzu-Coriander Braised Hodo Soy Tofu Natural Enoki Mushrooms, Scallions & Black Sesame Wild Rice "Furikake", Sudachi Lime Yuzu Aioli 
- My bf had this dish, but I tried it and it was pretty good. The enoki mushrooms were really scrumptious. The ahi itself was a little bland. I expected a little more flavor from it. 

PAN SEARED SEA SCALLOPS
* Artichoke Hearts, Fresh Shelling Beans & Sea Spinach Preserved Lemon, Castelvetrano Olive & Amaranth Gremolata
- My starter, however, kicked my bf's starters bootie. This was really delicious. The artichoke hearts were tasty and gave a nice saltiness eaten with the scallops. The olives weren't overpowering at all, which I expected. Instead they gave a nice freshness to the dish. 

Mains: 
ANGUS FILET MIGNON
* Wood Oven Roasted Potatoes Cacio E Pepe: Red Thumb Fingerlings with Pecorino, Parmesan & Crushed Black Pepper Roasted King Trumpet Mushrooms, Shaved Scarlett Turnips & Roasted Radishes with Thyme Sauteed Bloomsdale Spinach, Penja Peppercorn Beef Jus 
- My bf had this one. I tasted the filet and it melted like butter in my mouth. It was cooked to perfection. They had a little play of a fried egg on top with the turnips and potatoes. It was a nice surprise for him. 

MAINE LOBSTER & TAYLOR MUSSEL BEIGNETS HALF 1.5# BUTTER POACHED LOBSTER
* Shellfish Mushrooms: Lobster, Abalone, Clamshell & Oyster Risotto Al Nero & Lobster Stuffed Ale Battered Mussels, Tarragon Meyer Lemon Aioli
- The mussels on this dish were delicious! It wasn't expecting to like it all that much, but it was my favorite part of the dish. The risotto was a little undercooked and over salted, so I was not pleased. The abalone had a weird flavor to it and normally I'm a big fan. 

Dessert: 
CHOCOLATE POT DE CREME
* Flourless Chocolate Cake, Caramel Malt Syrup, Guinness Meringue, Milk Chocolate Lace, Malted Ice Cream  
- My bf had this and I was completely jealous. I wanted to steal this from him. The malted ice cream was really interesting and gave a different texture to the ice cream. The cake was delicious. I'm a huge fan of dessert and I only got a bite of this, I'd go back just for this. 

STICKY TOFFEE SUNDAE
* Medjool Date Cake, English Toffee, Toasted Almond Ice Cream, Hot Fudge
 Buttered Pecans 
- Can't complain about my dessert though, it was really tasty and literally a sticky dessert. It was a little sweet after awhile though, so I couldn't finish it. 

SERVICE
This is where I'm completely peeved. The service should be more or less on point, but it wasn't. We waited over 25 minutes just for our starters. Our waiter barely came by our table. Having empty drinks on the table is not acceptable if we're paying for food and service. No apology, just glazed over it like it was normal. We were right in front of the main service pass. You could tell the kitchen was backed up, so I'm sure that the starter's pass was just as backed up, but that doesn't mean you can't come by the table to check on your guests. 

The food was good, the service was not. It's one of those places where I'll cross it off my list and it'd be lucky for me to ever return. Although, that chocolate pot de creme is a good temptation to lure me back, that memory of the service slaps me back to reality.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
solid good food. this restaurant has stood the test of time (in trendy SF standards) and consistently serves up yummy food with impeccable service. 

to note:
- foie gras appetizer = delicious! 
- crab salad = yummy
- ahi tartar = yummy + 
- pork chop = yummy + 
- quail = delicious! 
- lamb = yummy
- desserts = meh...

the only lackluster part of the evening was the dessert. we pretty much sampled the entire dessert menu but felt underwhelmed by all options. the presentation seemed very "90's" and the flavors + components didn't really wow anyone.
author: Sammi C.

description:
*****All in all, we left the restaurant saying, "That was okay." which is not what you want after spending $175 on a special night.*****

Wanted a nice night out with my honey with great food and good service.  I got a nice night out but mediocre food and less than fantastic service. 

Boulevard had come highly recommended to us so after trying Gary Danko last week, we had to give a try.  We were seated promptly in a corner booth (our choosing) and the waiter was by shortly there after.  He was kind but offered no suggestions or explanations for anything on the menu.  

I had the lobster and artichoke bisque which was served just barely above room temperature and in such a shallow bowl it was hard to eat.  I asked our waiter if that it was intended temperature and he agreed that they usually serve it colder than he thinks they should.  They ended up taking this dish off our bill.  

My other half had the sea scallops which were cooked well but was a little small for a starter.  

I ordered the filet for main and Honey had the lobster and mussel beignets. It was good.  The lobster was very buttery and the beignets were cooked well. However this portion was not even close to being enough for a main dish.  It could have passed as another starter and he left the restaurant hungry.  My filet came out of the kitchen under done (I had ordered medium and it was definitely rare) and again on the cold side.  I brought this up to the waiter and he took both our dishes back to warm them up.  After being warmed to a better temperature the steak was quite tasty; the au jus sauce was good.  The potatoes were okay, heavy on the pepper for better or worse.  

The best part of the meal were the specialty cocktails that we ordered.
author: Bess F.

description:
My wife and I have a drinking game. Every night during the Stephen Colbert Report we take a drink after Colbert says the word "Nation".

So do the math. The show starts at 8:30 which means by about 8:58 we are both schnockered and slurring "I love you honey!" and spilling wine all over our couch.

Nation!

Boulevard is one of those kinds of places where you can integrate a drinking game. Every time you hear the word "classic" said by your waitperson and trust me, you will be completely wasted by the time they are finished telling you what the specials of the evening are. 

Good restaurant, not great and slightly overrated.

I see that that I have two compliments to approve from my pal Sparkley K. Nation!
author: Rene C.

description:
Classic. Contemporary. Chic.  

That's Boulevard, alright. 

Kuleto's Boulevard has been around forever. The building has been open since 1906. It's a historic gem. You also can't go wrong w/ San Francisco's waterfront location. The views of the Bay Bridge are amazing.

The food was amazing. We started off w/ the adriatic figs, summer beets, and goat cheese. 
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ&select=hftYPmKjEbO0swhj7HNqLQ

Impressed by all the positive Yelper's comments regarding the day boat sea scallops, I made that my order for the day.
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ&select=hftYPmKjEbO0swhj7HNqLQ. I'd have to agree, it was pretty amazing.

My colleague ordered the fresh sockeye salmon, which also earned raved reviews. 
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ&select=k3dnVR6qEjZuSAzbK2J1_A. 

Bottom line: It's a great restaurant~ amazing view of the Bay Bridge, delicious eats, and very personable service. Boulevard is a great place to take your family, a date, and even your colleagues.

Tip:
*If you sit at the bar in the back, you can check out the dishes as the cooks make them in front of you.
author: Joy A.

description: Very delicious drinks. They treated us well. They have absinthe which was super cool. Wish they stayed open past 9:30. Seemed odd to go last call when they weren't at their closing hour yet. But oh well. Will be back.
author: Aaron E.

description:
Forgot to add that the server was super accommodating to the fact I can't have gluten. Bumping it from 3 to 4 stars. 


***

We went here last night for anniversary dinner. The plusses: excellent, charming waiter who mastered the balance of being attentive without bugging us. My filet mignon was extremely tender and seasoned to perfection. The beets and winter citrus salad was also really flavorful and beautifully presented. Our desserts were delicious (banana caramel ice cream and they brought a mini chocolate mousse complimentary for our anniversary). They sat us at a super cute table where we sat side by side and could watch the chefs. 

The minuses: it was a Tuesday night, so there was a ton of stuffy business people and thus, the atmosphere was a bit stuffy and pretentious. I wasn't expecting that part; I'm not that familiar with the Fi-Di but in hindsight it seems apt that at 6 on a Tuesday night it would be full of biz peeps. The portions were smaller than I'd expect for the prices. Dinner was $180 with a tip, and we didn't drink. Ouch. 

I'm really glad we went; it's been on our bucket list for a long time. It was a memorable but I don't know that we'll blow that kind of cash again on dinner there. Maybe the ambiance is way different on a weekend? I dunno. The space is stunning, but the atmosphere and pretentiousness of the crowd turned me off. I just don't know that we'll go back, despite having a great meal.
author: H H.

description:
Boulevard is at or near the top of the mountain in SF's very competitive restaurant landscape.  I've enjoyed numerous lunches and and dinners here over the years, and I have never been disappointed.  Not even slightly disappointed.

Boulevard has an incredible array of appetizers, entrees, and desserts, and make sure to go very hungry to do the best justice to the diversity on the menu.  Amongst my favorites are their various risottos and sole & halibut dishes. They also have a great skirt steak, soft-shell crab, and much more.  There is some menu rotation, but generally speaking the menu is similar each time I visit- perhaps 60% similar.  My wife claims they have the best hamburger that she has ever had... Other tips are to try their signature cocktails, or if not consuming alcohol, they have wonderful 'fresh daily lemonades', featuring various complimentary fruit flavor blends.  Save room for dessert- they have a wonderful variety of creative dishes- but if you are too hungry, simply go for their ice-cream bon-bons- they can be ordered by the piece and are a manageably sized and delicious 'two-biter'.

Of course the Bridge & Embarcadero view is legendary, but if you have a group of 8 or 10- they may be able to place you in their super secret wine cellar room - I didn't know about this room (after scores of visits...) until we were placed in their with a group of 7 sometime last summer.  Now I try to request it if we have an adequately sized dinner party.

Boulevard has remained a consistent winner with exceptional service and food over the years.  I can't tell you how many times I have been disappointed while trying another similarly priced restaurant- and thought to myself- should have gone to Boulevard...
author: Andy S.

description: like many old restaurants, boulevard is very expensive.  but it is good and the service is attentive.  certainly very good for special occasions
author: Jocelyn S.

description: Big disappointment... Not going back for sure! I actually didn't even finish my food it was so bad. My husband got the salmon and it was also really bad! To top it off our server was bizarre, totally inappropriate with his comments. So much hype for nothing.
author: Tina D.

description:
I have nothing but good memories of this place.

The ambiance is inviting and romantic.  Even the little details of architecture and decor contribute to what ultimately sets itself apart from other contemporary restaurants.

But enough about the place... the food was absolutely delicious.  Our server was knowledgeable and made excellent suggestions.  It makes me wonder how they know so much about food and the way they know the "science" of tastebuds.  I ordered the halibut.  It almosted tasted like a steak.  The way it was presented along with the pairings of others foods on the plate was very delicious.

Given the chance, I would love to come back here again.
author: Krystal Nina L.

description:
My experience was of the bar and hostess the staff were so rude we left so I do not know what the food is like. We arrived and waited at the hostess stand for the girls to finish their conversation without even acknowledging us finally my friend interrupted them and asked if we could eat dinner at the bar by the kitchen she told us it would be about 10 minutes. 

We go to the main bar and asked for a wine menu which we were given but then ignored for 15 minutes (6 other people who arrived after us were served) we finally managed to get the bar tenders attention to ask for a nice bottle of white wine who said he knew nothing about wine and would find us someone?? WTH we wait another 5 minutes and still no wine "expert" or even water offered. 

Finally our seats were ready the hostess comes over and mumbles something to us and leaves so we make our way over there and wait by the seats she comes over and tells us to sit and she will get our menus we sit down and a waitress rushes over and says we cant sit there as we have to see the hostess first when we told her we had she walked off no oh I'm sorry can I get you a drink or anything, we were done at this point for a Michelin rated restaurant I found the staff rude and unattentive we wasted 30 minutes in this place I won't come back I felt that they couldn't be bothered with us
author: julie c.

description: This place has it all, great food, great ambience and great service. This is San Francisco so the prices reflect all the above. Our group had the Lamb, Filet and Halibut and all were terrific.
author: Chris H.

description:
This restaurant is adorable. It hits every category at a high note. 

Service was amazing! The waiters made us feel at home and joked around with us. 

Ambiance made me feel as if I were in Paris (check out the brick ceiling!). This place would make a perfect place for an anniversary dinner, as more than half the restaurant is dedicated to 2-person tables. Boulevard is also in a romantic location, right by the pier and bow & arch (where you left your heart in San Francisco), with a lovely view of the Bay bridge.

For appetizer I ordered the Ahi Tuna tartare, not the best choice. It was okay, but nothing special. My boyfriend ordered the foie gras, probably the best choice! It was a huge portion (good thing it was, since it was $27!) and could easily and comfortably be split between two people. 

Main entrees were delicious! I ordered the roasted duck, which was really yummy. Very tender and went well with the wild rice. Weird to say this, but one of the things I remember most from this dish is the 3 little pearl onions that went with it. They were cooked very soft and juicy from the oil...my mouth waters just thinking of it! My boyfriend ordered the lamb, which he really loved. I tried some and it tasted like beef, not gamey at all. Pretty impressive!

Boulevard is not my favorite restaurant but definitely up there.  Can't wait to return...hopefully my boyfriend takes me here for our anniversary!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Life is too short.

Y'know, I thought Boulevard would be safe for a nice experience with out-of-town visitors who'd invited me to dinner and had asked me to suggest a nice restaurant.  I'd had a relaxing time there before.

The four of us made a reservation for 9:30 p.m., and showed up on time.  Our table wasn't ready, and I got the tried-and-true airline-style runaround when I tried to find out how long it would be.  "Oh, they're just clearing it."  Right.  Ten minutes later, we were seated.  

Our waiter came by and I asked for the wine steward, because by that time we'd pretty much decided on our courses.  I wanted to ask about some domestic sauvignon blancs vs. a nice sancerre to suit the food choices that two of us had made.  Time passed.  More time passed.  I flagged the waiter as he was passing by, and was assured the wine steward was "just coming."  I was embarassed that I'd delayed my companions' dinner, and ordered a 2009 Rochioli sauvignon blanc to go with two of our choices.

The wine came, and it was a 2010.  The wine steward finally materialized upon my pointing out this fact.  He was dour, expressionless, didn't make eye contact, and didn't apologize for the error.  He checked (more time) and determined that indeed, there was no more 2009.  In the interest of time, I stuck with the 2010.  (Easy money-saver tip: don't shell out for the two year old Rochioli sauv blanc at Boulevard.)

Our food was very nice.  That night, there was a lovely abalone first course.  I had quail, with the legs _confites_ and the breast poached in butter.  Very good.

But the overall experience was tainted, and I felt it necessary to apologize to my hosts.  I see other, positive reviews, but they just tell me that Boulevard cannot be relied upon.
author: T D.

description:
First, let me say that I have been eating at Boulevard for about 12 years. It was always a magical place for me, with fantastic food. 

This week I went back for a special meal. And boy, was I surprised. 

First, the service. Rushed. Appetizers arrived less than a minute after ordering and the busboy hovered over our table waiting to snatch the plate. Mains arrived two minutes after the appetizers were done.  Total elapsed time: 14 minute since ordering. Drinks arrived with the mains (and the bread). Service was earnest...but bad.
