For entrees we had the Wood Grilled Walu and the Butter Poached Maine Lobster. These were both memorable dishes and went perfectly with the New Zealand Huia Chardonnay we enjoyed. We finished with the Gingersnap and Pumpkin spiced ice cream sandwiches. There were many tasty things on the menu that also looked great when they went by, like the lamb chops. I don't think you can go wrong here as you are in good hands. Sit back with someone special and enjoy some fine dining.
author: Dan G.

description:
Came here for Drew's Dad's birthday with a large group of 10.  The server was extremely attentive and helpful in giving us tips to help us choose our menu items.  I had the wood oven roasted pork prime rib chop...it was SO tasty!
Drew had the wood oven roasted angus filet mignon and he ate every last bite!  Everyone at the table enjoyed their dinner and we went home FULL!  We even had a light and unique ice cream sorbet...coconut chocolate chip SORBET? So different, light and deeelicious!  It was perfect!

Our server even took extra effort to entertain our 3 year old niece at the table!  He even brought her a piece of paper and a few highlighters ....!!  Zoe was extremely well behaved through our entire 3 hour dinner (also thanks to phone videos)!!

AND... he overheard Drew's dad toasting our engagement, so they added a little chocolate message that said Congratulations on our icecream!  And for Drew's dad, his said Happy Birthday!  ALL little things they paid attention to really made our evening! 
Great food, great service, and great wine with our lovely family...thanks Boulevard!
author: Emi G.

description:
Wow. I loved the Boulevard. 

I was taken here for a birthday dinner and let me tell you that it was a very special experience. This is a beautiful, upscale and classy restaurant. A beautiful view, beautiful classic decor and a really impressive bar and kitchen. 

I started off dinner with a glass of champagne and some incredible appetizers. I can only rave about the abalone and sea scallops. My main dish was the lamb and it was amazing. It fell off the bone and I almost fell off my chair. I savored every last bit of it. With a meal like that I couldn't leave without dessert and had the ice cream selection. It really was a beautiful meal and I found the service to be fantastic.

Great location, great experience.
author: Denise S.

description:
Good food, however noise from the kitchen was too loud (tables are too close), and the views are only enjoyed by a small portion of the tables.  So for the overt noise, and lack of view, it was a bit pricy.

Once was good.
author: Ara L.

description: We were so excited to try the restaurant based on all the awards received. However, I was so disappointed with the under seasoned bland filet. My husband liked his lamb. An OK place. Didn't live up to the hype.
author: Irene B.

description:
Everything about this restaurant was fantastic.  My fiance and I ate dinner here on a quick trip to SF, and we were extremely impressed.  Service was prompt, attentive and knowledgeable and the food was incredible.

Definitely recommended.
author: Mat B.

description:
Michelin restaurant and burnt steak?? It doesn't sound like a winning combo. I wanted to fall in love with this place, I really did.

After reading all the rave reviews Yelpers had written about Boulevard's spectacular service and delectable dishes, and because it was Michelin rated, I chose this restaurant over Chaya, a nearby French/Japanese fusion place, to celebrate my birthday. I VERY MUCH REGRET THIS DECISION.

For starters, after we had been seated, our waiter, Jake, neither bothered to introduce himself (I found out his name when we paid and his name was on the check), ask how we were doing, or explain anything about the restaurant or the menu. He got straight to the point and asked us if we were ready to order. Perhaps I would have been, had I gotten a chance to glance over the menu. In a $5 pho restaurant, that's fine - in a Michelin rated dining experience, it is substandard to rush your dining patrons.

Started with the Sonoma Foie Gras: I feel exuberant for loving foie gras as much as I do, but over the last couple of years, ever since I first sampled it, I've been in love and have been able to tell the quality and effort put into making it. Loved the fruity accents the strawberries provided, and the duck was so tender - it was a perfect, melt-in-your-mouth texture that contrasted nicely with the black Russian rye toast.

Decided to keep it simple and order filet mignon, a staple in high-end restaurants that never fails to satisfy. Given that filet mignon is the most tender cut of beef and that this restaurant was so hyped, I expected stellar. What I got was a "medium rare" piece of cow burnt on both sides, overcooked to the point where it was tiring for me to cut a piece of it, and burnt pieces were flaking off onto my plate. MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT, to say the least. There was little to no flavor in the bites I took because the meat was so dry and burnt. It was certainly not tender like filet mignon is supposed to be, and I wasn't able to finish half of it because it was so tasteless.

This is where it gets fun: service. Our waiter said nothing to us the entire night. He filled our water one time and got lost in a black hole or something for the rest of our meal. He came back out to give us dessert menus and to give us the check. But I was honestly so surprised at the lack of attention and quality given to my $40 piece of shitsteak that I lost my appetite and didn't end up ordering dessert. I did, however, inquire about the quality of the filet mignon to our waiter. He replied haughtily that Nancy Oakes had been working there for 18 years and that the filet mignon has always been made like this, in an air that allowed for no further questions. I get the impression that since my parents didn't feel like getting buzzed off wine and that we were Asian, he immediately stereotyped us cheap fobs whom he was beneath serving, which is why he was neglectful and indirectly rude.

...THAT was what really annoyed me. I'm not at Burger King or a Chinese hole-in-the-wall, where I don't care about service. Service is a bigger and bigger part of the overall experience as the restaurant's reputation and quality increase. In a restaurant so praised for quality service and a fulfilling culinary experience, calling our waiter's patronizing tone, cold attitude, and lack of attention to our party subpar would be a huge understatement. I would have brought it up with their manager, save for the fact that he gave me the impression that every employee was as poor-mannered as himself, and I just didn't want to get into it on my birthday. My parents have tipped up to 25-30% for outstanding service. Let's just say that Jake fell short of those stats.

Boulevard, I sincerely hope you improve. I wanted to love you so much... you seemed so amazing. But as my friends would say about certain men, you're only HFFA (Hot From Far Away).
author: Chrystal Z.

description: I went last night with my family and we were seated a nice table with a view of the bay bridge. The atmosphere is definitely warm and lively. Unfortunately we were cold at the table and kind of underwhelmed by the food. The truffle ravioli didn't taste or smell like truffle but more like ammonia and the filet was not the most tender I've had for sure. Overall we had a good time but unfortunately in my opinion it doesn't stand up to its reputation foodwise.
author: Lucia B.

description:
Why, hello, cute server.

And thank you, Mr. Bartender.  I was impressed with the way you accommodated my requests.

Why, yes, we would greatly appreciate the extra appetizer you brought out since our meal is taking a few minutes longer than expected.

And my compliments to the chef.

It's the Boulevard.  Go hard or go home.  An appetizer, a cocktail, fresh fish or foie gras, and dessert for everyone!

Flourless chocolate cake.  Trust me.
author: Lauren R.

description: Ate there yesterday with a customer. Paid a $380 bill for 3 people. Ordered a $60 Cab Stagecoach. They charged me $125 for a different bottle. I was too self-conscious and embarrassed to scrutinize in front of my customers while paying. Only noticed it after!  This is plain cheating.
author: Addy U.

description: Ive been here for a VIvino Ap event so I didnt really try any food just their wine list. Enjoyed the wine here and ambiance. I definitely will come here for dinner. Great date place or celebration place and from the look and smell of it the food its pretty good.
author: Kristan B.

description: OMG such a pretty view! And the scallops were perfection! Husband & I both had filet mignon and that was cooked to a perfect medium... Just as ordered!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Everything was over salted. Another dated SF food institution that rests on its laurels. Everything about this place was mediocre at best.  I'm guessing out of towners sustain this place.
author: Eric C.

description: We were greeted promptly upon arrival and brought to our table. The service was great, the server made some great food and drink recommendations that we followed and did not regret. The food was expertly prepared and extremely delicious. Don't expect enormous portions but do expect the portions that you are served to be excellent. If you're fortunate enough to sit at the back of the restaurant, there's a very nice scenic view of the bay bridge.
author: 偉文 W.

description: Went here for our wedding annviersary again.  I took one star off this time for two reasons:  First, we made an early reservation and I guess because of the busy holiday time our food took a while because the kitchen was juggling between two large parties.  Second, I ordered the filet and it was labeled "umami"  I was so hyped about this and then letdown.  Maybe it because I ordered medium rare, but still it was nothing exciting and didn't leave me craving more.  It was just too meaty and didn't have the flavor I wanted.  I almost was going to say something but that would be mean a long wait.  It wasn't bad, just did "wow" me.  My wife had the pork chops and they were amazing.  We may take a break from BLVD for our anniversary this year.  Still a great romantic place.
author: Josh L.

description: I came here this past weekend for dinner with my cousins. There was four of us and we made reservations about a month ago. Reservations are highly recommended for this restaurant. Overall, the restaurant is nice and intimate, and the food was very enjoyable. Our table was ready almost right away. Our waiter was also very nice and attentive. They have a very nice drink - alcoholic and nonalcoholic - menu. The cucumber gimlet and Moscow mule's looked especially delicious. Being pregnant, I ordered the Specialty Lemonade and it was refreshing. We had the appetizers of the beet salad, sea scallops, and calamari. All of it was very good. The calamari was the best in my personal opinion. For the entrees, I had the halibut, and my cousins had the pork loin, quail, and the lamb. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meals and it all looked so good. The halibut was very good, and definitely recommended. After the entrees, we decided to do some of their desserts. We shared the local alpine and seascape strawberries, chocolate buckwheat shortcake, and butterscotch pudding. Everything was really good. The shortcake came with a little cherry float, which was flavorsome and cute. The butterscotch had real scotch in it, but I tried some anyways and I'm glad that I did. Overall, I am glad that we tried this restaurant and would deem this place a must try.
author: Carina R.

description:
My husband and I took a friend here for her bday.  We started with Manhattans, Ahi Tuna Ito-Zukuri, and Pan Seared Sea Scallops.  I had the New Zealand Sea Bass, husband had The ANGUS FILET MIGNON and friend had the Maine Lobster & Taylor Mussel Beignets, and we shared a bottle of Silver Oak. Finished with Toasted pecan cake & soft caramel glaze and chocolate pot de crème for dessert.  

Everything was excellent!  Our server was super attentive and made the whole experience worth every penny.
author: Deb S.

description: Great service. 8:15 reservation. Place was packed, got seated immediately, at a table with a view of the Bay Bridge light show. Excellent service. Two salads ordered, heirloom tomato and Avocado/Hearts of Palm and Truffle... Both great. The four of us ordered quail, pork chop, lamb t-bone and sole. Every entree was full of amazing flavors, we sampled from each other! We brought one bottle of wine and purchased one bottle, so no corkage on the one we brought. Will definitely return. Highly recommend!
author: Margie P.

description:
Another great restaurant in the San Francisco area.  It is noisy but trendy  and great food.
The Breeder
author: Alex B.

description: Had very high expectations perhaps too high. Did not live up to the reputation and hype. Ordered a sea bass that was overdone. Unacceptable at a restaurant of this price level and repute. The rest of the entrees and sides were very good but nothing stood out even there. so not quite a bad evening out but not memorable
author: Umair K.

description: The food is good along with the service. If you are interested in a large format event you need to go elsewhere. The events manager is rude and inflexible. She took the hard work of staff to present a great experience into the worst possible event.  Lots of great large format party space in SF this is not the place to go for sure.  As a result of her conduct and snotty attitude, I won't be returning to this place anytime soon. Hopefully, the owners are a different breed.
author: Steve S.

description:
We've dreamed of coming here for years and were able to drop by for dessert.
We shared the blueberry nectarine crisp and the brown sugar custard tart with peaches and raspberries. Both were delectable.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description:
I'll be brief.  Lived in SF for 20+ years, and I've been around the block as well.

Go here.  SF's best overall restaurant for the ambiance and food with attentive yet casual service.  A beautiful, low pretense brasserie serving world class grub.  This is SF, or what Paris should be?
author: Rob T.

description: AWESOME service not just from our waiter, but the whole staff. Our waiter brought us an extra appetizer, then an extra drink, and then a complimentary dessert when he noticed we were celebrating a wedding (we didn't, rather forgot, to tell him). The lamb sirloin was really good; The carpaccio + crab was really good.
author: Thomas C.

description: Had a celebratory work lunch here. Exceptional food and service. Intimate, old-school feel. I had the salmon and it was fantastic. Our team several desserts and they were all bomb. PS Had a bite of someone else's burger and it was divine!
author: Phoebe V.

description:
Perfection. Plated.

Boulevard was amazing from the service to the decor to the food. Down to the last bite. Since people have mostly covered it, I'll just add that it's an excellent spot for vegetarians. The chefs made me a delicious veggie plate and the waitress was very accommodating, going out of her way to tell me when there were unexpected animal products in their dishes. Much appreciated.

Go here. You won't be sorry.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
Great food!! Impressive pairings, and my taste buds were highly entertained. It's kind of fru-fru plating, which I'm fine with, but don't expect large portions. The scallops appetizer had 3 tiny scallops for around $20. TINY. But YUMMY! Our waiter/server was so sweet, and we had a romantic table for my husband's bday. 

It was on my bucket list of restuarants. Will I go back? Sure, but I'm sure there are a lot more places I want to try first.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Wasn't as impressed as everyone makes it out to be. Good service, fun atmosphere, but food was sub par and not as tasty as I'd hoped...well on the pork chop and scallops. I can't speak for the whole menu.
author: Richard W.

description:
So the food lived up to the hype - heard a lot of great things and saw the reviews so finally tried this place out. It will end up being a pricey meal so be prepared. It was my bday dinner so my wife decided to splurge here.

Ambience: wasn't too impressed - decor is ok and diners seemed to be all finance/consultant/lawyer types so had that conservative, stuffy feel. The one nice thing is you can see the bridge so get close to the Embarcadero window and you'll get a great view with your meal

Apps: split the calamari, not the usual fried basket but the squid was cut and filled with some shrimp filling that had a bit of a kick to it - quite tasty

Wine: superb (Chardonnay and Pinot Noir - I forget the brands but both from Santa Barbara)

Entrée: I had the New Zealand Grouper, which was good and flavorful but my wife won out by having the Pork Prime Rib Chop - easily the best pork chop I've ever had....succulent, tender and perfectly cooked! We saw a number of pork chops being served and heard other customers talking about it so I guess this is their thing.
 
Dessert: some sort of chocolate concoction that had peanut butter, vanilla ice cream and chocolate bon bons...very tasty.

It can be a challenge to get reservations so book in advance. We did it last minute and had a 9:15pm slot but were able to go early and get seated at 8pm. A very good dining experience...I give it 4.5 stars, not quite enough to go all the way.
author: Alex C.

description:
Atmosphere: Elegant and luxurious. The building is reminiscent of an older era.

Service: Amazing, friendly and very professional.

Total cost: $180 - 1 starter, 2 entrees, 1 dessert and 2 cocktails. 

It's definitely on the expensive side, but when in SF you should at least try Boulevard once. Make sure to try the bacon wrapped quail and the carpaccio.

I Recommend Boulevard if you're in the area.
author: Ray N.

description: Very nice for a quick lunch, not nearly as jampacked as others in the area. Had the tartare (ahi) which was not one of my best ever, not super excited about the fritters, the codcake at Park Tavern is better, as is the boulevardier, which here was mildly sweet and not to my taste, but the midnight manhattan was an awesome cocktail! Service as expected, very much at a high level, and without many faults, although the reception at the door was poor. I genuinely did not feel welcomed by the host(although this isnt abnormal for me at high end spots.) however the waitstaff and bartender were definitely both hospitable and knowledgable. Boulevard was once an excellent restaurant with impeccable standards in food as well as service. However I think the food has taken a turn, whether its because of Nancy's (Nancy Oakes) preoccupation with other projects or the CDC is not up to par, the food is a bit unimaginative, and has little or no wow power to it. Dont let this review deter you however, this is still THE restaurant to visit on the embarcadero. I would only suggest you visit during dinner service.
author: Cameron Y.

description:
Great place for special occasions. 
I've been here many times and love the food.  I also bought Nancy Oakes' Boulevard cookbook but the recipes are too time consuming. You're better off eating here.
One thing I noticed is that appetizers tend to be a little better than entrees. 
Overall a great experience.
author: Oscar W.

description:
I am a foody. I'll admit it. I love to cook and more than that, I love to dine out to taste what the tastemakers are putting in front of some of the most discerning palates. Boulevard is THE BEST IN SAN FRANCISCO. Trust me, I have bee to just about every great restaurant in this city and none satisfies, surprises, and delights me more than Boulevard. The service is great. The ambiance is cozy. The wines are so good they taste like liquid candy. The food it to die for. I usually put in a good suggestion on the menu as a tip for yelpers, but seriously, everything is divine. Whatever you order, you will be delighted! Eat at Boulevard. You will thank me. 

You're welcome :)
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I was a little skeptical because just because a restaurant is popular doesn't  always means it measures up where it matters - the food.

Everything was stellar.  We were warmly greeted when we arrived and shown to our table which was next to the open kitchen. It was fun to watch everyone in the kitchen work together in a complimentary way.

I had a special appetizer - fresh linguini with truffles.  The pasta was just the right density, the sauce was creamy and the truffles gave it just the right amount of earthiness.  For my entree I had the quail.  I have never had   quail so tasty and perfectly cooked (and I probably never will until I return to this restaurant.)  It was a breast and 2 small drumsticks.  Cooked to medium rare plus.  It was magnificent.  

The entire experience was delightful.  A restaurant like this could be snooty, but everyone we encountered was warm, but also efficient.  

Great food and a well-run restaurant!  A real treat.
author: Kathryn L.

description:
Went here for our 5th anniversary.

Decor/Atmosphere: Very nice, upscale and unique feeling without being pretentious. We felt very comfortable. Open kitchen near the bar smells amazing.

Service: Very good and attentive.  Couldn't have been much better.

Food: Truly outstanding. I can see why this restaurant got a Michelin star. We were impressed with every part of the meal, which included calamari, crab soup (which came with a wonderful uni pretzel toast), quail, and sea bass dishes. The presentation was beautiful and the flavors were up to the same standard.

Price: We felt like it was a deal for the quality of food we got.
author: Morli V.

description:
To me, Boulevard is the standard by which other fine dining establishments are judged.  It does everything very well, from their food to drink selection, from their service staff to the ambiance of the place.  I have no gripes about this place, and cannot point out a single flaw.  However, nothing about it stands out as extraordinary, and that is the reason why I am giving it 4 stars and not 5.

To start, I had the truffle risotto and Monterey red abalone.  Both were delicious, with the truffles taking the edge slightly.  For the main course, I tried the king quail and king salmon dishes.  The quail is excellent, my favorite course of the night, while the salmon was very well cooked and smoked but felt a bit lacking (though for what reason, I'm not sure).  The desserts were excellent as well - the butterscotch pudding was solid, while the Italian bon bons were tiny balls of fun and tasty.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Boulevard has been my favorite restaurant in San Francisco for years.  It's consistently fantastic and never fails to impress.  I have never had a bad meal at Boulevard.  Never.  

The food is spectacular, the view of the Bay Bridge is beautiful, and the service is impeccable every time.  I'd say my most memorable meal at the restaurant was when I took my friend, Scott, here for his 50th birthday lunch a couple of years ago.  I made a reservation and requested a quiet corner table with a view.  Boulevard delivered in spades!  

We had a huge corner table with a view of the bridge and we felt very secluded and comfortable as we celebrated Scott's 50th birthday.  Most of all, everyone from the hostess to the waiter understood the special occasion and made our visit very special.

We were scheduled to watch a matinee of Wicked that day so I told our waiter that time was of the essence.  The service was phenomenal.  We each had 3 courses and then shared his birthday dessert.  All of our selections were delicious.  I tried some of Scott's food and it was divine.  But it was my meal that I remember most vividly.

I started with the ahi tartare.  It was a delectable starter that was beautifully presented.  It was followed by the lobster bisque.  Oh my, oh my, oh my...  Yum!!!  And to think I wasn't even going to order it.  But Scott was torn between ordering the lobster bisque or a salad.  I told him to order both.  He was hesitant.  So when the waiter took our order, I decided to order the lobster bisque as an extra course for myself.  Okay, I was going to share with the birthday boy too!  LOL.  

But when Scott saw that I ordered 3 courses, he contemplated ordering the lobster bisque himself.  Of course, he asked our waiter if the soup came in a cup or a bowl.  Oh Scott!!!  This is Boulevard not a diner!  I tried very hard not to laugh out loud.  It was actually very cute.  It was one of those unforgettable moments when you realize why you're friends with someone.  Scott could always make me laugh...sometimes intentionally and sometimes (like this time) unintentionally.  The waiter kindly explained that it came in a shallow bowl plate.  The waiter was very gracious about it all.    

Scott then asked our waiter if he thought 3 courses was too much food.  Both the waiter and I said "no" at the same time.  To be fair, I was used to dining at Boulevard and am keenly aware of the serving sizes.  This was Scott's first time at the restaurant.

The lobster bisque was fabulous.  Simply fabulous!  It's one of my favorite dishes there.  It's creamy yet subtle.  It's the best lobster bisque I've ever had.  Seriously, if you go to Boulevard and it's on the menu, you have to try it.  It's awesome!

My main entree were the lamb chops.  I love lamb and these were perfectly cooked medium rare chops just the way I like them.  They succulent, well seasoned, and heavenly.  

After our each of our 3 courses plus the birthday dessert, we were stuffed!  It was a beautiful meal on a gorgeous day by the Bay.  Thank you Boulevard for always making every meal I have at your establishment memorable and spectacular!
author: Chrys S.

description:
Took the boss/wife here for VDAY celebration 2012 and once again this place has exceeded all expectations. It was definitely popping as the Prince of Taiwan walked through the door and was greeted by the hostess. As I surveyed the room, I really had to think to myself.."where is this damn recession?" You had people of every ilk and color eating away at their food like starving Chinamen at my local Moonstar buffet and it seems like money was raining everywhere. When we were seated, i noticed to my right that were two tourists from Texas seemingly spending their money on bottles and bottles of wine like there was no tomorrow. I was surprised the manager didn't come out and lick the guy's butt for being so spend-y. 

There was so much money abound that the Prince of Taiwan felt like he was from North Korea instead...and that is a sad thing to say.

For the Apps we tried the boudin and lobster and the little gem salad with Green Goddess dressing. Both items were clean and really tasted fresh. The lobster was a small bite, but o what a glorious bite it was.

mains were the Pork chop and Lamb Prime Rib. the portions are smaller than the cuts you would get at a typical steakhouse but the taste and profiles were more complex. 

Dessert was a definite treat with the icebox..this wonderful creation of mousse, cream, all encased in a white chocolate box. 

left feeling like we were celebrities.
author: Jerry C.

description:
My wonderful and amazing boyfriend has taken me here, to my favorite restaurant in the world, two years in a row now for my birthday, and it has NEVER disappointed me, or even come close. I also came here for my 20th birthday with my dad and brother and the experience was wonderful then as well. 

Had an 8:15pm reservation Friday, 12/16/11. Arrived at about 8:10pm. We had to wait about ten or fifteen minutes for our table though as my boyfriend had requested a seat near the windows, but Boulevard is such a magnificently beautiful restaurant and is even more stunning when its decorated for Christmas, that its quite pleasant to sit and just take in the surroundings. I ordered a drink from the bar, a Mojito. Best damn Mojito I have ever had. 

When we got our table we we discovered that our waiter was the same waiter we had had for my birthday the previous year! We told him this and he was very excited, and asked us if we had enjoyed ourselves last year to which I replied, "Well we wouldn't be back this year if it hadn't been!" He said he thought he remembered us, which I believe would be a bit of a stretching of the truth, I mean it was a year ago. Its not like we're there every Friday night. Anyways, this excited him enough that he brought us each an amuse bouche, "Compliments of the house". Super yummy!!! It had plain yogurt, glazed and caramelized granola, a mandarin orange section, and a few other things, which I can't even explain, but OMG it was a slice of heaven. So that was awesome. 

For appetizer we split the crab salad with comes with fresh heart of palm. The other two times I have been there this salad has come with tiny pieces of lime. This time I didn't detect any lime, but there were some slices of grapefruit. It was delicious. 

For the main course we each got the fillet Mignon. I know I need to branch out and try new things, but why bother if it's so good?! This if the best fillet Mignon in the world. Hands down. In fact, I dare you to try and find one cooked better. Cooked medium rare this fillet could be cut with a spoon it is so tender. I could go on and on, and in fact I think I may have just drooled all over my laptop after writing this. Its just THAT good, trust me on this. It arrived on a bed of perfectly cooked spinach and fingerling potatoes. The potatoes were very large for fingerling, but super yummy. 

For dessert we had the Dreamsicle Brulee. It had a Meyer lemon meringue whipped topping, which was tart and tasty. The creme brulee was amazing, it had a sort of orange gel bottom which was a nice surprise on the bottom of the brulee bowl. It also came with a Meyer lemon sorbet sandwich. Also delicious. Boyfriend also had a cinnamon ice cream bonbon. He said it was great, so I believe him. 

Everyone here is so wonderful and amazing, the service has always been excellent. It really is an art form, even watching the busers clear the table, they do it a certain way and there is something interesting about it. 

I highly recommend this restaurant. Always a pleasure.
author: Stephanie S.

description: If you are in San Francisco for ANY reason, you must dine at Boulevard.  The food is PERFECTION.  The atmosphere is classic San Francisco, the noise level is perfect and the tables have enough space between to afford a great dining experience.  Both the cocktails and the wine list are amazing.  The waiters are quite well versed in the preparation of the dishes. We come here every single time we plan a trip to the city.  Dinner reservations should be made 30-days in advance.  If you cannot get in for dinner, make it a point to get there for lunch.  This restaurant will NEVER disappoint.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Worth the time and the money. 

Being as I used to frequent Shanghai 1930 all the time, i couldnt help but notice this spot. It has been on my list of places to try but I have never had a chance until the other day. I had the american kobe beef burger for lunch and needless to say it was what i thought it would be....just a properly cooked burger. I had kobe beef in NY this past march and it tasted the exact same. Just a perfectly cooked burger. Nice and juicy. ...no complaints, but no accolades either. The fries we amazing though! Never have I tasted fries that good in my life. The best hands down. What blew my mind though was the desert. 

I had the black forest ice box cake and after one bite i felt as if everything in the world had no tangible meaning or worth. What was this flavourful concoction that the gods decided to send to my table? So many different flavors so perfectly paired, i had no idea what to do. I have never take so much time to finish a dessert as i did that day. I just did not want it to end, but unfortunately, like all good things, it came to an end. 

I recommend taking someone there for dinner on a date. Elegant, intimate, and amazing food.
author: Derek F.

description:
This place is one of my staples for client dinners / work events. Food is good, atmosphere is work appropriate and they have attentive service. Also good for a group or a date, crowd mixes between 30s and older but definitely a lot of work folks. I've had very good luck on food here and can't think of anything that was bad. That being said, nothing stands out either but for the price and what i need it for it fits the bill and so i go alot.

From the current menu can recommend the following: ahi tuna tartare, royal sweet scallops (scallops always prepared well here), maine lobster pyramid ravioli (very rich), crab salad (basic), salmon (portion is good), white sea bass. And for dessert, my favorite meal, chocolate flourless cake, warm gravenstein and pink pearl apple tart, peach almond custard cake
author: sasha h.

description: The hostess are about the worst!!! So rude!!!! They had maybe 3 tables that were being occupied and they turned us away for dinner. It was like really? Everyone is coming in for there reservation in the next 45 minutes. Please. Get some customer service!!! Horrible!!!
author: Jaffe L.

description:
Came into Boulevard by chance, looking for coffee, and extremely overwhelmed by all of the happy hour packed places by our hotel. Boulevard looked pretty empty at first. There were a handful of people sitting at the bar, but that changed quickly as they opened for dinner. 

I still can't believe they gave us a table despite not having a reservation and our probably offensive attire. Are the people in San Francisco just that nice!? (I decided at the end of my trip that yes, yes they are.) We really weren't aware of Boulevard's amazing reputation. We would have otherwise made the effort to change out of our lax, borderline hip-hop show travel clothes. 

The food---Deviled Crab Bisque, Maine Lobster & Taylor Mussel Beignets, Wood Oven Roasted Filet Mignon---, the service, the 'ambiance' altogether made for an amazing experience.
author: Desiree R.

description:
We shared a scallops appetizer with a couple of Mai Tai's to celebrate our anniversary; both very nice! For entrees, we had Filet Mignon and Swordfish. All the food was fabulous. My wife commented that the service was the best and most "classy" that she had ever experienced in a restaurant.
Service Example: I ordered horseradish sauce with my filet. My sauce arrived 2 minutes before my filet.
Update: Second visit: Results were 5 stars again. Wood roasted pork chop melts in your mouth. This time, I saved room for dessert; a lemon tart that was delightful.
Service was very personal.
author: Wayne S.

description: Awesome French restaurant. We went there by chance and we were actually not expecting a Michelin-star! The quil was so delicately cooked. It's great in the look, the smell, and the taste~ Great service and also icecream :)
author: Ming H.

description: I visit San Francisco quite a bit for business and I've always wanted to step into Boulevard.  It's in a beautiful building and near the Embarcadero.  I finally got a chance, taking my grown daughter with me.  We sat in the bar.  The bartender clearly saw us, but did not come to take our order for at least 15 minutes.  When he did come, he said "Is there something I can do for you?"  I replied with "You certainly can, you can take our order."  We ordered drinks.  I asked my daughter if she was hungry and she said she would have to see a menu.  The bartender, who was standing there when she said that, then walked away.  And never came back.  The service was SO RUDE.  Which is very unfortunate because it is beautiful inside.  It was a huge disappointment and I will not return.
author: Hope P.

description: Boulevard's food is addictive. Service is consistently friendly, helpful, and attentive. The experience is always spectacular.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
We went to San Francisco for business, our first recommendation by a local person was to go to boulevard.  We went, made reservations and headed here that night... A few drinks and 3 courses later we fell in love. The decor, views (at a table in the back), and the service (Alisha is the best waitress ever! If you get her, it's your lucky day) were all remarkable.  O, yea we ate food there too... Every dish was prepared perfectly, looked amazing, was very flavorful with various textures, and every single ingredient added something to each dish.  So much so that we went back the very next night.  All in all we had most of the menu in those 2 nights and no plate had anything left on it after any course. The second night Alisha even brought us a small bite before our appetizers, and it was not something given to every table (we watched!), and were also treated to a free glass of wine after being a repeat customer... Just another thing that made this a great dining experience.

If you are a person that appreciates a good dining experience, and are not one of those "well everyone says its amazing, so I'm going to try hard to find something bad about it" people... Trust me, go here.  I am from Philly and there are some great restaurants there... But this is honestly one of, if not the best place I have ever dined at... If I could give it 20 stars, I would.  If you don't like it... I will be shocked, stop reading and stop yelping and go.

Also, save room for dessert! and if you do get Alisha, tell her we said hi.
author: Mike Z.

description:
I'm a VEGETARIAN. Now that that's out of the way...

They did an incredible job on my birthday last year. Even though the menu is lacking on vegetarian entrees (I think there was maybe one), they made a beautiful platter of all the vegetarian sides from the meaty entrees. Sounds like it could've been a disaster, but it was Delightful! This past year I went to Millenium for my birthday and while it was good, Boulevard was better.  -- it also helps that my boyfriend (cook at Zuni) knew someone in the kitchen so we got all the delightful little amuse bouches too. ;) 

Moral of the story: vegetarians, you won't be disappointed.
author: Kate L.

description:
Mixed food quality, and not very good value for the money. My appetizer was really outstanding: truffles on risotto. But the scallops were just alright: cooked to my liking, but rather bland. My friend had sole and had a similar opinion. We had two cheeses for dessert: I've had far better.

Fairly nice ambience and good service. I think overpriced.
author: George F.

description:
One of the best restaurant I ate in a while. 

Starters: In terms of foie gras, it was as good as Gary Danko and The Dining Room. But what i liked about it more than the other restaurant is that this place bring both torchon and seared instead of big one kind. I like little of everything. The goat cheese ravioli with shaved truffle is creative and divine. 

Main: I had guinea hen presse. whenever I see something unusual, i have to order them. This time, it was not mistake. It was most creative bird dish i have eaten!! The mushroom and kale sausage that came is it was so yummy i did not know that it was mushroom until i looked back the menu. Oh not to mention truffle dumpling. Only thing on this dish was i wish truffle smell was a bit stronger. 

We each had 2 glasses of wine, appetizer, main, and 1/2 of dessert and it came out to be little over $100 per person. Thats' so much cheaper than Gary Danko or The Dining Room and comparable. Not to mention, better view with Bay Bridge.

Over all, I had a great dinner
author: Mika G.

description:
Beautiful restaurant, and great view of the ferry building.
And it was my first time eating pork chop that's still pink
author: Yimin C.

description: All I can say is WOW!  Boulevard Restaurant is one of the best restaurants I have every been too. I called on Friday night and they were booked solid. I tried back again Saturday and it just so happened that someone had canceled their reservation. We arrived and the place was packed. We had to wait so we headed to the bar and it was packed. We had a couple of glasses of pinot and a shot of patron while we waited. We were finally seated but didn't really care for our seats. We wanted a booth against the wall. Our waiter was kind enough to move us to a more desirable table. I ordered the Pork Prime Rib Chop it was beautiful, scrumptious and totally tender. My friend ordered the Pan Roasted Wild King again the presentation of her plate was flawless. I had a couple of bites and it was delicious! I can't wait to go back! :-)
author: Sonia L.

description:
You know, honestly not as impressed.  I've heard such good things over the course of a few years but for some reason, never made it out to Boulevard.  When I finally did, I wasn't wowed by the reviews and recommendations of Michelin quality food for prices under $75/person.

Tuna Tartare wasn't anything special, especially knowing the kind that Michael Mina had to offer.

I believe my main course was a lobster stuffed calamari that seemed exactly as it sounds without any of the punch or pizazz that I'd expect from a Michelin caliber restaurant.  

All in all, to me, these dishes could have been served in any mid-range quality San Francisco restaurant.
author: Jeff N.

description:
Boulevard is enclosed in one of San Francisco's oldest buildings along the Embarcadero. Once a vodka distillery that was one of the only buildings saved in the 1906 earthquake (for reasons that are obvious if you're a vodka fan), it now houses the 2011 Michelin Rated Boulevard.

They really pack it in at Boulevard with a busy bar area and tables very close to each other. Needless to say, this is not an intimate quiet restaurant. Take a look at the vaulted brick ceilings when you enter the rotating door. The interior also has some interesting light fixtures and decor which is reminiscent of the cheesecake factory decor in some respect. With that said, you can't compare the cheesecake factory with Boulevard as the food speaks for itself.

So onto the food! I started off with their beet salad. Served with different varieties of cut beats with nuts and a light dressing the beets were purely spectacular--with a taste so fresh and crisp. A great way to start the the night.

Next up was their pork chop. Served atop a bed of what appeared to be mini gnocchi pieces and spinach, the pork was juicy and seared to perfection with rich flavors.

I topped off dinner with a nice chocolate cake and cream--and in my book a chocolate cake with a lava center is a good cake! At boulevard it was a great cake--cooked just right and served warm and savory!
author: Andrew S.

description:
I judge based on peer comparatives, not on an objective scale.  You could get the same quality food and service, with better ambiance, for slightly less extortionate prices, at a better location.  Perbacco?

Food - abalone: unimpressive, deep-fried. Beef carpaccio: tasty, not heavy. Salmon entree: balanced, light, flavorful, not too salty. Dessert: creative, diverse. 

Atmosphere - lively. The layout of the dining area and bar, and the coziness of the ornamentation, make the place seem vaguely jazz-era Paris.

Prices - I would not have come here if my employer hadn't been paying. Four appetizers, four entrees, four desserts, and two bottles of wine. After tip: $370.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Okay.

Well, I am a tough critic and love my food. However, I have to give Boulevard 5 stars. Have to. I came here with a group of friends- 5 of us total- and was treated like a queen from the moment I walked in. The wait staff quickly moved aside as we walked through, bent over backwards for us, and were SO nice. SO informative. I also enjoyed a glass or three of Pinot Gris... such a good choice.

Then the food came! We had two orders of crab-stuffed Calamari as well as two orders of scallops. DELICIOUS. Amazing. Loved it!! I ordered the Halibut as my entree, and I have zero complaints. It was so good. 

The decor is a bit outdated, but honestly, I like that. Old charm and class. Nothing beats that.
author: Kristin F.

description:
I went to Boulevard Restaurant for my birthday this past Thursday 9/29/11 with my fiance.  I had a wonderful time.  Going to expensive restaurants is not really my thing, but I decided to make an exception for my birthday.

I have to say that I was very impressed, and the hostess and wait staff were very down to earth, polite and well manered.  The food was absolutely to die for.  For an appetizer I had the spicy scallops, yum.  For my main entree I had the wild salmon, absolutely delicious, and for dessert I had the apple tart with vanilla ice cream.  All made to perfection.  I loved how they spaced out everything, so I never felt rushed and didn't feel stuffed.  Portions were perfect, the drinks were wonderful.  Our waitor was not pretentious at all, I absolutely hate when I go to an upscale restaurant and the staff thinks they are better than the customer.  Our waitor, made me feel at ease by just being normal, and attentive.

Highly recommend it.  Very hip, good atmosphere.
author: Camila B.

description:
I was a little self-conscious walking in on a whim with a buddy, as neither of us were well-dressed, but there was no judgement at all. In fact, we were seated immediately at the chef's counter (6:45PM on a Friday).

Pretty much what you expected from neo-French, Michelin-starred cuisine. The food was top-notch, and I left feeling perfectly satisfied. A nice dry French cider was a welcome accompaniment, but do yourself a favor and skip the cocktails. Mediocre at best.
author: Justin M.

description: Everything about this place is really good: the service, the plating, the flavor combinations; good restaurant, very good food.
author: Matt L.

description: Great for a special occasion!  This French Fare is on-point.
author: Callie R.

description:
Truly amazing food, service and desserts! I love this place! Everything is exceptionally fresh and they have a great wine list.

My only gripe is not about the restaurant itself, but the amount of tourists that walk in wearing jeans or track suits - it's such a beautiful, classy restaurant and the prices are definitely upscale... just ruins the ambiance
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
This place is WAY over-rated and over-priced.  The interior décor is beautiful!  I'll give them that, but most of the tables overlook a bus parking lot so that detracts a little.

I knew this was expensive, so I called ahead to get price info.  It wasn't a high as I expected, so I went ahead and made reservations.  It was only after my dinner companions and I were seated that I found out I had been given INCORRECT prices.  The staff didn't even apologize for the mistake!  I found the food to be good, but not outstanding.  I wouldn't go back.
author: S. C.

description: Wow... What a great dining experience! It's been awhile since we have been back to San Francisco, but restaurants like Boulevard make something seem timeless! Thank you DT & MT
author: Donnie T.

description:
What a wonderful experience. My fiance and I came here to celebrate Valentine's day a night early. We had received a gift certificate to Boulevard for our recent engagement from my brother's family and thought it was be a great place for the holiday.

Upon arriving, service was top notch. We had to wait about 5 minutes at the bar for our table but once ready, we were escorted by a friendly hostess who handled our beverages, and were seated in the dark yet classy and bustly dining area. 

We had a great waiter who was attentive and nice during the entire meal, and never overbearing. Now to the food.

Appetizers: We decided to split two appetizers, the foie gras and the quail. Absolutely delicious. The foie gras rivals Fleur de Lys's foie gras which has been #1 in my book (comon, it has shaved black truffles on it!) but Boulevard's combo with the bread or whatever they serve it with and the overall flavor made the dish incredible. The quail was also excellent and I quote, "This is one of the best things I've ever had," said the fiance. We couldn't believe how incredible the starters were.

Entrees: Keeping it all in the fowl family, we both ordered the duck. Never order the same thing but neither of us was budging on our decision. We both really enjoyed it. I couldn't even finish my entire order I was so full!

Dessert: Nothing crazy here, just got a scoop of chocolate ice cream and he got grappa.

We had a wonderful experience here and I hope to be back! Valentine's dinner was a sucess! You will drop a pretty penny here so be ready, but the service, ambience and food make it worth it!
author: Dalia M.

description: To die for! Had the truffle ravioli and ahi tuna for appetizers, both delectable. Then had the swordfish and risotto, halibut and fingerlings, and filet mignon and corn+mashers for our entrees...all of which were absolutely unique and superb! The creativity of the dishes was the best part, not the "safe" (bland) preparation you'll find at other steak and seafood restaurants. Everything was delicious and the service was wonderful as well. Best meal I've had in my week long visit and foodie exploration of San Fran!!!
author: Samantha M.

description:
I've been to Boulevard on a number of occasions, for lunch and dinner and I've never been disappointed to this point. Seemingly, I could blindfold myself and blindly point to something on the menu and I could rest assured that whatever comes out would be good. Yes, I trust Nancy Oakes that much. The service is top notch and the ambiance is above average. You also might run into a celebrity of two here...I saw 49ers great Ronnie Lott, but didn't bother him since he looked like he was in deep conversation and plus he's made a career out of laying the hard hits.

BTW, did you know that she's the wife of famed sausage entrepreneur Bruce Aidell of Aidell's sausages? Found this out because Aidell's was one of our clients at the firm I used to work for.
author: Jason C.

description:
I like this place. I'm glad it's famous, and I'd come back again for a special occasion. But, I was disappointed just enough that I'm knocking off a star.

My one gripe is with the food. Among 3 guys, we ordered the following:

1 glass of strawberry-mango lemonade
1 glass of regular lemonade
1 glass of pinot noir

Ahi tuna tartare
Lobster ravioli

Sea bass
Duck breast
Lamb chop

First, the drinks. I was on-call so I couldn't have any alcohol -- hence the lemonade. Both the plain and the strawberry-mango were way too sweet. Like, teeth-shatteringly sweet. Only after letting the ice melt into them for half and hour did the drinks become more tolerable. My friend's pinot, however, was quite good (so he said, anyway).

The appetizers were also so-so. The tuna tartare was tasty but an awfully small portion. The lobster ravioli was especially disappointing -- a little dry, lukewarm, and although filled with plenty of lobster meat, the meat itself was tougher than even lobster should be.

Fortunately, the entrees were terrific. I had the sea bass, which was expertly pan-fried and paired with the most delicious artichoke hearts I've ever had. My friends' entrees were even better. The duck breast in particular was incredible, with liver wrapped in duck skin on the side that was just rich enough without being too fatty.

The service was also excellent. Waters and bread were refilled promptly, and not once did I feel we were waiting unreasonably long for attention. And the space! There's an old money, almost Southern quality to the restaurant that's a nice contrast to ultra-modern settings like Luce or low-lit, intimate dining rooms like Gary Danko's. We ate on a clear evening with a view of the Bay Bridge, and when we left we caught the tail end of the sunset.
author: Albert L.

description: Wonderful experience at the Boulevard. My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and wanted to try a place that fit our foodie needs/wants. The presentation of the food was spot on and the service complimented the experience perfectly. Our waitress was very knowledgable about the food including origin, how it was prepared and how she would suggest we remake the dishes at our own home. Very happy with the experience and my boyfriend and I look forward to visiting again with our friends.
author: Kelsey M.

description: Our go-to place in San Francisco. Love the food and decor. I miss their orange creme brulee though. Hope they bring it back soon.
author: Positron X.

description:
Went here last week as a birthday dinner date with the hubby. 
We made reservations for 630pm and was seated promptly upon arrive.  We started off with a glass of wine and a long island for the Mr.  (they make good drinks - def top shelf alcohol). Followed by seared scallops (melt in your mouth delicious), Freebie - tempura veg with spicey aoli, Filet mignon (delish - cooked perfectly)
author: Sheenie L.

description: This place is fantastic! Expensive, but fantastic. Came here for my wife's birthday and we were seated immediately. Came at about 8:30-9pm and the place was packed but our table was waiting for us even though we were about 15 minutes late. Our waiter was very good. Suggested a very good and affordable wine (he could have really screwed us, but he knew just what we wanted). Was very helpful with the menu items and funny. He even brought out free coffee and dessert since it was her birthday... Again,the place is first class and well worth it, but it is expensive. Make sure your credit card is good lol. Overall I will definitely be back for another special occasion or next time I am in SF... Thank you!
author: Ryan C.

description:
Great food! Spectacular drinks. We ate there recently for my daughter's birthday.The servers are very knowledgeable about the wine. Can't wait to go back there soon.
I highly recommend
author: Laks C.

description: Great place just really over rated in my opinion. The pork was really good and so was the banana ice cream . Doubt we will return though.
author: Steven J.

description: I absolutely love their Brent Wolfe King Quail. I've came here a few times and always ordered this dish.
author: Krystal S.

description: Came here for dessert and coffee. The service was great. Ordered the bittersweet chocolate and caramel s'more. The ganache was absolutely delicious and the dessert was beautiful. My only complaint was that the scoop of caramel ice cream was actually like a quarter of a scoop.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Boulevard is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Their kitchen is amazing, and the service is rather great as well.

The most important thing it has going for it is consistency - I keep coming back here, and every single time the food and the experience are simply phenomenal. There are a lot of other places that are terrific on one visit but then the next time aren't quite as awesome. Boulevard, though, have really managed to deliver exactly what I expect every single time.
author: Victor K.

description:
I kept hearing about how wonderful this restaurant was, and I was immensely pleased by the quality of the food and the service. Several times during our meal I found I wasn't paying attention to the conversation because I was too busy enjoying the food! 

I feel like I should wax rhapsodic about how amazing the experience was, but honestly, it would be a disservice to the elegance of the meal, and the service, to indulge in superfluous praise - Boulevard speaks for itself!
author: Meg L.

description:
this restaurant is a special kind of occasion meal, especially since you can't just walk in and get a table. the decor inside is absolutely gorgeous, it really transforms you from where you are. i forgot i was in san francisco.

food amazing! it was delicious, full of bold flavors and dimensional. my favorite was the foie gras, how can you screw that up though right? the lamb and the duck is tres delish as well. make reservations, bring a loved one, ignore the price and enjoy the night!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
still great after all these years.  i came for dinner w/ my family last night, and it was lovely.  the whole restaurant was decked out in xmas decorations, which was beautiful.  we shared 3 apps, the best of which was the gnocchi w/ mushrooms.  the ahi tartare and crab and avocado were also good, but the gnocchi stood out more.

i had the sole for dinner, which was a light(er) meal than the other dishes my family got.  the pork chop was huge!

for dessert, we ordered a matcha bonbon, a scoop of brown sugar miso ice cream, and the lemon bar, but the server accidentally brought out the butterscotch pudding rather than the lemon bar.  we didn't complain and started eating it.  he then realized he was supposed to give us the lemon bar, so he brought that too!  we essentially got one dessert for free, but we probably didn't need it.  of course, we ate it anyway, and it was delicious.
author: Helen T.

description: The appetizers are over priced and mediocre. The service is decent and the entrees are pretty good.  They use too much butter and too much salt on everything and the corn is canned... it's summer corn is on season it shouldn't be canned. All in all its about $5 overpriced per dish. Nice view of the bay bridge though.
author: Jacklyn H.

description:
After every therapy session I go to, I like to treat myself to something. 

Drinks at Zeki's with Keane? Yes. 

World of Warcraft questing until 2am? I deserve it. 

Dinner by myself? I'm not a cheap date and I don't put out but sure let's go. 

Dinner at Boulevard with Amanda? Why do you keep asking me? You already know I'm going to say yes. 

So last night we went to Boulevard as our own little therapy because Amanda doesn't get out anymore unless she's going to the store for more cupcake ingredients. 

Everything on the menu has black truffles on it. EVERYTHING. So I thought, wow! I feel all classy and professional because I'm about to eat something that normally people save for special occasions! Well yes I would like that gigantic glass of wine despite not eating all day, thanks!

We end the night having had probably 5 or 6 courses: some made specifically for us by one of the chefs (her friend Cameron), and some that we ordered ourselves. While the food itself was flavorful and unique, I couldn't really say it was 5 stars for me. For others it might be, but I'm not a huge fan of a) cala fish (?) and b) calamari unless it's deep fried with lots of dipping sauce. But it was delicious Cameron! So 4 and a 1/2 stars. 

The SERVICE was amazing. Patrick, our bartender and the barback that would set up our utensils after every course, were just superb. He asked for our IDs and said, "You have a youthful air about you" *squeals* I don't look as old as I feel when I'm wearing these glasses! (So 5 stars!)

By the time dinner was over, not only was I two sheets to the wind but I was also too full for dessert. Next time, I promise. 

When I woke up this morning in my bed, my phone had died. Then when I got to work and checked my friend's tweets from the night before (because I'm bored), I found this: 

@formschlag: took a minute to realize that when his gf stopped talking to him on the phone mid sentence.... she had fallen asleep. 

5 stars for their wine list, and the glass of fernet we were served as an appertif, but negative 500 stars to Amanda for saying, "Don't black truffles taste like manstuff to you?" :| Next time I'm ordering the filet.
author: Jaime L.

description:
If I had a better expense account, i would eat here all the time.

Fell in love the first time I walked in from the Parisian Deco exterior to the rather laid back interior with attentive but non fussy staff.

Foie Gras was incredible.  I don't care if you have to strangle a whole flock of geese one at a time to-- wait you mean its not veguh-whoops!  Seriously peeps, I love all kinds of animals but this stuff is delicious.

Fillet was extremely tender perfectly done from top to bottom with a good sear ... must be sous vide?

Its pricey.  I was coming back from the Ferry  building when a homeless guy asked me out (yeah, been that kind of week) and I almost said "I've got a half hour if we're going to Boulevard), lol.
author: Kelly D.

description:
This has been on my list of places to try for a long time so when my mom came to visit me, it became the perfect excuse to take her out! Street parking is free after 6PM (our reservation was right at 6PM so there was plenty of parking for a Sat evening). 
Ordered the following:
Sea Scallops- Good but for how much you're paying, I expected a little better. It was pretty standard but the prices were pricier than other restaurants
Sonoma Foie Gras - Good, one of the better foie gras I've had but I can probably get just as good foie gras somewhere else. However, was still a winner for me but I'm not fan of the decorative foam that all these fancy restaurants are doing. I don't get the appeal. The grapefruit was a nice complement
Liberty Farms Duck Breast - My favorite dish of the night. Really tender, rich, savory, delicious, you name it. It was also my mom's favorite dish. 
Halibut - I'm not a huge fan of halibut but this one was pretty good. Really light in comparison to the duck but delicious. 
Roasted Pork Prime Rib Chop - Just as good as the duck but with a different flavor. Really meaty and savory. 
For dessert, I forget the name but it had nuts, whip cream, chocolate icecream, and Pepperidge farm cookies. It was delicious but a slightly heavier dessert. 

Overall, I'm glad I finally got to try this place and cross it off my list.
author: Diana Y.

description: I wrote a review on April 1 about a very bad experience at Boulevard.  Two days after my review I received a call from a man that identified himself as the General Manager of Boulevard. After I explained what had happened,  he apologized and said he would credit back to my card a partial refund and that he would send an invitaion to be his guest upon my next trip to San Francisco.  He asked that they be given another chance.  I agreed to try again, We all have bad days. I appreciated his effort to reach out.  ONLY PROBLEM was he never credited back the amount to my credit card nor did he send anything in the mail.  Its one thing to have a bad experience its another to have NO INTEGRITY.
author: Jeff V.

description: Oh my what a meal. What an evening. Love this place. I love to sit at the kitchen bar and watch the staff crank out amazing meals. Great beet and carrot salad with an amazing strip of funky cheese then on to perhaps the best pork chop I have ever eaten an amazing yam an amazing crispy potato filled cannoli and greens with apples and followed by the most beautiful and amazing butterscotch pudding creation I have ever eaten. Thanks to the amazing staff. The best show in town and worth every penny.
author: Tom E.

description: It feels as though Ive returned to europe, when dining at this place. Great decor and good food, especially the salmon.
author: Ashutosh T.

description:
Came for CE class one weeknight. 

Organic little gem lettuce and White endive salad. Black peppercorn, honey bacon. Green goddess dressing radishes peppercress. nice lightly dressed salad. the perfect amount of dressing and flavor. 

Herb roasted organic free range chicken pistachio currant. Castelvetrano olive lemon and chilies flake relish. Fingerling potatoes w orange zest and parsley crispy Brussels sprouts Seville orange aioli. great chicken. moist and flavorful. the brussel sprouts were bitter. but when is it not? 

Caramelized apple tart. Aramagnac ice cream Chantilly cream. yum. slightly hard to cut into. but other than being a little over cooked it was good.
author: Judy N.

description:
This place is not as good as it used to be.  It has gone downhill.
It used to be much better.  I would not return. It is overrated, and lives on its reputation.
author: Robert Y.

description:
we ordered a few appetizers, and they were all ok. but nothing super special.

for the main course, i ordered the off the bone lamb. i would say that its not the best lamb i've had, perhaps slightly overcooked. 

given the quality, i feel like its overpriced.
author: Danielle A.

description: We have eaten here three times in the last three years on our visits to San Francisco.  Each time we came with a large party for a family reunion.  We have never been disappointed.  This year our server was Dennis.  He did an excellent job helping us pick entrees and wines.  Everything was delicious.  The food was efficiently served even though we had a large party.  They made it look easy without having a lot of people scurrying around.
author: Glenn O.

description: I had the best meal of my life here in 2009, with some of the loveliest service I've ever had. The space is beautiful, and food was really exquisite. Highly recommended.
author: Moira R.

description: Sit at the chef counter if you can. The food is as you would expect from a 4 star rating, good, solid, well executed, with attention to detail. Flavor was good from app to entree, but can't say there was anything that "wow'd" me. The nectarine and cherry crumble with hazelnuts, bourbon ice cream, and sage was the surprise dish that made me want more. But I'm not the type to seek out a particular high end restaurant for great dessert. I look for places that exceed my expectations and give that wow factor. I would recommend for those that want a good dependable higher end dining experience.
author: Saji P.

description:
Great service and style but I'm just not high-class enough for these kind of places. Very expensive, good, but not that good. I ordered the two-birds (never ate TWO birds on the same plate before!) but I tried to pork and thought it was much better.

Desert was good as well, crepes, but very small.

The bathroom is also very hard to find. You have to go to the end of the building, go through two doors, down some stairs. It's an adventure!
author: Matthew W.

description:
My "go to" restaurant has always been Boulevard, especially when we have guests from out of town.  Last week we took our company out to S.F. and walked along the waterfront before our dinner reservation.  We we're lucky to get table in the back to enjoy the lights upon the bay bridge.  But I give this view to our guests, and enjoy the looking down this bustling restaurant with all the beautiful ornamentation.  Being a designer I can never get enough visual stimulation, and ever surface here is covered with something to admire.  

For an appetizer I shared the scrumptious rabbit ravioli and heirloom tomato salad (always a favorite for me) with my husband, this way we can taste as many of the dishes as possible.  My quail entrée with the gnocchi and mushrooms was cooked perfectly, while my husband got the heavier pork prime rib chop with chard, so moist and flavorful. We always leave room to split a dessert, and were glad to get the delectable peach crisp before its season is over, we could barely finish it.  Just when I think I can't possibly eat another bite out comes the chocolate bon bon, which we manage to slip down.  

To me the service is just the right balance of precisely attentive & friendly, but never stuffy.  I only wish they would serve a better Chai tea, since I'm not a coffee drinker, but their other brewed teas are great, and I love the little dishes for every kind of sugar or honey you could imagine, makes me feel like I'm ending the evening with a mini tea party.
author: Jennie G.

description: We are long-time SF dwellers (and foodies) and decided to return to Boulevard when we stayed at Hotel Vitale across the street.  Of course the reputation of Boulevard has always been great, so we thought we had nothing to lose.  Wrong.  Started out with a burrata cheese salad with a couple pieces of arugula and some strange, stringy yet flavorless second green, pistachios. ($19)  The dressing was flavorless.  I kept thinking my taste buds must have been damaged...but my husband agreed.  The waiter obligingly sent me a crab salad, which was comprised of a ball of flavorless crab (?) in mayonnaise (?) with one tiny piece of fresh crab, a chunk of avocado and a blood orange dressing.  I started to feel as though the dinner so far tasted canned.  Then I ordered a cod entree with risotto.  The small piece of cod was slightly overcooked and the risotto was delicious.  ($34). The suggested rosé was nice. My husband enjoyed his quail.  The waiter was attentive and had an interesting personality.  He comped both appetizers, which was extremely generous.  Still and all, would not return.
author: Ginger S.

description:
We walked in for a 9:30 reservation and were kept waiting for a half hour but we got a complimentary round of drinks, a free squash blossom appetizer and apologies from just about everyone on staff. As New Yorkers we're used to waiting but never has a restaurant been so attentive and regretful for keeping people waiting. Very impressive service! Also we were dazzled by the vaulted brick ceiling in the bar area so we were visually satiated.

The sweetbreads and foie gras appetizers were excellent and  the lobster raviolis were nice but not a must. I wasn't thrilled with my salmon but my brother got the same thing and loved it, determining that he just had a better piece of fish. The pork chop with farro was also delicious. Great drinks as well and the mint bonbons were fantastic. I'd definitely recommend this place for a special night out.
author: Dara F.

description:
The one time I came here, I went to the valet, and as I handed over my keys, carefully explained how the reverse gear in my car worked (push down on the shifter and shift into where 6th would normally be).

A quick nod from the valet and 20 seconds later, I saw my car creeping forward in 2 foot increments before ultimately crashing into a curb. When I pointed out the fact that the bottom of my front bumper was now white (my car is black), the valet tried to deny that he had done anything wrong. I sat there, kind of dumbfounded for a second, before flying into a fit of rage that would've made Mike Tyson proud.

Maybe it's unfair to 1-star Boulevard based on the actions of what was probably a contracted third-party parking vendor but whatever, life isn't always fair, and someone crashed my damn car when I tried to eat here.
author: Leo K.

description:
The desserts were amazing. I tried the vanilla crepes and my co-diners had the ice cream and the chocolate cake. Both sampled very deliciously. If you can't afford dinner, go for dessert!

For dinner I had the lamb T-bone (no bone). Garnished and tasted wonderful. My only minor problem with the food was that 3 pieces of the lamb were medium-rare and one piece was rare. It was pretty easy to spot because the color difference was dramatic. I have never sent anything back in my life, but for the price I thought why not. I received the same piece, re-garnished and slightly warmed, but still very red and rare.

For an app I had the veal schnitzel. It was really good. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind sweat breads.

The presentation was nice on every dish. The service was par and I mean that in a good way. Very busy and noisy on a Saturday night. The food and service make it worth it. Make a reservation and save up some $$$$.
author: Matt A.

description: Delicious food and bread. We were here for our anniversary this past weekend. Great location,  and a super spot to celebrate. Fine dining and an excellent experience overall. I had the ravioli and the beet salad, my husband had the salmon. Fantastic!
author: LJ M.

description:
4.8.2011
8:00PM

Amuse (dill creme fraishe, rye,salmon)
Ricotta Ravioli
Mixed Slad
Bass
Lamb

From the bucket list to the frequent list - Great service, great food.
author: William R.

description:
Good food at a classy joint. It's more of an old school classy American restaurant. To be honest, it seems like it draws a slightly older crowd but the decor doesn't feel old. It actually has great ceilings in the restaurant.

Had a smal meal and got out for under $100 for 2 people including 1 non-alcoholic drink, tax, tip, health tax blah blah. Ordered one chicken dish and one lobster dish. For me, the chicken dish was to smokey and salty; it had a LOT of salt on it. But the lobster dish was one of the best lobster "dishes" I had. When it first arrived, I was afraid because the plate had all sorts of things on it and I usually like my lobster to be only dating butter. But to my surprise, that bunch of stuff on the plate was great (bacon, mushrooms, blood orange and the pine nuts. I could have done without the nuts. the nuts didn't do anything for me and i hate nuts, but i picked around it). Oh and the lobster was cooked great too.

Filling without being too much. Beware on the drink menu it says "Fresh squeezed" on a few things but it may not be; but they are upfront when you ask. I don't know why they don't update their menu. I guess it was fresh squeezed sometime, before it was bottled.

Good food, nice place. Nothing too exciting but a solid dinner.
author: Traci H.

description: Came here for the first time on my birthday with some close friend and had an amazing time. The food, decor, and environment were perfect and provided a wonderful place for my celebration. Our server Ryan had extensive wine and food knowledge, extremely helpful, and did a wonderful job. Highly recommend  to anyone
author: Chase H.

description:
I have had my own bad experience (over cooked food, a martini was spilled on my mom, etc) with this place and think its way, way overrated, but my friend had such an awful experience there yesterday, I had to share. 

He was at a meeting with his boss and a client and found a LIVE WORM in his chicken. He said it was resting in between two slices of his chicken. He said it was green and fuzzy. 

Apparently Boulevard offered to bring him a second lunch (which he denied) but did not comp his meal or offer any discount in the future. This is a pretty poor remedy for such an outrageous mistake by the kitchen. 

Don't go to Boulevard. Unless you like worms.
author: Blond E.

description: Michelin 1 Star rated.  The food was excellent as was the service.  They have an excellent wine list and ambience was very cool as well.  I would go back here again!
author: Aman S.

description:
Phenomenal.

I'm not sure what can be said that has not been said one hundred times previous.

Some of the best foie gras I've enjoyed. My pork shoulder actually was absolutely the best I've ever had. Both of my friends fillets were fantastic. The wine pairings were excellent. The dessert was equally amazing...

Service? On par with what one would expect with this caliber of establishment.

I will count the minutes until I make up an excuse to return.

Bravo!
author: Erich N.

description: Very posh restaurant. The food here was good and the service was amazing. Get the scallops for dinner and make sure you ask for a sweet treat after your meal. I was having an anniversary dinner here so i didnt pay much attention to detail so i dont have too many specifics to write down but  I will def tell my freinds to come here.
author: Ranj P.

description:
My friend form NY was over and she knew this place, and said it was great. It was my first time. It was a Wednesday evening a little after 7pm, and it was kind of busy. Yet they were able to seat us immediately. 

I am tall and for some reason the little table wasn't to comfortable, I to be honest I think it was the height of the chair something was off.  Nevertheless the waitress was there in no time, to take our drink order. Before we knew it we've had our drinks and bread. 

My starter was the AVOCADO, DUNGENESS CRAB & MELON, which was amazing!!, it looked cute as well but there wasn't a lot of it. My main course LOCAL WILD KING SALMON PAN ROASTED with GARLIC & THYME,  my salmon was done medium and soft like butter. Everything about the food was yummy. I do think that the starters are a bit on the expensive side.

The restaurant is sort of chic yet casual, but definately a place I would like to come back to.
author: Khaleesi T.

description:
This place has been in my bookmarks since July and I felt like it was time to start knocking out these bookmarks.

I made reservations for a Wednesday evening at 6:30pm. My company for the night, my fellow yelper and buddy Cherylynn N. =) We were both running late due to traffic and parking. Parking was a little hectic but I was lucky and found parking about two blocks away, the unlucky part was the fact that it was raining and I didn't have an umbrella. (The restaurant has valet). 

When we walked through the through the doors and entered the restaurant, to our surprise the place was pretty packed for a weekday so make sure you have reservations because throughout the night it stayed steadily packed and tables kept getting filled. Though we were late for our reservations, we were still seated right away.

On to the reasons that makes this review a review, for drinks I ordered the Classic Eggnog (warm eggnog with brandy). The Classic Eggnog was really good, it had a slight burn when it was going down your throat. =P For appetizer, the most talked about dish: Foie Gras with Yuzu Marmalade & Persimmons. The foie gras was actually bigger than I thought it would be, I was expecting something the size of an eraser. =X The foie gras just melted in my mouth but when I tried the bread with it, it had a weird taste because of the sweetness of the bread and like Cherylynn said the bread was "dense." The main course of the night was the filet mignon, which I actually don't have much to say for. It was pretty good but I think I've had better else where. You can't end a meal without DESSERT!! We shared the Fromage Cheesecake with Pistachio Crust & Lemon Sherbet. The cheesecake was really light and had a nice texture and the pistachio crust was flakey and flavorful. YUM! 

The service was a bit slow, probably due to the high foot traffic of the restaurant. Our entrees took well over 30 minutes after getting our appetizers to come out. Good service, our server came to check up on us every now and then. =) Overall I enjoyed dining here but there were some things that turned me off and away from giving this place 5 stars.
author: Heather C.

description:
Went there for lunch with my friend. It was very busy at lunch time.. I would suggest make reservation before you go.

I had lobster soup and grill salmon. Both of them were really good. The lobster soup was very thick and flavorful. You can taste the savor flavor of the lobster. I wanted another one after finishing it actually. And the salmon was cooked perfectly. It tasted very succulent and tender. I spent $48 for this meal. It was a bit pricy for a lunch actually. 

Most of their client are older generation. if you like traditional American food, this may be just right for you.
author: Rouise L.

description: I've eaten here so many times, I cannot even count the number. This place is first-rate. The food excels in quality and appearance. The wine selection is good. The cocktails are fairly strong. The service is professional, and very attentive. The restaurant has an awesome venue and menu selection from choice meats to seafood.  Private dining is a first-class experience, and the catering manager is a pleasure to work with. The place has a good buzz-atmosphere, and you won't be disappointed with your experience.
author: Derek N.
