The only item that was perfectly spiced and not oversalted was the soup!  Even the butter brought to the table had salt on the top of it.  Great place if you like/love very salty food.  Pass if you prefer a place that uses herbs and spices other than salt to bring out food flavors.
author: Perry S.

description: It was okay. For the price paid, it is not comparable to other fine restaurants we have enjoyed more. Perhaps we should give it a second and third try.  The host who greeted was a sour pus.  The wait for the food was long. Waiters were good. Food was okay, but not fantastic, for the price paid.
author: Ken V.

description: This place is SOOOO good!  The service is fantastic, atmosphere is exquisite, and the food is delicious!  I had the squab....mmmmmmm..birds....
author: Jacquelyn M.

description:
i lunched here about a year ago with some friends...  Boulevard is a very pretty restaurant that oozes style and class (who'd think they'd let riff raff like me in!) and the view from the restaurant is spectacular - right across from the pier, you can see the bay bridge in the background and watch people walk by on the embacardero.

here's what we had:

DUNGENESS CRAB CAKE - Maine Sweet Shrimp Aioli, Lobster Bisque, Chervil 

SEARED MONTEREY CALAMARI - Rancho Gordo Italian Butter Beans, Framani Chorizo, Oven Roasted Tomatoes, Crispy Tentacles & Aioli

GULF WHITE PRAWN SALAD - WILD CAUGHT, POACHED & CHILLED
White Asparagus, Soft Boiled Farm Egg, Catalina French Dressing, Baby Spinach with Crimini Mushrooms, Smoked Bacon, Pickled Onions

DAY BOAT SEA SCALLOPS - WILD CAUGHT & PAN ROASTED
Butternut Squash Risotto with Vialone Nano Rice, Butternut Squash Relish, Sage & Sydney's Watercress

AMERICAN "KOBE" BAVETTE - SNAKE RIVER FARM, WOOD OVEN ROASTED
French Fingerling Potatoes, Baby Artichokes, Trumpet Mushrooms, Mache, Beef Jus 

- everything was delicious BUT, even for a shi-shi restaurant, the portions are SMALL.
when they mean 'crab cake' they mean 1. and not a super steroid-sized crab cake either.

the "Kobe" bavette melts in your mouth. the sea scallop was fresh, as was the prawn salad.

honestly I would have given this 5 stars if the portions were a bit bigger. for the price they charge, even for lunch, we were all still hungry afterward. well i got to take my friend to have Beard Papa to round out the meal, so all is not lost. 

still for that price, i don't expect to still want to eat after lunch - and i don't have an abnormal appetite.

4 solid stars for the food, ambiance and scenery - parking is always a biatch in that area, they do have valet. 

***it's a great date place, but pricey, so make sure your date is worth it. ***

and you might want to check out dessert or snack plans for after your meal, in case you are still a bit hungry after dining here.
author: amy c.

description: It's pricey but worth it especialy if you can manage to make this a "business" dinner. The service is amazing, wines are amazing, and the food amazing. The portions are a bit small and everything is generally overpriced but the whole package makes it a great dinning experience.  I love the turn-of-the century decor. The farther into the belly of the restaurant you wander the more "stuffy" it gets but if you're dinning in the front room, it's more lively and the bar scene cuts the usual uptight frou frou frenchie feel.
author: Runt T.

description: Boulevard is the quintessential SF power lunch venue. Although tables may be hard to come by unless you're a partner at one of the many law firms residing down the street in the financial district, you can usually sneak in during lunch and sit at the bar, where the food is equally delicious. Although the menu is ever changing, the Tuna Tartare appetizer, Steak, Lamb, and Pork Loin entrees, and Chocolate Toffee Crunch Cake dessert are all fantastic. If you're a real power broker, you'll make sure to reserve the special room off the side of the bar at the entrance, where you can have an intimate meal surrounded by brick and throngs of wine stored on the walls. Consistently voted one of the best restaurants in SF by critics and locals alike, Boulevard is a treat that should not be missed.
author: Nishan K.

description: A San Francisco classic!!!!  One of my favorites.  Consistently a good meal.  I usually get some kind of pork dish.  I have never been let down.  The wood oven puts out some great flavored dishes.  Always busy and high energy.  I have have gone with groups of friends, office parites of 40+ and alone with my wife.  Blvd. works for all occasions.  Service is good and staff is knowledgable.  Prices in line with SF restaurants of that caliber.  I still think it's a bit high for food though??  Enjoy if you haven't been .  A must go.
author: Jim A.

description:
So, what is going on at Boulevard?

I have been there maybe 30 times since it opened years ago, and until recently, counted it as one of the absolute best restaurants in SF, and the definite "go to" restaurant for special occasions.  Boulevard's combined outstanding service, with amazingly tasty and creative food, in a beautiful, and slightly boisterous bistro type ambiance.  (I stress the 'slightly' part - picture mildly boisterous WASPs -- in suits).  And when I went in September of last year, Boulevard's was still all that.  

But two visits this year (February and then this week) show a real change.  The wait staff is younger, and while friendly, clearly not well trained.  (Waiters who ignore your table for 10-15 minutes and rarely, if ever, check back with you; bussers who refuse to bus your table until EVERY person is clearly done, so we all get to stare at dirty plates; and my personal favorite - bussers who stride up to your table, point at a dirty plate two places in and demand "give that to me".)  Worse, the food is just not as good.  While the menu reads fabulously (as always), the kitchen no longer seem to be able to execute.  It's as if a college team was being asked to fill in for a professional team -- they are certainly trying, but lacking the skills, things just are not working out well.

I hope its a blip on the radar for a restaurant that has been able to maintain ridiculously high standards for so long.  But at the prices Boulevard's charges, and with two mediocre dinning experiences under our belts, it will be a while before we go back.
author: Laura T.

description: I blew about 400 dollars worth of slot machine winnings (stopover after Burning Man: 3 pulls, $1100 jackpot, my first and last gambling experience) here.  It was definitely good food but quite stuffy.  It never seemed like the right occasion to go back. I wonder if it ever will.  In retrospect I wish we had spent the whole jackpot on 2 nights at Gary Danko, or diverted to the French Laundry.
author: Kevin S.

description: Boulevard is a truly exceptional restaurant. The service is impeccable, the decor is sleek and modern, and the food is great. When I went here a weekend ago with my friend, it was great. I had the Artichoke Ravioli and it was done perfectly, with bold flavors and perfect texture. This restaurant is impressive on every level. I would deem it a bit of a splurge, but it's definitely worth it on a special occasion.
author: Gee M.

description: Boulevard is the best restaurant I have dined at in a long time. The restaurant is housed in a big industrial looking building situated in the waterfront area of the Embarcadero. Inside, the decor is largely French-influenced with floor-to-ceiling brocade drapes, fresco paintings, dramatic floral arrangements, and white columns with their flourish designs. By the same token, there's also an American lightheartedness that pervades throughout the atmosphere of the restaurant.   Read more here: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=24
author: Baochi N.

description: Yummy!! Love the  soft shelled crab, scallops, and the foie gras..
author: Shirl C.

description: Boulevard is the restaurant that has never missed, for fifteen years, and they have a wall of Best Of awards on the way to the restrooms to prove it. I'll echo what everyone else in the city has always said, which is that Boulevard delivers outstanding food, excellent but never overbearing service, and their prices *aren't* the highest in the city. Factoid: at a booksigning with Nancy Oakes, she said that there's a guy who's had lunch at Boulevard every day that they have ever been open for business. Also, I have a signed copy of her new cookbook, so nyeah.
author: David Y.

description: I took my gf here for her bday.  We ordered the filet mignon, the quail, and 3 appetizers, scallops, cod and pork belly, and ahi tuna tartare.  Everything was exquisite, although the filet could have been more flavored.  The quail was the best I've ever had and the scallops were pretty pricey, 3 for about $16, but was very good.  The cod and ahi tartare was also quite good, but I'd mainly go back for the quail dish, everything on that plate was amazing!
author: Richard T.

description:
This particular restaurant has intimidated me for years and years.  I don't know why.  I think it has to me felt like a spot for wealthy, salt and pepper haired, well-heeled, well-dressed adult adults.  Whenever I've strolled by and peeped into the windows in the past, this is the impression I've received.  Yesterday evening, after drinks at the Vitale bar, my friend and I decided to have a burger at Boulevard.  

We went through the revolving front door into a really beautiful, crowded restaurant.  It was much bigger than I thought it was, and it immediately felt to me like being in a bistro full of the after work metropolitan crowd rather than a formal, seriously weighty French restaurant.  The bar area was crowded, and the wait we were told was an hour.  We put ourselves down and walked around the block for twenty minutes.  A  table opened up facing the kitchen, which we took instantly.  I love watching the chefs do their thing, so it worked out fine.

It's visually just great in Boulevard, especially if you like art nouveau or art deco.  The lamps and lighting fixtures are all in this style, as well as the "fencing" around the various dining areas.  I particularly liked the ceiling in the front area.  it looks to be made of brick and it is sort of arched or vaulted, reminding me of Roman architecture.  Also, I liked the mosaic tile flooring around the bar, which is made of a bright orange reddish wood.  The place glowed in orange to me.

Excellent food.  Fortunately, burgers are on the lunch menu, so we had to dive into what was on offer for dinner.  Hunter our waiter gave me a copy of last night's menu, I wanted to try everything on it.  Felt the same way about G. Danko's menu.  Last night, I started with the Organic figs, almonds & mad river goat cheese in an arugula & red lettuce salad with fig-balsamic jam vinaigrette.  It was a perfectly balanced appetizer, with just the right amounts of each ingredient.  The dressing was excellent.  In my dreams I make vinaigrette this great.  For my main, I chose the California Lamb T-bone from Dixon.  Wood oven roasted , stuffed with oven dried tomatoes, feta & eggplant.  Fingerling potatoes with feta cheese as one side.  Another side was a relish made from rosa bianca eggplant, pistachio, currant & nicoise olive.  Last side:  sauteed erbette chard w/lemon & butter, rosemary lamb jus.  All very delicious.  In particular, the lamb was tender & not too overwhelmingly browned or overcooked, the flavor combinations in the unusual relish was fun & interesting to my palette.  The sauteed chard was original and one of my favorites.  Overall, I was very pleased and satisfied and very full.  Oh, and the bread & butter are both awesome.

Everyone mentions the black cod.  I must go back to try it.  It was my second choice last night.  My friend had the Berkshire Pork Chop.  I tried it & it was otherworldly in flavor.  I don't know how that roasted that piece of meat, but I have never in my life tasted a lowly port chop like that.  It was a sublime moment, just wonderful to eat.   Food experiences like these to my mind absolutely justify the money one spends in places like Boulevard of Chez Panisse.  A writer I read years ago described it as eternal moments.  I like that.
author: Roland C.

description: Yummy, great service, fabulous atmosphere, excellent cookbook.  One of my favorites.
author: Liz L.

description: Sweet Mother of God, now this is what I'm talking about.  Go here for a boozy, extended 3hr lunch and your guts/friends will thank you for the rest of your life.  Authentic, polished French-style cooking with a Californian twist and faultless service.  Gorgeous, plush brasserie-esque interior with cosy booths.  Attracts suits around lunch, but it's lovely when everyone empties out and you're still there with your lover contemplating a third bottle of wine and a second cheese plate.  The best restaurant (by a long shot) I've found in San Francisco since moving here 5 months ago.
author: Kelly P.

description: I always try to to eat here when I'm in town.  It's just one of those places that meets my personal definition of fine dining.  Very metropolitan... lots of dark wood, brass, bar mirrors and a view of the ocean and bridge to kill for.  Try to get a reservation in the back as thats where it's at.  I can see by other reviews that you can have a not so five star evening but what restaurant doesn't?   Fortunately I have been lucky so far.  My food recommendation is order anything because I have never had a bad meal.  It's expensive but do you want "He really knew the best cheap restaurants to eat at" carved on your tombstone?
author: Brent A.

description:
My gf took me here for my bday last night.  It has been long over due to come here especially with how much we love the culinary scene in the bay area.  It was really an amazing dining experience.  Boulevard has all the characteristics of an amazing upscale rest. but without any of the stuffyness and pretentious attitude around it.  Its the type of place that has the high / top notch executed food in a more loud and sociable atmosphere.  
Service here was awesome. Aside from just being extremely nice and helpful, she even helped us get a picture with Nancy Oakes.  It was just a nice gesture.  For food, there is nothing new I can possibly say about it considering all the reviews prior to mine.  I will say, food here is prepared in a very rich and indulgent way, so be prepared to have flavors explode in your mouth.  Do highly recommend for appetizers the ravioli and the foie gras.  For entrees, the t bone lamb chop was just perfect.  This is the type of establishment just like the Gary's that you are happy to pay a premium for a great dining experience.
author: Charles C.

description: I was here on New Years eve and had a very expensive slightly above average experience. Some of the wines were very good that we selected from a very good selection, but overall the price performance was just not there. I may consider going back to give it a second chance, but there are so many other places to sink money into. I've read others here being honest, and its simply good food, but I don't think its great.
author: Mick R.

description:
Negatives: Overpriced food, haughty waitress, 35 minute wait for our table makes this only a 2 star for me. 

Positives: The food was expertly made (but not spectacular), the bartender and waiter were great, had great suggestions for wine pairings, and the Hangar One Mandarin Cosmo is to die for. The negatives however outweigh the positives for me, and I'd only go back for drinks at the bar, or maybe  an expense account meal.
author: rupa b.

description: Hands down, Boulevard is in my top ten for the past 15 years! Not formal or stuffy at all. Just remember three words when ordering: Rack of Lamb, the rest will be history.
author: Robert D.

description: I've never been much of a foodie, but Boulevard has always been exceptional in my opinion and the only restaurant I ever long to visit.  Lovely atmosphere, helpful service and delicious food.
author: D N.

description: I first came here back when I was in high school and the meal was so good that I go back every few years when in SF, it is now 10 years later and the restaurant is still consistenly good.  Good service, good wine list, great food, atmosphere, this restaurant has it all.
author: Jen W.

description:
Great Heirloom tomato salad. 

However, based on the crab cake I ordered I wasn't thoroughly impressed. I like my crab cakes well done. The inside of this one was like cutting into crab salad that was made with frozen crab that had been thawed out the night before and tossed with Best Foods mayonnaise.

(Can you feel the chunks rising in your throat?)
author: C C.

description: this is hands down the best all around restaurant that i've ever been to.  from cocktails, first course through dessert, everything was exceptional.
author: tiana w.

description: Looking for quintessential San Francisco? Bingo. The presentation is wonderful and if you can sit by the window and look out on the Embarcadero, you will have envious out-of-town guests. While the food is rich and the decor a little old school (in a good way), it somehow isn't the typical 'expense account' heavy meal covered in too much sauce oil or butter.  Lamb, filet, fish.. all as they should be.  The starters, especially the tuna, are just the right amount and done perfectly. My only bad experience was with related to the valet. I used their valet (as a legit customer) and they only take cash (what is that?) so I asked when I went in if I could add it to my bill and they said of course, they would take care of it. When I went to get my car, they wouldn't give it to me because they said I didn't pay, I explained the situation, I went back inside, they said it was their mistake (the manager and the waiter) but instead of just validating the ticket (AFTER A $400+ meal), they made me run my card through for $10. That was annoying, but not enough to stop me from going.. the food is too good.
author: Nora F.

description: I have lived in San Francisco for almost 6 years and just now ventured here for my birthday.  One of our sales offices is around the corner and I always stared longingly at it as I drove by.  When my birthday came around, my boyfriend said that it was now time for us to eat there and I will be forever grateful to him.  This place is AMAZING!!  All dolled up in a dress with extra room so I could chow down, I had the hardest time selecting the various plates that would be our heaven for the evening.  We started with the stuffed calamari and the tuna tartare and once we ate those, we couldn't wait for more food to come.  They were both soooo good and my bf and I were looking at each other in amazement. I had the filet mignon which was the most delicious filet that I have ever had - it melted in my mouth.  My bf had the halibut and it was also delicious.  We then had a cheese plate with the St Nectaire and Accapella, accompanied by several perfect compliments toasted bread, salted almonds, and several fruit garnishes.  I wanted to lick the plate clean.  We ended our night with the donut cake and it was the perfect ending to this perfect meal.  It was an incredible experience and meal and I would recommend it to anyone that will listen.  It also wasn't as expensive as I thought it would be so I will be saving up for our next visit.
author: Arica V.

description: Best lamb t-bone I have ever had. Wife's sea bass was good. Foie gras was a little rich for me, and the beet salad was ok. Overall, as many yelpers can attest, you can't really go wrong with this place. But at about $100 a head, you'd want it to blow your mind. Maybe there was just too much hype or anticipation.
author: Ky L.

description: Still very good, but not the great restaurant it once was.  I had earlier given it 5 stars, now four.
author: Kara H.

description: This has to be one of the best restaurants I've been to in SF. I know there are many many more that I'll  have to make my way to. The food was excellent! The ambiance was very classy, clean, & romantic.  I recommend the Billecart-Salmon Champagne. All together the bill came out to be about $200 + tip for just 2 people. But it was well worth it.
author: Shy M.

description: This place is delicious. I ate in the bar area, which is a great way to have dinner without reservations. I'm a tasty-sauce addict, and this place really impressed. I highly recommend the squab and the lamb.
author: Ellie P.

description: Boulevard is a trad San Franciscan with very decent lunch menu, great effort in appearance both on the plate and interior. Slightly trying to please a large audience but still tasteful. Feeling inside the restaurant is slightly Art Nouveau with many tourists but location is just great. Unfortunately no outdoor dining possibilities but having a meal here is worth every penny. Great service :)
author: Jari S.

description: Oh man, I had one of the best meals here. The dessert I chose, an apple a day trio was splendid. I'm hoping to go back again soon.
author: kristin e.

description: I came here with a friend for dinner and wasn't all that impressed.  The restaurant itself is classy and the service was good but the food didn't knock my socks off and the first bottle of wine that was suggested to us was disappointing.  Except for the company I kept that night, I felt the food here was standard fare for a 4 - 5 star restaurant.  The pricing was on the high side but should be expected.
author: Scott K.

description: What an amazing restaurant. I have been here 5 times and it never get old. Chef Oaks makes some of the most amazing dishes I have ever had. One of my favorite things about Boulevard is the waitstaff, even if you spend 50 bucks of a 1000 they treat you the like you're only table. Everything is always spot on.  O don't forget to order the strawberry shortcake.
author: C J.

description: This is a reliable favorite of mine.  Service is usually good, though  seems a bit rushed especially during busy dinner hour. Food is generally consistent, although not as inventive as it could be.  Great wine selection.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Wonderful. Great atmosphere, great food, reasonable prices for a very fancy SF restaurant.  Wonderful bar area, and fantastic ambiance.
author: Don H.

description: I think my expectations were set very high based on reviews and hearsay but I wasn't blown away.  And I think for the price, I should be blown away...however, it was delicious and top notch service and food.  I loved the fish dish I ordered with the 4 kinds of mushrooms and palm salad, very unique and tasty.  It's on the fancier, older, conservative side...I think my friends and I broke the pattern of gray hair and shades of gray attire with our splashes of reds and blues.  I'm glad I got to try this restaurant finally and I recommend trying it once.
author: Debbie Y.

description: I don't think I've ever had a more perfect dinner. Sure, I dropped over two bills on four courses and amazing bottle of wine, but everything down to the service was perfect. As soon as we were done with a dish, the waiter had our next one on the table. If you are looking to take someone on the perfect first date, of show someone what SF dining is all about, this is the place.
author: Tim T.

description: Went to this restaurant for a lunch. It was pretty nice. We were in a downstairs room for a presentation which wasn't all that great, but the menu that was planned for us had a lot of variety of flavours. Meat and potatoes with some salad and dessert. I had some Kobe beef with mashed potatoes and mushrooms. The jus was amazing. The salad that I had was just some leaves and two blocks of cheese. One was bleu cheese, the other was unknown, but really good and topped with figs. The dessert was chocolate ice cream topped with more pieces of chocolate. Not too rich, but tasted smooth. It was free for me, but I'm sure it would have cost a lot to go on my own...I'm not sure that I would pay for it but it was good to eat...if you want to pay for it.
author: Andrew Y.

description: I have a special spot for this place.  I lived in SF for 3 years and it is my favorite restaurant there.  The food has never disappointed me.  It is in a really nice area and the atmosphere is great.  The crowd is an older more sophisticated crowd, which I am content with.  The food is great, everything from the appetizers to the desert menu.  Love the taste and presentation of all the dishes.   Service is great, but getting a table can be hard on occasions.  Parking isn't bad because there is valet parking right in front.   Boulevard gets 5 stars from me.  Always a pleasant visit.
author: Christopher D.

description: Great food and Excellent service. I'm embarrased its taken me this long to try this place! The staff was extremely knowledgable about their food and very professional. Kudos to server: Angela and busser: Hector for giving me an experience worth sharing!
author: Jay C.

description:
I have heard so many good things about Boulevard, which is why I was so disappointed in the food and the service. I came here for my mom's birthday, and we started off with some champagne...so far so good. I had a pretty decent salad as an appetizer, nothing memorable though. 

When our main courses came (I got the steak, my mom got the sea bass), my mom asked me to try hers. I put it in my mouth and wanted to spit it out; not only was it completely dry and over salted. The host or sommelier or whatever came over to ask how our food was; I said mine was good (though it was quite underwhelming), and my mom said she was a little disappointed. The host asked what she wanted him to do about it, being rather aggressive and unprofessional. He offered to get her something else, and when she asked what he recommended, he very rudely said, "well I always recommend the sea bass, so I can't really help you." We were both pretty uncomfortable at that point, so she just said thank you and that she was fine with what she had. Eventually our waiter came over, was very apologetic, and replaced her dish with something else (which she really enjoyed...thus the 2 stars instead of 1).

The meal came to about $200 for the two of us, and though I'm sure that's not their biggest check of the night, I would like the sommelier/host to at least pretend he cares about our dining experience. I think I can safely say I will never go back here again.
author: Em G.

description: Wife took me here for my birthday.  Got there a tad early and had to hang out at the bar until the table was ready.  Service was good since there weren't many patrons at that time but it got progressively slower as the orders kept going in.  Food was really good and I would definitely return.  Note that the bathroom is next door and down the stairs.
author: Jeff W.

description: One of my favorite restaurants near the Embarcadero.  I stop by for dinner, but I also luv to just come for their deserts (I hate sweets).  If you stop for desert see if you can get a bar seat right in front of the kitchen.  Your order would be made in an open kitchen exhibition.  For sweet tooths this is a good place to get your fix.
author: Sherman H.

description: The best upscale restaurant in SF, hands down. I always finagle a business lunch or dinner at Blvd when I can. There were 6 years I dated a server here, that made for a lot of great nights of gorging. I've never been disappointed by the food and will always recommend this as a romantic little spot. Great views, good location, gorgeous interior! I actually disagree that it's stuffy here, but, to each his own.
author: Colleen B.

description: I'd heard raves about Boulevard so when I went there I was slightly disapointed but when I thought about the food the next day I realized my expectations might have been a bit unreasonable. They have excellent service and the ambiance of the restaurant is awesome, I went with my boyfriend and we're fairly young looking together (even though we're both late 20s) and we were treated just like any customer. The food was excellent and well done but what really stood out for us were the desserts. I had the creme brulee which was quite tasty and he had the chocolate cake which was divine. I wouldn't go there fo rmy next special occasion but it's definitely a good standby to keep in mind if you're looking for a place you know will reliably have good food.
author: Cathy T.

description: Went here last Friday and I really enjoyed it.  We were given a gift certificate as a wedding present and decided to make it our anniversary dinner.  I thought the atmosphere was great without being pretentious.  The food was fantastic.  We started with the crab salad, which was a plate of fresh crab meat..it was great.  We also had the scallop appetizer which was great, one giant bay scallop in tomatoes with calamari.  For dinner I had the filet, and my husband the veal tenderloin.  Both were great.  I thought the presentation, food and wine list were all great and I would definitely go back.
author: Jaime C.

description: It has a nice feel to it and the food is just amazing.  First time I went was a few years ago and the pork tenderloin made me realize pork can actually be tender and taste good.  damn.  I went again recently and the hawaiian escolar was cooked to perfection.  Best free meal at an expensive restaurant ever.
author: Shyam P.

description: Came here for a business meeting. I had this pasta, thinking that I was going to get a lot... but I only got like 4 pieces. I was kind of disappointed, but oh well. I would still come back to this place though. I love the interiors!!
author: Joanne D.

description: 4.5 stars.  I have been to Boulevard for both lunch and dinner and have always enjoyed a great meal.  I also planned my company's Christmas party with them in their private dining room downstairs.  Unfortunately, their food wasn't nearly as good en masse, which is to be expected, yet still sad.  But don't worry, I took FULL advantage of the open bar of fabulous wine.  I found out later when we got the bill that our company racked up the highest bar tab they had ever had.  Glad I could be a part of that.
author: Katie M.

description: It's not a surprise why Boulevard is still so popular.  It's a great place for a special occasion dinner, what with it's waterfront view.  They even have "sweetheart" tables, which I am very thankful they did not seat my brother and I at one of them.  Haha!  The food is terrific, just as it was my first visit a few years ago.  I couldn't resist indulging in a full meal: appetizer, entree and dessert.  A chance to taste a little bit here and there, and not come away overly stuffed.  Boulevard will remain tops in my list of places to go, special occasion or not!
author: Irene C.

description: It wasn't until I came back from SF this time that I forgot to review this place. We were in SF for my birthday and had our best meal of our trip here. The restaurant is pricey- but so worth it if you are coming for a special occasion. When we arrived, we sat at the bar for a drink and then were placed in one of the cute booths that you get to sit side by side. For my meal I had the filet which was amazing. My boyfriend arranged for a birthday dessert to be sent to celebrate for my birthday which was a selection of 4 of their top desserts. The service was amazing and very attentive. I love it there- and hope to come back again!
author: Amy C.

description: Extensive wine list. The cocktail menu was decent. I really liked the table we were seated at. It was by the window, oval shaped, and you can sit next to each other. It was relaxing and felt less formal than sitting directly across each other. As far as appetizers, we had the calamari and the pasta... both were well prepared and unique. As far as entrees, I had the steak. It was well cooked and simple but that's really all I want and expect from a good steak. Was too stuffed and tired to order dessert. One complaint, you have to pay valet at the beginning of the meal and they are very strict about this. Meaning, we had to walk to the bank and then walk back. Granted, we should have had cash on us but we assumed we could pay at the beg. or end.
author: shadi m.

description:
i think my biggest issue with boulevard is what you get for your money.

i've been here 4 or 5 times, and i can honestly say that after a week goes by i don't remember anything that i've eaten here -- because everything is just fine, not spectacular. for the price, it should be memorable -- not "just fine."

you have high hopes when you go to michelin star-rated restaurants. but nothing about my visits to boulevard resonates with me as standout....and i would never choose to go back here. i often get dragged here on work functions/dinners -- and just go along because i have to.
author: Jason P.

description:
Boulevard has got to be one of my favorites in SF, right under Gary Danko.  The atmosphere, the service and the stellar and creative food make the crazy prices almost worth it.  I've been here a few times and it definitely is a special occasion restaurant.  I had a fois gras and quail appetizer that is one of my favorite dishes of all time.

Sit at the kitchen bar and watch the cooks as they make your food, it's the best seat in the house.  Wine is usually excellent here and dessert is also special.
author: V N.

description:
Every time I come I leave here so happy and satisfied. It is never time nor money wasted. 

-Baby lettuce salad: It was a little over dressed. Too acidic and too oily. My lips were shiny and burning from the dressing. This was the only thing we ate that was not perfect. 

The ravioli, scallops, bavette, and swordfish were all excellent. 

I felt a little under dressed again this time, but I had a flight to catch later on in the day so I was just wearing jeans and a sweater. It is a big power lunch spot.
author: Jason P.

description: This was probably our best experience in San Francisco. We actually got a table on a Friday night with only a phone call. The restaurant design is very inviting and the food was fantastic. The wine steward was from the town we live in so he made a special trip to our table and brought us out an appetizer of cheese and truffle ravioli that was amazing. We shared a chicken plate that was to die for, and had a great dessert. The energy level and food quality really made our last night in San francisco special.  Although the level of service was not the same as Gary Danko, the food quality was every bit as good, and the prices were definitly better, It's probably a good thing we don't live in San Francisco, because we would totally become regulars.
author: S. C.

description: I gave it just 2 stars because of the price in large part.  I would have given three stars if our meal wasn't nearly $180 (before tip) for two and I had one glass of wine and my friend doesn't drink.   I was told this is a great place and it has great reviews, so maybe my expectations were too high.  It's a beautiful restaurant with great views, but our table was up front near the door.  There were loud people at the bar that would go outside (near the door) and smoke, so we were getting that smell while we ate.  The bread and butter was very good (they put salt in the butter) and the bread seems very fresh.  I had a beet salad and my friend had the tuna starter and both were very good.  I had the filet mignon and while it was ok, it was overprice at $42 for what I received.  The steak was good, but nothing special and I was provided with two steak fries, a little mound of broccoli and a few mushrooms.  I was not impressed.  My friend had the lobster & scallop meal and said it was good, but also not impressive.  We had the pudding & doughnut dessert.  The pudding was very good, but the doughnuts were tough and seemed a bit stale.  Overall, food is average, service is good and ambiance (other than the smokers) was nice.  However, over-hyped and overpriced.  As a side note, a lot of interesting couples in there.  Men that didn't seem to "fit" with the women they were with.. ;)
author: Michael P.

description: NOT bad not great,populer ok. The bar tender is great. I think hes from central america. well after a few drinks I can't even center...
author: OSEPH E.

description: I've had some absolutely wonderful bites at this classic SF spot.  It's great for a business dinner, special occasion, or sitting at the bar for a glass of wine, first course, and dessert.  The service is wonderful...nothing like your dish being prepared table-side (I know the menu is ever changing, but the sea bass I had was absolutely amazing)...and the dessert menu is always impressive!  Classic and wonderful!
author: Sarah D.

description: Quite often with high-end restaurants, too much hype surrounds them and expectations are not met.  This is NOT the case with Boulevard.  Every time I have gone, the service has been great and the dishes have been prepared to the highest quality.  I love the old-school atmosphere and the location can't be beat for entertaining out of town clients and friends if you work/live close to downtown.
author: Max C.

description: The best place in the City to order sweetbreads and the service is incredible.
author: Mary B.

description: I just recently returned to Boulevard after spending the past year exploring all the other "great" restaurants in the bay area, and I was surprisingly just as in love with the food as ever.  Still the most consistent great food and service.  Still well worth the splurge, and the crowd seems to be getting younger - just a bit.
author: Alice C.

description: Perfect restaurant for entertaining clients or parents. The service and food was good and I have no complaints, but this is not a restaurant I will frequent.
author: Raymond M.

description: Boulevard was my all time SF favorite for ages. I'm not sure what is now. It's consistently amazingly near perfect! Great food, locale, view, ambience, and service. The wood burning and cooking smells coming out of the restaurant in the morning can really make you drool -- I think they smoke their own meats or something (I used to work in the building kitty-corner to it). Everything is amazing. Don't miss dessert either.
author: Dana B.

description: The best salmon dish I've had in years, accompanied by a downright beautiful environment (those fresh flowers!) and phenomenal service.
author: Ann M.

description: I was only here once a few years ago and from what I remember, it's all style no substance. Portions are skimpy but presentation aims to compensate. However, you're there to eat and not to just admire their overpriced food. In the end, I left still feeling hungry. The restaurant itself is very nice but I've eaten at  better places.
author: Michelle G.

description: Boulevard does have great food - it's one of those 'I'm on the expense account and need to wine and dine someone' type places. I don't think I'd ever go there if this wasn't the situation. The price is expensive enough to make your guest feel like they're really getting something and the food is quite good. I've always had good service when I've been there. Sometime the bill comes a little slow, but the food and drinks are usually right there when you need them.
author: Dan M.

description: Food was great, however I the atmosphere is kind of old class.  Great for anniversaries, dates and bringing the parent here.  The filet mignon is tender and juicy and the wines as most nice restaurants have a decent selection.  I'm not sure if I would want to come again unless it was a special occassion as a surprise.  I've had better with far better decor, but I am not knocking it... food is great!
author: Jenn C.

description: Yes it is a little stuffy and pretentious but the food is good, especially the meat dishes and they have a pretty good wine list. This is a good place for business lunches and diners - that way you can write off or get reimbursed the $100+ your meal is going to cost.
author: Russ C.

description: I had a relatively uneventful meal here.  Not in a bad way, but the service was good, the meal was great, the ambiance was ok.  I guess it does have a nice view of the bay but I had my back turned to the scenery.  I did have an excellent meal here.  We had the ravioli with truffles to start and then shared a couple of entrees.  The lamb chops and the filet mignon were tender and delicious.  It is a bit on the pricey side with entrees all around $40.  The wine list is pretty solid though.
author: Andrew C.

description:
this is one of the first places i've eaten at that served the perfect portion (for me).  every time i have been here i have loved the food.  i've never had anything that was even a little iffy.  

i think it's great for special dinners, or when you just want good food and have $100+ burning a hole in your pocket begging to be spent on food and booze.
author: jen b.

description: Maybe I should give Boulevard another chance.  I came here once for a business dinner right after I found out my grandma had died.  My mood could certainly have influenced my enjoyment of the food - being there was essentially excruciating.  Still I remember thinking prices were quite high and I didn't like my food that much.  But I'll try it again.
author: Jes H.

description: Hands down the desserts are the best. I don't remember enjoying it as much on my previous visits, however, this time I was pleasantly surprised with the wonderful combination of flavors in the trio of desserts. Each dessert plate is a tasting of 3 different desserts. This is perfect for me b/c I'm always indecisive about desserts and want to order more than one. In addition, Boulevard was able to create a trio w/ flavors that went well together and each dessert on the plate was equally delicious. Other good dishes: Scallops w/ truffles and pheasant ravioli appetizers. We went on a busy sat. evening and was able to grab a table in the bar but definitely a place reservations are necessary on the weekends. Dining in the bar was nice; it was a casual atmosphere with an attentive bartender that was extremely busy but still able to provide good service.
author: Royce L.

description: This is a San Francisco staple. The menu often changes, but if you are willing to spend no less then $50 on yourself (meaning if you are bringing a date, bring your credit card buddy!) its totally worth it1 Sit at the CHEFS COUNTER to have great incite from the chefs and great entertainment!!
author: Liz C.

description: Apparently someone has hacked into my yelp account then felt the liberty to write bad reviews.
author: John F.

description: Went here for lunch and wasn't impressed. Its a fancy restaurant, where the servers rush to fold your napkin once you get up to go to the bathroom. However, the food didn't meet expectations. I had the sole, which was a bit salty and had much to be desired.
author: Samantha S.

description: I had dinner with a couple of friends here.  I thought the food was ok.  We sat in the booth seats towards the front of the restaurant so it was a little noiser than the tables in the back.  Our server was awesome, recommending appetizers and wine pairings.
author: Jen L.

description: This place is one of my favorites.  The scallop appetizer is fantastic.
author: Chaz N.

description: I've been here a couple of times for very special occasions, and the food has been consistently delicious. My fiance and I are a pretty young couple, and we've experienced bad service at other restaurants because of this. Boulevard had great service every time - friendly, attentive, and relatively quick. Their salmon is just as good as their steak. If you are willing to spend well over $100 on dinner for two, definitely give this place a try. They get VERY busy, so be sure to make a reservation.
author: Jamie L.

description: I love Boulevard.  I have never had anything but fantastic food, service and company here.  On my first visit (5-6 years ago?) our poor waiter was absolutely entrapped by a party of 12 -which meant we were lavished with comped appetizers and amazing service when he was able to break free from their demands.  My most recent visit was a birthday dinner- totally memorable.  The seafood is always as fresh as possible and beautifully prepared.  HIGHLY recommend.
author: Jo A.

description: I've been coming here for quite a while and have always loved the place.  Just went to the bar the other night and was served by a new bartender, someone I hadn't seen before.  A very polite and knowledgeable young guy, Ryan.  Glad he's on board at this reataurant.  The martini was about the best I'd ever had.  Thanks.
author: Manchester Z.

description: great atmosphere for a romantic dinner. My wife and I loved our food. The staff was incredibly nice and always there right when you needed something. we even saw Mike Rowe from "dirty jobs" there.
author: randy s.

description: My wife and I went there last week to celebrate our Anniversary. While the atmosphere is nice, the whole dinner experience left a LOT to be desired. First, the waiter was not very friendly and his service was slow. The appetizer we selected featured 3 rather small scallops for $19. When it came to the main course we relied on his recommendations since we had never dined there before. Since my wife wanted seafood, he recommended the salmon for her. I was undecided, but he couldn't stop raving about the Lamb and highly recommended I get it. Well, both dishes were a huge disappointment. The Salmon was average at best, and my Lamb was undercooked and not very appetizing! We didn't even bother with dessert. Maybe I wouldn't be so critical if the service were better and the prices more reasonable, but when you pay $150 for a dinner for two (without dessert) you expect MUCH better. About an hour later we were both hungry again and ordered a pizza in North Beach. This place does not live up to its reputation if you ask me!!
author: D H.

description: If you want to spend a bundle of money, leave hungry, and experience lousy service in the interim, this is your place.  In a city full of amazing restaurants (Gary Danko, Jardiniere, etc), Boulevard is incredibly overrated.  I've been there for lunch and dinner several times over a period of 10 years - have yet to be wowed by anything I tasted, and have never tasted anything that was worth the price they charged for it.  Okay service is a pleasant surprise - usually it's just plain awful.  Ambiance is lovely, but overall, it does not live up to the hype in any way ,shape, or form.
author: Maggie Z.

description:
I came here, invited by my boss. Awesome dinner, excellent service.
We were 5, and we were sitted in the cellar. Great room! Maybe you can ask for it, if you have a party of 5 or more.
I ordered fois gras: better than you can find in France itself (trust me: i had very many in France over the past 3 years), and sea bass: small portion but good.
At the table we also had lamb: excellent, and pork prime rib: looked awesome (but didn't try). Those who ordered scallops were a bit disappointed.
Good champagne selection: we had an awesome Taittinger cuvée préstige.
author: Peppe R.

description: I am not sure exactly why this restaurant received a Michelin One Star award. I mean, it wasn't bad. But it was also not that spectacular. The filet mignon I had was decent. But I would be lying if I said it was great. The dessert at the end was a huge disappointment. And the menu selection is rather small.
author: Michael Y.

description: This is definitely a great SF restuarant.  Went here with a group of 5, and we ordered the prawn & lobster fetticini, a scallops entree, and a carb entree.  I had the fetticini and it was really good.  The portions are small (not sure if this is because they were lunch sized or not), but it the food was so flavorful and rich, I ended up feeling full afterwards.  The entrees we bought weren't very expensive for lunch time ($16-$18).  The restaurant is pretty nice inside, and almost everyone is wearing dress clothes.
author: Joel F.

description:
They really know how to cook!  Never had Foie Gras that melted in my mouth like ice cream.  And the fish there was cooked just right...very juicy.  Great selection of wine (expected) and other rare drinks.

The only negative is the service was a bit slow (but it was a great service).  And a bit pricy...but it is worth the price.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Great food, great service, great bar, great selection. The only downside, it is a maze to the bathroom. Small price I guess. GO THERE!
author: Jon C.

description: If you want to go all out for food in the city, I think Boulevard is the best choice.  Fine dining with a emphasis on the food.  Arguably my fav place in the city.
author: Brent H.

description: I haven't been here for a while, but Boulevard stands out amongst my food memories as having the best foie gras ever!  So good that you feel that you haven't truly lived before eating it here.  Subtle nuttiness and buttery decadence.  First time I had foie gras was here and I have been a fan ever since!
author: Jane L.

description: The food here is great of course from the crab bisque to the filet mignion to the desert selection.  Very pricey, but it's not as if you wouldn't expect that here.  The location is great, the decor is nice, but not really my thing.
author: Medwin M.

description: The food was good - not spectacular, but very good.  The abalone was interesting, but tiny.  The tuna tartare and hamachi sashimi was fresh, but nothing innovative.  The duck breast was spectacular with the seared foie gras.  Ross's pork loin rib was tender and cleverly stuffed with artichokes.  The service was good, although our server had something against keeping our wine glasses full.  The banana cream pie was innovative with shaved white chocolate and delicious!  I would go back, but it's not one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Christina S.

description: Very cute restaurant.  I went for lunch. I had the kobe bravette, it was good. Nothing too special about my entree, but it wasn't bad. However dessert was the best.  For those of you who know me, I have a sweet tooth... we had the chocolate malt cake... it was a dome of chocolcate mouse - delicious!  and three mini scoops of vanilla, chocolate and coffee ice cream.  Then I also had the pistachio carmel creme brule!! yummy! on the plate beside were a truffle, a great pistachio toffee cookie and a coconut macaroon.  All wonderful with my cup of coffee!
author: kiko v.

description: Wonderful food, wonderful service, great wine selection and wine steward. Expensive, but worth it.  It's interior design, alone, is worth the trip. Great beef. Save this place for a special dinner.
author: Don W.

description:
Not sure what the hype (if there is any left) is about this place. The food is outdated. A decade ago the food may have been interesting, Californian, and inventive. Now? Just okay. Then if you factor in the price it's not really worth going here unless you are dying for their foie gras. 

Going for lunch is probably the best deal and the easiest way to get a reservation. Inside the decor is modern, simple and the help is friendly and professional.
author: Cary W.

description: As always in top form Boulevard does not disappoint.  If you're willing to dish out the cash, get ready for a culinary experience like few in the bay area. soft shell crab salad is great as is the ice cream sandwich dessert.
author: Julio V.

description: I wasnt too impressed with the service the few times ive been there so thats why i took the one star away. however, the food was pretty good. the foie gras is one of the better ones in the city and the wine selection is not bad. im not really a wine person so if i recognize some of them, thats good in my books. im not too fond of the decor but heck i guess if youre just there for good food and company, who cares about the pictures they hang on the wall.
author: Bren L.

description: Excellent.  Lives up to all the hype.  Skip out on buying The Boulevard cookbook (read my review of Green Apple Books) and enjoy the dishes that you just can't replicate at home.
author: K W.

description: Didn't quite live up to the hype. Food was very tasty, but not omfg this one of best restaraunts in the bay area. The service was the same, very good, but not great. It was understated, which I like, but to the point where I felt like "just another table for two". I don't need them to fall all over me, but at least take an interest. Starter: crab stuffed calamari-best dish of the evening. Main: Suckling Pig three ways: Very good, but the "third way" was dry. desert: almond cake with chocolate ice cream: again very good, but not off the charts. Everything was very good, but given the reputation and the price, I expected a little something more everywhere.
author: ron j.

description: I love everything about Boulevard.  For me, it is reminiscent of those grand-scale classic dining establishments in Paris or Vienna.  I would suggest avoiding lunch hours, as the restaurant is mostly filled by grayish corporate crowd and you can almost sense a tension in the air.  At night, it is a different story.  The quality of every dish is ranging from "utmost perfection" to just "perfection". My ultimate favorites are tartar tuna and carpaccio, crab salad with caviar, fillet mignon with sherry cream and duck breast.  I always wanted to find out who their Dessert Chef is, just want to meet this person!  Absolutely the most creative and best tasting desserts in town.  And then - the wine list, and the service!  I would eat in Boulevard every day, the only thing that I do not like about the place is the price.  At least here you are surely getting above and beyond what you pay for.
author: Lana L.

description: Very good food, beautiful restaurant, wonderful wine, great service, expensive. I rate this along the lines of Chez Panisse. It is hyped, it is pricey, but once in a while, the splurge is worth it and it deserves its hype.
author: Lora C.

description: One of my very favorite San Francisco restaurants. The menu is creative, but specials of the day are often tempting. They also have a very impressive selection of wines to compliment any meal. the service and ambianece re always superior.
author: Terry G.

description: I know, does this place really need another review?.  However, this is my first review so I'm going to write it about my favorite.  I've been here about 6 times but I don't go with people who don't share, so I've probably had 25 - 30 dishes and they've all been fabulous.  Their menu changes often so I won't bore you with my epicurean descriptions.  Just know that the food is well conceived and perfectly executed.  The staff is extremely knowledgeable, professional and efficient without being stuffy and some of them are great for banter.  The wine list is extensive and well rounded and if you want to get a recommendation from the somelier (sp?) he's knowledgeable, down to earth and won't push you to spend a lot of money.  If you've not been here, this should be your next meal out.
author: Patrick R.

description: I've only been to Boulevard for lunch.  I had the crab salad which was way to creamy for my palate.  They have a great wine list which is almost enough to make any bad meal good.  Don't get me wrong I don't think my meal at Boulevard was bad.  I also had the scallops which were excellent and way better then aqua's!  They don't have a veggie option on the menu but if you ask they will bring you out a cute and delicious display of all the side veggies they have, it was fantastic.  I definitely need to go back for dinner.
author: Michele G.

description: I have been here twice and everything that I have had has been soooo good. I really enjoy the laid back atmosphere here as well. Its always nice being able to roll into a nice restaurant with my Giants jersey still on from the game and get a good meal.
author: Jared T.

description: Near the waterfront, a great must do restaurant for those living in and visiting San Francisco. I've had both dinner and lunch here, recommend for dinner. Arrive early and grab a drink at the bar. While an upscale dining experience, not crazy expensive and you can have a drink or 2 and still get out for $100 per person.
author: Jason M.

description: Been here a few times in the last month or two and everything was brilliant. You can watch the cooks and they're all super focused, meticulously grinding out some mean entrees. The clientele can be a bit fuddy duddy but these are the people with the money in our society, so here they are. I was definitely the least dressed person in there each time I went but no one cared, they probably thought I was some spurning dotcommer. Anyways, words are just words; check this place out! Bring a date! Bring one for me too. Hit me up.
author: Nate L.

description: You know I don't even like food.  Not a foodie.  Usually I order something eat half and get bored and just talk.  I am difficult to impress especially if you bill yourself as a high class super expensive restaurant.  But here is the deal...  Boulevard is the best restaurant in San Francisco.  Period.  No no..  Shut your mouth..its the best.  I have eaten there maybe a dozen times.  Every time the service was outstanding and the food made me shut up and lick my plate clean.  Order the Pork Chop or the Filet and a 2005 Bordeaux.  If that doesn't do it for you then I have no idea what will.  Some places charge a huge amount for average food and of course they have uppity attitudes. Here I get up for a second and boom there is a metal lid on my food.  The waitresses are always super friendly and fun.  I never see attitude here just great food and great service.   Awesome place to bring a date unless you are a cheap bastard.  Great place for medium size groups as well.  Excellent wine list.  Unless the food is Boulevard quality I would just assume take an astronaut pill and drink.
author: Sean K.

description: I think if I hadn't ordered a starter this would be a 4/5 star review.  The service was great. The lamb for main course was perfectly cooked and the desert was decadent! The crab stuffed calamari for starters was a bit of a flop though.  Pretty bland.  That and a densely laid out restaurant makes it 3 stars from me.  I'll give it another go at some point, just not until I try a bunch more places first.
author: Nick S.

description: This was the best meal I've had so far in San Francisco.  A large party of friends and family met in the wine cellar for dinner one Thursday night.  We had impeccable service, and the food was outstanding.  I thoroughly enjoyed the halibut and all of my dining companions felt similarly about their entrees.  I'd definitely go here again, and I'd take friends and family with me.  Loved it.
author: Arminda K.

description: The design and decor of the restaurant is beautiful, and the food.....to die for.  My favorite- The Fois Gras
author: Christopher S.

description: I hate to say it, but my husband and I had a pretty terrible time at this restaurant. After reading reviews and taking forever making up our mind, we decided Boulevard would be the place for our one special night out in the City. We got reservations at 9:45, which wasn't ideal, but not too late for a night out. As soon as we arrived we felt like our server just wanted to rush our table and get out of there. She was brief, and didn't tell us any specials. We each ordered a glass of wine, rather than splitting a bottle (it was almost 10 PM - we already had a head start!) and I got the feeling our server wrote us off as being cheap. We ordered the scallop appetizer. The scallops were tiny, and one was completely under done. My husband ordered the pork and I had the hen. The hen was better, we thought, but neither was very exciting or perfectly executed. We couldn't help but feel like we were the table that the fine dining experience forgot. Our server stopped by (more like drove by) once, when our appetizer first arrived. She didn't check in again, so we really had no opportunity to tell her about the undercooked scallop. When our entrees were finished and she asked if we wanted dessert, we had already given up hope for the memorable and delicious meal we had hoped for. We told her we weren't particularly interested in dessert because the rest of the meal was disappointing, and it was like we attacked her personally. She became very defensive and told us we should have "waved her down" as she was walking by. Seriously? Her reaction was totally unprofessional. She did take the scallop app off the bill, which was nice, but not what we were hoping for, and also brought us a free dessert. Consistent with the rest of the meal, the dessert was completely ho-hum. Overall, we were disappointed, and really had to try hard not to let the experience ruin our otherwise wonderful day in the City. We will not be back.
author: Lindsey E.

description: Every time I have lunch here the meal is exquisitely simple, but wonderful because of that special touch they have with the clean flavors. Yes, overpriced, but consistent. Good for business lunches.
author: miriam b.

description: It is said that this is the best in the city and it certainly is up there.  Lots of celeberties can be seen here and when clients are in from out of town, this is te place to take them.  The service is top notch, but they also expect to be tipped that way.  Everything is so clean and the food is very good.  You can not not go wrong here, but you better bring a credit card, because I bet you won't have enough cash to pay for your dinner!
author: Pele N.

description: Probably one of the best most consistant restaurants in the city for years now.  Put it on your top 5 restaurants to check out in the city.
author: Craig I.

description: Food and service is stellar. Parking is SFs usual. Wine list is long stretching all the way from California to South America to France and Italy, Spain, Germany, Portugal and through the ages. So long as they have Chateau Neuf du Pape I'm happier than a footbal hooligan at a world cup match.
author: Jean M.

description: This is one of my favorite Bay Area resturants.  The service is superb.  I tables are kind of cramped unless you can get one of the 4-6 tops in the back.  Personally, if i am on a date i prefer the counter seating in front of the sous chefs.  This is great entertainment watching it all come together.
author: Paul L.

description: A wonderful place with incredible food and a really good atmosphere. I've been there for both lunch and dinner and never been disappointed. The wine list is solid. The food quality, preparation, and presentation were impeccable. Prices are worthy of a special occasion.
author: Franco R.

description: I am giving this restaurant 5 stars for its 5 star service and 5 star food. I went for the first time yesterday for lunch and had such an amazing experience I must find a reason to go back soon. I had the bay sea scallops to start and the escalar for my entree. Both were delicious. They have a lemonade of the day and yesterday's was raspberry- mango. Mmm. This is a restuarant in the city that you must try at least once.
author: jodi v.

description:
Great food in small portions at high prices in good ambiance. 

The space that houses Boulevard is lovely, with beautiful brick vaulted ceilings, booths, and a long beautiful bar fronting the open kitchen. 

You have to appreciate a place where the menu lists not only the executive chef, but also the chef de cuisine and the sous chefs.

The food was prepared with utmost care. I began with the sweetbreads wrapped in bacon with an egg and continued with the suckling pig three ways, which included a chop and a morcilla (blood sausage). The sweetbreads were perfectly cooked, as was the pork chop the morcilla was a nice surprise as I am a big fan.  Our apple dessert was also tasty, with a apple cake, ice cream and the most lovely apple terrine.

Nonetheless, except for dessert, the portions were minuscule for the price ($35 for the suckling pig), and while the cooking was perfect and the dishes delicious, they were not spectacular or that memorable. Given this, the portion size and the price, it is unlikely that Boulevard will become a regular stop.
author: E L.

description:
Just took my mom there this past weekend for her BD. It was recommended by a friend of mine. They have a nice location right on Embarcadero, with a view of the Bay Bridge and the water.  We had two starters , the calamari and scallops. The scallops were definitely the best I've had. Very tender and fresh on the inside, and tasty on the outside. We tried four different main dishes, the suckling pig, rack of lamb, black bass and ANGUS SHORT RIBS. They were all very good. The lamb and short rib were very tender and fresh. All dishes had great presentation. To finish up we had a double chocolate cake and a butter cake for desert. 
The service was very good and the staff very friendly. We didn't have to wait too long for our dishes. Throughout the meal they kept the table clean by cleaning up after each course, like you would expect at a upscale restaurant. The setting was quiet and dim, great for a family gathering or romantic dinner. Parking is a bit tough, you can either park at nearby lots, or go valet. This is near the financial district after all. I highly recommend it! I only took off one star because it's pretty expensive and the food portions are fairly small. Not for the hungry men. :)
author: Bill Z.

description:
been here for both lunch and dinner. a former employer took me here for my "welcome to the company" lunch.  even though i was a profitable employee, my farewell lunch was not as nice - but i'm not bitter because i am a good drone (insert your favorite robot sound here).

just got back from dinner with two very good friends for their annual b-day dinner (Feb birthdays).  they took me to Danko in Nov, so this was kind of a revenge meal.  one of these guys claimed that i would spend 500 bucks tonite.  despite the abundance of tapeworms in their guts, these sorry mofos could not  get to 500 despite two bottles of wine.  ha! i hate to use the word "wuss" but these "men" will suffer come November when their bank accounts are decimated by a meal that requires a trip by private jet.

honestly, though, all of us really enjoyed our meals.  for the three of us we had 5 appetizers - ahi tuna tartare, scallops, calamari stuffed with crab, foie gras and abalone.  all of the appetizers were delicious.  we probably liked the abalone and calamari the best.  i must admit the appetizers were a little bit small, especially for three obnoxious,(except for me!) and hungry dudes.

these two got the filet mignon, which was very good and tender.  i got the blue nose sea bass.  it was a good piece of fish.  it looked dry prior to eating, but you could cut that sucker with your finger, and it was flaky and delicious. 

honestly i can't remember dessert because by then we were down two bottles of wine - a skylark syrah and a skylark blend - not to mention some whisky.  

service was good, and attentive.  i wouldn't say they were exactly friendly though.  place was relatively crowded for a thursday nite.  we had a res so definitely make one to avoid an f-ed up line.

a solid restauarant to be sure.  if yelp had a 4.5 option i would opt for that.
author: Jimmy F.

description: Still fantastic after all these years. Comfortable, unpretentious, great place to hangout. My favorite? Scallops.
author: Pandora B.

description:
I've been to Boulevard a couple of times, and it seems to be on the slide. The service is still the right mix of attentive and non-obtrusive, which is great. But the last time I was there the food just wasn't top par.   I had the Monterey  Red Abalone which, while tasty, was a tiny tiny piece.   They filled out the appetizer with the mushrooms, but something that barely makes up one mouthful for almost $20.00?!   The table shared several other appetizers and nothing was a standout.  For my main dish the Atlantic Sea bass was slightly better portion-wise, but it was much fishier than it should have been.  My partner had the fillet which was seasoned and cooked well, the only part of the meal that was as expected.  Desert, attractively presented, was nothing to rave about.

In general the food is still quality, but for the price and the portion sizes there are far better choices in the city nowadays.
author: Laura K.

description:
I'm only a college student and do not get to fine dine that frequently but, Boulevard is EASILY in the highest tier of dining.  From the moment you walk in the door you are waited on hand and foot.  My waiter offered to hang up my coat, recommend specific wine to go with each item on the menu (even if I can not legally drink yet it was still nice), and recommended her personal favorites when I couldn't choose between entrees. 

My girlfriend and I started with the Scallops and the Mixed Green salad.  The scallops melted in my mouth and were nothing short of the best prepared scallops I have ever tasted.  The hamhock that came with the scallops was well cooked and was a good contrast to the softness and subtlety of the scallops.  The mixed green salad came with pears, goat cheese, and candied walnuts.  These 4 flavors came together perfectly; it is very obvious that they only used the highest quality ingredients.

We ordered the pork tenderloin to follow.  This was similarly prepared fantastically and was full of flavor. 

We ended with an apple-crumble like dessert (the exact name doesn't come to my mind).  This was the only part of the dinner that was not awesome.  While still being very good, there was nothing that set this dessert out from the desserts being offered at any moderately to high priced restaurants.

Overall, Boulevard is a bit pricey, but will wow you with its extremely flavorful food and extremely helpful and courteous staff.
author: Dustin M.

description: Really great food! We sat at the Chefs Counter and watched them plate the food as we ate, which was really fun. The service was fantastic and the plating was nicely done. The salmon I ordered was cooked to perfection and the morels were so delicious that I actually saved one for the end of the meal, just so it would be the last thing I ate. Well worth the money. Well done, Boulevard. Thanks for being an excellent restaurant with a good attitude!
author: Tini D.

description:
Barely 4 stars.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but I wasn't overwhelmed by the glory that was supposed to be Boulevard.

The décor is gorgeous, but instead of sitting back, relaxing, and enjoying your surroundings, the atmosphere at Boulevard is loud and frantic.  The kitchen is exposed, which may provide entertainment for those sitting at the bar, but for the rest of us it just means 6 people in white jumping around.  There are no booths, just closely positioned tables.  You can hear a few other conversations and the waiters have to squeeze by each other.  You definitely get the feeling that this is not supposed to be a long, leisurely dinner.

The food was good.  I started out with the mozzarella and ricotta, and both cheeses were excellent.  My bf's tuna tartar was great, especially those carrots and their sauce, but at the same time I wasn't wowed.  Next I had the sea bass, and it was just a piece of plain, well cooked fish, but those mushrooms were pretty incredible.  My bf had the quail, which he said was really excellent and looked pretty awesome too.  For dessert I of course went chocolate, but the chocolate cake was dry, and that's quite disappointing.  The fudge on top was delicious (but all fudge is delicious) and the minty ice cream tasted like you were actually biting into frozen mint.  The strawberry vanilla tart was not my thing but my bf enjoyed it.

Overall, I think that Boulevard may be better for a business lunch than a birthday dinner. The service was good, the food was good, the atmosphere was fine - I think you have to know what you're getting into beforehand.  But at least I can say that I've been to Boulevard!
author: Ali W.

description: Boulevard is one of our favorite restaurants in SF.  We've been going there for more than 10 years.  The beef dishes are always great and their deserts are worth the trip by themselves.
author: Gene W.

description: food is tasty, but this place doesn't feel like SF.  Stuffy, old-shool  atmosphere.  Great service and menu.
author: mark l.

description: A geat place to frequent every now and so often, just to remind oneself  "what a  good dining experience is really all about". Granted this place might hurt your pocket book just a little, but when you audition all their eats and their exotic wine menu, it all seems well worth the $$. The service their is prompt and every entree there seems to be cooked just right. This place could have earned 6 stars, if yelp had given me the option to.
author: Raj K.

description: I was SO excited to finally go to Boulevard. I spend a lot of time in the area and was eager to experience the much-talked about dining experience there. Plus, I am making my way through all of the top restaurants in SF one at a time (Slowly!!). But I am very dissappointed. Not by the food...the food was excellent. For the price, however, the service blew. Our server rushed us along like we were at a Denny's and there was a wait line. The whole place was way too fast paced to relish a dining experience on par with the food. Sad. Plus our server took away my wine before I was finished....and that just plain pissed me off.
author: Hallie A.

description: I have heard a lot about this restaurant inthe years I have lived here. I finally went the other night for dinner. I love the decor of the restaurant, exposed brick ceiling, a beautiful view of the bridge, and dark wood. I only give it 3 stars because, the waiter creeped me out, enough to where I would no longer look him in the eyes and would answer him by staring down at my plate. Also, I expected when you go to a place like Boulevard you are expecting a leisurely dinner. We had drinks apps and entree all in under 50 minutes. I felt a little rushed. The food was good, I had the halibut which tasted a little fishy. The mozzarella and arugula salad was great. I most likely won't go back for a long time.
author: Fallon F.

description: Another good meal at Boulevard...  I've never had a bad meal there.  the staff is great.  I was sooo stuffed by the time I got to the sweets... but that would be the only area lacking in my book.  I would love to see some more interesting items on the dessert menu.
author: Sang L.

description: I was a little apprehensive about the portion sizes after reading some of the reviews here, but the dinner we had was outstanding in quality and size for the money.  (I think the highest-priced entree was $39.50 for the filet mignon, which I had--PERFECTLY cooked in every way.)  You can find a wide variety of wines for about $30, and everything the four of us had was excellent.  Our friends wanted just a simple salad to start (which wasn't on the menu), and the waiter brought a mixed greens salad that fit the bill perfectly.  The foie gras is so succulent, and all the fish dishes were tender and moist without being watery.  Reservations are a must.
author: Jeanne G.

description:
the place is really upscale ,food is really good ,kind but the price -dam!!!
but is worth it!
author: philip l.

description: why am i even writing a review for this place?  Everyone knows boulevard is sexcellent and glorious all at the same time!  I went for the first time for my birthday dinner and although the wait for our appetizer was long, I had good people and good conversation to sustain me.  They also sent out some complimentary amuse bouches to tide our hunger.  Our server was excellent and knowledgeable:  he answered our silly question about why some of us got white napkins and the other got a black one (apparently it's a lint issue).  the timing between courses was good (aside from the wait for our apps).  I have nothing bad to say about the place and would go back again in a heartbeat!!!
author: Vonnie L.

description:
I took my mom to Boulevard for her birthday dinner this last Saturday.  This is my 2nd visit here and it did not disappoint.   Overall, excellent dining experience.  The food was amazing.  The only downside was that my waitress wasn't very attentive.  the bright side is that she was at least friendly when we did get a hold of her.    

Appetizers:
*Calamari stuffed with lobster and crab, sided with artichoke fritters
*Foie Gras

Both dishes were great but the Foie Gras was simply spectacular.  Buttery and smooth.  The portion was very generous.  Sided with the chocolate bread/cake, it went perfectly and really brought out the flavors.  

Entree:
*Filet Mignon with Mascapone Mashed Potatoes
*Halibut

I enjoy meat and the filet was thick and juicy, prepared just right.  The mascapone mash potatoes gave it that cheesiness that completed the dish.  Beautiful and sophisticated.

Dessert:
*Lemon meringue pie

It was good but did not stand out from other lemon pie's I've hard.  wasn't fancy.

ahhh....great meal.   Each dish was a piece of art.  with our table being close to the bar, it was a great experience enjoying our meal, seeing other dishes, and smelling the wonderful aromas throughout the evening.
author: Michelle C.

description: I had my lunch interview in this restaurant.  I can't remember what I had..but of course nice place and service.
author: Pikachu P.

description:
3 1/2 stars if I could.  I was really looking forward to dinner here.  Being one of the most booked restaurants in SF, I had high expectations.  I took my mom and friend here for dinner on a sat night.  Even with two weeks advance notice, our reservation options were 6:30 or 9:30, we opted for the earlier.  

Upon arrival, we still had to wait a few minutes to be seated even though the place was not full.  The tables were cramped and I could not help but overhear the conversations next to us.  

We had a $150 gift card, so we ordered four apps, three entrees and shared a dessert.  For apps, we had the asparagus soup, crab stuffed calamari, ahi tuna tartar, and pheasant and mushroom ravioli.  The portions were laughably small...my mom actually LOLed when the food was served.  The soup was about one half of ladle's worth, in a bowl the size of a large dinner plate, with a few shavings of asparagus and ricotta dumplings.  The ricotta dumplings were delish, but the soup and asparagus tasted like air.  The pheasant and mushroom ravioli (we got three, so one for each of us) were wonderful and probably my favorite part of the meal.  I wish I could have had more than one bite.  The tuna and calamari were both fine, nothing extraordinary except for their portion size. 

For entrees, I had the short rib, my mother had the carrot crusted halibut, and my friend had the sea bass.  I thought both of the fish entrees tasted bland, but that may have been because my beef was very flavorful.  The beef was in a dense sauce which my friend thought tasted BBQ-ish, but the beef was very tender and juicy, and I definitely thought it was the best entree out of the three.  

For dessert we shared the almond butter cake, which came with dark hot chocolate ice cream, raspberry sorbet, a toasted marshmallow and chocolate brittle.  The almond butter cake was basically a pound cake, but it was a great combination and I thought dessert was really nice presented.
