One star off for their glasses and silverware.  My friend was served his drink in a glass that had very large food pieces stuck to the inside, my mom's silverware was sticky when he sat down, and the table next to us was served their sparkling water in a dirty glass as well.  That's not a good sign when dirty dishes are all around you.  

Service was also sub par (but I recently dined at Gary Danko and really, no other service compares...).  They originally brought out the wrong entrees for our table, and it took awhile for us to get our food between the apps and entrees.  

With the food and non-alcoholic drinks, the bill came to about $200.  If I did not have the gift card, I would not have been a happy face.  I will probably return if I'm with someone who really wants to go, but this will not be a place I choose on my own.
author: Grace C.

description:
ginger martini was awesome, ahi tuna app was good ( i know, i know-
but still different due to the fava bean puree)- but then went down hill due our up-selling waitress (are you sure you don't want 3 appetizers? 4 salads, 2 scoops of sorbet?)oh and the fact that 5 minutes after we ordered we were informed that  the Lamb was no longer available- it was 6:20 pm BTW- kinda early to sell out of something? Otherwise. all entree's were served cold -great flavors, but would have been better hot, or warm?
Only went there because mom from out of town requested it- too many  flashing cameras too.
It's a beautiful space, if you are looking for a very "SF" spot to take out of town guests, this is a good choice (albeit an expensive one) - but if you live here- skip it there are far better, less expensive choice for you
to check out.
author: rori nicole z.

description:
Awesome! Can't really say much more than the other great reviews, Boulevard is just one of those must go to places. The food is great, from start to finish. My wife and I truly enjoyed our dining experience here this past Memorial Day weekend. We had a couple appetizers that were excellent, we then had the short ribs and the fillet, both are awesome. Whatever you order for dessert, make sure you get the cherry bon bons also. They are really good.
Nice view from dinning room, great service and excellent food. We will be back again for sure.
author: Marie C.

description: Great location, interesting food and a tasty cocktail menu.  A bit pricey, but worth it.  I like duck again!
author: Byron W.

description: Welcome to San Francisco! The Boulevard is right next door to my favorite restaurant, Ozumo's and they're both delicious.  I usually order the fish of the day or  one of their seafood specials and every time the fish is marinated, cooked, seasoned, flakely, buttery, to die for.  The crowd can be a little stiff but if you can get over that...enjoy the food.  The service is what's to be expected of a nice SF restaurant...very good.
author: Alicia K.

description: Amazing service, beautiful environment, average food, extremely expensive for what it has to offer.  I do not recommend Boulevard if good food is your priority.  If decor and great service is your main priority over good food and do not mind the high prices then go and miss out on something better . . . . .
author: M Y.

description:
Best fine dining I've been to in the Bay Area hands down.  The meal was paced perfectly, everything was cooked perfectly, it was a moderate amount of food where you came away full but not stuffed or uncomfortable, every bite was a thrill to the taste buds, and the wine was fantastic.  We had the abalone appetizer, and we both laughed when they brought it out, as the single piece of abalone was about the size of a silver dollar; however, it was fantastically garlicky, and the other veggies and sauce on the plate rendered it wonderful.  Top standout of the meal was the filet mignon, which came with a blue cheese fritter - just try it, it was amazing.  We had key lime cheesecake for dessert, which came with a scoop of raspberry gelato (yum) and also a bit of margarita granitas, which honestly was a bit odd.  Each part of the dessert was yummy on its own, but I'm not quite sure why they put those things together on the plate.  However, we still enjoyed it.  

Awesome ambiance - great place to people watch.  The restaurant has a lot of energy and verve to it.  You will come away energized.  I think it would be fun to sit at the bar to watch the chefs at work.  The service was great.  We will definitely be back for a special occasion some time.
author: Kathy K.

description: I love coming here for lunch when I am in the city.  Everything I have ever had is prepared perfectly, however I subtracted a star because they are overpriced regardless.
author: hello l.

description: Dinner last night was a disappointment. The service was very slow, and the food was not hot when it arrived. When we told them about this, they took our plates back and reheated them, so then the food was overcooked. For a $34 entree, they should have prepared us a new entree. Also, there were odors / fumes coming from the ovens....really unpleasant.....it was just not a good experience.
author: Madeline B.

description: The food was good, but not Michelin star good.  If anything, the menu reminded me of the roasted items from a chain restaurant, but the quality was high.  Service was fine and the atmosphere was bustling.
author: Jason L.

description: So delicious, it is difficult not to make obsene noices while you are eating. Plus, they have Rafanelli zin on the list!
author: Alexis T.

description:
Not sure what the big deal is about Boulevard.  Everything here is standard.  Although the service was excellent, the food was average for this type of establishment.  

We ordered appetizers, but they were so unremarkable, I honestly can't remember what we had.  

For the main, I had the rack of lamb which was certainly tasty, but nothing to write home about.  The food was rich and buttery, but the flavor was not unique or inspiring.  We also had the halibut which was overcooked and oversalted.  I thought only Chinese restaurants piled on the MSG.
author: Brian K.

description:
A Classy, but Stuffy San Francisco Establshment

I went to Boulevard for lunch and ordered a bacon cheeseburger that was great, but I felt like the snobby waiter was far too important to deal with people who order hamburgers.  The food turned out great, but the waiter could have done a lot more.

Having returned, I would say that my problem with the service was a one time thing, but I didn't love Asiago cheese on my burger
author: Ian M.

description: Was brought here on a first date, definitely a good move.  The food was great the atmosphere was old school San Francisco charm and even saw Mayor Brown.  Everything that we tasted was awesome, don't think you can really go wrong here.  I love that the French serve cheese as a dessert!
author: Lauren H.

description: My favorite fancy schmancy restaurant in the city. I always say I'm going to get something different but I can never do it. When you find an awesome steak, you don' t want to pass it up in favor of trying some potentially bland hunk of meat. I've tried my companions meals and they are always good but nothing is as perfect as that filet they have. Salads and soups are awesome-great flair, presentation, use of fresh ingredients. The only low point is that I'm not rich enough to go more often and I've never really had a great dessert there. When I get to the last course it is usually dried out (brownie), ho hum (creme brulee), or tasteless (pumpkin ice cream). The interior is beautiful, I love the lighting, but avoid the table by the door on a windy night.  Service has never been anything but great and the bar is always comfortably packed when I've gone. A Must Eat!
author: Allison L.

description: It is consistently great and rarely disappoints.  I think it is worthy of it's praise and worth the high price tag.
author: John M.

description: Excellent delicious meal!  Beautiful restaurant - great ambience.  Everthing we ordered (6 of us) was delicious and beautifully presented.  GREAT service - fantastic night all round.
author: kylie o.

description:
I have been here several occasions and NEVER been dissapointed.  This was my first average meal there... maybe due to the fact we ate at the bar.   My friend and I shared the tuna, which was good, but not spectacular.  Then we both had the duo of shortribs.  Both of our meals came out luke warm and a bit over cooked.  The braised short rib was not really all that tender.  I suppose we were dissapointed as this was Boulevard, always touted as a top restauarant in SF, either way, definitely not worth a $200 bill (we had a couple drinks).  

I am sure I'll give it another go, but another round of mediocre food (for these prices) and I'll look for another favorite spot.
author: Brad G.

description:
I'm a little disappointed about my husband and my first wedding anniversary dinner at Boulevard last night. The restraunt itself is absolutly beautiful. Nice atmosphere, lots of energy. Since my husband is a chef we enjoy being able to watch the kitchen. Unfortunatly, the food was not what I was expecting. I had the sea bass and it was very fresh as were the spring peas that accompanied. But it was so boring I felt as if I ordered something off the low cholestoral menu. There was no flavor what so ever, the peas were soooo bland, can i get a little salt, pepper, sauce, ANYTHING!!!??? 
My husband ordered the pork chop and it was pretty amazing. Nice full flavor and great sides. From the previous reviews I thought I would be safe with fish, I thought wrong. The menu changes constantly so I guess you never know what to expect. 
The service was mediocre. The gal was very sweet but not super attentive. It wasn't bad but it wasn't outstanding.
I guess I 'm just a little spoiled and expect the best from these kind of restraunts. Nothing to right home about.
author: Kristin W.

description: I had heard some great things about this place.  The atmosphere is great the place was packed on a Saturday.  Our reservations were for 9:45 pm and it was still packed.  Great waitstaff but not overly impressed with the food.  I expected much more.  Thats not to say the food was bad it was very good, I guess with all the hype my expectations were higher.
author: perry m.

description: Food was ok, but it cost $100 for just me - 2 glasses of wine. Also, a small point, but I'm traveling for business, ate by myself, took my iPad, they wouldn't give me the wi-fi password, said no one knew it. Really?
author: Pat C.

description: We've been meaning to go here for a while and finally decided to go here for lunch. There was 6 of us, and ordered 4 appetizers and 6 entrees. The appetizers were quite tasty, but minuscule and quite ordinary. the only appetizer were truly enjoyed and was worth the cost was the Spanish goat cheese and arugula salad. It was zesty, there was a good amount of it and it was was generally satisfying. The rest of the appetizers were..meh. The calamari dish featured more deep-fried crust then actual calamari. The scallop appetizer, while savory, only had 2 scallop with a few droplets of some oil. The ravioli plate, had exactly 2 ravioli. Considering the ingredients were banal and not expensive, one would expect a ~15 dollar appetizer to have more volume, much more volume. The entrees that followed were more satisfying. The veal shank was very and the risotto complimented it well. The other entrees were very good quality, but nothing amazing. The waiters were polite but weren't too engaged or helpful. Considering we shelled out over 50 dollars/person for lunch without dessert, this dining experience wasn't very satisfactory and I don't have an urge to come here again soon.
author: Igor B.

description: Boulevard was a good place to eat. The food flavors are great and you can tell that the chef actually appreciates the food that his is making. My only two complaints are the portion sizes and lack of privacy, as some of the tables are right next to each other. However, the food and ambiance in general more than make up for its minor faults and do not take away from its well deserved 4 stars.
author: Noelle U.

description: Loud, crowded and overly priced - basically a disappointment...
author: Tom J.

description:
Went here on Jan 12,2008 for dinner before hubby's company shindig.  We had heard so much about this restaurant's food and were eager to try it.  No disappointment in the food.  The foi grae (sp) and crab salad were excellent starters and the lamb and braised short rib for main dishes were yummy.  The service was straightforward.  Not overly friendly and not overly pretentious.  The servers and busboys did what they needed to - nothing more - nothing less.  

The reason for only 4 stars:

1- the main dishes' proteins were a bit bland on the inside.  Although the seasonings were delicious, it seemed as though the flavors did not go through all the way on the cuts of meat.  

2- value. The meal with tax and tip was just under $210 for 2 people and all we had were 2 courses and a glass of wine each.  The portions are small (as noted by previous reviews), but we still found we were full at the end of the meal.  It was just we could not find value in spending 200 for a meal and did not even have dessert or more than just one drink each.
author: dee t.

description:
Yes, it's become very pricey, but no you don't get that much for your money. I thought i would try it again after a long absence, in order to show a midwest  associate one of the more interesting places. Yes, it is still atmospheric, and my friend had a good time taking it in. But that mixed salad with dressing on the side we ordered came drowned in dressing, the polenta with the Sturgeon was really greasy. And the wine is so ridiculously overpriced. 

In fact, as a former wine industry person, I'd have to say that places like this give wine appreciation a bad name. Such fussing,along with the prices. IT"S A BEVERAGE, and ONLY A BEVERAGE. Of course, some people will feel better about themselves if they spend more, and it is less harmful than buying a Hummer, but, really, a few decent wines by the glass under $10 would make this place a lot less pretentious.

The food quality has not slipped much, but the prices have gone up so much that the price/quality ratio puts this at Three Stars. Sorry..
author: Arthur B.

description:
5 for the food, 3 for the service.  Arrrived promtly for reservation and told "we aren't ready for you yet, please wait in the bar".  Had to ask again if our table was ready.  Felt like a second class citizen... our greeting was "We havd a special about 5 minutes ago and there was only 1 so if you really want me to find out about if it is available let me know and by the way we are out of lamb.  This was for a 7:30 reservation where we sat at 7:55 on a Tuesday night,  greeted at 8:10 and finally got our order taken at 8:25 and the 1st course of soup was delivered at 7:55.  Only know this as my view was of the Ferry Building and the very LARGE clock on the building.  Our server was so sparce, she came to check to see how we liked our meals when only 2 of us had 1 bite left... does it really matter at that point?  Had to ask for our dessert wine after dessert.  Watched many other tables get served around us while we waited paitently for our.... soup.
The food was amazingly wonderful.  Our guests were in heaven.  We felt slighted.    Have told may over the years that this is our fav. place.  Sit at the bar and keep it as your fav. place.  

Last time here over 4 years ago with a vegie friend she was dissapointed with what was provided and the server talked about the Vegetarian restaurant she was opening during the entire dinner service.  Didn't come here to hear how lousy vegetarians are treated at the place you work and that we are spending a hefty amount.  OH Well... should have learned.

Will still recommend, but will sit at bar in the future for good service.
author: Tracey B.

description: I lam not a steak person, however I love their Filet Mignon and chocolate cake-- probably the best I've ever had.  They always have great service and everything, including the bread and the sides are delicious.  I'm so excited about the new restaurant that will be opening near my place.
author: Janny J.

description:
Nice decor. Pleasant arrival experience. Experienced and delightful bartender. Host led us to our table near the bathroom exit door and kitchen (nuff said) and that's where my party of four was greeted by the most condescending and rude waitress in the city. I'm not sure where she thought she was going to get-off treating us the way she did throughout the evening but she was the worst. It was my friends wedding anniversery and thi women could not have been worse.

Thank god the food was nice, the wine divine and the Sommelier agreeable, knowledgable and entertaning because the waitress was the type that puts restaurants out of business.

I ill go back but, before I'm seated I will walk the restaurant to avoid the same issues with this particular waiteress.
author: Levi M.

description: Brilliant dining experience. Although this is listed as $$$$, the lunch menu is extremely reasonable, as most entrées are between $14-$18 (more like $$)--and at that price, this food is a bargain. The lobster bisque was one of the best I've ever had.
author: Ben F.

description: Came here after the Giants game last week, the menu was excellent, food did not disappoint and service was good.  It can get loud and is usually crowded but if you're ok with it I'd recommend.
author: Adam C.

description: Delicious!  There are seriously no words for how amazing this place is.  No. Words.  I was in SF for work and my trusty Yelp iPhone App brought my coworker and I here.  We sat at the counter by the kitchen and it was amazing to watch such a large crew of talented chefs turn out consistently beautiful dishes.  But the food -- oh, the food -- just. so. good.  I hesitate to even describe it because I lack the vocabulary.  You'll just have to try it for yourself.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Lola A.

description: Very disappointing.  Everything was disappointing at Boulevard.  From the service, wine list, and ultimately the food.  To start off, the waitress was constantly harassing us to order food, but vanished once the food arrived and was no where to be found when service was needed.  She did not know the wine list, and at first said that a particular type of wine was not available on the list, only to come back a few minutes later stating "oh I lied, we have that" pointing to a list of half a dozen wines.  She then reappeared again and was practically forcing us to finish our dinner and leave to make room for customers waiting at the bar for tables.  These folks did not look very happy waiting for such a protracted period of time to get a table and that made the place unfriendly.  The sonoma foie gras appetizer was good, but the shrimp was meh.  The main lamb was overpriced and there was no synergy in the ingredients.  It tasted as if someone wearing a blindfold randomly took ingredients and threw them in a frying pan.  It was not properly cook.  The menu had very limited choices for the main.  The dessert was, again, disappointing.  Very, very disappointing ...
author: Hood R.

description:
Actually, Id have to give Boulevard 4-1/2 stars - if it was possible-based on our only experience. We are from the South Bay and rarely get up to San Francisco for dinner and actually didn't know much about Boulevards stellar reputation... we were simply looking for something decent to eat on a late Sunday afternoon before heading down 101 South.  
The three of us (our 19 year old son was with us) stumbled somewhat dazed and confused into Boulevard through a side entrance about 25 minutes before they officially opened for service and were, frankly, dressed rather casually  ( we found out by observing the normal crowd as they entered) But we were, nonetheless, warmly greeted by a pleasant Maitre d, who informed us that he'd be happy to check the reservation list to see if there were any cancellations... We thought... really... would this nearly empty restaurant be that booked up on a Sunday?  (the answer is YES)  Luckily, the Maitre d' informed us that they had an opening and he could seat us for dinner as soon the place opened. While waiting at a bar table, I thought he might be pulling our chain and while scanning the menu, my wife and I couldn't help but see that dinner was going to cost about double what we had planned to spend for the evening. The selections were enticing and we agreed - "So what, let's give it a try"  We were very glad we stayed.
Within a half hour of opening, Boulevard was packed and turning away all the drop ins.  We were seated at a nice table in the very center of the place. The atmosphere is very comfortable, but somewhat rustic for the high end cuisine. Our server was a very genuine and knowledgeable young woman who treated the three of us to spectacular, unpretentious service. She was among the best servers we've encountered in a US establishment.
I ordered the lamb and it was perfection and grace - the presentation was delightful.  My wife ordered a filet mignon and it was among the best she'd ever had. I sampled her filet and it was so tender and flavorful, I forgot about my lamb, for a moment.  Our son ordered a a halibut dish that featured a beautiful boneless filet grilled and delicately sauced as well as a squid tube stuffed with a halibut mousse which turned out to be the only dud of the evening. I noticed by his expression that our son didn't seem to care for it,  so both my wife and I sampled the dish. We both found it strangely bland and felt the squid tube was just a little waxy. On the plus side, all of the other side dishes were substantial and complimented each entree beautifully. The portions were ample, too.
Since we were clearly going over our casual dining budget, we ordered two decent wines by the glass at reasonable cost and shared a single (generous sized) desert between us. Our server never pushed, rushed or tried to "up sell" any items. She was terrific, as were the other table staff.
For the food and service, Boulevard probably deserves a full five stars. However, I'm deducting 1/2 star for the slightly -less- than-stunning ambience, a "so-so squid recipe" and for the fact their menu did not offer a simple salad of mixed greens among numerous "first course" selections. There were several dishes (both warm and cold) that sounded fabulous, but we didn't want that much to eat and ,honestly, to add three more $16 to $20 starter items to our bill, but we would have gladly ordered a couple of small salads, even priced at ten dollars.  Sometimes you just want that simple, cool plate of greens.
All in all - Boulevard is a top notch dining experience - but don't take it for granted they'll have a cancellation and seat you on a moments notice - we were fortunate, but know that we should call way in advance, next time.
author: Stephen M.

description: Great food, but could their attitude towards reservations be more annoying?  No prime time OpenTable slots, but then when you are asked to call to "confirm" your slot, they put you on hold and then very snootily tell you that NO, there aren't any earlier.  Come on Boulevard, you're not all that.
author: a s.

description: Boulevard is always rated extremely high so I knew I needed to check it out.  Overall I had a decent time, but it's not one of the best spots in town, not even in the top ten.  Food was decent but not outstanding and the portions were small.  Walk a couple of blocks and let Town Hall blow you away.
author: Jake B.

description:
Update: 8/9/07
I was lucky enough to return for a second lunch on Thursday!  The two of us arrived without reservations about 12:30.  They were completely full but the counter was open at the kitchen.  We had a very enjoyable meal watching the cooking happen at an amazing speed.  At our arrival the cooking seemed to be at the busiest point of the meal.  

Between the two of us we had a glass of white, two vodka martinis, an amazing appetizer of buffalo carpaccio with black truffle, a nicely-done scallop dish and crab louis plus coffee at the end of the meal.  Total price was $95 plus tip.

Once again service was professional, smooth, helpful yet unobtrusive.  It was the highlight of the 3 meals we packed into 24 hours in SF.  The menu looked completely changed since April.  I would gladly return here again and again.

---
4/29/07
It's been around for a long time and now I can understand why!  We went for lunch on Friday and thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Something about the interior was very relaxing and attractive.  The curved brick ceiling made it feel like a basement restaurant in Europe but the entire wall of windows along Mission and Embarcadero kept the room light.  

We shared a sand dab stuffed with lobster to start and then a pork tenderloin dish with cheddar mashed potatoes and greens.  A huge portion of the lunch menu had fish as an entree choice and I did not feel like two fish dishes.  "E" had paella with guinea hen.  All of the food was absolutely delicious, with great texture, flavor and presentation.  I had two sizable glasses of a white wine, I believe it was Bordeaux Blanc, Chateau Haut Rian, which the waiter recommended as a pair for both my dishes.  We would have tried dessert but just couldn't manage to eat more food at the moment.  

I would gladly go back in a heartbeat!  Lunch came to $100, (I believe that was before tip).  They were full for lunch and it seemed everyone had reservations.  There were a few large tables of 8-12 people.  I wish we lived closer...
author: Elke B.

description:
While this place is a bit of a splurge (for me anyway) the lunch menu makes it possible. There are at least prices on the menu before the dinner service starts.  My friend and I have been three times and we each get something and split- we had almost every menu item- and we are NEVER disappointed. 
Highlights are:
Burgers (duck or beef) with bleu cheese and the best fries ever.
Crab cake
Blood orange iced tea

The service is excellent, the restaurant is beautiful, french inspired art deco with interesting architectural details like a brick ceiling and neat wooden booths. I can be a little loud, due to the open kitchen and full dining room. I would also suggest reservations.
author: C D.

description:
So, we went to Boulevard for my hubby's b-day. I had hopes of a quiet romantic evening and when I first walked in my hopes were dashed.  I was initially put off by the valet who didn't exactly rush or even saunter to take our car, it was as if he wanted us to beg to park our car.  Then he informs us "it's $10".  Ok, I say, he just stares, oh, you want my money now?  Then we walk in and it is so loud inside.  The host was luke warm and informs us that our table is not ready.  I think if you make it so difficult to have a reservation on a Thursday night that my table should be ready at the time of my reservation.  Isn't that the point of a reservation, so you don't have to wait at the bar for 20 minutes?  
Ok, I will get to the good stuff now.  Once we sat down I was feeling relieved.  The view was spectacular and our waiter exceeding my expectations. Brett was attentive and informed but never intrusive.  The food was great, All the food was delicious, but I have to rave about the chocolate cake, if you can call it cake.  We ordered desserts that in no way resembled the written description, but who cares when something is so delicious.  Over all, I would say not the best place for an intimate romantic dinner, but for a special night out with excellent service and delicious food why not Boulevard?
author: Christina C.

description:
Absolutely LOVED it!!!  

Was walking around bar-hopping with a friend of mine on Embarcadero.  I personally had absolutely no idea about the iconic history of this place.   There was only one reason that I suggested it.   Almost every day, when I lived in the neighborhood, I'd walk by and see these tables of families -- some of them with extremely stern looks on their faces.  So, I thought that if this establishment was the type of place that families go to break bad news to each other, that it HAD to be good!! 

Was it the halibut or the steak that was amazing?  Both.  Service, and somellier as well.    And. . . then of course there's the architecture and ambiance.  WONDERFUL stuff.  So glad I finally walked indoors.
author: KDog W.

description: Best restaurant I've been to in the city.  Not that much more expensive than the others, and the food and decor are exceptional.
author: Rex S.

description:
Fantastic Restaurant. Went here on Saturday night. Had a reservation for 9pm, through open table. Alas...I had reserved for the wrong night, but...no problem! The female hostess was very kind to us and found us a table anyway. We ordered the cheese platter first, which was perfect! Than the scallop appetizer, very good as well. For dinner we both chose the lamb, delicious! Service was very good, our waiter was very patient with my indecisiveness I appreciated. The manager ( I think his name was Andrew?) or that was the waiter's name, one or the other, anyway he was very helpful and friendly, took care of a minor problem very professionally. Our busboy Emiliano was amazing! Rarely does a bus boy make such an impression. When we tried to hail a cab, after leaving, which for some reason was not an easy thing to do this busboy came outside, stood in the street waving his white napkin, to try and hail a cab for us, in the rain! 
Every part of this establishment is topnotch, from decor to food to staff. 
I definitely recommend this restaurant,. Ours was a special event ie; Birthday, but I would definitely go again anytime. Dress is anywhere from casual to dressy. Seems all are welcome.
author: Rocky A.

description: We went the other night for one of those milestone birthdays while visiting San Francisco.  The restaurant is very attractive, although the tables are very close to each other.  We had an excellent table and a clear view of the chefs, which was fun.  The menu was very limited - alot of seafood.  We both had a filets and although they were good, I have had better.  There was not much taste to them.  I was very disappointed in the dress of several patrons - shorts, "I love SF" t-shirts and dirty sneakers.  Obviously they don't enforce any dress code whatsoever.  That was a big disappointment.  They are just interested in filling seats.  Many patrons, however,  were beautifully dressed.  I also don't care for leaving the restaurant and going down an elevator to the restrooms.  All  in all, it was a fun evening with good food, although overpriced for what you got.  I don't know if I would return but I am glad we tried Boulevard after hearing so much about it.
author: MC B.

description: We only stopped in for a drink and sat at the bar. The bartender was seemed aloof and bored and least of all engaging. I would have expected a restaurant of this caliber to have the Best of the Best behind the bar.
author: Suzy Q.

description: Wow. After stopping in here for lunch today, I'm not surprised Boulevard is a James Beard finalist for Outstanding Restaurant. This elegant but down-to-earth fine dining spot, which in the early afternoon felt like a bustling Golden Age cafe, really was *that* good. I started with the Organic Little Gem Lettuce salad, which is a mix of Parmigiano Reggiano, Rosso del Bruno tomato relish, Olio Nuovo and shaved Parmesan. It's dressed with both a creamy buttermilk dressing on the bottom and a balsamic vinaigrette on top, and the blend of flavors is positively sublime. For an entree, at the server's recommendation, I went with the wild caught and pan-seared Day Boat Sea Scallops, which were clean, perfectly textured and served with a ridiculously creative celery root and parsley potato "ravioli" atop a bed of wilted spinach. The whole thing is dressed with truffle and celery root relish as well as beurre blanc. It's just flat-out heavenly. This will probably go on my list of must-visit restaurants every time I'm in San Francisco. (3/23/2009)
author: Rommie J.

description: i'm with jeremy on this....... everyone hypes this place up so much and i don't really know why. i've never been overwhelmed dining here. like i said before, great place to take your parents or grandparents. not exciting, but solid enough to satisfy people looking for a boring and traditional meal.(like your parents)
author: Michelle I.

description:
eating *almost* a $100 w/tip (i said, almost*...)for lunch during normal work hours, with a HOT guy is so unheard of, but lucky me scored a date ... no fartheads, he's NOT my coworker ...=D mebe for valentines too? tsk tsk* lol ... 

boulevard was amazing ... from beginning to end ... service, food, and my date. 

haven't really found a great 5* restaurant in sf, and i am proud to say that blvd has finally made me happy ... sheesh* after 6 months of living in sf, finally ONE place ... jesus! 

he got the grilled hawaiian butterfish ($21.50) basically sauteed spinach, potatoes, chorizo, oven roasted tomatoes, and spanish sauce)... a LEETLE bit salty, but flavorful... it wasn't to the point of running crazy for the agua. it seriously melted right in my mouth ... im SO glad that the server emphasized that it was a limited item...nonetheless, i'm just SUPER glad he chose this dish since i was able to take a few nibbles here and there ... 

i got the oven roasted snake river kobe bavette ($24) baked russet potatoes, mascarpone and creme fraiche, crispy shallots, broccolini, and natural beef jus.. wow, this was sooo good ... if only i had gotten my meat cooked "rare" .. but its my bad that i said, "well." read further if you insist ...

can i just say how it was such a funny ass moment when the server asked me how i wanted my meat cooked? of course, normally, id say "medium rare" but i just blurted out "well" and got a chuckle out of him. hahah ...  jeez, wouldn't you want your meat cooked "well?" pfft.

we shared a bottle of water ($8) ... you get a choice btwn pellegrino or evian ... i kno water is water but i like me water = smart water // fiji ... guess it's better than tap water ... but iono ... *shrugs*

and of course, we had to spoil ourselves by getting 2, not 1, but 2 desserts ...

we got the caramelized vanilla soaked savarin (basically brown sugar ice cream, cider soaked apples and apple caramel) $9.50 = this was pretty good but it was not my favorite, but it was his ...

and

huckleberries & meyer lemon (huckleberry glzed dreamsicle ice cream w/frozen meyer lemon meringue $10). i loved this one ... not only was it perfect for me, but if you like to munch on scones or any pastries or some sort, this would be your best bet ... the lemon was just a bit too sour, yes, i kno its lemon, but still ... it was quite light, overall.

anyways, i can't tell you how much ive been WANTING TO TELL YOU ALL THIS ... the cushiony seats you see when you first walk in, o man, that needs to go ... it totaaaaaaaallly clashes .. my eyes were like eyeing on those seats, even when i was sitting in the way back ... it was just so bothersome .. ugh ... goodness... 

i'm not going to use this bathroom review as a dock but man, can't they have one ON the floor ... with high heels, it's just not comfortable to walk down the CARPETED floors ... if it wasn't carpeted, then it would be a different story ...

tip: $4 split plate charge. crazy... does it really take an arm and a leg to split? just wondering.

man, i'm being so nice today .. with the restroom a floor down and serving evian water ... it'd have been EASILY a 4 stars ... but, im curious why i feel so nice today... must it be the sunny weather? and/or my HOT date??? hehe..

anyhow, i can't wait to venture out their dinner one of these days ...
author: Jennifer S.

description: Boulevard has wonderful service, ambience and great locally grown food. The kitchen has a flair for combining what's fresh and available in a consistently creative way without overdoing it for shock value like some places.the building is historic, predating 1906 earthquake with lots of windows and beautifully unique inside. There is nothing not to like about Boulevard.
author: John D.

description: "So lame. the food was completely blah and way overpriced, even for a paid biz lunch; would never go there again. waste of stomach space"
author: Jocelyn L.

description: I brought two hoes here because I was trying to look like a baller/pimp/pirate.  We had a 800pm reservation but didn't get seated until 8:30pm.  The place was packed but still no good.  The food here is very pricey for what you get.  People claim this place and Gary Danko are the top restaurants in SF.  But Boulevard doesn't compare with Gary Danko.  In my personal opinion, they aren't even in the same league.  The service was good but nothing special for a fine dining establishment.  The food was nothing memorable.  The scallops were cooked very well but it wasn't anything special.  I don't remember what my hoes ordered.  Thats how much I liked it.  The sea bass was cooked very well.  Nice crispy skin.  The pork dish was nibbled on by hoe #2.  I don't think she liked it so I had to pirate slap her.  I forgot what I ordered but I remember the garbanzo that came with the dish were dry and hard.  I think it was undercooked.  The dessert was also a disappointment.  It was was some kind of toffee thing.  Don't remember.  I usually remember explicitly what I eat at these places but I seriously can't recall the food.  Thats how much I enjoyed it.   I won't be back to try this place again.  I am sticking with Gary Danko and Michael Mina's for now.  In terms of value nobody beats GD and in tastes Mina's is the best in SF.  Trust me I'm a fatty.
author: Fatty A.

description: I like their wine and drinks. The service was good but the food was not that original, but it was good. The venue was lovely and the area nice but it just wasn't the best place ever. I would rate it a 3.7 when its the kind of place you expect to be like a 4.5 from all the hype.
author: Laura R.

description: they do it right...great service, unpretentious, great food. The foie gras is some of the best i've had, great wine list. I've been back many times. I can't say enough about this place.
author: Deo V.

description: We went there during the Christmas season, and our service and food was below expectations. Our 8:15 reservation was not seated until 8:45, and it took 35 minutes for us to receive our first drinks.  The food was cold and sauces congealed when the sommelier delivered it.  Our waiter was not very helpful as well -- he never even acknowledged the delays or issue with food, even when we returned it to the kitchen.
author: Hal B.

description: Boulevard came highly recommended by local friends but our experience was disappointing. We clearly felt that out-of-towners were second class citizens. Despite a reservation, we were given a table near a door and in section that felt like a highway intersection.  We've heard since our dinner that the restaurant has remarkable views. All we saw was the wheelchair entrance. A request to move to a better table was swiftly dismissed. The food was good, but nothing memorable and certainly not innovative. To add injury to insult, we were bumped frequently by other diners who were being escoted past us to the nicer tables.  Oh yeah, it was also my birthday.  The locals got cakes with candles, I got jostled and hurried along. There are a lot of great restaurants in SF, so there is no need to settle for Boulevard.
author: Bea B.

description: Service was phenomenal, and the food, delicious every bite was spectacular.  Rather loud and busy for my liking but that was to be expected.  I'll definitely go back there.
author: Libby B.

description: If you're gonna do it...do it right...and Boulevard gets it right every time!  Food is outstanding, impeccable service, fantastic dining atmosphere and yes, spotless bathrooms! We ordered the buffalo carpacchio, the seared foie gras and the soft shell crab to start. I wasn't too keen on buffalo meat but I was quite surprised by the flavor....similar texture to beef and very tasty. I had the rack of lamb which was remarkably tender and juicy. She had the filet, cooked pefectly and so tender you can cut it with a butter knife. Boulevard is a true dining experience! Pricey but worth it!!
author: Roger T.

description: Excellent food, especially the tuna tartare and pork chops.  Fun place with a lot of action, lots of noise!  Luckily our guests ordered for us as there were just too many choices and too many distractions. A hip SF place to go at least once!
author: P G.

description: the fois gras was the best don't skip it, wine list was excellent.
author: pochini m.

description: kudos to this restaurant - great atmosphere, helpful and attentive service, great drinks and very flavorful food. perfect for a business dinner or even a social evening!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Went for a special occasion.  Service was friendly; food was good but, for the price, not outstanding.  My vegetarian compatriot found the serving a bit skimpy.  ,
author: Jay F.

description: absolutely on point, atmosphere is wonderful, food is exceptoinal, service flawless, outstanding wine list. really nothing negative about this place at all.
author: John R.

description: if you choose to drop a pretty penny, this place is where you should. the best kobe beef if you're a man hungry meat eater. overall, all around, never served a bad thing here (i'm pretty confident), fancy place to dine. you forget you're in downtown san francisco near the embarcadero and instead you've been whisked away to paris-decor is very art neavou.
author: Liz R.

description: hands down my favorite restaurant ever.  i don't even get anything fancy, but any chef who can make my filet actually well-done, but still melt-in-my-mouth delicious wins at life.  every details of the food is interesting and delicious and the flavors melt together in the most perfect and sometimes unusual ways.  i've always been treated well there, and the one time they couldn't seat me on time for my reservation i was a hero and given all kinds of love and praise because i didn't make a fuss.
author: Sharon M.

description: I had dinner at Boulevard last night, food was good, not great.  I've experienced much much better for what I've spent.  Presentations of foods were clumsy at best.  My friend raved about tuna tartare, was good but nothing I couldn't prepare at home within minutes and I'm no chef.  Pear salad had no flavor, chicken was good, not memorable.
author: Kay H.

description: I absolutely love Boulevard; we always brings guests here when they come to visit and want a nice meal.  Actually, for Christmas last year I even bought their cookbook as a gift for a family friend.
author: Melissa S.

description: After hearing so much talk about Blvd. in the past, I decided to see what people were talking about.  Since we were right across the street at the Americano for Happy Hour, driving somewhere didn't seem like a good idea. :P  We walked over to Blvd. and asked if they had an available table.  The hostess asked to give her a few minutes.  Before the minute was up, she had a nice table by the window available.  The decor reminds me of the high-class, turn-of-the-century, dining establishments of yesteryear.  Very rich and classy.  The wait staff was fairly attentive.  I didn't think they were stuffy.  The food was served fairly quickly too.  We probably waited no more than 15 min from the time our waiter took our order.  Now, there's no denying that the food is excellent here.  I savored every bite of my tender veal..every bit of the 2" diameter loin cut.  You had to chew it slowly to really enjoy it.  Eat too fast and that was it...no more, all gone.  Call me unrefined, but this is really not my idea of dinner.  I prefer to think of their portions as appetizers.  Their prices really are not justified.  It's a nice place for a special date or to impress clients.  If your idea of a great dinner is atmosphere, service, and great food, and $ is no object, then definitely try Blvd.  For those looking for real portions, I'm sure there are better choices in the City that will meet that goal.
author: JeFF T.

description: My husband and I have been here twice for dinner. Overall, it's a solid restaurant. Our 2nd time was more memorable. The service is good, the food is good. Nothing was bad. It just wasn't amazing or 5 star to me. If you compare this place to say "Gary Danko's" - just can't compare, but it's a good date night place, nice atmosphere.
author: alice q.

description: went there a few years ago w/ some co-workers and none of us walked out of here w/ anything good to say about our food.  i remember it being very underwhelming and totally overrated.  we got the private dining room too and you would think the service would be a bit better but it wasn't.  not gonna drop my hard earned coin on this place and i was shocked it got a coveted michelin star!
author: Swarup B.

description: Was just in with a few of my girlfriends for a birthday. WE all just loved it. The food was great and the service was friendly and attentive.
author: sandra o.

description: A special night out to one of my usual favorites on a Friday night. The service was superb as always. The apps were trying too hard and not delivering. They were undressed and the flavors did not marry well. The lobster bisque was served with an over smoky fish and some kind of foam that was lost in the whole dish. Our entrees were good. Not stunning as I expected from years past. The pork chop was great as usual and the filet was pretty good. The sides were a bit bland. Now for the hard part...swallow....have they lost their pastry chef??? I read here that quite a few people mentioned that the desserts were not good at all and I just could not believe it. It was definitely the worst dessert I have had in years. I don't do packaged desserts and I was reminded why. We choose the strawberry shortcake and it as a dry flavorless biscuit and a few sweet sliced strawberries, something they called creme fresh that tasted like old whipped butter and a spoonful of lemon sorbet. Terrible...really....where are the show stopper desserts from years past?
author: Amy H.

description: Really cool SF restaurant!!! good food, good service, good environment!!!  The cucumber gimlet ( I think that is what its called), but anyways, a cucumber martini is the best cocktail I've ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Karen T.

description: SHORT & SWEET: were it not for my well-connected concierge cousin, I would be forced to call for a reservation a month in advance like the rest of the unwashed masses; the ability to get in on a day's notice gives me some small amount of comfort as I'm seated next to someone whose bank statement has several more zeros than my own; my sense of inferiority is an afterthought as my piping hot ravioli starter is served, followed by...another ravioli starter (these people do incredible things with ravioli); just keep ordering starters until you are either stuffed or broke (most likely broke); the entree selections change so often, just stick the menu up on the nearest wall and throw darts....just like you did with stocks during the tech bubble, you can't go wrong; forget Gary Danko, French Laundry (did they ever re-open?) and the rest...Boulevard will be right down your alley; and BTW, you WILL be kept waiting for a table, and like it.
author: Corey S.

description: Just went here recently for the second time.  The first time was a few years ago for a client dinner and I was super impressed, everything was delicious.  This time went on a date and even though we had a reservation had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated.  At the end of the night,  to be perffectly honest I was underwhelmed.  Felt it was a bit pretentious and not as excellent as it should be considering the prices.  I had the sushi roll which tasted good but was not superb.  The lamb was my main course and it was ok but I think there are other places I would go before coming back here again.
author: Melanie -.

description: Want a great weekend nite out without stressing over reservations? Go to Boulevard, sit at the bar and have a great dinner with your girlfriend, chat with the bartender, watch the servers, get right into the thick of the night time crowd without sitting at a more formal dining table (available by calling well in advance). The food at Boulevard is excellent, the service is great, and the atmosphere is relaxed. The busyness of the restaurant along with the cool crowd makes this one of my favorite spots.
author: Mike H.

description: I love the food, service & ambiance. Their fish is awesome and grilled to perfection. The Hawaiian walu is my favorite and they change the ingredients depending on the season. This winter, it was served with brussel sprouts and chanterelle mushrooms in a brown butter sauce. Their lobster bisque is rich and flavorful (not for the calorie conscious, but delicious!). The heirloom tomato salad is good too, if it's on the menu - usually around late summer.
author: D C.

description: Absolutely exceptional. The most memorable meal I've had in months. Went here last night for a birthday celebration and am now plotting when I can go back. Started with the sweetbreads which were to die for, even if you are not a fan, try them, it will turn you around forever. Found a very reasonably priced wine on the extensive menu which I was happy about. Main course was squab over risotto. Also could not pass on the cheese course which I would go back to enjoy  alone anytime. Everything was perfect.
author: Cbr A.

description:
ok, there are over 220 reviews for this place (as of 5/15 when i write my review).  can i add anything new?  no, probably not.  but i had such a great experience that i feel i must talk about it!

the service was attentive in the right way (not hovering, but anticipating needs).  the atmosphere was relaxing.  but, most importantly, the food was out of this world.  everything we tried i would order again.  we ordered a salad with pear in it.  i expected the pear to be regular pear, but this tasted like it had been candied.  was sweeter and a little crisp - very unexpected.  there were four of us.  between all of us, i got the sample quite a few things:  the steak - it was melt in your mouth good.  the lamb dish was prepared three ways, and each way was delicious.  the florida butterfish came with a risotta that was so fresh and complimentary to the fish.  the desserts were awesome too.  i got the cream puffs! (the exclamation pt ! is their addition, not mine).  you must order these with excitement, due to the puncuation.  other people got some some chocolate thing and some strawberry thing.  the bite i had of each was delicious.  in fact so delicious, that my friends wrote a letter (not an email, but a real snail mail letter) to the pastry chef telling her she changed their lives!  their lives were quite boring (and still are after the change inducing desserts), so it doesn't take a lot to change it, but still the sentiment should be appreciate.

i highly recommend going to boulevard.
author: scott w.

description: This is the standard bearer, there is not, in my opinion, a better choice in this city of restaurants.  The servers are first rate, the food, particularly the presentation, no, actually the food itself is splendid.  They are not inexpensive, but I've yet to have anything but a wonderful experience.  Kudos to the management!
author: Sue F.

description: I've been wanting to come here for awhile and I finally got to eat here last night! Everything was SOOOOO good!  Even the drinks from the bar! I started off with the pear bellini and my friend had the elderflower tart and after tasting hers, i was so jealous so i had many of those for the rest of the nite... it was so yummy.  I'm glad I came with my fiancee and best friend because I got to try more dishes.  We all got different things and tasted each others dishes.  For appetizers we had the Dungeness Crab Salad, the Ribeye Carpaccio and the Stuffed Monterey Calamari.  For our main dishes we had the Sea Bass, the Prime Rib Pork Chop and the Filet Mignon.  There were no complaints whatsoever about the food.  We even finished it off with desserts.  We shared the yummy cream puffs and the truffle cake. We got there before the restaurant had even started seating people because the only reservations they had for the night were the 5:30 ones.  But I'm glad we took that reservation because we still got out of the restaurant at 8:00 so it was a perfect time for dinner.  The restaurant had filled up pretty well right after we were seated too.  I want to go back already, but I cant afford to for awhile, lol :P
author: Kymberli C.

description: Great food, beautiful decor, shockingly loud, and scary good service. The wait staff is there to SERVE. A little unnerving at first, but they are there to make sure your experience is first class, so don't be surprised if they make you feel pampered. My first night there was with a bunch of friends in college, probably 8 or 9 of us, and none of us had had a dinner that was that expensive before. Determined to make the most out of the fact that we were about to blow more than a $1000 on drinks and food, we shared every single dish we ordered and kept the wine flowing. WOW. Every appetizer wonderful, every entree lip-smackingly good, every dessert a work of art to the eye and the mouth, Each of us swore that every one else's dish tasted better than our own, and we left the evening with one of the peak dining experiences of our lives. Now I take my mom there every mother's day and go there to celebrate a special occasion. Always worth the trip and the megabucks.
author: jeffrey m.

description: I give this place 4.5 stars for the food and service.  However, everyone who recommended this place said it was very romantic.  I did not find this at all.  Maybe because we were seated right in the middle of the restaurant across from the open kitchen (cooking area).  It was very busy and loud.  But that didn't bother us too much because the service and food made up for it.  We had the filet mignon and pork chops - absolutely delicious!!!  I think next time I make reservations here, I have to mention that we'd like a quiet, more romantic table.
author: Helen V.

description: Went there Saturday night and was surprised by the very relaxed, laid back dress code for such a fancy restaurant, most people were in jeans.  Thankfully, I blended in.  Ordered the organic beet salad to start and then had the guinea hen which was prepared with a type of pasta (can't remember which kind), red spinach (never knew there was a red spinach, but okay), and a hazelnut pesto.  Hellooooo!  I'm all for the hazelnut.  Love the hazelnut.  So, naturally I had to try the hazelnut pesto.  Gawd it was goooood!!!!!!.  The whole thing.  Never had a guinea hen and had never heard of it, but I would have to say it's a little gamier than but not very different from the chicken.  The atmosphere was lovely and the staff friendly though our waiter was not that attentive.  Which is why I gave it four stars.  Perusing over the menu I couldn't help but notice that there really aren't many choices for the vegetarian/vegans.  I'm not one of them but have friends who are so am always looking for places where we can all dine together.   This wouldn't be one.   Although I enjoyed my meal, I wasn't really bowled over by anything, in the sense that I didn't feel they were doing anything that other restaurants weren't.  Perhaps if we had desert I may have been.  But we were far too full to eat anymore.   It was an experience, a good one overall.
author: Magdalena ..

description: I've been to this restaurant now 3 times and every time I am impressed. I would argue this restaurant is better than Gary Danko. From the decor to the friendly wait staff and obviously the food!
author: Sara K.

description: Over rated and over priced.  The food was very good but neither creative nor great.  Service at the table was excellent and friendly.  The front of the house however has some real problems.  We were shown to an unacceptable table in a high traffic area.  When we objected and said we'd like the open table right next to it we were told "it's reserved."  After refusing to sit at the first table  we were seated at the "reserved table"  Three other couples were shown to the unacceptable table and refused it as well.  When I brought this up to the manager as we were leaving I got an argument from him that there was nothing wrong with the first table .  Sorry, that's not great customer service nor worthy of the price.  There are plenty of other great restaurants in San Francisco with better management attitudes.
author: Donald F.

description: Our server was the greatest redeeming factor of my experience at Boulevard. He was very professional and mostly invisible; just how I like. My appetizer was good, but my entree was terrible. My filet was quite overcooked and the setup on the plate was weak. The sommelier first snubbed us then when we ordered and expensive bottle of wine he served it incorrectly. We spent over $500 for 3 and left feeling violated. I won't return.
author: J S.

description: This is my "go to" restaurant for it's warm, friendliness, attention to detail, wine list and most importantly the consistently great food they serve. The menu varies by season but the mainstays are always present. I fell in love with this restaurant back in 1997 arriving from Chicago and this is a restaurant for any time - business, casual, special. I had a birthday party in the downstairs that was spectacular.
author: Peggy G.

description: Had a fabulous meal, great service and ambience.  The Boulevard is a must if you are in SF.
author: Bella C.

description: This is my favorite upscale restaurant in SF.  The service is consistently good, as is the food.  The prices are reasonable given the quality as well.  If you're in SF, want something nice, and don't know where to go, go to Boulevard.
author: P H.

description: OVER-RATED.  is it the location?   is it the olde building that it occupies?  what?  the is the decor early or late victorian parlour?  the environment is highly stuffy.  i have eaten here a dozen times both for lunch and dinner and yes technically nothing is terrible-- it is the lack of inspiration.  when i think of inspiring i think of PLA or REPLA or CAL PEP in Barcelona.  getting a reservation is high drama and worse is the hurried get in you / get you out.  every time i see Nancy Oakes looking things over i look her way and smile even have said hello instead i have discovered that i was see-through while i was there.  -- i do like, however, eating at the bar watching the food being prepared and i like how the preparer always look at me for approval-- now they are doing the hard work and it is nice to discover i am not a see through man after all.  all-in-all i cannot and will go kicking and screaming to go a 13th time.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: I had an interview lunch at Boulevard. The portions were small and pricey, but delicious. I loved the range of seafood options. The service was good (but not incredibly fast), and the waiters were accommodating of our desire to split all the food and desserts. I remember thinking it was a bit dark. Good social dinner ambience; would take a date there. Less good for power lunch.
author: B L.

description: two words - EAT HERE.  i will spare the short story of all the reasons why this place rules, and just say it sets the bar for what any aspiring top tier restaurant must reach. excellent food, design, energy, service and experience. every time.
author: Kevin J.

description: This place was ridiculously good.  I went here with my fiancee directly after getting engaged.  I had called ahead to have some roses delivered to our table, and sure enough they were there as we sat down.  Huge kudos for how accomadating they were and how easy it was.  Everyone from the Maitre'd to the Busser to the Waiter were amazing to us.  They made us feel like a million bucks and made an already special evening even more unforgettable.  Now onto the food:  We had a glass of champagne with our appetizers of Tuna Tartare and organic Heirloom Tomatoes.  Delicious.  I particularly liked the addition of watermelon with the Tuna.. the tastes complimented each other quite nicely.  Following this, our waiter recommended a fantastic bottle of wine to go with the Lobster my fiancee ordered, and the Filet Mignon which I had.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  I used to think that a steak I had at Mastro's in Scottsdale was the best I'd ever had, until now.  It literally melted in my mouth.. unreal.  Also, the flavor of the beef was very pronounced.  I'm not a fan of strong sauces or wine butters that usually accompany a steak and, in my opinion, take away from the flavor of the beef, and there was no such problem here.  It was the best filet i've had to date.  Finally, our dessert included a small chocolate sign that said "Congratulations" on it.  I never even asked for something like this, and they went ahead and surprised us with it.  Just A+ service in my opinion.  It was truly a night we'll never forget and everything from the decor, to the food, to *especially* the service helped make it so.  I'm sure we'll be back for anniversaries to come...
author: Michael S.

description: i went here for lunch the other day and honestly couldn't walk out upright. that was how full i allowed myself to become since i did not want to miss out on even a bite of food. the restaurant is decorated beautifully, additionally, the food is to die for. i had the best time. while i loved all the food my favorites were, the rabbit ravioli, the kobe beef bavette, and the sea scallops in risotto (it was mainly because of the risotto since i am not the biggest fan of scallops even though these were amazing). 5 stars all around. the staff was so sweet, the food was so sweet and my time there was sooooo sweet!!!! drinks were amazing too! i am going to come back as often as possible!
author: Lola r.

description: still staying strong after all this years....fois gras was a great choice for appetizer and the abolone, then the filet minon was excellent so tender and finished with panecotta...wine is shockingly expensive but what can you do when they serve the best selections for  red wine and not to crazy with desert wine.
author: cecille p.

description: Have been quite a few times and always impressed with the food here.  Well presented and nice interesting combinations.  The pan seared foie gras is always good however it comes.   Roasted meats is what Ms. Oakes does so well and I have never had a poor entree here.  Wine list is also quite good and dining alone I always find nice half bottles which is an area that many restaurants miss.  Impeccable service as well even when you sit at the counter.  The only complaint is that I have sometimes recieved lukewarm food.  I know its a busy restaurant but they should figure out a way to not have to pick up 28 entrees at a time.  The complex plating means start to finish plating can take several minutes.  Desserts are ok nothing crazy and I usually finish my meal iwth a salad or cheese.  But overall a a SF standard that deserves all the praise it gets.
author: Bew B.

description: Love love love this restaurant.  Never lets me down.  Food is perfect everytime.  Love their desserts. can't complain on their service.  Always a pleasant dining experience.
author: Cj P.

description:
check my review at south park cafe.  had dinner at boulevard friday evening.   south park cafe last weekend.

cost, atmosphere favors boulevard.  food is good, not great.  squab was tasteless.  even with a generous allotment of truffles.  guys, taste the truffles before laying them over your dish.  i've had squab better at just about any other chinese restaurant anywhere.  lobster over risotto was fantastic.  dessert was a chocolate spike through my taste glands.  loved it.


but food, value favors south park cafe.
author: C C.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  I was there a few years ago and I had the poulet special (only a few chickens left, my waiter informed me) and my husband had the filet mignon.  My chicken was so succulent and quite possibly the best chicken I have ever eaten to this day.
author: Elnaz B.

description: Very very nice!  Went with someone who paid the whole bill for a table of 6 so no stress involved, although judging by the prices on the menu, they weren't all too bad when compared with other restaurants in the same class which I would say Boulevard is a card carrying "A-class" member.  Visit Boulevard for the architecture and lighting alone if for no other reason - incredible lamps, floor mosaics and brick ceilings to captivate your eye while trying to distinguish what perfect mix of spices/ingredients it took to create such flavor in your dish.  My dinner was about 3.5 stars though others at the table raved over their kobe bavette, fish dishes, prawns, scallops and even the cobb salad was a winner .  I had the stuffed pork chop which WAS a little over-cooked and gristly but the stuffing and flavor were tasty along with the accompanying mashed potatoes and sprout leaves.  The 4 diff. appetizers were all Delicious but sparse, especially for a table of 6;  I enjoyed the spinach stuffed oysters the best - perfection!  The best desert of the four we tried was the huckleberry tart with Meyer lemon sorbet - sweet!  A very extensive wine list kept us very happy and the service was "out of your face" and adequate though don't expect any real insightful answers to any questions regarding restaurant history or background on food items like whether something is organic or whether it's free range or sea safe fish, etc.  I will be back however, how could I not!  Cheers!
author: Tim F.

description: Was just at Boulevard for the first time this past Friday. The service was great...the waiter was attentive and very familiar with both the wine and food menus.The food was innovative and very yummy. And although I enjoyed the atmosphere I don't know that it was very romantic...but that could have been the company too. I would definately go back.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Wonderful food.  Anything you order, you are going to love it.  My husband and I always play it safe and order on meat dish and something different.  The food was great and we loved every bit of it starting with the appetizer and ending with desert.
author: Cassandera S.

description: This has been one of the best restaurants I've been to since I've returned to the bay area. I had dinner at boulevard right before christmas and was very impressed! The service was both friendly and attentive, and the restaurant decor was festive but tasteful, to reflect the holiday season. In terms of food, Boulevard definitely lives up to its reputation. I started off with quail wrapped in bacon, complimented with sweetbreads and chestnuts. I definitely have to say that the appetizer stole the show! The quail was incredibly moist and the crispness of the bacon was a perfect contrast! For my entree I had the black cod with crab, lobster and artichokes. The dish was good, but a bit disappointing. The fish was cooked perfectly, and the crab and lobster were nice, but didn't particularly add anything special other than that they were star ingredients. We opted to go somewhere else for dessert since nothing on the menu stood out. Overall, great experience but a bit pricey.
author: Jessica S.

description: Appetizers, drinks, entrees and desserts = yummy!  A little pricey for frequent dining but the Christmas decor with the bay bridge view was worth the trip.  Fun for "adult dining" with a mellow atmosphere.
author: Grace K.

description: I treated myself to a relaxing lunch one afternoon, on a whim. I think it's worth the hype. It's classy, bustling but not overwhelming, great view, and overall nice ambience. And the food is really spectacular. Didn't get as far as dessert, but the halibut I had was beautifully crispy, wonderfully presented, and every texture in the surrounding vegetables was just perfect.
author: Lemon S.

description: truly fabulous: sweetbreads.  divine.  i was somewhat dismayed at how tiny they looked on my big white plate but it was a completely sensuous experience i almost cried when i realized there was no more left.
author: Lenita M.

description: i always have a great dining experience here no matter if i am just dining out or if i am coming for a special occasion.  the atmosphere is great, the staff is always pleasant and courteous, and the food is always tasty.  highly recommend coming here for dinner
author: Mike M.

description: took my mom there for her birthday, service was amazing, they sat us in the wine cellar room, I had the lamb, it was huge, cooked medium rare as i requested, these people dont mess around when it comes to food,
author: Jonathan S.

description: clean, classy, feels french.  great sirloin steak strips.  the superb quality of food made up for the medium-sized portion.  moderately priced (for lunch).  you have to take an elevator to the bathroom; it's kind of an adventure.
author: Catherine H.

description: A great restaurant to visit after a hard night's work in the Financial District. To me, this is my impression of what a restaurant dedicated to magnificent food should look like. Nothing overstated in the decor. Good bar. Perhaps the best waiter I have had at any restaurant. He was mature, professional, educated, and yet made us sooo comfortable at the same time. Rare. The chef, Nancy Oakes, came out to the table next to us at the customer's request. He wanted to ask her some of the finer points of the dish he was having (seriously, I think he just wanted to impress his date). Ms. Oakes seemed very gracious, though clearly busy. I was impressed that she came out though. I would say that this is a restaurant you come to enjoy really well prepared dishes. A very balanced establishment. The ONLY reason I didn't give it the fifth star is the menu is a little too staid for my tastes. Really standard choices: a fish, a lamb, a steak, a chicken, a seared tuna, etc, although cooked way better than most!
author: Johnny O.

description: if you want to be entertained, sit at the bar where the chefs work.  phenomenal veggies and seafood.  we started with the crab salad-super fresh with nice citrusy flavors.  moved to the best ravioli we've had in ages.  we almost ordered a second they were that good.  the truffles and fontina were orgasmic.  next were the scallops, again delish.  we had a perfect borolo and a soso champagne throughout.  finished with a few cheeses and lattes.  flavors, textures, and service were done to perfection making price irrelevant.
author: Tammy N.

description: We had our company christmas party here two years ago, and it was the first time I had eaten at a nice place at night in the city. This place was pretty impressive back then, although I have been to better ones since then. My company rented out L'Avenida, which is a private room downstairs for about 20 of us in the region. The setup was a bit weird bc there were four circular tables and about 5 or 6 of us sat at each so we could only talk to each other. Everything was served at our seat, so we didn't really get up to mingle as much. The food however was delicious. There was a prechosen three course meal and two options for a starter, entree and dessert that we could choose from. I had  crab arugula salad with pears, good but a little bitter (from the arugula). My main course was chicken with mashed potatoes and spinach which was pretty good. For dessert I had a pear cobbler thing that was pretty tasty. My company picked up the tab so I don't know how pricey it was, probably relatively expensive, but upstairs seemed more casual and lots of people were laughing. It seems like a fun place for older people or those that come for drinks after a long day at work
author: Thao T.

description: yes its true, nancy oakes signature restaurant is all that, this is an adult dinning spot ... food is the draw, wonderfully prepared and tasty, maybe a bit underseasoned for my palate and my lovely companion, but spot on for the general public, seated in the back of the room, (at first thought, why? i understood later on why us, were seated there), i the wine guy and she the foodie could watch the dinning room and appreciate what hard work and talent takes to pull off a dinning experience ... and it was!  service, very professional and well coached and rehearsed ... this place delivers the goods!  i did not check, but if they have been opened for twenty years, i give them ****!
author: tim y.

description: Came here with a friend for a lunch and the food was great. There was this crab appetizer that my friend wont stop talking about. Haven't been for dinner b/c I heard its a mess trying to get a table on Friday night, but the lunch is really good!
author: Michael P.

description: Abalone is the bomb.  I love this place.  Its a little pricey, but well worth the money.   The service is outstanding as well!
author: Adrianne E.

description: I came here for my birthday dinner and it was a nice splurge. The restaurant was packed on a Wednesday evening. I loved the food. Highlights were the appetizer and dessert. Real shaved truffles on the ravioli made this dish stand out. And the strawberry shortcake is a MUST! I ordered white sea bass for dinner and thought it would tasted better if it was chilean. Although I like fish undercooked, it seemed a little too undercooked for my taste. Hubby loved his steak and service was very attentive. I recommend this restaurant and bring lots of money (it's $$$).
author: Red R.

description: This has to be my favorite restaurant in the city. Although the portions are small, the food is great. I would probably eat there more often, but it's always so busy. Reservations are a must!
author: Nicole N.

description: Excellent food and a very inviting and comfortable decor but they get knocked a star for snooty service at the front of the room.  At a place like this, they should be apologetic if they are not able to seat me at the time of my reservation.  A snooty "you may sit in the bar" (why thank you!), is just not acceptable.
author: Peter H.

description: Can't say anything bad about a restaurant that has awesome Crabcakes and house made seasonal sorbet.... the atmoshphere is great and it is right at the embarcadero. By far one of my favorite restaurants in the city!
author: Courtney W.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. Beats M. Mina's and the others. This food is amazing and the wait staff is perfectly timed. The Sommelier is friendly and knowlegable (MW). I love this restaurant.
author: J J.

description: last time we went we were all disappointed, none of the dishes were stellar which they were on our previous visits and for this price they should be....back to looking for a special occasion restaurant in the city..
author: Amy Y.

description: I took my parents here and had the BEST steak I have had in a long time. Tasty stuff! I wasn't thrilled with the stuck up service, but they were attentive and made my parents happy. It was pricey but well worth it, also the deserts were pretty amazing as well. The decor was really nice too. When I have enough money to go back, oh I will!
author: Stacy J.

description: This place does not disappoint.   The staff is very professional  and knows how to handle crowds.  The waitstaff is very well trained.  The food is wonderfully prepared.  This is how a fine restaurant should be run.
author: Ken J.

description: i had a great dining experience here...a little spendy, but the food was definitely worth it and the service was excellent.
author: Amy K.

description: My wife and I took my parents here when they were in town last month. Its convenient location and great views make for a Paris brasserie parked at the end of Mission.   If you arrive when it is busy, the tables in the bar can be requested to be pulled together for a party of 4 and you can short cut the wait in the main restaurant.  The stuffed chop, sea bass and desserts were memorable and had my parents reminiscing about their time in the city forty years ago when they were first married.   Everyone at our table and the tables around us visibly enjoyed their meals, with the exception of a sand dab appetizer that we passed on, and the table next to ours barely touched.  Getting to and from the bathrooms is a bit of an adventure, but became a silly joke as each diner ultimately experienced the trek.  Aside from picking up the tab :), as this (like French Laundry and Aqua) is always better when someone else pays, no complaints from this solid establishment.
author: Michael B.

description: I always search for the comparisons so here I go - I liked my lunch at Boulevard better than my lunch at Aqua. And by this I mean, better ambiance, better selection and better food. I've said my piece.
author: Mia T.

description: Went for a somewhat early business dinner.  Raucous and live atmosphere.  That being said, how can you run out of some the night's specials in round one when none of the tables have turned over yet?  Food was not innovative but delicious nonetheless.  Perhaps worth another try on a date, but just wasn't blown away on the first attempt.
author: Benson J.

description: Beautiful restaurant. Food was very good, though my lamb was over cooked.
author: Adie B.

description: Have been a few times over the years.  One of my fav's.  But if you need to watch your duckets, you might try somewhere else.
author: James B.

description:
this is another review that i will likely come back and edit after a proper visit but, in the meanwhile, i just had to post because the mini-visit we had was so awesome. 

we stopped in for dessert after a birthday dinner at chaya up the road and wow, talk about mind blowing, amazing wonderfulness.  we snagged a cozy little table in the bar, had excellent, immediate service and before long were toasting the birthday girl over their tasty, beautifully presented deserts.  bonus points to the wait staff who had were prompt but not over solicitous (big pet peeve). the space was warm and cozy and had a great celebratory feel, perfect for our party.
author: Cindi H.

description: small small portions the food was okay it was just okay as far as the price is concerned!
author: Rhea F.

description: boulevard is the best.  seriously, its the best.  its the best in a mecca of REALLY great restraurants, and it is now, and has always been, the best.  the food is fabulous, for lunch or dinner.  the wine selection is top notch.  the decor is old-school san francisco without being stuffy.  its fancy, but not pretentious.  the location is outstanding.  the service is second-to-none.  particularly if you are not footing the bill, go to boulevard.  you won't be sorry.
author: Erin C.

description:
very late review:  dined with my husband during v. day weekend...
